signal.name: GtkATContext::state-change
signal.description: Emitted when the attributes of the accessible for the #GtkATContext instance change.

property.name: GtkATContext:accessible
property.description: The #GtkAccessible that created the #GtkATContext instance.

property.name: GtkATContext:accessible-role
property.description:
The accessible role used by the AT context.
Depending on the given role, different states and properties can be set or retrieved.

property.name: GtkATContext:display
property.description: The #GdkDisplay for the #GtkATContext.

signal.name: GtkAboutDialog::activate-link
signal.description: The signal which gets emitted to activate a URI. Applications may connect to it to override the default behaviour, which is to call gtk_show_uri().

parameter.name: label
parameter.parameter_description: The object on which the signal was emitted

signal.return: %TRUE if the link has been activated

property.name: GtkAboutDialog:artists
property.description: The people who contributed artwork to the program, as a %NULL-terminated array of strings. Each string may contain email addresses and URLs, which will be displayed as links, see the introduction for more details.

property.name: GtkAboutDialog:authors
property.description: The authors of the program, as a %NULL-terminated array of strings. Each string may contain email addresses and URLs, which will be displayed as links, see the introduction for more details.

property.name: GtkAboutDialog:comments
property.description: Comments about the program. This string is displayed in a label in the main dialog, thus it should be a short explanation of the main purpose of the program, not a detailed list of features.

property.name: GtkAboutDialog:copyright
property.description: Copyright information for the program.

property.name: GtkAboutDialog:documenters
property.description: The people documenting the program, as a %NULL-terminated array of strings. Each string may contain email addresses and URLs, which will be displayed as links, see the introduction for more details.

property.name: GtkAboutDialog:license
property.description:
The license of the program. This string is displayed in a text view in a secondary dialog, therefore it is fine to use a long multi-paragraph text. Note that the text is only wrapped in the text view if the "wrap-license" property is set to %TRUE; otherwise the text itself must contain the intended linebreaks. When setting this property to a non-%NULL value, the #GtkAboutDialog:license-type property is set to %GTK_LICENSE_CUSTOM as a side effect.
The text may contain links in this format <http://www.some.place/> and email references in the form <mail-to@some.body>, and these will be converted into clickable links.

property.name: GtkAboutDialog:license-type
property.description:
The license of the program, as a value of the %GtkLicense enumeration.
The #GtkAboutDialog will automatically fill out a standard disclaimer and link the user to the appropriate online resource for the license text.
If %GTK_LICENSE_UNKNOWN is used, the link used will be the same specified in the #GtkAboutDialog:website property.
If %GTK_LICENSE_CUSTOM is used, the current contents of the #GtkAboutDialog:license property are used.
For any other #GtkLicense value, the contents of the #GtkAboutDialog:license property are also set by this property as a side effect.

property.name: GtkAboutDialog:logo
property.description: A logo for the about box. If it is %NULL, the default window icon set with gtk_window_set_default_icon_name() will be used.

property.name: GtkAboutDialog:logo-icon-name
property.description: A named icon to use as the logo for the about box. This property overrides the #GtkAboutDialog:logo property.

property.name: GtkAboutDialog:program-name
property.description: The name of the program. If this is not set, it defaults to g_get_application_name().

property.name: GtkAboutDialog:system-information
property.description:
Information about the system on which the program is running. This is displayed in a separate tab, therefore it is fine to use a long multi-paragraph text. Note that the text should contain the intended linebreaks.
The text may contain links in this format <http://www.some.place/> and email references in the form <mail-to@some.body>, and these will be converted into clickable links.

property.name: GtkAboutDialog:translator-credits
property.description: Credits to the translators. This string should be marked as translatable. The string may contain email addresses and URLs, which will be displayed as links, see the introduction for more details.

property.name: GtkAboutDialog:version
property.description: The version of the program.

property.name: GtkAboutDialog:website
property.description: The URL for the link to the website of the program. This should be a string starting with "http://.

property.name: GtkAboutDialog:website-label
property.description: The label for the link to the website of the program.

property.name: GtkAboutDialog:wrap-license
property.description: Whether to wrap the text in the license dialog.

property.name: GtkAccessible:accessible-role
property.description:
The accessible role of the given #GtkAccessible implementation.
The accessible role cannot be changed once set.

enum.name: GtkAccessibleAutocomplete
enum.description: The possible values for the %GTK_ACCESSIBLE_PROPERTY_AUTOCOMPLETE accessible property.

parameter.name: GTK_ACCESSIBLE_AUTOCOMPLETE_INLINE
parameter.parameter_description: When a user is providing input, text suggesting one way to complete the provided input may be dynamically inserted after the caret.

parameter.name: GTK_ACCESSIBLE_AUTOCOMPLETE_LIST
parameter.parameter_description: When a user is providing input, an element containing a collection of values that could complete the provided input may be displayed.

parameter.name: GTK_ACCESSIBLE_AUTOCOMPLETE_BOTH
parameter.parameter_description: When a user is providing input, an element containing a collection of values that could complete the provided input may be displayed. If displayed, one value in the collection is automatically selected, and the text needed to complete the automatically selected value appears after the caret in the input.

enum.name: GtkAccessibleInvalidState
enum.description:
The possible values for the %GTK_ACCESSIBLE_STATE_INVALID accessible state.
Note that the %GTK_ACCESSIBLE_INVALID_FALSE and %GTK_ACCESSIBLE_INVALID_TRUE have the same values as %FALSE and %TRUE.

parameter.name: GTK_ACCESSIBLE_INVALID_FALSE
parameter.parameter_description: There are no detected errors in the value

parameter.name: GTK_ACCESSIBLE_INVALID_TRUE
parameter.parameter_description: The value entered by the user has failed validation

enum.name: GtkAccessibleProperty
enum.description: The possible accessible properties of a #GtkAccessible.

parameter.name: GTK_ACCESSIBLE_PROPERTY_AUTOCOMPLETE
parameter.parameter_description: Indicates whether inputting text could trigger display of one or more predictions of the user's intended value for a combobox, searchbox, or textbox and specifies how predictions would be presented if they were made. Value type: #GtkAccessibleAutocomplete

parameter.name: GTK_ACCESSIBLE_PROPERTY_DESCRIPTION
parameter.parameter_description: Defines a string value that describes or annotates the current element. Value type: string

parameter.name: GTK_ACCESSIBLE_PROPERTY_HAS_POPUP
parameter.parameter_description: Indicates the availability and type of interactive popup element, such as menu or dialog, that can be triggered by an element.

parameter.name: GTK_ACCESSIBLE_PROPERTY_KEY_SHORTCUTS
parameter.parameter_description: Indicates keyboard shortcuts that an author has implemented to activate or give focus to an element. Value type: string

parameter.name: GTK_ACCESSIBLE_PROPERTY_LABEL
parameter.parameter_description: Defines a string value that labels the current element. Value type: string

parameter.name: GTK_ACCESSIBLE_PROPERTY_LEVEL
parameter.parameter_description: Defines the hierarchical level of an element within a structure. Value type: integer

parameter.name: GTK_ACCESSIBLE_PROPERTY_MODAL
parameter.parameter_description: Indicates whether an element is modal when displayed. Value type: boolean

parameter.name: GTK_ACCESSIBLE_PROPERTY_MULTI_LINE
parameter.parameter_description: Indicates whether a text box accepts multiple lines of input or only a single line. Value type: boolean

parameter.name: GTK_ACCESSIBLE_PROPERTY_MULTI_SELECTABLE
parameter.parameter_description: Indicates that the user may select more than one item from the current selectable descendants. Value type: boolean

parameter.name: GTK_ACCESSIBLE_PROPERTY_ORIENTATION
parameter.parameter_description: Indicates whether the element's orientation is horizontal, vertical, or unknown/ambiguous. Value type: #GtkOrientation

parameter.name: GTK_ACCESSIBLE_PROPERTY_PLACEHOLDER
parameter.parameter_description: Defines a short hint (a word or short phrase) intended to aid the user with data entry when the control has no value. A hint could be a sample value or a brief description of the expected format. Value type: string

parameter.name: GTK_ACCESSIBLE_PROPERTY_READ_ONLY
parameter.parameter_description: Indicates that the element is not editable, but is otherwise operable. Value type: boolean

parameter.name: GTK_ACCESSIBLE_PROPERTY_REQUIRED
parameter.parameter_description: Indicates that user input is required on the element before a form may be submitted. Value type: boolean

parameter.name: GTK_ACCESSIBLE_PROPERTY_ROLE_DESCRIPTION
parameter.parameter_description: Defines a human-readable, author-localized description for the role of an element. Value type: string

parameter.name: GTK_ACCESSIBLE_PROPERTY_SORT
parameter.parameter_description: Indicates if items in a table or grid are sorted in ascending or descending order. Possible property values are in the #GtkAccessibleSort enumeration. Value type: #GtkAccessibleSort

parameter.name: GTK_ACCESSIBLE_PROPERTY_VALUE_MAX
parameter.parameter_description: Defines the maximum allowed value for a range widget. Value type: double

parameter.name: GTK_ACCESSIBLE_PROPERTY_VALUE_MIN
parameter.parameter_description: Defines the minimum allowed value for a range widget. Value type: double

parameter.name: GTK_ACCESSIBLE_PROPERTY_VALUE_NOW
parameter.parameter_description: Defines the current value for a range widget. Value type: double

parameter.name: GTK_ACCESSIBLE_PROPERTY_VALUE_TEXT
parameter.parameter_description: Defines the human readable text alternative of aria-valuenow for a range widget. Value type: string

enum.name: GtkAccessibleRelation
enum.description: The possible accessible relations of a #GtkAccessible. Accessible relations can be references to other widgets, integers or strings.

parameter.name: GTK_ACCESSIBLE_RELATION_ACTIVE_DESCENDANT
parameter.parameter_description: Identifies the currently active element when focus is on a composite widget, combobox, textbox, group, or application. Value type: reference

parameter.name: GTK_ACCESSIBLE_RELATION_COL_COUNT
parameter.parameter_description: Defines the total number of columns in a table, grid, or treegrid. Value type: integer

parameter.name: GTK_ACCESSIBLE_RELATION_COL_INDEX
parameter.parameter_description: Defines an element's column index or position with respect to the total number of columns within a table, grid, or treegrid. Value type: integer

parameter.name: GTK_ACCESSIBLE_RELATION_COL_INDEX_TEXT
parameter.parameter_description: Defines a human readable text alternative of %GTK_ACCESSIBLE_RELATION_COL_INDEX. Value type: string

parameter.name: GTK_ACCESSIBLE_RELATION_COL_SPAN
parameter.parameter_description: Defines the number of columns spanned by a cell or gridcell within a table, grid, or treegrid. Value type: integer

parameter.name: GTK_ACCESSIBLE_RELATION_CONTROLS
parameter.parameter_description: Identifies the element (or elements) whose contents or presence are controlled by the current element. Value type: reference

parameter.name: GTK_ACCESSIBLE_RELATION_DESCRIBED_BY
parameter.parameter_description: Identifies the element (or elements) that describes the object. Value type: reference

parameter.name: GTK_ACCESSIBLE_RELATION_DETAILS
parameter.parameter_description: Identifies the element (or elements) that provide additional information related to the object. Value type: reference

parameter.name: GTK_ACCESSIBLE_RELATION_ERROR_MESSAGE
parameter.parameter_description: Identifies the element that provides an error message for an object. Value type: reference

parameter.name: GTK_ACCESSIBLE_RELATION_FLOW_TO
parameter.parameter_description: Identifies the next element (or elements) in an alternate reading order of content which, at the user's discretion, allows assistive technology to override the general default of reading in document source order. Value type: reference

parameter.name: GTK_ACCESSIBLE_RELATION_LABELLED_BY
parameter.parameter_description: Identifies the element (or elements) that labels the current element. Value type: reference

parameter.name: GTK_ACCESSIBLE_RELATION_OWNS
parameter.parameter_description: Identifies an element (or elements) in order to define a visual, functional, or contextual parent/child relationship between elements where the widget hierarchy cannot be used to represent the relationship. Value type: reference

parameter.name: GTK_ACCESSIBLE_RELATION_POS_IN_SET
parameter.parameter_description: Defines an element's number or position in the current set of listitems or treeitems. Value type: integer

parameter.name: GTK_ACCESSIBLE_RELATION_ROW_COUNT
parameter.parameter_description: Defines the total number of rows in a table, grid, or treegrid. Value type: integer

parameter.name: GTK_ACCESSIBLE_RELATION_ROW_INDEX
parameter.parameter_description: Defines an element's row index or position with respect to the total number of rows within a table, grid, or treegrid. Value type: integer

parameter.name: GTK_ACCESSIBLE_RELATION_ROW_INDEX_TEXT
parameter.parameter_description: Defines a human readable text alternative of aria-rowindex. Value type: string

parameter.name: GTK_ACCESSIBLE_RELATION_ROW_SPAN
parameter.parameter_description: Defines the number of rows spanned by a cell or gridcell within a table, grid, or treegrid. Value type: integer

parameter.name: GTK_ACCESSIBLE_RELATION_SET_SIZE
parameter.parameter_description: Defines the number of items in the current set of listitems or treeitems. Value type: integer

enum.name: GtkAccessibleRole
enum.description:
The accessible role for a #GtkAccessible implementation.
Abstract roles are only used as part of the ontology; application developers must not use abstract roles in their code.

parameter.name: GTK_ACCESSIBLE_ROLE_ALERT
parameter.parameter_description: An element with important, and usually time-sensitive, information

parameter.name: GTK_ACCESSIBLE_ROLE_ALERT_DIALOG
parameter.parameter_description: A type of dialog that contains an alert message

parameter.name: GTK_ACCESSIBLE_ROLE_BUTTON
parameter.parameter_description: An input element that allows for user-triggered actions when clicked or pressed

parameter.name: GTK_ACCESSIBLE_ROLE_CHECKBOX
parameter.parameter_description: A checkable input element that has three possible values: `true`, `false`, or `mixed`

parameter.name: GTK_ACCESSIBLE_ROLE_COLUMN_HEADER
parameter.parameter_description: A header in a columned list.

parameter.name: GTK_ACCESSIBLE_ROLE_COMBO_BOX
parameter.parameter_description: An input that controls another element, such as a list or a grid, that can dynamically pop up to help the user set the value of the input

parameter.name: GTK_ACCESSIBLE_ROLE_DIALOG
parameter.parameter_description: A dialog is a window that is designed to interrupt the current processing of an application in order to prompt the user to enter information or require a response.

parameter.name: GTK_ACCESSIBLE_ROLE_GRID_CELL
parameter.parameter_description: An item in a grid or tree grid.

parameter.name: GTK_ACCESSIBLE_ROLE_GROUP
parameter.parameter_description: An element that groups multiple widgets. GTK uses this role for various containers, like #GtkBox, #GtkViewport, and #GtkHeaderBar.

parameter.name: GTK_ACCESSIBLE_ROLE_LABEL
parameter.parameter_description: A visible name or caption for a user interface component.

parameter.name: GTK_ACCESSIBLE_ROLE_METER
parameter.parameter_description: An element that represents a value within a known range.

parameter.name: GTK_ACCESSIBLE_ROLE_MENU_ITEM_CHECKBOX
parameter.parameter_description: A check item in a menu.

parameter.name: GTK_ACCESSIBLE_ROLE_MENU_ITEM_RADIO
parameter.parameter_description: A radio item in a menu.

parameter.name: GTK_ACCESSIBLE_ROLE_NONE
parameter.parameter_description: An element that is not represented to accessibility technologies.

parameter.name: GTK_ACCESSIBLE_ROLE_PRESENTATION
parameter.parameter_description: An element that is not represented to accessibility technologies.

parameter.name: GTK_ACCESSIBLE_ROLE_PROGRESS_BAR
parameter.parameter_description: An element that displays the progress status for tasks that take a long time.

parameter.name: GTK_ACCESSIBLE_ROLE_RADIO
parameter.parameter_description: A checkable input in a group of radio roles, only one of which can be checked at a time.

parameter.name: GTK_ACCESSIBLE_ROLE_ROW
parameter.parameter_description: A row in a columned list.

parameter.name: GTK_ACCESSIBLE_ROLE_SCROLLBAR
parameter.parameter_description: A graphical object that controls the scrolling of content within a viewing area, regardless of whether the content is fully displayed within the viewing area.

parameter.name: GTK_ACCESSIBLE_ROLE_SEARCH_BOX
parameter.parameter_description: A type of textbox intended for specifying search criteria.

parameter.name: GTK_ACCESSIBLE_ROLE_SEPARATOR
parameter.parameter_description: A divider that separates and distinguishes sections of content or groups of menuitems.

parameter.name: GTK_ACCESSIBLE_ROLE_SLIDER
parameter.parameter_description: A user input where the user selects a value from within a given range.

parameter.name: GTK_ACCESSIBLE_ROLE_SPIN_BUTTON
parameter.parameter_description: A form of range that expects the user to select from among discrete choices.

parameter.name: GTK_ACCESSIBLE_ROLE_SWITCH
parameter.parameter_description: A type of checkbox that represents on/off values, as opposed to checked/unchecked values.

parameter.name: GTK_ACCESSIBLE_ROLE_TAB
parameter.parameter_description: An item in a list of tab used for switching pages.

parameter.name: GTK_ACCESSIBLE_ROLE_TAB_LIST
parameter.parameter_description: A list of tabs for switching pages.

parameter.name: GTK_ACCESSIBLE_ROLE_TAB_PANEL
parameter.parameter_description: A page in a notebook or stack.

parameter.name: GTK_ACCESSIBLE_ROLE_TEXT_BOX
parameter.parameter_description: A type of input that allows free-form text as its value.

parameter.name: GTK_ACCESSIBLE_ROLE_WIDGET
parameter.parameter_description: An interactive component of a graphical user interface. This is the role that GTK uses by default for widgets.

enum.name: GtkAccessibleSort
enum.description: The possible values for the %GTK_ACCESSIBLE_PROPERTY_SORT accessible property.

parameter.name: GTK_ACCESSIBLE_SORT_NONE
parameter.parameter_description: There is no defined sort applied to the column.

parameter.name: GTK_ACCESSIBLE_SORT_ASCENDING
parameter.parameter_description: Items are sorted in ascending order by this column.

parameter.name: GTK_ACCESSIBLE_SORT_DESCENDING
parameter.parameter_description: Items are sorted in descending order by this column.

parameter.name: GTK_ACCESSIBLE_SORT_OTHER
parameter.parameter_description: A sort algorithm other than ascending or descending has been applied.

enum.name: GtkAccessibleState
enum.description: The possible accessible states of a #GtkAccessible.

parameter.name: GTK_ACCESSIBLE_STATE_BUSY
parameter.parameter_description: A “busy” state. This state has boolean values

parameter.name: GTK_ACCESSIBLE_STATE_CHECKED
parameter.parameter_description: A “checked” state; indicates the current state of a #GtkCheckButton. Value type: #GtkAccessibleTristate

parameter.name: GTK_ACCESSIBLE_STATE_DISABLED
parameter.parameter_description: A “disabled” state; corresponds to the #GtkWidget:sensitive property on #GtkWidget. It indicates a UI element that is perceivable, but not editable or operable. Value type: boolean

parameter.name: GTK_ACCESSIBLE_STATE_EXPANDED
parameter.parameter_description: An “expanded” state; corresponds to the #GtkExpander:expanded property on #GtkExpander. Value type: boolean or undefined

parameter.name: GTK_ACCESSIBLE_STATE_HIDDEN
parameter.parameter_description: A “hidden” state; corresponds to the #GtkWidget:visible property on #GtkWidget. You can use this state explicitly on UI elements that should not be exposed to an assistive technology. Value type: boolean See also: %GTK_ACCESSIBLE_STATE_DISABLED

parameter.name: GTK_ACCESSIBLE_STATE_INVALID
parameter.parameter_description: An “invalid” state; set when a widget is showing an error. Value type: #GtkAccessibleInvalidState

parameter.name: GTK_ACCESSIBLE_STATE_PRESSED
parameter.parameter_description: A “pressed” state; indicates the current state of a #GtkToggleButton. Value type: #GtkAccessibleTristate enumeration

parameter.name: GTK_ACCESSIBLE_STATE_SELECTED
parameter.parameter_description: A “selected” state; set when a widget is selected. Value type: boolean or undefined

enum.name: GtkAccessibleTristate
enum.description:
The possible values for the %GTK_ACCESSIBLE_STATE_PRESSED accessible state.
Note that the %GTK_ACCESSIBLE_TRISTATE_FALSE and %GTK_ACCESSIBLE_TRISTATE_TRUE have the same values as %FALSE and %TRUE.

signal.name: GtkAdjustment::changed
signal.description: Emitted when one or more of the #GtkAdjustment properties have been changed, other than the #GtkAdjustment:value property.

parameter.name: adjustment
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal

signal.name: GtkAdjustment::value-changed
signal.description: Emitted when the #GtkAdjustment:value property has been changed.

parameter.name: adjustment
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal

property.name: GtkAdjustment:lower
property.description: The minimum value of the adjustment.

property.name: GtkAdjustment:page-increment
property.description: The page increment of the adjustment.

property.name: GtkAdjustment:page-size
property.description: The page size of the adjustment. Note that the page-size is irrelevant and should be set to zero if the adjustment is used for a simple scalar value, e.g. in a #GtkSpinButton.

property.name: GtkAdjustment:step-increment
property.description: The step increment of the adjustment.

property.name: GtkAdjustment:upper
property.description: The maximum value of the adjustment. Note that values will be restricted by `upper - page-size` if the page-size property is nonzero.

property.name: GtkAdjustment:value
property.description: The value of the adjustment.

enum.name: GtkAlign
enum.description:
Controls how a widget deals with extra space in a single (x or y) dimension.
Alignment only matters if the widget receives a “too large” allocation, for example if you packed the widget with the #GtkWidget:hexpand property inside a #GtkBox, then the widget might get extra space. If you have for example a 16x16 icon inside a 32x32 space, the icon could be scaled and stretched, it could be centered, or it could be positioned to one side of the space.
Note that in horizontal context %GTK_ALIGN_START and %GTK_ALIGN_END are interpreted relative to text direction.
%GTK_ALIGN_BASELINE support is optional for containers and widgets, and it is only supported for vertical alignment. When it's not supported by a child or a container it is treated as %GTK_ALIGN_FILL.

parameter.name: GTK_ALIGN_FILL
parameter.parameter_description: stretch to fill all space if possible, center if no meaningful way to stretch

parameter.name: GTK_ALIGN_START
parameter.parameter_description: snap to left or top side, leaving space on right or bottom

parameter.name: GTK_ALIGN_END
parameter.parameter_description: snap to right or bottom side, leaving space on left or top

parameter.name: GTK_ALIGN_CENTER
parameter.parameter_description: center natural width of widget inside the allocation

parameter.name: GTK_ALIGN_BASELINE
parameter.parameter_description: align the widget according to the baseline. See #GtkWidget

property.name: GtkAlternativeTrigger:first
property.description: The first #GtkShortcutTrigger to check.

property.name: GtkAlternativeTrigger:second
property.description: The second #GtkShortcutTrigger to check.

property.name: GtkAppChooser:content-type
property.description:
The content type of the #GtkAppChooser object.
See [GContentType][gio-GContentType] for more information about content types.

signal.name: GtkAppChooserButton::changed
signal.description: Emitted when the active application on the #GtkAppChooserButton changes.

parameter.name: self
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal

signal.name: GtkAppChooserButton::custom-item-activated
signal.description: Emitted when a custom item, previously added with gtk_app_chooser_button_append_custom_item(), is activated from the dropdown menu.

parameter.name: self
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal

parameter.name: item_name
parameter.parameter_description: the name of the activated item

property.name: GtkAppChooserButton:heading
property.description: The text to show at the top of the dialog that can be opened from the button. The string may contain Pango markup.

property.name: GtkAppChooserButton:show-default-item
property.description: The #GtkAppChooserButton:show-default-item property determines whether the dropdown menu should show the default application on top for the provided content type.

property.name: GtkAppChooserButton:show-dialog-item
property.description: The #GtkAppChooserButton:show-dialog-item property determines whether the dropdown menu should show an item that triggers a #GtkAppChooserDialog when clicked.

property.name: GtkAppChooserDialog:gfile
property.description: The GFile used by the #GtkAppChooserDialog. The dialog's #GtkAppChooserWidget content type will be guessed from the file, if present.

property.name: GtkAppChooserDialog:heading
property.description: The text to show at the top of the dialog. The string may contain Pango markup.

signal.name: GtkAppChooserWidget::application-activated
signal.description:
Emitted when an application item is activated from the widget's list.
This usually happens when the user double clicks an item, or an item is selected and the user presses one of the keys Space, Shift+Space, Return or Enter.

parameter.name: self
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal

signal.name: GtkAppChooserWidget::application-selected
signal.description: Emitted when an application item is selected from the widget's list.

parameter.name: self
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal

property.name: GtkAppChooserWidget:default-text
property.description: The #GtkAppChooserWidget:default-text property determines the text that appears in the widget when there are no applications for the given content type. See also gtk_app_chooser_widget_set_default_text().

property.name: GtkAppChooserWidget:show-all
property.description: If the #GtkAppChooserWidget:show-all property is %TRUE, the app chooser presents all applications in a single list, without subsections for default, recommended or related applications.

property.name: GtkAppChooserWidget:show-default
property.description: The ::show-default property determines whether the app chooser should show the default handler for the content type in a separate section. If %FALSE, the default handler is listed among the recommended applications.

property.name: GtkAppChooserWidget:show-fallback
property.description: The #GtkAppChooserWidget:show-fallback property determines whether the app chooser should show a section for fallback applications. If %FALSE, the fallback applications are listed among the other applications.

property.name: GtkAppChooserWidget:show-other
property.description: The #GtkAppChooserWidget:show-other property determines whether the app chooser should show a section for other applications.

property.name: GtkAppChooserWidget:show-recommended
property.description: The #GtkAppChooserWidget:show-recommended property determines whether the app chooser should show a section for recommended applications. If %FALSE, the recommended applications are listed among the other applications.

signal.name: GtkApplication::query-end
signal.description: Emitted when the session manager is about to end the session, only if #GtkApplication:register-session is %TRUE. Applications can connect to this signal and call gtk_application_inhibit() with %GTK_APPLICATION_INHIBIT_LOGOUT to delay the end of the session until state has been saved.

signal.name: GtkApplication::window-added
signal.description: Emitted when a #GtkWindow is added to @application through gtk_application_add_window().

signal.name: GtkApplication::window-removed
signal.description: Emitted when a #GtkWindow is removed from @application, either as a side-effect of being destroyed or explicitly through gtk_application_remove_window().

property.name: GtkApplication:register-session
property.description: Set this property to %TRUE to register with the session manager. This will make GTK+ track the session state (such as the #GtkApplication:screensaver-active property).

property.name: GtkApplication:screensaver-active
property.description:
This property is %TRUE if GTK+ believes that the screensaver is currently active. GTK+ only tracks session state (including this) when #GtkApplication:register-session is set to %TRUE.
Tracking the screensaver state is supported on Linux.

enum.name: GtkApplicationInhibitFlags
enum.description: Types of user actions that may be blocked by gtk_application_inhibit().

parameter.name: GTK_APPLICATION_INHIBIT_LOGOUT
parameter.parameter_description: Inhibit ending the user session by logging out or by shutting down the computer

parameter.name: GTK_APPLICATION_INHIBIT_SUSPEND
parameter.parameter_description: Inhibit suspending the session or computer

parameter.name: GTK_APPLICATION_INHIBIT_IDLE
parameter.parameter_description: Inhibit the session being marked as idle (and possibly locked)

property.name: GtkApplicationWindow:show-menubar
property.description:
If this property is %TRUE, the window will display a menubar unless it is shown by the desktop shell. See gtk_application_set_menubar().
If %FALSE, the window will not display a menubar, regardless of whether the desktop shell is showing it or not.

enum.name: GtkArrowType
enum.description: Used to indicate the direction in which an arrow should point.

signal.name: GtkAssistant::apply
signal.description:
The ::apply signal is emitted when the apply button is clicked.
The default behavior of the #GtkAssistant is to switch to the page after the current page, unless the current page is the last one.
A handler for the ::apply signal should carry out the actions for which the wizard has collected data. If the action takes a long time to complete, you might consider putting a page of type %GTK_ASSISTANT_PAGE_PROGRESS after the confirmation page and handle this operation within the #GtkAssistant::prepare signal of the progress page.

signal.name: GtkAssistant::cancel
signal.description: The ::cancel signal is emitted when then the cancel button is clicked.

signal.name: GtkAssistant::close
signal.description: The ::close signal is emitted either when the close button of a summary page is clicked, or when the apply button in the last page in the flow (of type %GTK_ASSISTANT_PAGE_CONFIRM) is clicked.

signal.name: GtkAssistant::escape
signal.description: The action signal for the Escape binding.

signal.name: GtkAssistant::prepare
signal.description:
The ::prepare signal is emitted when a new page is set as the assistant's current page, before making the new page visible.
A handler for this signal can do any preparations which are necessary before showing @page.

property.name: GtkAssistant:use-header-bar
property.description:
%TRUE if the assistant uses a #GtkHeaderBar for action buttons instead of the action-area.
For technical reasons, this property is declared as an integer property, but you should only set it to %TRUE or %FALSE.

property.name: GtkAssistantPage:complete
property.description: Setting the "complete" property to %TRUE marks a page as complete (i.e.: all the required fields are filled out). GTK uses this information to control the sensitivity of the navigation buttons.

property.name: GtkAssistantPage:page-type
property.description: The type of the assistant page.

property.name: GtkAssistantPage:title
property.description: The title of the page.

enum.name: GtkAssistantPageType
enum.description:
An enum for determining the page role inside the #GtkAssistant. It's used to handle buttons sensitivity and visibility.
Note that an assistant needs to end its page flow with a page of type %GTK_ASSISTANT_PAGE_CONFIRM, %GTK_ASSISTANT_PAGE_SUMMARY or %GTK_ASSISTANT_PAGE_PROGRESS to be correct.
The Cancel button will only be shown if the page isn’t “committed”. See gtk_assistant_commit() for details.

parameter.name: GTK_ASSISTANT_PAGE_CONTENT
parameter.parameter_description: The page has regular contents. Both the Back and forward buttons will be shown.

parameter.name: GTK_ASSISTANT_PAGE_INTRO
parameter.parameter_description: The page contains an introduction to the assistant task. Only the Forward button will be shown if there is a next page.

parameter.name: GTK_ASSISTANT_PAGE_CONFIRM
parameter.parameter_description: The page lets the user confirm or deny the changes. The Back and Apply buttons will be shown.

parameter.name: GTK_ASSISTANT_PAGE_SUMMARY
parameter.parameter_description: The page informs the user of the changes done. Only the Close button will be shown.

parameter.name: GTK_ASSISTANT_PAGE_PROGRESS
parameter.parameter_description: Used for tasks that take a long time to complete, blocks the assistant until the page is marked as complete. Only the back button will be shown.

parameter.name: GTK_ASSISTANT_PAGE_CUSTOM
parameter.parameter_description: Used for when other page types are not appropriate. No buttons will be shown, and the application must add its own buttons through gtk_assistant_add_action_widget().

enum.name: GtkBaselinePosition
enum.description: Whenever a container has some form of natural row it may align children in that row along a common typographical baseline. If the amount of vertical space in the row is taller than the total requested height of the baseline-aligned children then it can use a #GtkBaselinePosition to select where to put the baseline inside the extra available space.

parameter.name: GTK_BASELINE_POSITION_TOP
parameter.parameter_description: Align the baseline at the top

parameter.name: GTK_BASELINE_POSITION_BOTTOM
parameter.parameter_description: Align the baseline at the bottom

property.name: GtkBookmarkList:attributes
property.description: The attributes to query

property.name: GtkBookmarkList:io-priority
property.description: Priority used when loading

property.name: GtkBookmarkList:loading
property.description: %TRUE if files are being loaded

property.name: GtkBoolFilter:expression
property.description: The boolean expression to evaluate on item

property.name: GtkBoolFilter:invert
property.description: If the expression result should be inverted

enum.name: GtkBorderStyle
enum.description: Describes how the border of a UI element should be rendered.

parameter.name: GTK_BORDER_STYLE_INSET
parameter.parameter_description: Looks as if the content is sunken into the canvas

parameter.name: GTK_BORDER_STYLE_OUTSET
parameter.parameter_description: Looks as if the content is coming out of the canvas

parameter.name: GTK_BORDER_STYLE_DOUBLE
parameter.parameter_description: Two parallel lines with some space between them

parameter.name: GTK_BORDER_STYLE_GROOVE
parameter.parameter_description: Looks as if it were carved in the canvas

parameter.name: GTK_BORDER_STYLE_RIDGE
parameter.parameter_description: Looks as if it were coming out of the canvas

property.name: GtkBoxLayout:baseline-position
property.description:
The position of the allocated baseline within the extra space allocated to each child of the widget using a box layout manager.
This property is only relevant for horizontal layouts containing at least one child with a baseline alignment.

property.name: GtkBoxLayout:homogeneous
property.description: Whether the box layout should distribute the available space homogeneously among the children of the widget using it as a layout manager.

property.name: GtkBoxLayout:spacing
property.description: The space between each child of the widget using the box layout as its layout manager.

property.name: GtkBuilder:current-object
property.description: The object the builder is evaluating for.

property.name: GtkBuilder:scope
property.description: The scope the builder is operating in

property.name: GtkBuilder:translation-domain
property.description: The translation domain used when translating property values that have been marked as translatable in interface descriptions. If the translation domain is %NULL, #GtkBuilder uses gettext(), otherwise g_dgettext().

enum.name: GtkBuilderClosureFlags
enum.description: The list of flags that can be passed to gtk_builder_create_closure(). New values may be added in the future for new features, so external implementations of GtkBuilderScopeInterface should test the flags for unknown values and raise a %GTK_BUILDER_ERROR_INVALID_ATTRIBUTE error when they encounter one.

parameter.name: GTK_BUILDER_CLOSURE_SWAPPED
parameter.parameter_description: The closure should be created swapped. See g_cclosure_new_swap() for details.

enum.name: GtkBuilderError
enum.description: Error codes that identify various errors that can occur while using #GtkBuilder.

parameter.name: GTK_BUILDER_ERROR_INVALID_TYPE_FUNCTION
parameter.parameter_description: A type-func attribute didn’t name a function that returns a #GType.

parameter.name: GTK_BUILDER_ERROR_UNHANDLED_TAG
parameter.parameter_description: The input contained a tag that #GtkBuilder can’t handle.

parameter.name: GTK_BUILDER_ERROR_MISSING_ATTRIBUTE
parameter.parameter_description: An attribute that is required by #GtkBuilder was missing.

parameter.name: GTK_BUILDER_ERROR_INVALID_ATTRIBUTE
parameter.parameter_description: #GtkBuilder found an attribute that it doesn’t understand.

parameter.name: GTK_BUILDER_ERROR_INVALID_TAG
parameter.parameter_description: #GtkBuilder found a tag that it doesn’t understand.

parameter.name: GTK_BUILDER_ERROR_MISSING_PROPERTY_VALUE
parameter.parameter_description: A required property value was missing.

parameter.name: GTK_BUILDER_ERROR_VERSION_MISMATCH
parameter.parameter_description: The input file requires a newer version of GTK.

parameter.name: GTK_BUILDER_ERROR_OBJECT_TYPE_REFUSED
parameter.parameter_description: A specified object type is of the same type or derived from the type of the composite class being extended with builder XML.

parameter.name: GTK_BUILDER_ERROR_TEMPLATE_MISMATCH
parameter.parameter_description: The wrong type was specified in a composite class’s template XML

parameter.name: GTK_BUILDER_ERROR_INVALID_PROPERTY
parameter.parameter_description: The specified property is unknown for the object class.

parameter.name: GTK_BUILDER_ERROR_INVALID_SIGNAL
parameter.parameter_description: The specified signal is unknown for the object class.

parameter.name: GTK_BUILDER_ERROR_INVALID_FUNCTION
parameter.parameter_description: A function could not be found. This often happens when symbols are set to be kept private. Compiling code with -rdynamic or using the `gmodule-export-2.0` pkgconfig module can fix this problem.

property.name: GtkBuilderListItemFactory:bytes
property.description: bytes containing the UI definition

property.name: GtkBuilderListItemFactory:resource
property.description: resource containing the UI definition

property.name: GtkBuilderListItemFactory:scope
property.description: scope to use when instantiating listitems

signal.name: GtkButton::activate
signal.description: The ::activate signal on GtkButton is an action signal and emitting it causes the button to animate press then release. Applications should never connect to this signal, but use the #GtkButton::clicked signal.

parameter.name: widget
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal.

signal.name: GtkButton::clicked
signal.description: Emitted when the button has been activated (pressed and released).

parameter.name: button
parameter.parameter_description: the object that received the signal

enum.name: GtkButtonRole
enum.description: The role specifies the desired appearance of a #GtkModelButton.

enum.name: GtkButtonsType
enum.description:
Prebuilt sets of buttons for the dialog. If none of these choices are appropriate, simply use %GTK_BUTTONS_NONE then call gtk_dialog_add_buttons().
> Please note that %GTK_BUTTONS_OK, %GTK_BUTTONS_YES_NO > and %GTK_BUTTONS_OK_CANCEL are discouraged by the > [GNOME Human Interface Guidelines](http://library.gnome.org/devel/hig-book/stable/).

signal.name: GtkCalendar::day-selected
signal.description: Emitted when the user selects a day.

parameter.name: calendar
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal.

signal.name: GtkCalendar::next-month
signal.description: Emitted when the user switched to the next month.

parameter.name: calendar
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal.

signal.name: GtkCalendar::next-year
signal.description: Emitted when user switched to the next year.

parameter.name: calendar
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal.

signal.name: GtkCalendar::prev-month
signal.description: Emitted when the user switched to the previous month.

parameter.name: calendar
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal.

signal.name: GtkCalendar::prev-year
signal.description: Emitted when user switched to the previous year.

parameter.name: calendar
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal.

property.name: GtkCalendar:day
property.description: The selected day (as a number between 1 and 31, or 0 to unselect the currently selected day). This property gets initially set to the current day.

property.name: GtkCalendar:month
property.description: The selected month (as a number between 0 and 11). This property gets initially set to the current month.

property.name: GtkCalendar:show-day-names
property.description: Determines whether day names are displayed.

property.name: GtkCalendar:show-heading
property.description: Determines whether a heading is displayed.

property.name: GtkCalendar:show-week-numbers
property.description: Determines whether week numbers are displayed.

property.name: GtkCalendar:year
property.description: The selected year. This property gets initially set to the current year.

signal.name: GtkCellArea::add-editable
signal.description: Indicates that editing has started on @renderer and that @editable should be added to the owning cell-layouting widget at @cell_area.

parameter.name: cell_area
parameter.parameter_description: the #GtkWidget relative #GdkRectangle coordinates where @editable should be added

parameter.name: path
parameter.parameter_description: the #GtkTreePath string this edit was initiated for

signal.name: GtkCellArea::apply-attributes
signal.description: This signal is emitted whenever applying attributes to @area from @model

parameter.name: area
parameter.parameter_description: the #GtkCellArea to apply the attributes to

parameter.name: model
parameter.parameter_description: the #GtkTreeModel to apply the attributes from

parameter.name: iter
parameter.parameter_description: the #GtkTreeIter indicating which row to apply the attributes of

parameter.name: is_expander
parameter.parameter_description: whether the view shows children for this row

parameter.name: is_expanded
parameter.parameter_description: whether the view is currently showing the children of this row

signal.name: GtkCellArea::focus-changed
signal.description:
Indicates that focus changed on this @area. This signal is emitted either as a result of focus handling or event handling.
It's possible that the signal is emitted even if the currently focused renderer did not change, this is because focus may change to the same renderer in the same cell area for a different row of data.

signal.name: GtkCellArea::remove-editable
signal.description: Indicates that editing finished on @renderer and that @editable should be removed from the owning cell-layouting widget.

property.name: GtkCellArea:edit-widget
property.description:
The widget currently editing the edited cell
This property is read-only and only changes as a result of a call gtk_cell_area_activate_cell().

property.name: GtkCellArea:edited-cell
property.description:
The cell in the area that is currently edited
This property is read-only and only changes as a result of a call gtk_cell_area_activate_cell().

property.name: GtkCellArea:focus-cell
property.description: The cell in the area that currently has focus

property.name: GtkCellAreaBox:align
property.description: Whether the cell renderer should be aligned in adjacent rows.

property.name: GtkCellAreaBox:expand
property.description: Whether the cell renderer should receive extra space when the area receives more than its natural size.

property.name: GtkCellAreaBox:fixed-size
property.description: Whether the cell renderer should require the same size for all rows for which it was requested.

property.name: GtkCellAreaBox:pack-type
property.description: A GtkPackType indicating whether the cell renderer is packed with reference to the start or end of the area.

property.name: GtkCellAreaBox:spacing
property.description: The amount of space to reserve between cells.

property.name: GtkCellAreaContext:area
property.description: The #GtkCellArea this context was created by

property.name: GtkCellAreaContext:minimum-height
property.description: The minimum height for the #GtkCellArea in this context for all #GtkTreeModel rows that this context was requested for using gtk_cell_area_get_preferred_height().

property.name: GtkCellAreaContext:minimum-width
property.description: The minimum width for the #GtkCellArea in this context for all #GtkTreeModel rows that this context was requested for using gtk_cell_area_get_preferred_width().

property.name: GtkCellAreaContext:natural-height
property.description: The natural height for the #GtkCellArea in this context for all #GtkTreeModel rows that this context was requested for using gtk_cell_area_get_preferred_height().

property.name: GtkCellAreaContext:natural-width
property.description: The natural width for the #GtkCellArea in this context for all #GtkTreeModel rows that this context was requested for using gtk_cell_area_get_preferred_width().

signal.name: GtkCellEditable::editing-done
signal.description:
This signal is a sign for the cell renderer to update its value from the @cell_editable.
Implementations of #GtkCellEditable are responsible for emitting this signal when they are done editing, e.g. #GtkEntry emits this signal when the user presses Enter. Typical things to do in a handler for ::editing-done are to capture the edited value, disconnect the @cell_editable from signals on the #GtkCellRenderer, etc.
gtk_cell_editable_editing_done() is a convenience method for emitting #GtkCellEditable::editing-done.

parameter.name: cell_editable
parameter.parameter_description: the object on which the signal was emitted

signal.name: GtkCellEditable::remove-widget
signal.description:
This signal is meant to indicate that the cell is finished editing, and the @cell_editable widget is being removed and may subsequently be destroyed.
Implementations of #GtkCellEditable are responsible for emitting this signal when they are done editing. It must be emitted after the #GtkCellEditable::editing-done signal, to give the cell renderer a chance to update the cell's value before the widget is removed.
gtk_cell_editable_remove_widget() is a convenience method for emitting #GtkCellEditable::remove-widget.

parameter.name: cell_editable
parameter.parameter_description: the object on which the signal was emitted

property.name: GtkCellEditable:editing-canceled
property.description: Indicates whether editing on the cell has been canceled.

signal.name: GtkCellRenderer::editing-canceled
signal.description:
This signal gets emitted when the user cancels the process of editing a cell. For example, an editable cell renderer could be written to cancel editing when the user presses Escape.
See also: gtk_cell_renderer_stop_editing().

parameter.name: renderer
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal

signal.name: GtkCellRenderer::editing-started

parameter.name: renderer
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal

parameter.name: path
parameter.parameter_description: the path identifying the edited cell

property.name: GtkCellRenderer:cell-background-rgba
property.description: Cell background as a #GdkRGBA

signal.name: GtkCellRendererAccel::accel-cleared
signal.description: Gets emitted when the user has removed the accelerator.

parameter.name: path_string
parameter.parameter_description: the path identifying the row of the edited cell

signal.name: GtkCellRendererAccel::accel-edited
signal.description: Gets emitted when the user has selected a new accelerator.

parameter.name: path_string
parameter.parameter_description: the path identifying the row of the edited cell

parameter.name: hardware_keycode
parameter.parameter_description: the keycode of the new accelerator

property.name: GtkCellRendererAccel:accel-key
property.description: The keyval of the accelerator.

property.name: GtkCellRendererAccel:accel-mode
property.description: Determines if the edited accelerators are GTK accelerators. If they are, consumed modifiers are suppressed, only accelerators accepted by GTK are allowed, and the accelerators are rendered in the same way as they are in menus.

property.name: GtkCellRendererAccel:accel-mods
property.description: The modifier mask of the accelerator.

property.name: GtkCellRendererAccel:keycode
property.description: The hardware keycode of the accelerator. Note that the hardware keycode is only relevant if the key does not have a keyval. Normally, the keyboard configuration should assign keyvals to all keys.

enum.name: GtkCellRendererAccelMode
enum.description: Determines if the edited accelerators are GTK accelerators. If they are, consumed modifiers are suppressed, only accelerators accepted by GTK are allowed, and the accelerators are rendered in the same way as they are in menus.

signal.name: GtkCellRendererCombo::changed
signal.description:
This signal is emitted each time after the user selected an item in the combo box, either by using the mouse or the arrow keys. Contrary to GtkComboBox, GtkCellRendererCombo::changed is not emitted for changes made to a selected item in the entry. The argument @new_iter corresponds to the newly selected item in the combo box and it is relative to the GtkTreeModel set via the model property on GtkCellRendererCombo.
Note that as soon as you change the model displayed in the tree view, the tree view will immediately cease the editing operating. This means that you most probably want to refrain from changing the model until the combo cell renderer emits the edited or editing_canceled signal.

parameter.name: combo
parameter.parameter_description: the object on which the signal is emitted

parameter.name: path_string
parameter.parameter_description: a string of the path identifying the edited cell (relative to the tree view model)

parameter.name: new_iter
parameter.parameter_description: the new iter selected in the combo box (relative to the combo box model)

property.name: GtkCellRendererCombo:has-entry
property.description: If %TRUE, the cell renderer will include an entry and allow to enter values other than the ones in the popup list.

property.name: GtkCellRendererCombo:model
property.description: Holds a tree model containing the possible values for the combo box. Use the text_column property to specify the column holding the values.

property.name: GtkCellRendererCombo:text-column
property.description:
Specifies the model column which holds the possible values for the combo box.
Note that this refers to the model specified in the model property, not the model backing the tree view to which this cell renderer is attached.
#GtkCellRendererCombo automatically adds a text cell renderer for this column to its combo box.

enum.name: GtkCellRendererMode
enum.description: Identifies how the user can interact with a particular cell.

parameter.name: GTK_CELL_RENDERER_MODE_INERT
parameter.parameter_description: The cell is just for display and cannot be interacted with. Note that this doesn’t mean that eg. the row being drawn can’t be selected -- just that a particular element of it cannot be individually modified.

parameter.name: GTK_CELL_RENDERER_MODE_EDITABLE
parameter.parameter_description: The cell can be edited or otherwise modified.

property.name: GtkCellRendererPixbuf:gicon
property.description: The GIcon representing the icon to display. If the icon theme is changed, the image will be updated automatically.

property.name: GtkCellRendererPixbuf:icon-name
property.description: The name of the themed icon to display. This property only has an effect if not overridden by the "pixbuf" property.

property.name: GtkCellRendererPixbuf:icon-size
property.description: The #GtkIconSize value that specifies the size of the rendered icon.

property.name: GtkCellRendererProgress:pulse
property.description:
Setting this to a non-negative value causes the cell renderer to enter "activity mode", where a block bounces back and forth to indicate that some progress is made, without specifying exactly how much.
Each increment of the property causes the block to move by a little bit.
To indicate that the activity has not started yet, set the property to zero. To indicate completion, set the property to %G_MAXINT.

property.name: GtkCellRendererProgress:text
property.description: The "text" property determines the label which will be drawn over the progress bar. Setting this property to %NULL causes the default label to be displayed. Setting this property to an empty string causes no label to be displayed.

property.name: GtkCellRendererProgress:text-xalign
property.description: The "text-xalign" property controls the horizontal alignment of the text in the progress bar. Valid values range from 0 (left) to 1 (right). Reserved for RTL layouts.

property.name: GtkCellRendererProgress:text-yalign
property.description: The "text-yalign" property controls the vertical alignment of the text in the progress bar. Valid values range from 0 (top) to 1 (bottom).

property.name: GtkCellRendererProgress:value
property.description: The "value" property determines the percentage to which the progress bar will be "filled in".

property.name: GtkCellRendererSpin:adjustment
property.description: The adjustment that holds the value of the spinbutton. This must be non-%NULL for the cell renderer to be editable.

property.name: GtkCellRendererSpin:climb-rate
property.description: The acceleration rate when you hold down a button.

property.name: GtkCellRendererSpin:digits
property.description: The number of decimal places to display.

property.name: GtkCellRendererSpinner:pulse
property.description:
Pulse of the spinner. Increment this value to draw the next frame of the spinner animation. Usually, you would update this value in a timeout.
By default, the #GtkSpinner widget draws one full cycle of the animation, consisting of 12 frames, in 750 milliseconds.

property.name: GtkCellRendererSpinner:size
property.description: The #GtkIconSize value that specifies the size of the rendered spinner.

enum.name: GtkCellRendererState
enum.description: Tells how a cell is to be rendered.

parameter.name: GTK_CELL_RENDERER_SELECTED
parameter.parameter_description: The cell is currently selected, and probably has a selection colored background to render to.

parameter.name: GTK_CELL_RENDERER_PRELIT
parameter.parameter_description: The mouse is hovering over the cell.

parameter.name: GTK_CELL_RENDERER_INSENSITIVE
parameter.parameter_description: The cell is drawn in an insensitive manner

parameter.name: GTK_CELL_RENDERER_SORTED
parameter.parameter_description: The cell is in a sorted row

parameter.name: GTK_CELL_RENDERER_FOCUSED
parameter.parameter_description: The cell is in the focus row.

parameter.name: GTK_CELL_RENDERER_EXPANDABLE
parameter.parameter_description: The cell is in a row that can be expanded

parameter.name: GTK_CELL_RENDERER_EXPANDED
parameter.parameter_description: The cell is in a row that is expanded

signal.name: GtkCellRendererText::edited
signal.description:
This signal is emitted after @renderer has been edited.
It is the responsibility of the application to update the model and store @new_text at the position indicated by @path.

parameter.name: renderer
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal

parameter.name: path
parameter.parameter_description: the path identifying the edited cell

property.name: GtkCellRendererText:alignment
property.description:
Specifies how to align the lines of text with respect to each other.
Note that this property describes how to align the lines of text in case there are several of them. The "xalign" property of #GtkCellRenderer, on the other hand, sets the horizontal alignment of the whole text.

property.name: GtkCellRendererText:background-rgba
property.description: Background color as a #GdkRGBA

property.name: GtkCellRendererText:ellipsize
property.description: Specifies the preferred place to ellipsize the string, if the cell renderer does not have enough room to display the entire string. Setting it to %PANGO_ELLIPSIZE_NONE turns off ellipsizing. See the wrap-width property for another way of making the text fit into a given width.

property.name: GtkCellRendererText:foreground-rgba
property.description: Foreground color as a #GdkRGBA

property.name: GtkCellRendererText:max-width-chars
property.description:
The desired maximum width of the cell, in characters. If this property is set to -1, the width will be calculated automatically.
For cell renderers that ellipsize or wrap text; this property controls the maximum reported width of the cell. The cell should not receive any greater allocation unless it is set to expand in its #GtkCellLayout and all of the cell's siblings have received their natural width.

property.name: GtkCellRendererText:placeholder-text
property.description: The text that will be displayed in the #GtkCellRenderer if #GtkCellRendererText:editable is %TRUE and the cell is empty.

property.name: GtkCellRendererText:width-chars
property.description: The desired width of the cell, in characters. If this property is set to -1, the width will be calculated automatically, otherwise the cell will request either 3 characters or the property value, whichever is greater.

property.name: GtkCellRendererText:wrap-mode
property.description: Specifies how to break the string into multiple lines, if the cell renderer does not have enough room to display the entire string. This property has no effect unless the wrap-width property is set.

property.name: GtkCellRendererText:wrap-width
property.description: Specifies the minimum width at which the text is wrapped. The wrap-mode property can be used to influence at what character positions the line breaks can be placed. Setting wrap-width to -1 turns wrapping off.

signal.name: GtkCellRendererToggle::toggled
signal.description:
The ::toggled signal is emitted when the cell is toggled.
It is the responsibility of the application to update the model with the correct value to store at @path. Often this is simply the opposite of the value currently stored at @path.

parameter.name: cell_renderer
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal

parameter.name: path
parameter.parameter_description: string representation of #GtkTreePath describing the event location

property.name: GtkCellView:cell-area
property.description:
The #GtkCellArea rendering cells
If no area is specified when creating the cell view with gtk_cell_view_new_with_context() a horizontally oriented #GtkCellAreaBox will be used.
since 3.0

property.name: GtkCellView:cell-area-context
property.description:
The #GtkCellAreaContext used to compute the geometry of the cell view.
A group of cell views can be assigned the same context in order to ensure the sizes and cell alignments match across all the views with the same context.
#GtkComboBox menus uses this to assign the same context to all cell views in the menu items for a single menu (each submenu creates its own context since the size of each submenu does not depend on parent or sibling menus).
since 3.0

property.name: GtkCellView:draw-sensitive
property.description:
Whether all cells should be draw as sensitive for this view regardless of the actual cell properties (used to make menus with submenus appear sensitive when the items in submenus might be insensitive).
since 3.0

property.name: GtkCellView:fit-model
property.description:
Whether the view should request enough space to always fit the size of every row in the model (used by the combo box to ensure the combo box size doesn't change when different items are selected).
since 3.0

property.name: GtkCellView:model
property.description:
The model for cell view
since 2.10

signal.name: GtkCheckButton::toggled
signal.description: Emitted when the buttons's #GtkCheckButton:active flag changes.

signal.name: GtkColorButton::color-set
signal.description:
The ::color-set signal is emitted when the user selects a color. When handling this signal, use gtk_color_chooser_get_rgba() to find out which color was just selected.
Note that this signal is only emitted when the user changes the color. If you need to react to programmatic color changes as well, use the notify::color signal.

parameter.name: widget
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal.

property.name: GtkColorButton:show-editor
property.description:
Set this property to %TRUE to skip the palette in the dialog and go directly to the color editor.
This property should be used in cases where the palette in the editor would be redundant, such as when the color button is already part of a palette.

property.name: GtkColorButton:title
property.description: The title of the color selection dialog

signal.name: GtkColorChooser::color-activated
signal.description: Emitted when a color is activated from the color chooser. This usually happens when the user clicks a color swatch, or a color is selected and the user presses one of the keys Space, Shift+Space, Return or Enter.

parameter.name: chooser
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal

property.name: GtkColorChooser:rgba
property.description: The ::rgba property contains the currently selected color, as a #GdkRGBA struct. The property can be set to change the current selection programmatically.

property.name: GtkColorChooser:use-alpha
property.description:
When ::use-alpha is %TRUE, colors may have alpha (translucency) information. When it is %FALSE, the #GdkRGBA struct obtained via the #GtkColorChooser:rgba property will be forced to have alpha == 1.
Implementations are expected to show alpha by rendering the color over a non-uniform background (like a checkerboard pattern).

property.name: GtkColorChooserWidget:show-editor
property.description: The ::show-editor property is %TRUE when the color chooser is showing the single-color editor. It can be set to switch the color chooser into single-color editing mode.

signal.name: GtkColumnView::activate
signal.description:
The ::activate signal is emitted when a row has been activated by the user, usually via activating the GtkListBase|list.activate-item action.
This allows for a convenient way to handle activation in a columnview. See gtk_list_item_set_activatable() for details on how to use this signal.

property.name: GtkColumnView:columns
property.description: The list of columns

property.name: GtkColumnView:enable-rubberband
property.description: Allow rubberband selection

property.name: GtkColumnView:model
property.description: Model for the items displayed

property.name: GtkColumnView:reorderable
property.description: Whether columns are reorderable

property.name: GtkColumnView:show-column-separators
property.description: Show separators between columns

property.name: GtkColumnView:show-row-separators
property.description: Show separators between rows

property.name: GtkColumnView:single-click-activate
property.description: Activate rows on single click and select them on hover

property.name: GtkColumnView:sorter
property.description: Sorter with the sorting choices of the user

property.name: GtkColumnViewColumn:column-view
property.description: #GtkColumnView this column is a part of

property.name: GtkColumnViewColumn:expand
property.description: Column gets share of extra width allocated to the view

property.name: GtkColumnViewColumn:factory
property.description: Factory for populating list items

property.name: GtkColumnViewColumn:fixed-width
property.description: If not -1, this is the width that the column is allocated, regardless of the size of its content.

property.name: GtkColumnViewColumn:header-menu
property.description: Menu model used to create the context menu for the column header.

property.name: GtkColumnViewColumn:resizable
property.description: Whether this column is resizable

property.name: GtkColumnViewColumn:sorter
property.description: Sorter for sorting items according to this column

property.name: GtkColumnViewColumn:title
property.description: Title displayed in the header

property.name: GtkColumnViewColumn:visible
property.description: Whether this column is visible

signal.name: GtkComboBox::changed
signal.description: The changed signal is emitted when the active item is changed. The can be due to the user selecting a different item from the list, or due to a call to gtk_combo_box_set_active_iter(). It will also be emitted while typing into the entry of a combo box with an entry.

parameter.name: widget
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal

signal.name: GtkComboBox::format-entry-text

parameter.name: combo
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal

parameter.name: path
parameter.parameter_description: the GtkTreePath string from the combo box's current model to format text for

signal.return: a newly allocated string representing @path for the current GtkComboBox model.

signal.name: GtkComboBox::move-active
signal.description: The ::move-active signal is a [keybinding signal][GtkSignalAction] which gets emitted to move the active selection.

parameter.name: widget
parameter.parameter_description: the object that received the signal

signal.name: GtkComboBox::popdown
signal.description:
The ::popdown signal is a [keybinding signal][GtkSignalAction] which gets emitted to popdown the combo box list.
The default bindings for this signal are Alt+Up and Escape.

parameter.name: button
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal

signal.name: GtkComboBox::popup
signal.description:
The ::popup signal is a [keybinding signal][GtkSignalAction] which gets emitted to popup the combo box list.
The default binding for this signal is Alt+Down.

parameter.name: widget
parameter.parameter_description: the object that received the signal

property.name: GtkComboBox:active
property.description: The item which is currently active. If the model is a non-flat treemodel, and the active item is not an immediate child of the root of the tree, this property has the value `gtk_tree_path_get_indices (path)[0]`, where `path` is the #GtkTreePath of the active item.

property.name: GtkComboBox:active-id
property.description: The value of the ID column of the active row.

property.name: GtkComboBox:button-sensitivity
property.description: Whether the dropdown button is sensitive when the model is empty.

property.name: GtkComboBox:entry-text-column
property.description: The column in the combo box's model to associate with strings from the entry if the combo was created with #GtkComboBox:has-entry = %TRUE.

property.name: GtkComboBox:has-entry
property.description: Whether the combo box has an entry.

property.name: GtkComboBox:has-frame
property.description: The has-frame property controls whether a frame is drawn around the entry.

property.name: GtkComboBox:id-column
property.description: The column in the combo box's model that provides string IDs for the values in the model, if != -1.

property.name: GtkComboBox:model
property.description: The model from which the combo box takes the values shown in the list.

property.name: GtkComboBox:popup-fixed-width
property.description: Whether the popup's width should be a fixed width matching the allocated width of the combo box.

property.name: GtkComboBox:popup-shown
property.description: Whether the combo boxes dropdown is popped up. Note that this property is mainly useful, because it allows you to connect to notify::popup-shown.

property.name: GtkConstraint:constant
property.description: The constant value to be added to the #GtkConstraint:source-attribute.

property.name: GtkConstraint:multiplier
property.description: The multiplication factor to be applied to the #GtkConstraint:source-attribute.

property.name: GtkConstraint:relation
property.description: The order relation between the terms of the constraint.

property.name: GtkConstraint:source
property.description:
The source of the constraint.
The constraint will set the #GtkConstraint:target-attribute of the target using the #GtkConstraint:source-attribute of the source.

property.name: GtkConstraint:source-attribute
property.description: The attribute of the #GtkConstraint:source read by the constraint.

property.name: GtkConstraint:strength
property.description:
The strength of the constraint.
The strength can be expressed either using one of the symbolic values of the #GtkConstraintStrength enumeration, or any positive integer value.

property.name: GtkConstraint:target
property.description:
The target of the constraint.
The constraint will set the #GtkConstraint:target-attribute of the target using the #GtkConstraint:source-attribute of the source widget.

property.name: GtkConstraint:target-attribute
property.description: The attribute of the #GtkConstraint:target set by the constraint.

enum.name: GtkConstraintAttribute
enum.description: The widget attributes that can be used when creating a #GtkConstraint.

parameter.name: GTK_CONSTRAINT_ATTRIBUTE_NONE
parameter.parameter_description: No attribute, used for constant relations

parameter.name: GTK_CONSTRAINT_ATTRIBUTE_LEFT
parameter.parameter_description: The left edge of a widget, regardless of text direction

parameter.name: GTK_CONSTRAINT_ATTRIBUTE_RIGHT
parameter.parameter_description: The right edge of a widget, regardless of text direction

parameter.name: GTK_CONSTRAINT_ATTRIBUTE_TOP
parameter.parameter_description: The top edge of a widget

parameter.name: GTK_CONSTRAINT_ATTRIBUTE_BOTTOM
parameter.parameter_description: The bottom edge of a widget

parameter.name: GTK_CONSTRAINT_ATTRIBUTE_START
parameter.parameter_description: The leading edge of a widget, depending on text direction; equivalent to %GTK_CONSTRAINT_ATTRIBUTE_LEFT for LTR languages, and %GTK_CONSTRAINT_ATTRIBUTE_RIGHT for RTL ones

parameter.name: GTK_CONSTRAINT_ATTRIBUTE_END
parameter.parameter_description: The trailing edge of a widget, depending on text direction; equivalent to %GTK_CONSTRAINT_ATTRIBUTE_RIGHT for LTR languages, and %GTK_CONSTRAINT_ATTRIBUTE_LEFT for RTL ones

parameter.name: GTK_CONSTRAINT_ATTRIBUTE_CENTER_X
parameter.parameter_description: The center of a widget, on the horizontal axis

parameter.name: GTK_CONSTRAINT_ATTRIBUTE_CENTER_Y
parameter.parameter_description: The center of a widget, on the vertical axis

property.name: GtkConstraintGuide:max-height
property.description: The maximum height of the guide.

property.name: GtkConstraintGuide:max-width
property.description: The maximum width of the guide.

property.name: GtkConstraintGuide:min-height
property.description: The minimum height of the guide.

property.name: GtkConstraintGuide:min-width
property.description: The minimum width of the guide.

property.name: GtkConstraintGuide:name
property.description: A name that identifies the #GtkConstraintGuide, for debugging.

property.name: GtkConstraintGuide:nat-height
property.description: The preferred, or natural, height of the guide.

property.name: GtkConstraintGuide:nat-width
property.description: The preferred, or natural, width of the guide.

property.name: GtkConstraintGuide:strength
property.description: The #GtkConstraintStrength to be used for the constraint on the natural size of the guide.

enum.name: GtkConstraintRelation
enum.description: The relation between two terms of a constraint.

enum.name: GtkConstraintStrength
enum.description:
The strength of a constraint, expressed as a symbolic constant.
The strength of a #GtkConstraint can be expressed with any positive integer; the values of this enumeration can be used for readability.

parameter.name: GTK_CONSTRAINT_STRENGTH_REQUIRED
parameter.parameter_description: The constraint is required towards solving the layout

enum.name: GtkConstraintVflParserError
enum.description: Domain for VFL parsing errors.

enum.name: GtkCornerType
enum.description: Specifies which corner a child widget should be placed in when packed into a #GtkScrolledWindow. This is effectively the opposite of where the scroll bars are placed.

parameter.name: GTK_CORNER_TOP_LEFT
parameter.parameter_description: Place the scrollbars on the right and bottom of the widget (default behaviour).

parameter.name: GTK_CORNER_BOTTOM_LEFT
parameter.parameter_description: Place the scrollbars on the top and right of the widget.

parameter.name: GTK_CORNER_TOP_RIGHT
parameter.parameter_description: Place the scrollbars on the left and bottom of the widget.

parameter.name: GTK_CORNER_BOTTOM_RIGHT
parameter.parameter_description: Place the scrollbars on the top and left of the widget.

enum.name: GtkCssParserError
enum.description:
Errors that can occur while parsing CSS.
These errors are unexpected and will cause parts of the given CSS to be ignored.

parameter.name: GTK_CSS_PARSER_ERROR_SYNTAX
parameter.parameter_description: The given text does not form valid syntax

parameter.name: GTK_CSS_PARSER_ERROR_NAME
parameter.parameter_description: The given name has not been defined

parameter.name: GTK_CSS_PARSER_ERROR_UNKNOWN_VALUE
parameter.parameter_description: The given value is not correct

enum.name: GtkCssParserWarning
enum.description:
Warnings that can occur while parsing CSS.
Unlike #GtkCssParserErrors, warnings do not cause the parser to skip any input, but they indicate issues that should be fixed.

parameter.name: GTK_CSS_PARSER_WARNING_DEPRECATED
parameter.parameter_description: The given construct is deprecated and will be removed in a future version

parameter.name: GTK_CSS_PARSER_WARNING_SYNTAX
parameter.parameter_description: A syntax construct was used that should be avoided

signal.name: GtkCssProvider::parsing-error
signal.description:
Signals that a parsing error occurred. the @path, @line and @position describe the actual location of the error as accurately as possible.
Parsing errors are never fatal, so the parsing will resume after the error. Errors may however cause parts of the given data or even all of it to not be parsed at all. So it is a useful idea to check that the parsing succeeds by connecting to this signal.
Note that this signal may be emitted at any time as the css provider may opt to defer parsing parts or all of the input to a later time than when a loading function was called.

parameter.name: provider
parameter.parameter_description: the provider that had a parsing error

enum.name: GtkDeleteType
enum.description: See also: #GtkEntry::delete-from-cursor.

parameter.name: GTK_DELETE_WORD_ENDS
parameter.parameter_description: Delete only the portion of the word to the left/right of cursor if we’re in the middle of a word.

parameter.name: GTK_DELETE_DISPLAY_LINES
parameter.parameter_description: Delete display-lines. Display-lines refers to the visible lines, with respect to the current line breaks. As opposed to paragraphs, which are defined by line breaks in the input.

parameter.name: GTK_DELETE_DISPLAY_LINE_ENDS
parameter.parameter_description: Delete only the portion of the display-line to the left/right of cursor.

parameter.name: GTK_DELETE_PARAGRAPH_ENDS
parameter.parameter_description: Delete to the end of the paragraph. Like C-k in Emacs (or its reverse).

parameter.name: GTK_DELETE_PARAGRAPHS
parameter.parameter_description: Delete entire line. Like C-k in pico.

parameter.name: GTK_DELETE_WHITESPACE
parameter.parameter_description: Delete only whitespace. Like M-\ in Emacs.

signal.name: GtkDialog::close
signal.description:
The ::close signal is a [keybinding signal][GtkSignalAction] which gets emitted when the user uses a keybinding to close the dialog.
The default binding for this signal is the Escape key.

signal.name: GtkDialog::response
signal.description: Emitted when an action widget is clicked, the dialog receives a delete event, or the application programmer calls gtk_dialog_response(). On a delete event, the response ID is #GTK_RESPONSE_DELETE_EVENT. Otherwise, it depends on which action widget was clicked.

parameter.name: dialog
parameter.parameter_description: the object on which the signal is emitted

property.name: GtkDialog:use-header-bar
property.description:
%TRUE if the dialog uses a #GtkHeaderBar for action buttons instead of the action-area.
For technical reasons, this property is declared as an integer property, but you should only set it to %TRUE or %FALSE.

enum.name: GtkDialogFlags
enum.description: Flags used to influence dialog construction.

parameter.name: GTK_DIALOG_MODAL
parameter.parameter_description: Make the constructed dialog modal, see gtk_window_set_modal()

parameter.name: GTK_DIALOG_DESTROY_WITH_PARENT
parameter.parameter_description: Destroy the dialog when its parent is destroyed, see gtk_window_set_destroy_with_parent()

parameter.name: GTK_DIALOG_USE_HEADER_BAR
parameter.parameter_description: Create dialog with actions in header bar instead of action area

enum.name: GtkDirectionType
enum.description: Focus movement types.

property.name: GtkDirectoryList:attributes
property.description: The attributes to query

property.name: GtkDirectoryList:error
property.description: Error encountered while loading files

property.name: GtkDirectoryList:file
property.description: File to query

property.name: GtkDirectoryList:io-priority
property.description: Priority used when loading

property.name: GtkDirectoryList:loading
property.description: %TRUE if files are being loaded

property.name: GtkDirectoryList:monitored
property.description: %TRUE if the directory is monitored for changed

property.name: GtkDragIcon:child
