If no area is specified when creating the icon view with gtk_icon_view_new_with_area() a #GtkCellAreaBox will be used.

property.name: GtkIconView:column-spacing
property.description: The column-spacing property specifies the space which is inserted between the columns of the icon view.

property.name: GtkIconView:columns
property.description: The columns property contains the number of the columns in which the items should be displayed. If it is -1, the number of columns will be chosen automatically to fill the available area.

property.name: GtkIconView:item-orientation
property.description: The item-orientation property specifies how the cells (i.e. the icon and the text) of the item are positioned relative to each other.

property.name: GtkIconView:item-padding
property.description: The item-padding property specifies the padding around each of the icon view's item.

property.name: GtkIconView:item-width
property.description: The item-width property specifies the width to use for each item. If it is set to -1, the icon view will automatically determine a suitable item size.

property.name: GtkIconView:margin
property.description: The margin property specifies the space which is inserted at the edges of the icon view.

property.name: GtkIconView:markup-column
property.description: The ::markup-column property contains the number of the model column containing markup information to be displayed. The markup column must be of type #G_TYPE_STRING. If this property and the :text-column property are both set to column numbers, it overrides the text column. If both are set to -1, no texts are displayed.

property.name: GtkIconView:pixbuf-column
property.description: The ::pixbuf-column property contains the number of the model column containing the pixbufs which are displayed. The pixbuf column must be of type #GDK_TYPE_PIXBUF. Setting this property to -1 turns off the display of pixbufs.

property.name: GtkIconView:reorderable
property.description: The reorderable property specifies if the items can be reordered by DND.

property.name: GtkIconView:row-spacing
property.description: The row-spacing property specifies the space which is inserted between the rows of the icon view.

property.name: GtkIconView:selection-mode
property.description: The ::selection-mode property specifies the selection mode of icon view. If the mode is #GTK_SELECTION_MULTIPLE, rubberband selection is enabled, for the other modes, only keyboard selection is possible.

property.name: GtkIconView:spacing
property.description: The spacing property specifies the space which is inserted between the cells (i.e. the icon and the text) of an item.

property.name: GtkIconView:text-column
property.description: The ::text-column property contains the number of the model column containing the texts which are displayed. The text column must be of type #G_TYPE_STRING. If this property and the :markup-column property are both set to -1, no texts are displayed.

enum.name: GtkIconViewDropPosition
enum.description: An enum for determining where a dropped item goes.

parameter.name: GTK_ICON_VIEW_DROP_LEFT
parameter.parameter_description: dropped item is inserted to the left

parameter.name: GTK_ICON_VIEW_DROP_RIGHT
parameter.parameter_description: dropped item is inserted to the right

property.name: GtkImage:gicon
property.description: The GIcon displayed in the GtkImage. For themed icons, If the icon theme is changed, the image will be updated automatically.

property.name: GtkImage:icon-name
property.description: The name of the icon in the icon theme. If the icon theme is changed, the image will be updated automatically.

property.name: GtkImage:pixel-size
property.description: The "pixel-size" property can be used to specify a fixed size overriding the #GtkImage:icon-size property for images of type %GTK_IMAGE_ICON_NAME.

property.name: GtkImage:resource
property.description: A path to a resource file to display.

property.name: GtkImage:use-fallback
property.description: Whether the icon displayed in the GtkImage will use standard icon names fallback. The value of this property is only relevant for images of type %GTK_IMAGE_ICON_NAME and %GTK_IMAGE_GICON.

enum.name: GtkImageType
enum.description: Describes the image data representation used by a #GtkImage. If you want to get the image from the widget, you can only get the currently-stored representation. e.g. if the gtk_image_get_storage_type() returns #GTK_IMAGE_PAINTABLE, then you can call gtk_image_get_paintable(). For empty images, you can request any storage type (call any of the "get" functions), but they will all return %NULL values.

parameter.name: GTK_IMAGE_EMPTY
parameter.parameter_description: there is no image displayed by the widget

parameter.name: GTK_IMAGE_ICON_NAME
parameter.parameter_description: the widget contains a named icon

signal.name: GtkInfoBar::close
signal.description:
The ::close signal is a [keybinding signal][GtkSignalAction] which gets emitted when the user uses a keybinding to dismiss the info bar.
The default binding for this signal is the Escape key.

signal.name: GtkInfoBar::response
signal.description: Emitted when an action widget is clicked or the application programmer calls gtk_info_bar_response(). The @response_id depends on which action widget was clicked.

parameter.name: info_bar
parameter.parameter_description: the object on which the signal is emitted

property.name: GtkInfoBar:message-type
property.description:
The type of the message.
The type may be used to determine the appearance of the info bar.

property.name: GtkInfoBar:show-close-button
property.description: Whether to include a standard close button.

enum.name: GtkInputHints
enum.description:
Describes hints that might be taken into account by input methods or applications. Note that input methods may already tailor their behaviour according to the #GtkInputPurpose of the entry.
Some common sense is expected when using these flags - mixing %GTK_INPUT_HINT_LOWERCASE with any of the uppercase hints makes no sense.
This enumeration may be extended in the future; input methods should ignore unknown values.

parameter.name: GTK_INPUT_HINT_LOWERCASE
parameter.parameter_description: Suggest to convert all text to lowercase

parameter.name: GTK_INPUT_HINT_UPPERCASE_WORDS
parameter.parameter_description: Suggest to capitalize the first character of each word

parameter.name: GTK_INPUT_HINT_UPPERCASE_SENTENCES
parameter.parameter_description: Suggest to capitalize the first word of each sentence

parameter.name: GTK_INPUT_HINT_INHIBIT_OSK
parameter.parameter_description: Suggest to not show an onscreen keyboard (e.g for a calculator that already has all the keys).

parameter.name: GTK_INPUT_HINT_PRIVATE
parameter.parameter_description: Request that the input method should not update personalized data (like typing history)

enum.name: GtkInputPurpose
enum.description:
Describes primary purpose of the input widget. This information is useful for on-screen keyboards and similar input methods to decide which keys should be presented to the user.
Note that the purpose is not meant to impose a totally strict rule about allowed characters, and does not replace input validation. It is fine for an on-screen keyboard to let the user override the character set restriction that is expressed by the purpose. The application is expected to validate the entry contents, even if it specified a purpose.
The difference between %GTK_INPUT_PURPOSE_DIGITS and %GTK_INPUT_PURPOSE_NUMBER is that the former accepts only digits while the latter also some punctuation (like commas or points, plus, minus) and “e” or “E” as in 3.14E+000.
This enumeration may be extended in the future; input methods should interpret unknown values as “free form”.

parameter.name: GTK_INPUT_PURPOSE_NAME
parameter.parameter_description: Edited field expects the name of a person

parameter.name: GTK_INPUT_PURPOSE_TERMINAL
parameter.parameter_description: Allow any character, in addition to control codes

enum.name: GtkJustification
enum.description: Used for justifying the text inside a #GtkLabel widget.

parameter.name: GTK_JUSTIFY_LEFT
parameter.parameter_description: The text is placed at the left edge of the label.

parameter.name: GTK_JUSTIFY_RIGHT
parameter.parameter_description: The text is placed at the right edge of the label.

parameter.name: GTK_JUSTIFY_CENTER
parameter.parameter_description: The text is placed in the center of the label.

parameter.name: GTK_JUSTIFY_FILL
parameter.parameter_description: The text is placed is distributed across the label.

property.name: GtkKeyvalTrigger:keyval
property.description: The key value for the trigger.

property.name: GtkKeyvalTrigger:modifiers
property.description: The key modifiers for the trigger.

signal.name: GtkLabel::activate-current-link
signal.description:
A [keybinding signal][GtkSignalAction] which gets emitted when the user activates a link in the label.
Applications may also emit the signal with g_signal_emit_by_name() if they need to control activation of URIs programmatically.
The default bindings for this signal are all forms of the Enter key.

parameter.name: self
parameter.parameter_description: The label on which the signal was emitted

signal.name: GtkLabel::activate-link
signal.description: The signal which gets emitted to activate a URI. Applications may connect to it to override the default behaviour, which is to call gtk_show_uri().

parameter.name: self
parameter.parameter_description: The label on which the signal was emitted

signal.return: %TRUE if the link has been activated

signal.name: GtkLabel::copy-clipboard
signal.description:
The ::copy-clipboard signal is a [keybinding signal][GtkSignalAction] which gets emitted to copy the selection to the clipboard.
The default binding for this signal is Ctrl-c.

parameter.name: self
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal

signal.name: GtkLabel::move-cursor
signal.description:
The ::move-cursor signal is a [keybinding signal][GtkSignalAction] which gets emitted when the user initiates a cursor movement. If the cursor is not visible in @entry, this signal causes the viewport to be moved instead.
Applications should not connect to it, but may emit it with g_signal_emit_by_name() if they need to control the cursor programmatically.
The default bindings for this signal come in two variants, the variant with the Shift modifier extends the selection, the variant without the Shift modifier does not. There are too many key combinations to list them all here. - Arrow keys move by individual characters/lines - Ctrl-arrow key combinations move by words/paragraphs - Home/End keys move to the ends of the buffer

parameter.name: entry
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal

parameter.name: step
parameter.parameter_description: the granularity of the move, as a #GtkMovementStep

parameter.name: count
parameter.parameter_description: the number of @step units to move

parameter.name: extend_selection
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE if the move should extend the selection

property.name: GtkLabel:ellipsize
property.description:
The preferred place to ellipsize the string, if the label does not have enough room to display the entire string, specified as a #PangoEllipsizeMode.
Note that setting this property to a value other than %PANGO_ELLIPSIZE_NONE has the side-effect that the label requests only enough space to display the ellipsis "...". In particular, this means that ellipsizing labels do not work well in notebook tabs, unless the #GtkNotebook tab-expand child property is set to %TRUE. Other ways to set a label's width are gtk_widget_set_size_request() and gtk_label_set_width_chars().

property.name: GtkLabel:extra-menu
property.description: A menu model whose contents will be appended to the context menu.

property.name: GtkLabel:label
property.description:
The contents of the label.
If the string contains [Pango XML markup][PangoMarkupFormat], you will have to set the #GtkLabel:use-markup property to %TRUE in order for the label to display the markup attributes. See also gtk_label_set_markup() for a convenience function that sets both this property and the #GtkLabel:use-markup property at the same time.
If the string contains underlines acting as mnemonics, you will have to set the #GtkLabel:use-underline property to %TRUE in order for the label to display them.

property.name: GtkLabel:lines
property.description: The number of lines to which an ellipsized, wrapping label should be limited. This property has no effect if the label is not wrapping or ellipsized. Set this property to -1 if you don't want to limit the number of lines.

property.name: GtkLabel:max-width-chars
property.description:
The desired maximum width of the label, in characters. If this property is set to -1, the width will be calculated automatically.
See the section on [text layout][label-text-layout] for details of how #GtkLabel:width-chars and #GtkLabel:max-width-chars determine the width of ellipsized and wrapped labels.

property.name: GtkLabel:single-line-mode
property.description: Whether the label is in single line mode. In single line mode, the height of the label does not depend on the actual text, it is always set to ascent + descent of the font. This can be an advantage in situations where resizing the label because of text changes would be distracting, e.g. in a statusbar.

property.name: GtkLabel:width-chars
property.description:
The desired width of the label, in characters. If this property is set to -1, the width will be calculated automatically.
See the section on [text layout][label-text-layout] for details of how #GtkLabel:width-chars and #GtkLabel:max-width-chars determine the width of ellipsized and wrapped labels.

property.name: GtkLabel:wrap-mode
property.description: If line wrapping is on (see the #GtkLabel:wrap property) this controls how the line wrapping is done. The default is %PANGO_WRAP_WORD, which means wrap on word boundaries.

property.name: GtkLabel:xalign
property.description: The xalign property determines the horizontal alignment of the label text inside the labels size allocation. Compare this to #GtkWidget:halign, which determines how the labels size allocation is positioned in the space available for the label.

property.name: GtkLabel:yalign
property.description: The yalign property determines the vertical alignment of the label text inside the labels size allocation. Compare this to #GtkWidget:valign, which determines how the labels size allocation is positioned in the space available for the label.

property.name: GtkLayoutChild:child-widget
property.description: The widget that is associated to the #GtkLayoutChild instance.

property.name: GtkLayoutChild:layout-manager
property.description: The layout manager that created the #GtkLayoutChild instance.

signal.name: GtkLevelBar::offset-changed
signal.description:
Emitted when an offset specified on the bar changes value as an effect to gtk_level_bar_add_offset_value() being called.
The signal supports detailed connections; you can connect to the detailed signal "changed::x" in order to only receive callbacks when the value of offset "x" changes.

parameter.name: name
parameter.parameter_description: the name of the offset that changed value

property.name: GtkLevelBar:inverted
property.description: Level bars normally grow from top to bottom or left to right. Inverted level bars grow in the opposite direction.

property.name: GtkLevelBar:max-value
property.description: The #GtkLevelBar:max-value property determaxes the maximum value of the interval that can be displayed by the bar.

property.name: GtkLevelBar:min-value
property.description: The #GtkLevelBar:min-value property determines the minimum value of the interval that can be displayed by the bar.

property.name: GtkLevelBar:mode
property.description: The #GtkLevelBar:mode property determines the way #GtkLevelBar interprets the value properties to draw the level fill area. Specifically, when the value is #GTK_LEVEL_BAR_MODE_CONTINUOUS, #GtkLevelBar will draw a single block representing the current value in that area; when the value is #GTK_LEVEL_BAR_MODE_DISCRETE, the widget will draw a succession of separate blocks filling the draw area, with the number of blocks being equal to the units separating the integral roundings of #GtkLevelBar:min-value and #GtkLevelBar:max-value.

property.name: GtkLevelBar:value
property.description: The #GtkLevelBar:value property determines the currently filled value of the level bar.

enum.name: GtkLevelBarMode
enum.description: Describes how #GtkLevelBar contents should be rendered. Note that this enumeration could be extended with additional modes in the future.

parameter.name: GTK_LEVEL_BAR_MODE_CONTINUOUS
parameter.parameter_description: the bar has a continuous mode

parameter.name: GTK_LEVEL_BAR_MODE_DISCRETE
parameter.parameter_description: the bar has a discrete mode

enum.name: GtkLicense
enum.description:
The type of license for an application.
This enumeration can be expanded at later date.

parameter.name: GTK_LICENSE_CUSTOM
parameter.parameter_description: A license text is going to be specified by the developer

parameter.name: GTK_LICENSE_GPL_2_0
parameter.parameter_description: The GNU General Public License, version 2.0 or later

parameter.name: GTK_LICENSE_GPL_3_0
parameter.parameter_description: The GNU General Public License, version 3.0 or later

parameter.name: GTK_LICENSE_LGPL_2_1
parameter.parameter_description: The GNU Lesser General Public License, version 2.1 or later

parameter.name: GTK_LICENSE_LGPL_3_0
parameter.parameter_description: The GNU Lesser General Public License, version 3.0 or later

parameter.name: GTK_LICENSE_GPL_2_0_ONLY
parameter.parameter_description: The GNU General Public License, version 2.0 only

parameter.name: GTK_LICENSE_GPL_3_0_ONLY
parameter.parameter_description: The GNU General Public License, version 3.0 only

parameter.name: GTK_LICENSE_LGPL_2_1_ONLY
parameter.parameter_description: The GNU Lesser General Public License, version 2.1 only

parameter.name: GTK_LICENSE_LGPL_3_0_ONLY
parameter.parameter_description: The GNU Lesser General Public License, version 3.0 only

parameter.name: GTK_LICENSE_AGPL_3_0
parameter.parameter_description: The GNU Affero General Public License, version 3.0 or later

parameter.name: GTK_LICENSE_AGPL_3_0_ONLY
parameter.parameter_description: The GNU Affero General Public License, version 3.0 only

signal.name: GtkLinkButton::activate-link
signal.description:
The ::activate-link signal is emitted each time the #GtkLinkButton has been clicked.
The default handler will call gtk_show_uri() with the URI stored inside the #GtkLinkButton:uri property.
To override the default behavior, you can connect to the ::activate-link signal and stop the propagation of the signal by returning %TRUE from your handler.

property.name: GtkLinkButton:uri
property.description: The URI bound to this button.

property.name: GtkLinkButton:visited
property.description: The 'visited' state of this button. A visited link is drawn in a different color.

property.name: GtkListBase:orientation
property.description: The orientation of the list. See GtkOrientable:orientation for details.

signal.name: GtkListBox::row-activated
signal.description: The ::row-activated signal is emitted when a row has been activated by the user.

signal.name: GtkListBox::row-selected
signal.description:
The ::row-selected signal is emitted when a new row is selected, or (with a %NULL @row) when the selection is cleared.
When the @box is using #GTK_SELECTION_MULTIPLE, this signal will not give you the full picture of selection changes, and you should use the #GtkListBox::selected-rows-changed signal instead.

signal.name: GtkListBox::select-all
signal.description:
The ::select-all signal is a [keybinding signal][GtkSignalAction] which gets emitted to select all children of the box, if the selection mode permits it.
The default bindings for this signal is Ctrl-a.

parameter.name: box
parameter.parameter_description: the #GtkListBox on which the signal is emitted

signal.name: GtkListBox::selected-rows-changed
signal.description: The ::selected-rows-changed signal is emitted when the set of selected rows changes.

parameter.name: box
parameter.parameter_description: the #GtkListBox on which the signal is emitted

signal.name: GtkListBox::unselect-all
signal.description:
The ::unselect-all signal is a [keybinding signal][GtkSignalAction] which gets emitted to unselect all children of the box, if the selection mode permits it.
The default bindings for this signal is Ctrl-Shift-a.

parameter.name: box
parameter.parameter_description: the #GtkListBox on which the signal is emitted

signal.name: GtkListBoxRow::activate
signal.description:
This is a keybinding signal, which will cause this row to be activated.
If you want to be notified when the user activates a row (by key or not), use the #GtkListBox::row-activated signal on the row’s parent #GtkListBox.

property.name: GtkListBoxRow:activatable
property.description: The property determines whether the #GtkListBox::row-activated signal will be emitted for this row.

property.name: GtkListBoxRow:selectable
property.description: The property determines whether this row can be selected.

property.name: GtkListItem:activatable
property.description: If the item can be activated by the user

property.name: GtkListItem:child
property.description: Widget used for display

property.name: GtkListItem:item
property.description: Displayed item

property.name: GtkListItem:position
property.description: Position of the item

property.name: GtkListItem:selectable
property.description: If the item can be selected by the user

property.name: GtkListItem:selected
property.description: If the item is currently selected

signal.name: GtkListView::activate
signal.description:
The ::activate signal is emitted when a row has been activated by the user, usually via activating the GtkListView|list.activate-item action.
This allows for a convenient way to handle activation in a listview. See gtk_list_item_set_activatable() for details on how to use this signal.

property.name: GtkListView:enable-rubberband
property.description: Allow rubberband selection

property.name: GtkListView:factory
property.description: Factory for populating list items

property.name: GtkListView:model
property.description: Model for the items displayed

property.name: GtkListView:show-separators
property.description: Show separators between rows

property.name: GtkListView:single-click-activate
property.description: Activate rows on single click and select them on hover

property.name: GtkMapListModel:has-map
property.description: If a map is set for this model

property.name: GtkMapListModel:model
property.description: The model being mapped

property.name: GtkMediaControls:media-stream
property.description: The media-stream managed by this object or %NULL if none.

property.name: GtkMediaFile:file
property.description: The file being played back or %NULL if not playing a file.

property.name: GtkMediaFile:input-stream
property.description: The stream being played back or %NULL if not playing a stream, like when playing a file.

property.name: GtkMediaStream:duration
property.description: The stream's duration in microseconds or 0 if unknown.

property.name: GtkMediaStream:ended
property.description: Set when playback has finished.

property.name: GtkMediaStream:error
property.description: %NULL for a properly working stream or the #GError that the stream is in.

property.name: GtkMediaStream:has-audio
property.description: Whether the stream contains audio

property.name: GtkMediaStream:has-video
property.description: Whether the stream contains video

property.name: GtkMediaStream:loop
property.description: Try to restart the media from the beginning once it ended.

property.name: GtkMediaStream:muted
property.description: Whether the audio stream should be muted.

property.name: GtkMediaStream:playing
property.description: Whether the stream is currently playing.

property.name: GtkMediaStream:prepared
property.description: Whether the stream has finished initializing and existence of audio and video is known.

property.name: GtkMediaStream:seekable
property.description: Set unless the stream is known to not support seeking.

property.name: GtkMediaStream:seeking
property.description: Set while a seek is in progress.

property.name: GtkMediaStream:timestamp
property.description: The current presentation timestamp in microseconds.

property.name: GtkMediaStream:volume
property.description: Volume of the audio stream.

property.name: GtkMenuButton:direction
property.description: The #GtkArrowType representing the direction in which the menu or popover will be popped out.

property.name: GtkMenuButton:menu-model
property.description:
The #GMenuModel from which the popup will be created.
See gtk_menu_button_set_menu_model() for the interaction with the #GtkMenuButton:popup property.

property.name: GtkMenuButton:popover
property.description: The #GtkPopover that will be popped up when the button is clicked.

property.name: GtkMessageDialog:message-area
property.description: The #GtkBox that corresponds to the message area of this dialog. See gtk_message_dialog_get_message_area() for a detailed description of this area.

property.name: GtkMessageDialog:message-type
property.description: The type of the message.

property.name: GtkMessageDialog:secondary-text
property.description: The secondary text of the message dialog.

property.name: GtkMessageDialog:secondary-use-markup
property.description: %TRUE if the secondary text of the dialog includes Pango markup. See pango_parse_markup().

property.name: GtkMessageDialog:text
property.description: The primary text of the message dialog. If the dialog has a secondary text, this will appear as the title.

property.name: GtkMessageDialog:use-markup
property.description: %TRUE if the primary text of the dialog includes Pango markup. See pango_parse_markup().

enum.name: GtkMessageType
enum.description: The type of message being displayed in the dialog.

property.name: GtkMnemonicTrigger:keyval
property.description: The key value for the trigger.

property.name: GtkModelButton:active
property.description: The state of the button. This is reflecting the state of the associated #GAction.

property.name: GtkModelButton:icon
property.description: A #GIcon that will be used if iconic appearance for the button is desired.

property.name: GtkModelButton:iconic
property.description: If this property is set, the button will show an icon if one is set. If no icon is set, the text will be used. This is typically used for horizontal sections of linked buttons.

property.name: GtkModelButton:indicator-size-group
property.description: Containers like #GtkPopoverMenu can provide a size group in this property to align the checks and radios of all the model buttons in a menu.

property.name: GtkModelButton:menu-name
property.description: The name of a submenu to open when the button is activated. * If this is set, the button should not have an action associated with it.

property.name: GtkModelButton:role
property.description: Specifies whether the button is a plain, check or radio button. When #GtkActionable:action-name is set, the role will be determined from the action and does not have to be set explicitly.

property.name: GtkModelButton:text
property.description: The label for the button.

property.name: GtkModelButton:use-markup
property.description: If %TRUE, XML tags in the text of the button are interpreted as by pango_parse_markup() to format the enclosed spans of text. If %FALSE, the text will be displayed verbatim.

parameter.name: GTK_MOVEMENT_LOGICAL_POSITIONS
parameter.parameter_description: Move forward or back by graphemes

parameter.name: GTK_MOVEMENT_VISUAL_POSITIONS
parameter.parameter_description: Move left or right by graphemes

parameter.name: GTK_MOVEMENT_WORDS
parameter.parameter_description: Move forward or back by words

parameter.name: GTK_MOVEMENT_DISPLAY_LINES
parameter.parameter_description: Move up or down lines (wrapped lines)

parameter.name: GTK_MOVEMENT_DISPLAY_LINE_ENDS
parameter.parameter_description: Move to either end of a line

parameter.name: GTK_MOVEMENT_PARAGRAPHS
parameter.parameter_description: Move up or down paragraphs (newline-ended lines)

parameter.name: GTK_MOVEMENT_PARAGRAPH_ENDS
parameter.parameter_description: Move to either end of a paragraph

parameter.name: GTK_MOVEMENT_BUFFER_ENDS
parameter.parameter_description: Move to ends of the buffer

property.name: GtkMultiSelection:model
property.description: The list managed by this selection

property.name: GtkNamedAction:action-name
property.description: The name of the action to activate.

signal.name: GtkNativeDialog::response
signal.description:
Emitted when the user responds to the dialog.
When this is called the dialog has been hidden.
If you call gtk_native_dialog_hide() before the user responds to the dialog this signal will not be emitted.

parameter.name: self
parameter.parameter_description: the object on which the signal is emitted

property.name: GtkNativeDialog:modal
property.description: Whether the window should be modal with respect to its transient parent.

property.name: GtkNativeDialog:title
property.description: The title of the dialog window

property.name: GtkNativeDialog:transient-for
property.description: The transient parent of the dialog, or %NULL for none.

property.name: GtkNativeDialog:visible
property.description: Whether the window is currently visible.

property.name: GtkNoSelection:model
property.description: The model being managed

signal.name: GtkNotebook::create-window
signal.description:
The ::create-window signal is emitted when a detachable tab is dropped on the root window.
A handler for this signal can create a window containing a notebook where the tab will be attached. It is also responsible for moving/resizing the window and adding the necessary properties to the notebook (e.g. the #GtkNotebook:group-name ).

parameter.name: page
parameter.parameter_description: the tab of @notebook that is being detached

signal.return: a #GtkNotebook that @page should be added to, or %NULL.

signal.name: GtkNotebook::page-added
signal.description: the ::page-added signal is emitted in the notebook right after a page is added to the notebook.

signal.name: GtkNotebook::page-removed
signal.description: the ::page-removed signal is emitted in the notebook right after a page is removed from the notebook.

signal.name: GtkNotebook::page-reordered
signal.description: the ::page-reordered signal is emitted in the notebook right after a page has been reordered.

signal.name: GtkNotebook::switch-page
signal.description: Emitted when the user or a function changes the current page.

parameter.name: notebook
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal.

property.name: GtkNotebook:group-name
property.description: Group name for tab drag and drop.

enum.name: GtkNotebookTab
enum.description: The parameter used in the action signals of #GtkNotebook.

parameter.name: GTK_NOTEBOOK_TAB_FIRST
parameter.parameter_description: the first tab in the notebook

parameter.name: GTK_NOTEBOOK_TAB_LAST
parameter.parameter_description: the last tab in the notebook

enum.name: GtkNumberUpLayout
enum.description: Used to determine the layout of pages on a sheet when printing multiple pages per sheet.

property.name: GtkNumericSorter:expression
property.description: The expression to evaluate on items to get a number to compare with

property.name: GtkNumericSorter:sort-order
property.description: Whether the sorter will sort smaller numbers first

enum.name: GtkOrdering
enum.description:
Describes the way two values can be compared.
These values can be used with a #GCompareFunc. However, a #GCompareFunc is allowed to return any integer values. For converting such a value to a #GtkOrdering, use gtk_ordering_from_cmpfunc().

parameter.name: GTK_ORDERING_SMALLER
parameter.parameter_description: the first value is smaller than the second

parameter.name: GTK_ORDERING_LARGER
parameter.parameter_description: the first value is larger than the second

property.name: GtkOrientable:orientation
property.description: The orientation of the orientable.

enum.name: GtkOrientation
enum.description: Represents the orientation of widgets and other objects which can be switched between horizontal and vertical orientation on the fly, like #GtkBox or #GtkGesturePan.

parameter.name: GTK_ORIENTATION_HORIZONTAL
parameter.parameter_description: The element is in horizontal orientation.

parameter.name: GTK_ORIENTATION_VERTICAL
parameter.parameter_description: The element is in vertical orientation.

enum.name: GtkOverflow
enum.description: Defines how content overflowing a given area should be handled, such as with gtk_widget_set_overflow(). This property is modeled after the CSS overflow property, but implements it only partially.

parameter.name: GTK_OVERFLOW_VISIBLE
parameter.parameter_description: No change is applied. Content is drawn at the specified position.

parameter.name: GTK_OVERFLOW_HIDDEN
parameter.parameter_description: Content is clipped to the bounds of the area. Content outside the area is not drawn and cannot be interacted with.

signal.name: GtkOverlay::get-child-position
signal.description:
The ::get-child-position signal is emitted to determine the position and size of any overlay child widgets. A handler for this signal should fill @allocation with the desired position and size for @widget, relative to the 'main' child of @overlay.
The default handler for this signal uses the @widget's halign and valign properties to determine the position and gives the widget its natural size (except that an alignment of %GTK_ALIGN_FILL will cause the overlay to be full-width/height). If the main child is a #GtkScrolledWindow, the overlays are placed relative to its contents.
signal.return: %TRUE if the @allocation has been filled

property.name: GtkOverlayLayoutChild:clip-overlay
property.description: Whether the child should be clipped to fit the parent's size.

property.name: GtkOverlayLayoutChild:measure
property.description: Whether the child size should contribute to the #GtkOverlayLayout's measurement.

enum.name: GtkPackType
enum.description: Represents the packing location of a children in its parent. See #GtkWindowControls for example.

parameter.name: GTK_PACK_START
parameter.parameter_description: The child is packed into the start of the widget

parameter.name: GTK_PACK_END
parameter.parameter_description: The child is packed into the end of the widget

enum.name: GtkPadActionType
enum.description: The type of a pad action.

parameter.name: GTK_PAD_ACTION_BUTTON
parameter.parameter_description: Action is triggered by a pad button

parameter.name: GTK_PAD_ACTION_RING
parameter.parameter_description: Action is triggered by a pad ring

parameter.name: GTK_PAD_ACTION_STRIP
parameter.parameter_description: Action is triggered by a pad strip

enum.name: GtkPageOrientation
enum.description: See also gtk_print_settings_set_orientation().

enum.name: GtkPageSet
enum.description: See also gtk_print_job_set_page_set().

enum.name: GtkPanDirection
enum.description: Describes the panning direction of a #GtkGesturePan

signal.name: GtkPaned::accept-position
signal.description:
The ::accept-position signal is a [keybinding signal][GtkSignalAction] which gets emitted to accept the current position of the handle when moving it using key bindings.
The default binding for this signal is Return or Space.

parameter.name: widget
parameter.parameter_description: the object that received the signal

signal.name: GtkPaned::cancel-position
signal.description:
The ::cancel-position signal is a [keybinding signal][GtkSignalAction] which gets emitted to cancel moving the position of the handle using key bindings. The position of the handle will be reset to the value prior to moving it.
The default binding for this signal is Escape.

parameter.name: widget
parameter.parameter_description: the object that received the signal

signal.name: GtkPaned::cycle-child-focus
signal.description:
The ::cycle-child-focus signal is a [keybinding signal][GtkSignalAction] which gets emitted to cycle the focus between the children of the paned.
The default binding is f6.

parameter.name: widget
parameter.parameter_description: the object that received the signal

signal.name: GtkPaned::cycle-handle-focus
signal.description:
The ::cycle-handle-focus signal is a [keybinding signal][GtkSignalAction] which gets emitted to cycle whether the paned should grab focus to allow the user to change position of the handle by using key bindings.
The default binding for this signal is f8.

parameter.name: widget
parameter.parameter_description: the object that received the signal

signal.name: GtkPaned::move-handle
signal.description: The ::move-handle signal is a [keybinding signal][GtkSignalAction] which gets emitted to move the handle when the user is using key bindings to move it.

parameter.name: widget
parameter.parameter_description: the object that received the signal

signal.name: GtkPaned::toggle-handle-focus
signal.description:
The ::toggle-handle-focus is a [keybinding signal][GtkSignalAction] which gets emitted to accept the current position of the handle and then move focus to the next widget in the focus chain.
The default binding is Tab.

parameter.name: widget
parameter.parameter_description: the object that received the signal

property.name: GtkPaned:max-position
property.description: The largest possible value for the position property. This property is derived from the size and shrinkability of the widget's children.

property.name: GtkPaned:min-position
property.description: The smallest possible value for the position property. This property is derived from the size and shrinkability of the widget's children.

property.name: GtkPaned:resize-end-child
property.description: The "resize-end-child" property determines whether the second child expands and shrinks along with the paned widget.

property.name: GtkPaned:resize-start-child
property.description: The "resize-start-child" property determines whether the first child expands and shrinks along with the paned widget.

property.name: GtkPaned:shrink-end-child
property.description: The "shrink-end-child" property determines whether the second child can be made smaller than its requisition.

property.name: GtkPaned:shrink-start-child
property.description: The "shrink-start-child" property determines whether the first child can be made smaller than its requisition.

property.name: GtkPaned:wide-handle
property.description: Setting this property to %TRUE indicates that the paned needs to provide stronger visual separation (e.g. because it separates between two notebooks, whose tab rows would otherwise merge visually).

property.name: GtkPasswordEntry:activate
property.description: The ::activate signal is forwarded from the #GtkText::activated signal, which is a keybinding signal for all forms of the Enter key.

property.name: GtkPasswordEntry:extra-menu
property.description: A menu model whose contents will be appended to the context menu.

enum.name: GtkPickFlags
enum.description: Flags that influence the behavior of gtk_widget_pick()

parameter.name: GTK_PICK_DEFAULT
parameter.parameter_description: The default behavior, include widgets that are receiving events

parameter.name: GTK_PICK_NON_TARGETABLE
parameter.parameter_description: Include widgets that are marked as non-targetable. See #GtkWidget:can-target

property.name: GtkPicture:alternative-text
property.description: The alternative textual description for the picture.

property.name: GtkPicture:can-shrink
property.description: If the #GtkPicture can be made smaller than the self it contains.

property.name: GtkPicture:file
property.description: The #GFile that is displayed or %NULL if none.

property.name: GtkPicture:keep-aspect-ratio
property.description: Whether the GtkPicture will render its contents trying to preserve the aspect ratio of the contents.

property.name: GtkPicture:paintable
property.description: The #GdkPaintable to be displayed by this #GtkPicture.

enum.name: GtkPolicyType
enum.description: Determines how the size should be computed to achieve the one of the visibility mode for the scrollbars.

parameter.name: GTK_POLICY_ALWAYS
parameter.parameter_description: The scrollbar is always visible. The view size is independent of the content.

parameter.name: GTK_POLICY_AUTOMATIC
parameter.parameter_description: The scrollbar will appear and disappear as necessary. For example, when all of a #GtkTreeView can not be seen.

parameter.name: GTK_POLICY_NEVER
parameter.parameter_description: The scrollbar should never appear. In this mode the content determines the size.

parameter.name: GTK_POLICY_EXTERNAL
parameter.parameter_description: Don't show a scrollbar, but don't force the size to follow the content. This can be used e.g. to make multiple scrolled windows share a scrollbar.

signal.name: GtkPopover::activate-default
signal.description: The ::activate-default signal is a [keybinding signal][GtkSignalAction] which gets emitted when the user activates the default widget of @self.

signal.name: GtkPopover::closed
signal.description: The ::closed signal is emitted when the popover is closed.

property.name: GtkPopoverMenuBar:menu-model
property.description:
The #GMenuModel from which the menu bar is created.
The model should only contain submenus as toplevel elements.

enum.name: GtkPopoverMenuFlags
enum.description: Flags that affect how popover menus are created from a menu model.

parameter.name: GTK_POPOVER_MENU_NESTED
parameter.parameter_description: Create submenus as nested popovers. Without this flag, submenus are created as sliding pages that replace the main menu.

enum.name: GtkPositionType
enum.description: Describes which edge of a widget a certain feature is positioned at, e.g. the tabs of a #GtkNotebook, or the label of a #GtkScale.

parameter.name: GTK_POS_LEFT
parameter.parameter_description: The feature is at the left edge.

parameter.name: GTK_POS_RIGHT
parameter.parameter_description: The feature is at the right edge.

parameter.name: GTK_POS_TOP
parameter.parameter_description: The feature is at the top edge.

parameter.name: GTK_POS_BOTTOM
parameter.parameter_description: The feature is at the bottom edge.

enum.name: GtkPrintCapabilities
enum.description: An enum for specifying which features the print dialog should offer. If neither %GTK_PRINT_CAPABILITY_GENERATE_PDF nor %GTK_PRINT_CAPABILITY_GENERATE_PS is specified, GTK+ assumes that all formats are supported.

parameter.name: GTK_PRINT_CAPABILITY_PAGE_SET
parameter.parameter_description: Print dialog will offer printing even/odd pages.

parameter.name: GTK_PRINT_CAPABILITY_COPIES
parameter.parameter_description: Print dialog will allow to print multiple copies.

parameter.name: GTK_PRINT_CAPABILITY_COLLATE
parameter.parameter_description: Print dialog will allow to collate multiple copies.

parameter.name: GTK_PRINT_CAPABILITY_REVERSE
parameter.parameter_description: Print dialog will allow to print pages in reverse order.

parameter.name: GTK_PRINT_CAPABILITY_SCALE
parameter.parameter_description: Print dialog will allow to scale the output.

parameter.name: GTK_PRINT_CAPABILITY_GENERATE_PDF
parameter.parameter_description: The program will send the document to the printer in PDF format

parameter.name: GTK_PRINT_CAPABILITY_GENERATE_PS
parameter.parameter_description: The program will send the document to the printer in Postscript format

parameter.name: GTK_PRINT_CAPABILITY_PREVIEW
parameter.parameter_description: Print dialog will offer a preview

parameter.name: GTK_PRINT_CAPABILITY_NUMBER_UP
parameter.parameter_description: Print dialog will offer printing multiple pages per sheet

parameter.name: GTK_PRINT_CAPABILITY_NUMBER_UP_LAYOUT
parameter.parameter_description: Print dialog will allow to rearrange pages when printing multiple pages per sheet

enum.name: GtkPrintDuplex
enum.description: See also gtk_print_settings_set_duplex().

enum.name: GtkPrintError
enum.description: Error codes that identify various errors that can occur while using the GTK printing support.

parameter.name: GTK_PRINT_ERROR_INVALID_FILE
parameter.parameter_description: An error occurred while loading a page setup or paper size from a key file.

signal.name: GtkPrintJob::status-changed
signal.description: Gets emitted when the status of a job changes. The signal handler can use gtk_print_job_get_status() to obtain the new status.

parameter.name: job
parameter.parameter_description: the #GtkPrintJob object on which the signal was emitted

signal.name: GtkPrintOperation::begin-print
signal.description:
Emitted after the user has finished changing print settings in the dialog, before the actual rendering starts.
A typical use for ::begin-print is to use the parameters from the #GtkPrintContext and paginate the document accordingly, and then set the number of pages with gtk_print_operation_set_n_pages().

parameter.name: operation
parameter.parameter_description: the #GtkPrintOperation on which the signal was emitted

signal.name: GtkPrintOperation::create-custom-widget
signal.description:
Emitted when displaying the print dialog. If you return a widget in a handler for this signal it will be added to a custom tab in the print dialog. You typically return a container widget with multiple widgets in it.
The print dialog owns the returned widget, and its lifetime is not controlled by the application. However, the widget is guaranteed to stay around until the #GtkPrintOperation::custom-widget-apply signal is emitted on the operation. Then you can read out any information you need from the widgets.

parameter.name: operation
parameter.parameter_description: the #GtkPrintOperation on which the signal was emitted

signal.return: A custom widget that gets embedded in the print dialog, or %NULL

signal.name: GtkPrintOperation::custom-widget-apply
signal.description: Emitted right before #GtkPrintOperation::begin-print if you added a custom widget in the #GtkPrintOperation::create-custom-widget handler. When you get this signal you should read the information from the custom widgets, as the widgets are not guaraneed to be around at a later time.

parameter.name: operation
parameter.parameter_description: the #GtkPrintOperation on which the signal was emitted

parameter.name: widget
parameter.parameter_description: the custom widget added in create-custom-widget

signal.name: GtkPrintOperation::done

parameter.name: operation
parameter.parameter_description: the #GtkPrintOperation on which the signal was emitted

parameter.name: result
parameter.parameter_description: the result of the print operation

signal.name: GtkPrintOperation::draw-page

parameter.name: operation
parameter.parameter_description: the #GtkPrintOperation on which the signal was emitted

parameter.name: page_nr
parameter.parameter_description: the number of the currently printed page (0-based)

signal.name: GtkPrintOperation::end-print
signal.description: Emitted after all pages have been rendered. A handler for this signal can clean up any resources that have been allocated in the #GtkPrintOperation::begin-print handler.

parameter.name: operation
parameter.parameter_description: the #GtkPrintOperation on which the signal was emitted

signal.name: GtkPrintOperation::paginate
signal.description:
Emitted after the #GtkPrintOperation::begin-print signal, but before the actual rendering starts. It keeps getting emitted until a connected signal handler returns %TRUE.
The ::paginate signal is intended to be used for paginating a document in small chunks, to avoid blocking the user interface for a long time. The signal handler should update the number of pages using gtk_print_operation_set_n_pages(), and return %TRUE if the document has been completely paginated.
If you don't need to do pagination in chunks, you can simply do it all in the ::begin-print handler, and set the number of pages from there.

parameter.name: operation
parameter.parameter_description: the #GtkPrintOperation on which the signal was emitted

signal.return: %TRUE if pagination is complete

signal.name: GtkPrintOperation::preview
signal.description:
Gets emitted when a preview is requested from the native dialog.
The default handler for this signal uses an external viewer application to preview.
To implement a custom print preview, an application must return %TRUE from its handler for this signal. In order to use the provided @context for the preview implementation, it must be given a suitable cairo context with gtk_print_context_set_cairo_context().
The custom preview implementation can use gtk_print_operation_preview_is_selected() and gtk_print_operation_preview_render_page() to find pages which are selected for print and render them. The preview must be finished by calling gtk_print_operation_preview_end_preview() (typically in response to the user clicking a close button).

parameter.name: operation
parameter.parameter_description: the #GtkPrintOperation on which the signal was emitted

parameter.name: parent
parameter.parameter_description: the #GtkWindow to use as window parent, or %NULL

signal.return: %TRUE if the listener wants to take over control of the preview

signal.name: GtkPrintOperation::request-page-setup
signal.description: Emitted once for every page that is printed, to give the application a chance to modify the page setup. Any changes done to @setup will be in force only for printing this page.

parameter.name: operation
parameter.parameter_description: the #GtkPrintOperation on which the signal was emitted

parameter.name: page_nr
parameter.parameter_description: the number of the currently printed page (0-based)

signal.name: GtkPrintOperation::status-changed
signal.description: Emitted at between the various phases of the print operation. See #GtkPrintStatus for the phases that are being discriminated. Use gtk_print_operation_get_status() to find out the current status.

parameter.name: operation
parameter.parameter_description: the #GtkPrintOperation on which the signal was emitted

signal.name: GtkPrintOperation::update-custom-widget
signal.description: Emitted after change of selected printer. The actual page setup and print settings are passed to the custom widget, which can actualize itself according to this change.

parameter.name: operation
parameter.parameter_description: the #GtkPrintOperation on which the signal was emitted

parameter.name: widget
parameter.parameter_description: the custom widget added in create-custom-widget

property.name: GtkPrintOperation:allow-async
property.description:
Determines whether the print operation may run asynchronously or not.
Some systems don't support asynchronous printing, but those that do will return %GTK_PRINT_OPERATION_RESULT_IN_PROGRESS as the status, and emit the #GtkPrintOperation::done signal when the operation is actually done.
The Windows port does not support asynchronous operation at all (this is unlikely to change). On other platforms, all actions except for %GTK_PRINT_OPERATION_ACTION_EXPORT support asynchronous operation.

property.name: GtkPrintOperation:current-page
property.description:
The current page in the document.
If this is set before gtk_print_operation_run(), the user will be able to select to print only the current page.
Note that this only makes sense for pre-paginated documents.

property.name: GtkPrintOperation:custom-tab-label
property.description:
Used as the label of the tab containing custom widgets. Note that this property may be ignored on some platforms.
If this is %NULL, GTK uses a default label.

property.name: GtkPrintOperation:default-page-setup
property.description:
The #GtkPageSetup used by default.
This page setup will be used by gtk_print_operation_run(), but it can be overridden on a per-page basis by connecting to the #GtkPrintOperation::request-page-setup signal.

property.name: GtkPrintOperation:embed-page-setup
property.description: If %TRUE, page size combo box and orientation combo box are embedded into page setup page.

property.name: GtkPrintOperation:export-filename
property.description:
The name of a file to generate instead of showing the print dialog. Currently, PDF is the only supported format.
The intended use of this property is for implementing “Export to PDF” actions.
“Print to PDF” support is independent of this and is done by letting the user pick the “Print to PDF” item from the list of printers in the print dialog.

property.name: GtkPrintOperation:has-selection
property.description: Determines whether there is a selection in your application. This can allow your application to print the selection. This is typically used to make a "Selection" button sensitive.

property.name: GtkPrintOperation:job-name
property.description:
A string used to identify the job (e.g. in monitoring applications like eggcups).
If you don't set a job name, GTK picks a default one by numbering successive print jobs.

property.name: GtkPrintOperation:n-pages
property.description:
The number of pages in the document.
This must be set to a positive number before the rendering starts. It may be set in a #GtkPrintOperation::begin-print signal handler.
Note that the page numbers passed to the #GtkPrintOperation::request-page-setup and #GtkPrintOperation::draw-page signals are 0-based, i.e. if the user chooses to print all pages, the last ::draw-page signal will be for page @n_pages - 1.

property.name: GtkPrintOperation:n-pages-to-print
property.description:
The number of pages that will be printed.
Note that this value is set during print preparation phase (%GTK_PRINT_STATUS_PREPARING), so this value should never be get before the data generation phase (%GTK_PRINT_STATUS_GENERATING_DATA). You can connect to the #GtkPrintOperation::status-changed signal and call gtk_print_operation_get_n_pages_to_print() when print status is %GTK_PRINT_STATUS_GENERATING_DATA. This is typically used to track the progress of print operation.

property.name: GtkPrintOperation:print-settings
property.description:
The #GtkPrintSettings used for initializing the dialog.
Setting this property is typically used to re-establish print settings from a previous print operation, see gtk_print_operation_run().

property.name: GtkPrintOperation:show-progress
property.description: Determines whether to show a progress dialog during the print operation.

property.name: GtkPrintOperation:status
property.description: The status of the print operation.

property.name: GtkPrintOperation:status-string
property.description:
A string representation of the status of the print operation. The string is translated and suitable for displaying the print status e.g. in a #GtkStatusbar.
See the #GtkPrintOperation:status property for a status value that is suitable for programmatic use.

property.name: GtkPrintOperation:support-selection
property.description: If %TRUE, the print operation will support print of selection. This allows the print dialog to show a "Selection" button.

property.name: GtkPrintOperation:track-print-status
property.description: If %TRUE, the print operation will try to continue report on the status of the print job in the printer queues and printer. This can allow your application to show things like “out of paper” issues, and when the print job actually reaches the printer. However, this is often implemented using polling, and should not be enabled unless needed.

property.name: GtkPrintOperation:unit
property.description: The transformation for the cairo context obtained from #GtkPrintContext is set up in such a way that distances are measured in units of @unit.

property.name: GtkPrintOperation:use-full-page
property.description: If %TRUE, the transformation for the cairo context obtained from #GtkPrintContext puts the origin at the top left corner of the page (which may not be the top left corner of the sheet, depending on page orientation and the number of pages per sheet). Otherwise, the origin is at the top left corner of the imageable area (i.e. inside the margins).

enum.name: GtkPrintOperationAction
enum.description: The @action parameter to gtk_print_operation_run() determines what action the print operation should perform.

parameter.name: GTK_PRINT_OPERATION_ACTION_PRINT
parameter.parameter_description: Start to print without showing the print dialog, based on the current print settings.

parameter.name: GTK_PRINT_OPERATION_ACTION_EXPORT
parameter.parameter_description: Export to a file. This requires the export-filename property to be set.

signal.name: GtkPrintOperationPreview::got-page-size
signal.description:
The ::got-page-size signal is emitted once for each page that gets rendered to the preview.
A handler for this signal should update the @context according to @page_setup and set up a suitable cairo context, using gtk_print_context_set_cairo_context().

parameter.name: preview
parameter.parameter_description: the object on which the signal is emitted

signal.name: GtkPrintOperationPreview::ready
signal.description:
The ::ready signal gets emitted once per preview operation, before the first page is rendered.
A handler for this signal can be used for setup tasks.

parameter.name: preview
parameter.parameter_description: the object on which the signal is emitted

enum.name: GtkPrintOperationResult
enum.description: A value of this type is returned by gtk_print_operation_run().

parameter.name: GTK_PRINT_OPERATION_RESULT_APPLY
parameter.parameter_description: The print settings should be stored.

parameter.name: GTK_PRINT_OPERATION_RESULT_CANCEL
parameter.parameter_description: The print operation has been canceled, the print settings should not be stored.

parameter.name: GTK_PRINT_OPERATION_RESULT_IN_PROGRESS
parameter.parameter_description: The print operation is not complete yet. This value will only be returned when running asynchronously.

enum.name: GtkPrintPages
enum.description: See also gtk_print_job_set_pages()

enum.name: GtkPrintQuality
enum.description: See also gtk_print_settings_set_quality().

enum.name: GtkPrintStatus
enum.description: The status gives a rough indication of the completion of a running print operation.

parameter.name: GTK_PRINT_STATUS_INITIAL
parameter.parameter_description: The printing has not started yet; this status is set initially, and while the print dialog is shown.

parameter.name: GTK_PRINT_STATUS_PREPARING
parameter.parameter_description: This status is set while the begin-print signal is emitted and during pagination.

parameter.name: GTK_PRINT_STATUS_GENERATING_DATA
parameter.parameter_description: This status is set while the pages are being rendered.

parameter.name: GTK_PRINT_STATUS_SENDING_DATA
parameter.parameter_description: The print job is being sent off to the printer.

parameter.name: GTK_PRINT_STATUS_PENDING
parameter.parameter_description: The print job has been sent to the printer, but is not printed for some reason, e.g. the printer may be stopped.

parameter.name: GTK_PRINT_STATUS_PENDING_ISSUE
parameter.parameter_description: Some problem has occurred during printing, e.g. a paper jam.

parameter.name: GTK_PRINT_STATUS_PRINTING
parameter.parameter_description: The printer is processing the print job.

parameter.name: GTK_PRINT_STATUS_FINISHED
parameter.parameter_description: The printing has been completed successfully.

signal.name: GtkPrinter::details-acquired
signal.description: Gets emitted in response to a request for detailed information about a printer from the print backend. The @success parameter indicates if the information was actually obtained.

parameter.name: printer
parameter.parameter_description: the #GtkPrinter on which the signal is emitted

parameter.name: success
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE if the details were successfully acquired

property.name: GtkPrinter:accepting-jobs
property.description: This property is %TRUE if the printer is accepting jobs.

property.name: GtkPrinter:paused
property.description: This property is %TRUE if this printer is paused. A paused printer still accepts jobs, but it does not print them.

property.name: GtkProgressBar:ellipsize
property.description:
The preferred place to ellipsize the string, if the progress bar does not have enough room to display the entire string, specified as a #PangoEllipsizeMode.
Note that setting this property to a value other than %PANGO_ELLIPSIZE_NONE has the side-effect that the progress bar requests only enough space to display the ellipsis ("..."). Another means to set a progress bar's width is gtk_widget_set_size_request().

property.name: GtkProgressBar:show-text
property.description:
Sets whether the progress bar will show a text in addition to the bar itself. The shown text is either the value of the #GtkProgressBar:text property or, if that is %NULL, the #GtkProgressBar:fraction value, as a percentage.
To make a progress bar that is styled and sized suitably for showing text (even if the actual text is blank), set #GtkProgressBar:show-text to %TRUE and #GtkProgressBar:text to the empty string (not %NULL).

enum.name: GtkPropagationLimit
enum.description: Describes limits of a #GtkEventController for handling events targeting other widgets.

parameter.name: GTK_LIMIT_NONE
parameter.parameter_description: Events are handled regardless of what their target is.

parameter.name: GTK_LIMIT_SAME_NATIVE
parameter.parameter_description: Events are only handled if their target is in the same #GtkNative as the event controllers widget. Note that some event types have two targets (origin and destination).

enum.name: GtkPropagationPhase
enum.description: Describes the stage at which events are fed into a #GtkEventController.

parameter.name: GTK_PHASE_CAPTURE
parameter.parameter_description: Events are delivered in the capture phase. The capture phase happens before the bubble phase, runs from the toplevel down to the event widget. This option should only be used on containers that might possibly handle events before their children do.

parameter.name: GTK_PHASE_BUBBLE
parameter.parameter_description: Events are delivered in the bubble phase. The bubble phase happens after the capture phase, and before the default handlers are run. This phase runs from the event widget, up to the toplevel.

parameter.name: GTK_PHASE_TARGET
parameter.parameter_description: Events are delivered in the default widget event handlers, note that widget implementations must chain up on button, motion, touch and grab broken handlers for controllers in this phase to be run.

property.name: GtkPropertyLookupListModel:item-type
property.description: The #GType for elements of this object

property.name: GtkPropertyLookupListModel:object
property.description: The root object

property.name: GtkPropertyLookupListModel:property
property.description: Name of the property used for lookups

signal.name: GtkRange::adjust-bounds
signal.description: Emitted before clamping a value, to give the application a chance to adjust the bounds.

signal.name: GtkRange::change-value
signal.description:
The #GtkRange::change-value signal is emitted when a scroll action is performed on a range. It allows an application to determine the type of scroll event that occurred and the resultant new value. The application can handle the event itself and return %TRUE to prevent further processing. Or, by returning %FALSE, it can pass the event to other handlers until the default GTK handler is reached.
The value parameter is unrounded. An application that overrides the GtkRange::change-value signal is responsible for clamping the value to the desired number of decimal digits; the default GTK handler clamps the value based on #GtkRange:round-digits.

parameter.name: scroll
parameter.parameter_description: the type of scroll action that was performed

parameter.name: value
parameter.parameter_description: the new value resulting from the scroll action

signal.return: %TRUE to prevent other handlers from being invoked for the signal, %FALSE to propagate the signal further

signal.name: GtkRange::move-slider
signal.description: Virtual function that moves the slider. Used for keybindings.

signal.name: GtkRange::value-changed
signal.description: Emitted when the range value changes.

property.name: GtkRange:fill-level
property.description: The fill level (e.g. prebuffering of a network stream). See gtk_range_set_fill_level().

property.name: GtkRange:restrict-to-fill-level
property.description: The restrict-to-fill-level property controls whether slider movement is restricted to an upper boundary set by the fill level. See gtk_range_set_restrict_to_fill_level().

property.name: GtkRange:round-digits
property.description: The number of digits to round the value to when it changes, or -1. See #GtkRange::change-value.

property.name: GtkRange:show-fill-level
property.description: The show-fill-level property controls whether fill level indicator graphics are displayed on the trough. See gtk_range_set_show_fill_level().

signal.name: GtkRecentManager::changed
signal.description: Emitted when the current recently used resources manager changes its contents, either by calling gtk_recent_manager_add_item() or by another application.

property.name: GtkRecentManager:filename
property.description: The full path to the file to be used to store and read the recently used resources list

property.name: GtkRecentManager:size
property.description: The size of the recently used resources list.

enum.name: GtkRecentManagerError
enum.description: Error codes for #GtkRecentManager operations

parameter.name: GTK_RECENT_MANAGER_ERROR_NOT_FOUND
parameter.parameter_description: the URI specified does not exists in the recently used resources list.

parameter.name: GTK_RECENT_MANAGER_ERROR_INVALID_URI
parameter.parameter_description: the URI specified is not valid.

parameter.name: GTK_RECENT_MANAGER_ERROR_INVALID_ENCODING
parameter.parameter_description: the supplied string is not UTF-8 encoded.

parameter.name: GTK_RECENT_MANAGER_ERROR_NOT_REGISTERED
parameter.parameter_description: no application has registered the specified item.

parameter.name: GTK_RECENT_MANAGER_ERROR_READ
parameter.parameter_description: failure while reading the recently used resources file.

parameter.name: GTK_RECENT_MANAGER_ERROR_WRITE
parameter.parameter_description: failure while writing the recently used resources file.

enum.name: GtkResponseType
enum.description: Predefined values for use as response ids in gtk_dialog_add_button(). All predefined values are negative; GTK leaves values of 0 or greater for application-defined response ids.

parameter.name: GTK_RESPONSE_NONE
parameter.parameter_description: Returned if an action widget has no response id, or if the dialog gets programmatically hidden or destroyed

parameter.name: GTK_RESPONSE_REJECT
parameter.parameter_description: Generic response id, not used by GTK dialogs

parameter.name: GTK_RESPONSE_ACCEPT
parameter.parameter_description: Generic response id, not used by GTK dialogs

parameter.name: GTK_RESPONSE_DELETE_EVENT
parameter.parameter_description: Returned if the dialog is deleted

parameter.name: GTK_RESPONSE_OK
parameter.parameter_description: Returned by OK buttons in GTK dialogs

parameter.name: GTK_RESPONSE_CANCEL
parameter.parameter_description: Returned by Cancel buttons in GTK dialogs

parameter.name: GTK_RESPONSE_CLOSE
parameter.parameter_description: Returned by Close buttons in GTK dialogs

parameter.name: GTK_RESPONSE_YES
parameter.parameter_description: Returned by Yes buttons in GTK dialogs

parameter.name: GTK_RESPONSE_NO
parameter.parameter_description: Returned by No buttons in GTK dialogs

parameter.name: GTK_RESPONSE_APPLY
parameter.parameter_description: Returned by Apply buttons in GTK dialogs

parameter.name: GTK_RESPONSE_HELP
parameter.parameter_description: Returned by Help buttons in GTK dialogs

enum.name: GtkRevealerTransitionType
enum.description: These enumeration values describe the possible transitions when the child of a #GtkRevealer widget is shown or hidden.

signal.name: GtkScaleButton::popdown
signal.description:
The ::popdown signal is a [keybinding signal][GtkSignalAction] which gets emitted to popdown the scale widget.
The default binding for this signal is Escape.

parameter.name: button
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal

signal.name: GtkScaleButton::popup
signal.description:
The ::popup signal is a [keybinding signal][GtkSignalAction] which gets emitted to popup the scale widget.
The default bindings for this signal are Space, Enter and Return.

parameter.name: button
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal

signal.name: GtkScaleButton::value-changed
signal.description: The ::value-changed signal is emitted when the value field has changed.

parameter.name: button
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal

property.name: GtkScaleButton:icons
property.description:
The names of the icons to be used by the scale button. The first item in the array will be used in the button when the current value is the lowest value, the second item for the highest value. All the subsequent icons will be used for all the other values, spread evenly over the range of values.
If there's only one icon name in the @icons array, it will be used for all the values. If only two icon names are in the @icons array, the first one will be used for the bottom 50% of the scale, and the second one for the top 50%.
It is recommended to use at least 3 icons so that the #GtkScaleButton reflects the current value of the scale better for the users.

property.name: GtkScaleButton:orientation
property.description:
The orientation of the #GtkScaleButton's popup window.
Note that #GtkScaleButton implements the #GtkOrientable interface which has its own @orientation property. However, we redefine the property here in order to override its default horizontal orientation.

enum.name: GtkScrollType
enum.description: Scrolling types.

property.name: GtkScrollable:hadjustment
property.description: Horizontal #GtkAdjustment of the scrollable widget. This adjustment is shared between the scrollable widget and its parent.

property.name: GtkScrollable:hscroll-policy
property.description: Determines whether horizontal scrolling should start once the scrollable widget is allocated less than its minimum width or less than its natural width.

property.name: GtkScrollable:vadjustment
property.description: Vertical #GtkAdjustment of the scrollable widget. This adjustment is shared between the scrollable widget and its parent.

property.name: GtkScrollable:vscroll-policy
property.description: Determines whether vertical scrolling should start once the scrollable widget is allocated less than its minimum height or less than its natural height.

enum.name: GtkScrollablePolicy
enum.description: Defines the policy to be used in a scrollable widget when updating the scrolled window adjustments in a given orientation.

parameter.name: GTK_SCROLL_MINIMUM
parameter.parameter_description: Scrollable adjustments are based on the minimum size

parameter.name: GTK_SCROLL_NATURAL
parameter.parameter_description: Scrollable adjustments are based on the natural size

signal.name: GtkScrolledWindow::edge-overshot
signal.description:
The ::edge-overshot signal is emitted whenever user initiated scrolling makes the scrolled window firmly surpass (i.e. with some edge resistance) the lower or upper limits defined by the adjustment in that orientation.
A similar behavior without edge resistance is provided by the #GtkScrolledWindow::edge-reached signal.
Note: The @pos argument is LTR/RTL aware, so callers should be aware too if intending to provide behavior on horizontal edges.

signal.name: GtkScrolledWindow::edge-reached
signal.description:
The ::edge-reached signal is emitted whenever user-initiated scrolling makes the scrolled window exactly reach the lower or upper limits defined by the adjustment in that orientation.
A similar behavior with edge resistance is provided by the #GtkScrolledWindow::edge-overshot signal.
Note: The @pos argument is LTR/RTL aware, so callers should be aware too if intending to provide behavior on horizontal edges.

signal.name: GtkScrolledWindow::move-focus-out
signal.description: The ::move-focus-out signal is a [keybinding signal][GtkSignalAction] which gets emitted when focus is moved away from the scrolled window by a keybinding. The #GtkWidget::move-focus signal is emitted with @direction_type on this scrolled window’s toplevel parent in the container hierarchy. The default bindings for this signal are `Ctrl + Tab` to move forward and `Ctrl + Shift + Tab` to move backward.

signal.name: GtkScrolledWindow::scroll-child
signal.description: The ::scroll-child signal is a [keybinding signal][GtkSignalAction] which gets emitted when a keybinding that scrolls is pressed. The horizontal or vertical adjustment is updated which triggers a signal that the scrolled window’s child may listen to and scroll itself.

parameter.name: scroll
parameter.parameter_description: a #GtkScrollType describing how much to scroll

parameter.name: horizontal
parameter.parameter_description: whether the keybinding scrolls the child horizontally or not

property.name: GtkScrolledWindow:kinetic-scrolling
property.description: Whether kinetic scrolling is enabled or not. Kinetic scrolling only applies to devices with source %GDK_SOURCE_TOUCHSCREEN.

property.name: GtkScrolledWindow:max-content-height
property.description: The maximum content height of @scrolled_window, or -1 if not set.

property.name: GtkScrolledWindow:max-content-width
property.description: The maximum content width of @scrolled_window, or -1 if not set.

property.name: GtkScrolledWindow:min-content-height
property.description: The minimum content height of @scrolled_window, or -1 if not set.

property.name: GtkScrolledWindow:min-content-width
property.description: The minimum content width of @scrolled_window, or -1 if not set.

property.name: GtkScrolledWindow:overlay-scrolling
property.description:
Whether overlay scrolling is enabled or not. If it is, the scrollbars are only added as traditional widgets when a mouse is present. Otherwise, they are overlaid on top of the content, as narrow indicators.
Note that overlay scrolling can also be globally disabled, with the #GtkSettings:gtk-overlay-scrolling setting.

property.name: GtkScrolledWindow:propagate-natural-height
property.description:
Whether the natural height of the child should be calculated and propagated through the scrolled window’s requested natural height.
This is useful in cases where an attempt should be made to allocate exactly enough space for the natural size of the child.

property.name: GtkScrolledWindow:propagate-natural-width
property.description:
Whether the natural width of the child should be calculated and propagated through the scrolled window’s requested natural width.
This is useful in cases where an attempt should be made to allocate exactly enough space for the natural size of the child.

property.name: GtkSearchBar:search-mode-enabled
property.description:
Whether the search mode is on and the search bar shown.
See gtk_search_bar_set_search_mode() for details.

property.name: GtkSearchBar:show-close-button
property.description: Whether to show the close button in the search bar.

signal.name: GtkSearchEntry::activate
signal.description: The ::activate signal is forwarded from the #GtkText::activated signal, which is a keybinding signal for all forms of the Enter key.

parameter.name: self
parameter.parameter_description: The widget on which the signal is emitted

signal.name: GtkSearchEntry::next-match
signal.description:
The ::next-match signal is a [keybinding signal][GtkSignalAction] which gets emitted when the user initiates a move to the next match for the current search string.
Applications should connect to it, to implement moving between matches.
The default bindings for this signal is Ctrl-g.

parameter.name: entry
parameter.parameter_description: the entry on which the signal was emitted

signal.name: GtkSearchEntry::previous-match
signal.description:
The ::previous-match signal is a [keybinding signal][GtkSignalAction] which gets emitted when the user initiates a move to the previous match for the current search string.
Applications should connect to it, to implement moving between matches.
The default bindings for this signal is Ctrl-Shift-g.

parameter.name: entry
parameter.parameter_description: the entry on which the signal was emitted

signal.name: GtkSearchEntry::search-changed
signal.description: The #GtkSearchEntry::search-changed signal is emitted with a short delay of 150 milliseconds after the last change to the entry text.

parameter.name: entry
parameter.parameter_description: the entry on which the signal was emitted

signal.name: GtkSearchEntry::search-started
signal.description: The ::search-started signal gets emitted when the user initiated a search on the entry.

parameter.name: entry
parameter.parameter_description: the entry on which the signal was emitted

signal.name: GtkSearchEntry::stop-search
signal.description:
The ::stop-search signal is a [keybinding signal][GtkSignalAction] which gets emitted when the user stops a search via keyboard input.
Applications should connect to it, to implement hiding the search entry in this case.
The default bindings for this signal is Escape.

parameter.name: entry
parameter.parameter_description: the entry on which the signal was emitted

property.name: GtkSelectionFilterModel:model
property.description: The model being filtered

enum.name: GtkSelectionMode
enum.description: Used to control what selections users are allowed to make.

parameter.name: GTK_SELECTION_SINGLE
parameter.parameter_description: Zero or one element may be selected.

parameter.name: GTK_SELECTION_BROWSE
parameter.parameter_description: Exactly one element is selected. In some circumstances, such as initially or during a search operation, it’s possible for no element to be selected with %GTK_SELECTION_BROWSE. What is really enforced is that the user can’t deselect a currently selected element except by selecting another element.

parameter.name: GTK_SELECTION_MULTIPLE
parameter.parameter_description: Any number of elements may be selected. The Ctrl key may be used to enlarge the selection, and Shift key to select between the focus and the child pointed to. Some widgets may also allow Click-drag to select a range of elements.

signal.name: GtkSelectionModel::selection-changed
signal.description:
Emitted when the selection state of some of the items in @model changes.
Note that this signal does not specify the new selection state of the items, they need to be queried manually. It is also not necessary for a model to change the selection state of any of the items in the selection model, though it would be rather useless to emit such a signal.

parameter.name: position
parameter.parameter_description: The first item that may have changed

enum.name: GtkSensitivityType
enum.description: Determines how GTK handles the sensitivity of various controls, such as combo box buttons.

parameter.name: GTK_SENSITIVITY_AUTO
parameter.parameter_description: The control is made insensitive if no action can be triggered

property.name: GtkSettings:gtk-alternative-sort-arrows
property.description: Controls the direction of the sort indicators in sorted list and tree views. By default an arrow pointing down means the column is sorted in ascending order. When set to %TRUE, this order will be inverted.
