signal.name: GtkWidget::destroy
signal.description:
Signals that all holders of a reference to the widget should release the reference that they hold. May result in finalization of the widget if all references are released.
This signal is not suitable for saving widget state.

parameter.name: object
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal

signal.name: GtkWidget::direction-changed
signal.description: The ::direction-changed signal is emitted when the text direction of a widget changes.

parameter.name: widget
parameter.parameter_description: the object on which the signal is emitted

signal.name: GtkWidget::hide
signal.description: The ::hide signal is emitted when @widget is hidden, for example with gtk_widget_hide().

parameter.name: widget
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal.

signal.name: GtkWidget::keynav-failed
signal.description: Gets emitted if keyboard navigation fails. See gtk_widget_keynav_failed() for details.

parameter.name: widget
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal

signal.return: %TRUE if stopping keyboard navigation is fine, %FALSE if the emitting widget should try to handle the keyboard navigation attempt in its parent widget(s).

signal.name: GtkWidget::map
signal.description:
The ::map signal is emitted when @widget is going to be mapped, that is when the widget is visible (which is controlled with gtk_widget_set_visible()) and all its parents up to the toplevel widget are also visible.
The ::map signal can be used to determine whether a widget will be drawn, for instance it can resume an animation that was stopped during the emission of #GtkWidget::unmap.

parameter.name: widget
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal.

signal.name: GtkWidget::mnemonic-activate
signal.description: The default handler for this signal activates @widget if @group_cycling is %FALSE, or just makes @widget grab focus if @group_cycling is %TRUE.

parameter.name: widget
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal.

parameter.name: group_cycling
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE if there are other widgets with the same mnemonic

signal.return: %TRUE to stop other handlers from being invoked for the event. %FALSE to propagate the event further.

signal.name: GtkWidget::move-focus
signal.description: Emitted when the focus is moved.

parameter.name: widget
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal.

parameter.name: direction
parameter.parameter_description: the direction of the focus move

signal.name: GtkWidget::query-tooltip
signal.description:
Emitted when #GtkWidget:has-tooltip is %TRUE and the hover timeout has expired with the cursor hovering "above" @widget; or emitted when @widget got focus in keyboard mode.
Using the given coordinates, the signal handler should determine whether a tooltip should be shown for @widget. If this is the case %TRUE should be returned, %FALSE otherwise. Note that if @keyboard_mode is %TRUE, the values of @x and @y are undefined and should not be used.
The signal handler is free to manipulate @tooltip with the therefore destined function calls.

parameter.name: widget
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal

parameter.name: x
parameter.parameter_description: the x coordinate of the cursor position where the request has been emitted, relative to @widget's left side

parameter.name: y
parameter.parameter_description: the y coordinate of the cursor position where the request has been emitted, relative to @widget's top

parameter.name: keyboard_mode
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE if the tooltip was triggered using the keyboard

signal.return: %TRUE if @tooltip should be shown right now, %FALSE otherwise.

signal.name: GtkWidget::realize
signal.description: The ::realize signal is emitted when @widget is associated with a #GdkSurface, which means that gtk_widget_realize() has been called or the widget has been mapped (that is, it is going to be drawn).

parameter.name: widget
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal.

signal.name: GtkWidget::show
signal.description: The ::show signal is emitted when @widget is shown, for example with gtk_widget_show().

parameter.name: widget
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal.

signal.name: GtkWidget::state-flags-changed
signal.description: The ::state-flags-changed signal is emitted when the widget state changes, see gtk_widget_get_state_flags().

parameter.name: widget
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal.

signal.name: GtkWidget::unmap
signal.description:
The ::unmap signal is emitted when @widget is going to be unmapped, which means that either it or any of its parents up to the toplevel widget have been set as hidden.
As ::unmap indicates that a widget will not be shown any longer, it can be used to, for example, stop an animation on the widget.

parameter.name: widget
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal.

signal.name: GtkWidget::unrealize
signal.description: The ::unrealize signal is emitted when the #GdkSurface associated with @widget is destroyed, which means that gtk_widget_unrealize() has been called or the widget has been unmapped (that is, it is going to be hidden).

parameter.name: widget
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal.

property.name: GtkWidget:can-focus
property.description:
Whether the widget or any of its descendents can accept the input focus.
This property is meant to be set by widget implementations, typically in their instance init function.

property.name: GtkWidget:css-classes
property.description: A list of css classes applied to this widget.

property.name: GtkWidget:css-name
property.description:
The name of this widget in the CSS tree.
This property is meant to be set by widget implementations, typically in their instance init function.

property.name: GtkWidget:cursor
property.description: The cursor used by @widget. See gtk_widget_set_cursor() for details.

property.name: GtkWidget:focus-on-click
property.description:
Whether the widget should grab focus when it is clicked with the mouse.
This property is only relevant for widgets that can take focus.

property.name: GtkWidget:focusable
property.description: Whether this widget itself will accept the input focus.

property.name: GtkWidget:halign
property.description: How to distribute horizontal space if widget gets extra space, see #GtkAlign

property.name: GtkWidget:has-tooltip
property.description: Enables or disables the emission of #GtkWidget::query-tooltip on @widget. A value of %TRUE indicates that @widget can have a tooltip, in this case the widget will be queried using #GtkWidget::query-tooltip to determine whether it will provide a tooltip or not.

property.name: GtkWidget:hexpand
property.description: Whether to expand horizontally. See gtk_widget_set_hexpand().

property.name: GtkWidget:hexpand-set
property.description: Whether to use the #GtkWidget:hexpand property. See gtk_widget_get_hexpand_set().

property.name: GtkWidget:layout-manager
property.description:
The #GtkLayoutManager instance to use to compute the preferred size of the widget, and allocate its children.
This property is meant to be set by widget implementations, typically in their instance init function.

property.name: GtkWidget:margin-bottom
property.description:
Margin on bottom side of widget.
This property adds margin outside of the widget's normal size request, the margin will be added in addition to the size from gtk_widget_set_size_request() for example.

property.name: GtkWidget:margin-end
property.description:
Margin on end of widget, horizontally. This property supports left-to-right and right-to-left text directions.
This property adds margin outside of the widget's normal size request, the margin will be added in addition to the size from gtk_widget_set_size_request() for example.

property.name: GtkWidget:margin-start
property.description:
Margin on start of widget, horizontally. This property supports left-to-right and right-to-left text directions.
This property adds margin outside of the widget's normal size request, the margin will be added in addition to the size from gtk_widget_set_size_request() for example.

property.name: GtkWidget:margin-top
property.description:
Margin on top side of widget.
This property adds margin outside of the widget's normal size request, the margin will be added in addition to the size from gtk_widget_set_size_request() for example.

property.name: GtkWidget:opacity
property.description: The requested opacity of the widget. See gtk_widget_set_opacity() for more details about window opacity.

property.name: GtkWidget:overflow
property.description:
How content outside the widget's content area is treated.
This property is meant to be set by widget implementations, typically in their instance init function.

property.name: GtkWidget:root
property.description: The #GtkRoot widget of the widget tree containing this widget or %NULL if the widget is not contained in a root widget.

property.name: GtkWidget:scale-factor
property.description: The scale factor of the widget. See gtk_widget_get_scale_factor() for more details about widget scaling.

property.name: GtkWidget:tooltip-markup
property.description:
Sets the text of tooltip to be the given string, which is marked up with the [Pango text markup language][PangoMarkupFormat]. Also see gtk_tooltip_set_markup().
This is a convenience property which will take care of getting the tooltip shown if the given string is not %NULL: #GtkWidget:has-tooltip will automatically be set to %TRUE and there will be taken care of #GtkWidget::query-tooltip in the default signal handler.
Note that if both #GtkWidget:tooltip-text and #GtkWidget:tooltip-markup are set, the last one wins.

property.name: GtkWidget:tooltip-text
property.description:
Sets the text of tooltip to be the given string.
Also see gtk_tooltip_set_text().
This is a convenience property which will take care of getting the tooltip shown if the given string is not %NULL: #GtkWidget:has-tooltip will automatically be set to %TRUE and there will be taken care of #GtkWidget::query-tooltip in the default signal handler.
Note that if both #GtkWidget:tooltip-text and #GtkWidget:tooltip-markup are set, the last one wins.

property.name: GtkWidget:valign
property.description: How to distribute vertical space if widget gets extra space, see #GtkAlign

property.name: GtkWidget:vexpand
property.description: Whether to expand vertically. See gtk_widget_set_vexpand().

property.name: GtkWidget:vexpand-set
property.description: Whether to use the #GtkWidget:vexpand property. See gtk_widget_get_vexpand_set().

property.name: GtkWidgetPaintable:widget
property.description: The observed widget or %NULL if none.

signal.name: GtkWindow::activate-default
signal.description: The ::activate-default signal is a [keybinding signal][GtkSignalAction] which gets emitted when the user activates the default widget of @window.

parameter.name: window
parameter.parameter_description: the window which received the signal

signal.name: GtkWindow::activate-focus
signal.description: The ::activate-focus signal is a [keybinding signal][GtkSignalAction] which gets emitted when the user activates the currently focused widget of @window.

parameter.name: window
parameter.parameter_description: the window which received the signal

signal.name: GtkWindow::close-request
signal.description:
The ::close-request signal is emitted when the user clicks on the close button of the window.
Return: %TRUE to stop other handlers from being invoked for the signal

parameter.name: window
parameter.parameter_description: the window on which the signal is emitted

signal.name: GtkWindow::enable-debugging
signal.description:
The ::enable-debugging signal is a [keybinding signal][GtkSignalAction] which gets emitted when the user enables or disables interactive debugging. When @toggle is %TRUE, interactive debugging is toggled on or off, when it is %FALSE, the debugger will be pointed at the widget under the pointer.
The default bindings for this signal are Ctrl-Shift-I and Ctrl-Shift-D.
Return: %TRUE if the key binding was handled

parameter.name: window
parameter.parameter_description: the window on which the signal is emitted

signal.name: GtkWindow::keys-changed
signal.description: The ::keys-changed signal gets emitted when the set of accelerators or mnemonics that are associated with @window changes.

parameter.name: window
parameter.parameter_description: the window which received the signal

property.name: GtkWindow:application
property.description:
The #GtkApplication associated with the window.
The application will be kept alive for at least as long as it has any windows associated with it (see g_application_hold() for a way to keep it alive without windows).
Normally, the connection between the application and the window will remain until the window is destroyed, but you can explicitly remove it by setting the :application property to %NULL.

property.name: GtkWindow:decorated
property.description: Whether the window should be decorated by the window manager.

property.name: GtkWindow:deletable
property.description: Whether the window frame should have a close button.

property.name: GtkWindow:focus-visible
property.description:
Whether 'focus rectangles' are currently visible in this window.
This property is maintained by GTK based on user input and should not be set by applications.

property.name: GtkWindow:fullscreened
property.description:
Whether the window is fullscreen.
Setting this property is the equivalent of calling gtk_window_fullscreen() and gtk_window_unfullscreen(); either operation is asynchronous, which means you will need to connect to the #GObject::notify signal in order to know whether the operation was successful.

property.name: GtkWindow:icon-name
property.description: The :icon-name property specifies the name of the themed icon to use as the window icon. See #GtkIconTheme for more details.

property.name: GtkWindow:maximized
property.description:
Whether the window is maximized.
Setting this property is the equivalent of calling gtk_window_maximize() and gtk_window_unmaximize(); either operation is asynchronous, which means you will need to connect to the #GObject::notify signal in order to know whether the operation was successful.

property.name: GtkWindow:mnemonics-visible
property.description:
Whether mnemonics are currently visible in this window.
This property is maintained by GTK based on user input, and should not be set by applications.

property.name: GtkWindow:startup-id
property.description: The :startup-id is a write-only property for setting window's startup notification identifier. See gtk_window_set_startup_id() for more details.

property.name: GtkWindow:transient-for
property.description: The transient parent of the window. See gtk_window_set_transient_for() for more details about transient windows.

property.name: GtkWindowControls:decoration-layout
property.description:
The decoration layout for window buttons. If this property is not set, the #GtkSettings:gtk-decoration-layout setting is used.
See gtk_window_controls_set_decoration_layout() for information about the format of this string.

property.name: GtkWindowControls:empty
property.description: Whether the widget has any window buttons.

property.name: GtkWindowControls:side
property.description:
Whether the widget shows start or end side of the decoration layout.
See gtk_window_controls_set_decoration_layout().

enum.name: GtkWrapMode
enum.description: Describes a type of line wrapping.

parameter.name: GTK_WRAP_NONE
parameter.parameter_description: do not wrap lines; just make the text area wider

parameter.name: GTK_WRAP_CHAR
parameter.parameter_description: wrap text, breaking lines anywhere the cursor can appear (between characters, usually - if you want to be technical, between graphemes, see pango_get_log_attrs())

parameter.name: GTK_WRAP_WORD
parameter.parameter_description: wrap text, breaking lines in between words

parameter.name: GTK_WRAP_WORD_CHAR
parameter.parameter_description: wrap text, breaking lines in between words, or if that is not enough, also between graphemes

function.name: add_file
function.description: Adds the given @file with its associated @info to the @model. If the model is frozen, the file will only show up after it is thawn.

parameter.name: info
parameter.parameter_description: the information to associate with the file

function.name: freeze_updates
function.description: Freezes most updates on the model, so that performing multiple operations on the files in the model do not cause any events. Use thaw_updates() to resume proper operations. It is fine to call this function multiple times as long as freeze and thaw calls are balanced.

function.name: gtk_about_dialog_add_credit_section
function.description: Creates a new section in the Credits page.

parameter.name: people
parameter.parameter_description: The people who belong to that section

function.name: gtk_about_dialog_get_artists
function.description: Returns the string which are displayed in the artists tab of the secondary credits dialog.
function.return: A %NULL-terminated string array containing the artists. The array is owned by the about dialog and must not be modified.

function.name: gtk_about_dialog_get_authors
function.description: Returns the string which are displayed in the authors tab of the secondary credits dialog.
function.return: A %NULL-terminated string array containing the authors. The array is owned by the about dialog and must not be modified.

function.name: gtk_about_dialog_get_comments
function.description: Returns the comments string.
function.return: The comments. The string is owned by the about dialog and must not be modified.

function.name: gtk_about_dialog_get_copyright
function.description: Returns the copyright string.
function.return: The copyright string. The string is owned by the about dialog and must not be modified.

function.name: gtk_about_dialog_get_documenters
function.description: Returns the string which are displayed in the documenters tab of the secondary credits dialog.
function.return: A %NULL-terminated string array containing the documenters. The array is owned by the about dialog and must not be modified.

function.name: gtk_about_dialog_get_license
function.description: Returns the license information.
function.return: The license information. The string is owned by the about dialog and must not be modified.

function.name: gtk_about_dialog_get_license_type
function.description: Retrieves the license set using gtk_about_dialog_set_license_type()

function.name: gtk_about_dialog_get_logo
function.description: Returns the paintable displayed as logo in the about dialog.
function.return: the paintable displayed as logo or %NULL if the logo is unset or has been set via gtk_about_dialog_set_logo_icon_name(). The paintable is owned by the about dialog. If you want to keep a reference to it, you have to call g_object_ref() on it.

function.name: gtk_about_dialog_get_logo_icon_name
function.description: Returns the icon name displayed as logo in the about dialog.
function.return: the icon name displayed as logo or %NULL if the logo has been set via gtk_about_dialog_set_logo(). The string is owned by the dialog. If you want to keep a reference to it, you have to call g_strdup() on it.

function.name: gtk_about_dialog_get_program_name
function.description: Returns the program name displayed in the about dialog.
function.return: The program name. The string is owned by the about dialog and must not be modified.

function.name: gtk_about_dialog_get_system_information
function.description: Returns the system information that is shown in the about dialog.

function.name: gtk_about_dialog_get_translator_credits
function.description: Returns the translator credits string which is displayed in the translators tab of the secondary credits dialog.
function.return: The translator credits string. The string is owned by the about dialog and must not be modified.

function.name: gtk_about_dialog_get_version
function.description: Returns the version string.
function.return: The version string. The string is owned by the about dialog and must not be modified.

function.name: gtk_about_dialog_get_website
function.description: Returns the website URL.
function.return: The website URL. The string is owned by the about dialog and must not be modified.

function.name: gtk_about_dialog_get_website_label
function.description: Returns the label used for the website link.
function.return: The label used for the website link. The string is owned by the about dialog and must not be modified.

function.name: gtk_about_dialog_get_wrap_license
function.description: Returns whether the license text in @about is automatically wrapped.
function.return: %TRUE if the license text is wrapped

function.name: gtk_about_dialog_new
function.description: Creates a new #GtkAboutDialog.

function.name: gtk_about_dialog_set_artists
function.description: Sets the strings which are displayed in the artists tab of the secondary credits dialog.

function.name: gtk_about_dialog_set_authors
function.description: Sets the strings which are displayed in the authors tab of the secondary credits dialog.

function.name: gtk_about_dialog_set_comments
function.description: Sets the comments string to display in the about dialog. This should be a short string of one or two lines.

function.name: gtk_about_dialog_set_copyright
function.description: Sets the copyright string to display in the about dialog. This should be a short string of one or two lines.

function.name: gtk_about_dialog_set_documenters
function.description: Sets the strings which are displayed in the documenters tab of the credits dialog.

function.name: gtk_about_dialog_set_license
function.description: Sets the license information to be displayed in the secondary license dialog. If @license is %NULL, the license button is hidden.

function.name: gtk_about_dialog_set_license_type
function.description:
Sets the license of the application showing the @about dialog from a list of known licenses.
This function overrides the license set using gtk_about_dialog_set_license().

function.name: gtk_about_dialog_set_logo
function.description: Sets the logo in the about dialog.

function.name: gtk_about_dialog_set_logo_icon_name
function.description: Sets the icon name to be displayed as logo in the about dialog.

function.name: gtk_about_dialog_set_program_name
function.description: Sets the name to display in the about dialog. If this is not set, it defaults to g_get_application_name().

function.name: gtk_about_dialog_set_system_information
function.description:
Sets the system information to be displayed in the about dialog. If @system_information is %NULL, the system information tab is hidden.
See #GtkAboutDialog:system-information.

function.name: gtk_about_dialog_set_translator_credits
function.description:
Sets the translator credits string which is displayed in the translators tab of the secondary credits dialog.
The intended use for this string is to display the translator of the language which is currently used in the user interface. Using gettext(), a simple way to achieve that is to mark the string for translation: |[<!-- language="C" --> GtkWidget *about = gtk_about_dialog_new (); gtk_about_dialog_set_translator_credits (GTK_ABOUT_DIALOG (about), _("translator-credits")); ]| It is a good idea to use the customary msgid “translator-credits” for this purpose, since translators will already know the purpose of that msgid, and since #GtkAboutDialog will detect if “translator-credits” is untranslated and hide the tab.

function.name: gtk_about_dialog_set_version
function.description: Sets the version string to display in the about dialog.

function.name: gtk_about_dialog_set_website
function.description: Sets the URL to use for the website link.

function.name: gtk_about_dialog_set_website_label
function.description: Sets the label to be used for the website link.

parameter.name: website_label
parameter.parameter_description: the label used for the website link

function.name: gtk_about_dialog_set_wrap_license
function.description: Sets whether the license text in @about is automatically wrapped.

function.name: gtk_accelerator_get_default_mod_mask
function.description:
Gets the modifier mask.
The modifier mask determines which modifiers are considered significant for keyboard accelerators. This includes all keyboard modifiers except for %GDK_LOCK_MASK.

function.name: gtk_accelerator_get_label
function.description: Converts an accelerator keyval and modifier mask into a string which can be used to represent the accelerator to the user.
function.return: a newly-allocated string representing the accelerator.

function.name: gtk_accelerator_get_label_with_keycode
function.description:
Converts an accelerator keyval and modifier mask into a (possibly translated) string that can be displayed to a user, similarly to gtk_accelerator_get_label(), but handling keycodes.
This is only useful for system-level components, applications should use gtk_accelerator_parse() instead.

parameter.name: display
parameter.parameter_description: a #GdkDisplay or %NULL to use the default display

function.return: a newly-allocated string representing the accelerator.

function.name: gtk_accelerator_name
function.description:
Converts an accelerator keyval and modifier mask into a string parseable by gtk_accelerator_parse(). For example, if you pass in #GDK_KEY_q and #GDK_CONTROL_MASK, this function returns “<Control>q”.
If you need to display accelerators in the user interface, see gtk_accelerator_get_label().

function.name: gtk_accelerator_name_with_keycode
function.description: Converts an accelerator keyval and modifier mask into a string parseable by gtk_accelerator_parse_with_keycode(), similarly to gtk_accelerator_name() but handling keycodes. This is only useful for system-level components, applications should use gtk_accelerator_parse() instead.

parameter.name: display
parameter.parameter_description: a #GdkDisplay or %NULL to use the default display

function.name: gtk_accelerator_parse
function.description:
Parses a string representing an accelerator. The format looks like “<Control>a” or “<Shift><Alt>F1”.
The parser is fairly liberal and allows lower or upper case, and also abbreviations such as “<Ctl>” and “<Ctrl>”. Key names are parsed using gdk_keyval_from_name(). For character keys the name is not the symbol, but the lowercase name, e.g. one would use “<Ctrl>minus” instead of “<Ctrl>-”.
If the parse fails, @accelerator_key and @accelerator_mods will be set to 0 (zero).

parameter.name: accelerator_key
parameter.parameter_description: return location for accelerator keyval, or %NULL

parameter.name: accelerator_mods
parameter.parameter_description: return location for accelerator modifier mask, %NULL

function.name: gtk_accelerator_parse_with_keycode
function.description:
Parses a string representing an accelerator, similarly to gtk_accelerator_parse() but handles keycodes as well. This is only useful for system-level components, applications should use gtk_accelerator_parse() instead.
If @accelerator_codes is given and the result stored in it is non-%NULL, the result must be freed with g_free().
If a keycode is present in the accelerator and no @accelerator_codes is given, the parse will fail.
If the parse fails, @accelerator_key, @accelerator_mods and @accelerator_codes will be set to 0 (zero).

parameter.name: accelerator_key
parameter.parameter_description: return location for accelerator keyval, or %NULL

parameter.name: accelerator_codes
parameter.parameter_description: return location for accelerator keycodes, or %NULL

parameter.name: accelerator_mods
parameter.parameter_description: return location for accelerator modifier mask, %NULL

function.name: gtk_accelerator_valid
function.description: Determines whether a given keyval and modifier mask constitute a valid keyboard accelerator. For example, the #GDK_KEY_a keyval plus #GDK_CONTROL_MASK is valid - this is a “Ctrl+a” accelerator. But, you can't, for instance, use the #GDK_KEY_Control_L keyval as an accelerator.

function.name: gtk_accessible_get_accessible_role
function.description: Retrieves the #GtkAccessibleRole for the given #GtkAccessible.

function.name: gtk_accessible_property_init_value
function.description:
Initializes @value with the appropriate type for the @property.
This function is mostly meant for language bindings, in conjunction with gtk_accessible_update_property_value().

function.name: gtk_accessible_relation_init_value
function.description:
Initializes @value with the appropriate type for the @relation.
This function is mostly meant for language bindings, in conjunction with gtk_accessible_update_relation_value().

function.name: gtk_accessible_reset_property
function.description: Resets the accessible @property to its default value.

function.name: gtk_accessible_reset_relation
function.description: Resets the accessible @relation to its default value.

function.name: gtk_accessible_reset_state
function.description: Resets the accessible @state to its default value.

function.name: gtk_accessible_state_init_value
function.description:
Initializes @value with the appropriate type for the @state.
This function is mostly meant for language bindings, in conjunction with gtk_accessible_update_relation_state().

function.name: gtk_accessible_update_property
function.description:
Updates a list of accessible properties. See the #GtkAccessibleProperty documentation for the value types of accessible properties.
This function should be called by #GtkWidget types whenever an accessible property change must be communicated to assistive technologies.
Example: |[ value = gtk_adjustment_get_value (adjustment); gtk_accessible_update_property (GTK_ACCESSIBLE (spin_button), GTK_ACCESSIBLE_PROPERTY_VALUE_NOW, value, -1); ]|

parameter.name: Varargs
parameter.parameter_description: a list of property and value pairs, terminated by -1

function.name: gtk_accessible_update_property_value
function.description:
Updates an array of accessible properties.
This function should be called by #GtkWidget types whenever an accessible property change must be communicated to assistive technologies.
This function is meant to be used by language bindings.

parameter.name: n_properties
parameter.parameter_description: the number of accessible properties to set

parameter.name: values
parameter.parameter_description: an array of #GValues, one for each property

function.name: gtk_accessible_update_relation
function.description:
Updates a list of accessible relations.
This function should be called by #GtkWidget types whenever an accessible relation change must be communicated to assistive technologies.
If the #GtkAccessibleRelation requires a list of references, you should pass each reference individually, followed by %NULL, e.g.
|[<!-- language="C" --> gtk_accessible_update_relation (accessible, GTK_ACCESSIBLE_RELATION_CONTROLS, ref1, NULL, GTK_ACCESSIBLE_LABELLED_BY, ref1, ref2, ref3, NULL, -1); ]|

parameter.name: Varargs
parameter.parameter_description: a list of relation and value pairs, terminated by -1

function.name: gtk_accessible_update_relation_value
function.description:
Updates an array of accessible relations.
This function should be called by #GtkWidget types whenever an accessible relation change must be communicated to assistive technologies.
This function is meant to be used by language bindings.

parameter.name: n_relations
parameter.parameter_description: the number of accessible relations to set

parameter.name: values
parameter.parameter_description: an array of #GValues, one for each relation

function.name: gtk_accessible_update_state
function.description:
Updates a list of accessible states. See the #GtkAccessibleState documentation for the value types of accessible states.
This function should be called by #GtkWidget types whenever an accessible state change must be communicated to assistive technologies.
Example: |[ value = GTK_ACCESSIBLE_TRISTATE_MIXED; gtk_accessible_update_state (GTK_ACCESSIBLE (check_button), GTK_ACCESSIBLE_STATE_CHECKED, value, -1); ]|

parameter.name: Varargs
parameter.parameter_description: a list of state and value pairs, terminated by -1

function.name: gtk_accessible_update_state_value
function.description:
Updates an array of accessible states.
This function should be called by #GtkWidget types whenever an accessible state change must be communicated to assistive technologies.
This function is meant to be used by language bindings.

parameter.name: n_states
parameter.parameter_description: the number of accessible states to set

parameter.name: values
parameter.parameter_description: an array of #GValues, one for each state

function.name: gtk_action_bar_get_center_widget
function.description: Retrieves the center bar widget of the bar.

function.name: gtk_action_bar_get_revealed
function.description: Gets the value of the #GtkActionBar:revealed property.
function.return: the current value of the #GtkActionBar:revealed property.

function.name: gtk_action_bar_new
function.description: Creates a new #GtkActionBar widget.

function.name: gtk_action_bar_pack_end
function.description: Adds @child to @action_bar, packed with reference to the end of the @action_bar.

function.name: gtk_action_bar_pack_start
function.description: Adds @child to @action_bar, packed with reference to the start of the @action_bar.

function.name: gtk_action_bar_remove
function.description: Removes a child from @action_bar.

function.name: gtk_action_bar_set_center_widget
function.description: Sets the center widget for the #GtkActionBar.

parameter.name: center_widget
parameter.parameter_description: a widget to use for the center

function.name: gtk_action_bar_set_revealed
function.description:
Sets the #GtkActionBar:revealed property to @revealed. Changing this will make @action_bar reveal (%TRUE) or conceal (%FALSE) itself via a sliding transition.
Note: this does not show or hide @action_bar in the #GtkWidget:visible sense, so revealing has no effect if #GtkWidget:visible is %FALSE.

parameter.name: revealed
parameter.parameter_description: The new value of the property

function.name: gtk_action_observable_register_observer
function.description: Registers @observer as being interested in changes to @action_name on @observable.

parameter.name: observer
parameter.parameter_description: the #GtkActionObserver to which the events will be reported

function.name: gtk_action_observable_unregister_observer
function.description:
Removes the registration of @observer as being interested in changes to @action_name on @observable.
If the observer was registered multiple times, it must be unregistered an equal number of times.

parameter.name: observer
parameter.parameter_description: the #GtkActionObserver to which the events will be reported

function.name: gtk_actionable_get_action_name
function.description:
Gets the action name for @actionable.
See gtk_actionable_set_action_name() for more information.
function.return: the action name, or %NULL if none is set

function.name: gtk_actionable_get_action_target_value
function.description:
Gets the current target value of @actionable.
See gtk_actionable_set_action_target_value() for more information.

function.name: gtk_actionable_set_action_name
function.description:
Specifies the name of the action with which this widget should be associated. If @action_name is %NULL then the widget will be unassociated from any previous action.
Usually this function is used when the widget is located (or will be located) within the hierarchy of a #GtkApplicationWindow.
Names are of the form “win.save” or “app.quit” for actions on the containing #GtkApplicationWindow or its associated #GtkApplication, respectively. This is the same form used for actions in the #GMenu associated with the window.

function.name: gtk_actionable_set_action_target
function.description:
Sets the target of an actionable widget.
This is a convenience function that calls g_variant_new() for @format_string and uses the result to call gtk_actionable_set_action_target_value().
If you are setting a string-valued target and want to set the action name at the same time, you can use gtk_actionable_set_detailed_action_name ().

function.name: gtk_actionable_set_action_target_value
function.description:
Sets the target value of an actionable widget.
If @target_value is %NULL then the target value is unset.
The target value has two purposes. First, it is used as the parameter to activation of the action associated with the #GtkActionable widget. Second, it is used to determine if the widget should be rendered as “active” — the widget is active if the state is equal to the given target.
Consider the example of associating a set of buttons with a #GAction with string state in a typical “radio button” situation. Each button will be associated with the same action, but with a different target value for that action. Clicking on a particular button will activate the action with the target of that button, which will typically cause the action’s state to change to that value. Since the action’s state is now equal to the target value of the button, the button will now be rendered as active (and the other buttons, with different targets, rendered inactive).

parameter.name: target_value
parameter.parameter_description: a #GVariant to set as the target value, or %NULL

function.name: gtk_actionable_set_detailed_action_name
gtk_activate_action_get
function.description: Gets the activate action. This is an action that calls gtk_widget_activate() on the given widget upon activation.

function.name: gtk_adjustment_clamp_page
function.description:
Updates the #GtkAdjustment:value property to ensure that the range between @lower and @upper is in the current page (i.e. between #GtkAdjustment:value and #GtkAdjustment:value + #GtkAdjustment:page-size). If the range is larger than the page size, then only the start of it will be in the current page.
A #GtkAdjustment::value-changed signal will be emitted if the value is changed.

function.name: gtk_adjustment_configure
function.description:
Sets all properties of the adjustment at once.
Use this function to avoid multiple emissions of the #GtkAdjustment::changed signal. See gtk_adjustment_set_lower() for an alternative way of compressing multiple emissions of #GtkAdjustment::changed into one.

function.name: gtk_adjustment_get_lower
function.description: Retrieves the minimum value of the adjustment.
function.return: The current minimum value of the adjustment

function.name: gtk_adjustment_get_minimum_increment
function.description: Gets the smaller of step increment and page increment.

function.name: gtk_adjustment_get_page_increment
function.description: Retrieves the page increment of the adjustment.
function.return: The current page increment of the adjustment

function.name: gtk_adjustment_get_page_size
function.description: Retrieves the page size of the adjustment.
function.return: The current page size of the adjustment

function.name: gtk_adjustment_get_step_increment
function.description: Retrieves the step increment of the adjustment.
function.return: The current step increment of the adjustment.

function.name: gtk_adjustment_get_upper
function.description: Retrieves the maximum value of the adjustment.
function.return: The current maximum value of the adjustment

function.name: gtk_adjustment_get_value
function.description: Gets the current value of the adjustment. See gtk_adjustment_set_value().
function.return: The current value of the adjustment

function.name: gtk_adjustment_new
function.description: Creates a new #GtkAdjustment.

function.name: gtk_adjustment_set_lower
function.description:
Sets the minimum value of the adjustment.
When setting multiple adjustment properties via their individual setters, multiple #GtkAdjustment::changed signals will be emitted. However, since the emission of the #GtkAdjustment::changed signal is tied to the emission of the #GObject::notify signals of the changed properties, it’s possible to compress the #GtkAdjustment::changed signals into one by calling g_object_freeze_notify() and g_object_thaw_notify() around the calls to the individual setters.
Alternatively, using a single g_object_set() for all the properties to change, or using gtk_adjustment_configure() has the same effect of compressing #GtkAdjustment::changed emissions.

function.name: gtk_adjustment_set_page_increment
function.description:
Sets the page increment of the adjustment.
See gtk_adjustment_set_lower() about how to compress multiple emissions of the #GtkAdjustment::changed signal when setting multiple adjustment properties.

function.name: gtk_adjustment_set_page_size
function.description:
Sets the page size of the adjustment.
See gtk_adjustment_set_lower() about how to compress multiple emissions of the GtkAdjustment::changed signal when setting multiple adjustment properties.

function.name: gtk_adjustment_set_step_increment
function.description:
Sets the step increment of the adjustment.
See gtk_adjustment_set_lower() about how to compress multiple emissions of the #GtkAdjustment::changed signal when setting multiple adjustment properties.

function.name: gtk_adjustment_set_upper
function.description:
Sets the maximum value of the adjustment.
Note that values will be restricted by `upper - page-size` if the page-size property is nonzero.
See gtk_adjustment_set_lower() about how to compress multiple emissions of the #GtkAdjustment::changed signal when setting multiple adjustment properties.

function.name: gtk_adjustment_set_value
function.description:
Sets the #GtkAdjustment value. The value is clamped to lie between #GtkAdjustment:lower and #GtkAdjustment:upper.
Note that for adjustments which are used in a #GtkScrollbar, the effective range of allowed values goes from #GtkAdjustment:lower to #GtkAdjustment:upper - #GtkAdjustment:page-size.

function.name: gtk_alternative_trigger_get_first
function.description: Gets the first of the two alternative triggers that may trigger @self. gtk_alternative_trigger_get_second() will return the other one.

function.name: gtk_alternative_trigger_get_second
function.description: Gets the second of the two alternative triggers that may trigger @self. gtk_alternative_trigger_get_first() will return the other one.

function.name: gtk_alternative_trigger_new
function.description:
Creates a #GtkShortcutTrigger that will trigger whenever either of the two given triggers gets triggered.
Note that nesting is allowed, so if you want more than two alternative, create a new alternative trigger for each option.

parameter.name: first
parameter.parameter_description: The first trigger that may trigger

parameter.name: second
parameter.parameter_description: The second trigger that may trigger

function.name: gtk_any_filter_new
function.description:
Creates a new empty "any" filter. Use gtk_multi_filter_append() to add filters to it.
This filter matches an item if any of the filters added to it matches the item. In particular, this means that if no filter has been added to it, the filter matches no item.

function.name: gtk_app_chooser_button_append_custom_item
function.description: Appends a custom item to the list of applications that is shown in the popup; the item name must be unique per-widget. Clients can use the provided name as a detail for the #GtkAppChooserButton::custom-item-activated signal, to add a callback for the activation of a particular custom item in the list. See also gtk_app_chooser_button_append_separator().

parameter.name: name
parameter.parameter_description: the name of the custom item

parameter.name: label
parameter.parameter_description: the label for the custom item

parameter.name: icon
parameter.parameter_description: the icon for the custom item

function.name: gtk_app_chooser_button_append_separator
function.description: Appends a separator to the list of applications that is shown in the popup.

function.name: gtk_app_chooser_button_get_heading
function.description: Returns the text to display at the top of the dialog.
function.return: the text to display at the top of the dialog, or %NULL, in which case a default text is displayed

function.name: gtk_app_chooser_button_get_modal
function.description: Gets whether the dialog is modal.

function.name: gtk_app_chooser_button_get_show_default_item
function.description: Returns the current value of the #GtkAppChooserButton:show-default-item property.

function.name: gtk_app_chooser_button_get_show_dialog_item
function.description: Returns the current value of the #GtkAppChooserButton:show-dialog-item property.

function.name: gtk_app_chooser_button_new
function.description: Creates a new #GtkAppChooserButton for applications that can handle content of the given type.

parameter.name: content_type
parameter.parameter_description: the content type to show applications for

function.name: gtk_app_chooser_button_set_active_custom_item
function.description:
Selects a custom item previously added with gtk_app_chooser_button_append_custom_item().
Use gtk_app_chooser_refresh() to bring the selection to its initial state.

parameter.name: name
parameter.parameter_description: the name of the custom item

function.name: gtk_app_chooser_button_set_heading
function.description: Sets the text to display at the top of the dialog. If the heading is not set, the dialog displays a default text.

function.name: gtk_app_chooser_button_set_modal
function.description: Sets whether the dialog should be modal.

function.name: gtk_app_chooser_button_set_show_default_item
function.description: Sets whether the dropdown menu of this button should show the default application for the given content type at top.

function.name: gtk_app_chooser_button_set_show_dialog_item
function.description: Sets whether the dropdown menu of this button should show an entry to trigger a #GtkAppChooserDialog.

function.name: gtk_app_chooser_dialog_get_heading
function.description: Returns the text to display at the top of the dialog.
function.return: the text to display at the top of the dialog, or %NULL, in which case a default text is displayed

function.name: gtk_app_chooser_dialog_get_widget
function.description: Returns the #GtkAppChooserWidget of this dialog.

function.name: gtk_app_chooser_dialog_new
function.description: Creates a new #GtkAppChooserDialog for the provided #GFile, to allow the user to select an application for it.

function.name: gtk_app_chooser_dialog_new_for_content_type
function.description: Creates a new #GtkAppChooserDialog for the provided content type, to allow the user to select an application for it.

function.name: gtk_app_chooser_dialog_set_heading
function.description: Sets the text to display at the top of the dialog. If the heading is not set, the dialog displays a default text.

function.name: gtk_app_chooser_get_app_info
function.description: Returns the currently selected application.
function.return: a #GAppInfo for the currently selected application, or %NULL if none is selected. Free with g_object_unref()

function.name: gtk_app_chooser_get_content_type
function.description: Returns the current value of the #GtkAppChooser:content-type property.
function.return: the content type of @self. Free with g_free()

function.name: gtk_app_chooser_refresh
function.description: Reloads the list of applications.

function.name: gtk_app_chooser_widget_get_default_text
function.description: Returns the text that is shown if there are not applications that can handle the content type.

function.name: gtk_app_chooser_widget_get_show_all
function.description: Returns the current value of the #GtkAppChooserWidget:show-all property.

function.name: gtk_app_chooser_widget_get_show_default
function.description: Returns the current value of the #GtkAppChooserWidget:show-default property.

function.name: gtk_app_chooser_widget_get_show_fallback
function.description: Returns the current value of the #GtkAppChooserWidget:show-fallback property.

function.name: gtk_app_chooser_widget_get_show_other
function.description: Returns the current value of the #GtkAppChooserWidget:show-other property.

function.name: gtk_app_chooser_widget_get_show_recommended
function.description: Returns the current value of the #GtkAppChooserWidget:show-recommended property.

function.name: gtk_app_chooser_widget_new
function.description: Creates a new #GtkAppChooserWidget for applications that can handle content of the given type.

parameter.name: content_type
parameter.parameter_description: the content type to show applications for

function.name: gtk_app_chooser_widget_set_default_text
function.description: Sets the text that is shown if there are not applications that can handle the content type.

function.name: gtk_app_chooser_widget_set_show_all
function.description: Sets whether the app chooser should show all applications in a flat list.

function.name: gtk_app_chooser_widget_set_show_default
function.description: Sets whether the app chooser should show the default handler for the content type in a separate section.

function.name: gtk_app_chooser_widget_set_show_fallback
function.description: Sets whether the app chooser should show related applications for the content type in a separate section.

function.name: gtk_app_chooser_widget_set_show_other
function.description: Sets whether the app chooser should show applications which are unrelated to the content type.

function.name: gtk_app_chooser_widget_set_show_recommended
function.description: Sets whether the app chooser should show recommended applications for the content type in a separate section.

function.name: gtk_application_add_window
function.description:
Adds a window to @application.
This call can only happen after the @application has started; typically, you should add new application windows in response to the emission of the #GApplication::activate signal.
This call is equivalent to setting the #GtkWindow:application property of @window to @application.
Normally, the connection between the application and the window will remain until the window is destroyed, but you can explicitly remove it with gtk_application_remove_window().
GTK+ will keep the @application running as long as it has any windows.

function.name: gtk_application_get_accels_for_action
function.description: Gets the accelerators that are currently associated with the given action.

parameter.name: detailed_action_name
parameter.parameter_description: a detailed action name, specifying an action and target to obtain accelerators for

function.return: accelerators for @detailed_action_name, as a %NULL-terminated array. Free with g_strfreev() when no longer needed

function.name: gtk_application_get_actions_for_accel
function.description:
Returns the list of actions (possibly empty) that @accel maps to. Each item in the list is a detailed action name in the usual form.
This might be useful to discover if an accel already exists in order to prevent installation of a conflicting accelerator (from an accelerator editor or a plugin system, for example). Note that having more than one action per accelerator may not be a bad thing and might make sense in cases where the actions never appear in the same context.
In case there are no actions for a given accelerator, an empty array is returned. %NULL is never returned.
It is a programmer error to pass an invalid accelerator string. If you are unsure, check it with gtk_accelerator_parse() first.

parameter.name: accel
parameter.parameter_description: an accelerator that can be parsed by gtk_accelerator_parse()

function.name: gtk_application_get_active_window
function.description:
Gets the “active” window for the application.
The active window is the one that was most recently focused (within the application). This window may not have the focus at the moment if another application has it — this is just the most recently-focused window within this application.
function.return: the active window, or %NULL if there isn't one.

function.name: gtk_application_get_menu_by_id
function.description: Gets a menu from automatically loaded resources. See [Automatic resources][automatic-resources] for more information.

parameter.name: id
parameter.parameter_description: the id of the menu to look up

function.return: Gets the menu with the given id from the automatically loaded resources

function.name: gtk_application_get_menubar
function.description: Returns the menu model that has been set with gtk_application_set_menubar().

function.name: gtk_application_get_window_by_id
function.description:
Returns the #GtkApplicationWindow with the given ID.
The ID of a #GtkApplicationWindow can be retrieved with gtk_application_window_get_id().
function.return: the window with ID @id, or %NULL if there is no window with this ID

function.name: gtk_application_get_windows
function.description:
Gets a list of the #GtkWindows associated with @application.
The list is sorted by most recently focused window, such that the first element is the currently focused window. (Useful for choosing a parent for a transient window.)
The list that is returned should not be modified in any way. It will only remain valid until the next focus change or window creation or deletion.

function.name: gtk_application_inhibit
function.description:
Inform the session manager that certain types of actions should be inhibited. This is not guaranteed to work on all platforms and for all types of actions.
Applications should invoke this method when they begin an operation that should not be interrupted, such as creating a CD or DVD. The types of actions that may be blocked are specified by the @flags parameter. When the application completes the operation it should call gtk_application_uninhibit() to remove the inhibitor. Note that an application can have multiple inhibitors, and all of them must be individually removed. Inhibitors are also cleared when the application exits.
Applications should not expect that they will always be able to block the action. In most cases, users will be given the option to force the action to take place.
Reasons should be short and to the point.
If @window is given, the session manager may point the user to this window to find out more about why the action is inhibited.

parameter.name: flags
parameter.parameter_description: what types of actions should be inhibited

parameter.name: reason
parameter.parameter_description: a short, human-readable string that explains why these operations are inhibited

function.return: A non-zero cookie that is used to uniquely identify this request. It should be used as an argument to gtk_application_uninhibit() in order to remove the request. If the platform does not support inhibiting or the request failed for some reason, 0 is returned.

function.name: gtk_application_list_action_descriptions
function.description: Lists the detailed action names which have associated accelerators. See gtk_application_set_accels_for_action().
function.return: a %NULL-terminated array of strings, free with g_strfreev() when done

function.name: gtk_application_new
function.description:
Creates a new #GtkApplication instance.
When using #GtkApplication, it is not necessary to call gtk_init() manually. It is called as soon as the application gets registered as the primary instance.
Concretely, gtk_init() is called in the default handler for the #GApplication::startup signal. Therefore, #GtkApplication subclasses should chain up in their #GApplication::startup handler before using any GTK+ API.
Note that commandline arguments are not passed to gtk_init(). All GTK+ functionality that is available via commandline arguments can also be achieved by setting suitable environment variables such as `G_DEBUG`, so this should not be a big problem. If you absolutely must support GTK+ commandline arguments, you can explicitly call gtk_init() before creating the application instance.
If non-%NULL, the application ID must be valid. See g_application_id_is_valid().
If no application ID is given then some features (most notably application uniqueness) will be disabled.

function.name: gtk_application_remove_window
function.description:
Remove a window from @application.
If @window belongs to @application then this call is equivalent to setting the #GtkWindow:application property of @window to %NULL.
The application may stop running as a result of a call to this function.

function.name: gtk_application_set_accels_for_action
function.description:
Sets zero or more keyboard accelerators that will trigger the given action. The first item in @accels will be the primary accelerator, which may be displayed in the UI.
To remove all accelerators for an action, use an empty, zero-terminated array for @accels.
For the @detailed_action_name, see g_action_parse_detailed_name() and g_action_print_detailed_name().

parameter.name: detailed_action_name
parameter.parameter_description: a detailed action name, specifying an action and target to associate accelerators with

parameter.name: accels
parameter.parameter_description: a list of accelerators in the format understood by gtk_accelerator_parse()

function.name: gtk_application_set_menubar
function.description:
Sets or unsets the menubar for windows of @application.
This is a menubar in the traditional sense.
This can only be done in the primary instance of the application, after it has been registered. #GApplication::startup is a good place to call this.
Depending on the desktop environment, this may appear at the top of each window, or at the top of the screen. In some environments, if both the application menu and the menubar are set, the application menu will be presented as if it were the first item of the menubar. Other environments treat the two as completely separate — for example, the application menu may be rendered by the desktop shell while the menubar (if set) remains in each individual window.
Use the base #GActionMap interface to add actions, to respond to the user selecting these menu items.

function.name: gtk_application_uninhibit
function.description: Removes an inhibitor that has been established with gtk_application_inhibit(). Inhibitors are also cleared when the application exits.

parameter.name: cookie
parameter.parameter_description: a cookie that was returned by gtk_application_inhibit()

function.name: gtk_application_window_get_help_overlay
function.description: Gets the #GtkShortcutsWindow that has been set up with a prior call to gtk_application_window_set_help_overlay().
function.return: the help overlay associated with @window, or %NULL

function.name: gtk_application_window_get_id
function.description: Returns the unique ID of the window. If the window has not yet been added to a #GtkApplication, returns `0`.
function.return: the unique ID for @window, or `0` if the window has not yet been added to a #GtkApplication

function.name: gtk_application_window_get_show_menubar
function.description: Returns whether the window will display a menubar for the app menu and menubar as needed.
function.return: %TRUE if @window will display a menubar when needed

function.name: gtk_application_window_new
function.description: Creates a new #GtkApplicationWindow.

function.name: gtk_application_window_set_help_overlay
function.description:
Associates a shortcuts window with the application window, and sets up an action with the name win.show-help-overlay to present it.
@window takes responsibility for destroying @help_overlay.

function.name: gtk_application_window_set_show_menubar
function.description: Sets whether the window will display a menubar for the app menu and menubar as needed.

parameter.name: show_menubar
parameter.parameter_description: whether to show a menubar when needed

function.name: gtk_aspect_frame_get_child
function.description: Gets the child widget of @self.

function.name: gtk_aspect_frame_get_obey_child
function.description: Returns whether the child's size request should override the set aspect ratio of the #GtkAspectFrame.
function.return: whether to obey the child's size request

function.name: gtk_aspect_frame_get_ratio
function.description: Returns the desired aspect ratio of the child.

function.name: gtk_aspect_frame_get_xalign
function.description: Returns the horizontal alignment of the child within the allocation of the #GtkAspectFrame.

function.name: gtk_aspect_frame_get_yalign
function.description: Returns the vertical alignment of the child within the allocation of the #GtkAspectFrame.

function.name: gtk_aspect_frame_new
function.description: Create a new #GtkAspectFrame.

parameter.name: xalign
parameter.parameter_description: Horizontal alignment of the child within the allocation of the #GtkAspectFrame. This ranges from 0.0 (left aligned) to 1.0 (right aligned)

parameter.name: yalign
parameter.parameter_description: Vertical alignment of the child within the allocation of the #GtkAspectFrame. This ranges from 0.0 (top aligned) to 1.0 (bottom aligned)

parameter.name: obey_child
parameter.parameter_description: If %TRUE, @ratio is ignored, and the aspect ratio is taken from the requistion of the child.

function.name: gtk_aspect_frame_set_child
function.description: Sets the child widget of @self.

function.name: gtk_aspect_frame_set_obey_child
function.description: Sets whether the aspect ratio of the child's size request should override the set aspect ratio of the #GtkAspectFrame.

parameter.name: obey_child
parameter.parameter_description: If %TRUE, @ratio is ignored, and the aspect ratio is taken from the requistion of the child.

function.name: gtk_aspect_frame_set_ratio
function.description: Sets the desired aspect ratio of the child.

function.name: gtk_aspect_frame_set_xalign
function.description: Sets the horizontal alignment of the child within the allocation of the #GtkAspectFrame.

parameter.name: xalign
parameter.parameter_description: horizontal alignment, from 0.0 (left aligned) to 1.0 (right aligned)

function.name: gtk_aspect_frame_set_yalign
function.description: Sets the vertical alignment of the child within the allocation of the #GtkAspectFrame.

parameter.name: yalign
parameter.parameter_description: horizontal alignment, from 0.0 (top aligned) to 1.0 (bottom aligned)

function.name: gtk_assistant_add_action_widget
function.description: Adds a widget to the action area of a #GtkAssistant.

function.name: gtk_assistant_append_page
function.description: Appends a page to the @assistant.
function.return: the index (starting at 0) of the inserted page

function.name: gtk_assistant_commit
function.description:
Erases the visited page history so the back button is not shown on the current page, and removes the cancel button from subsequent pages.
Use this when the information provided up to the current page is hereafter deemed permanent and cannot be modified or undone. For example, showing a progress page to track a long-running, unreversible operation after the user has clicked apply on a confirmation page.

function.name: gtk_assistant_get_current_page
function.description: Returns the page number of the current page.
function.return: The index (starting from 0) of the current page in the @assistant, or -1 if the @assistant has no pages, or no current page.

function.name: gtk_assistant_get_n_pages
function.description: Returns the number of pages in the @assistant
function.return: the number of pages in the @assistant

function.name: gtk_assistant_get_nth_page
function.description: Returns the child widget contained in page number @page_num.

parameter.name: page_num
parameter.parameter_description: the index of a page in the @assistant, or -1 to get the last page

function.return: the child widget, or %NULL if @page_num is out of bounds

function.name: gtk_assistant_get_page
function.description: Returns the #GtkAssistantPage object for @child.

function.name: gtk_assistant_get_page_complete
function.description: Gets whether @page is complete.

function.name: gtk_assistant_get_page_title
function.description: Gets the title for @page.

function.name: gtk_assistant_get_page_type
function.description: Gets the page type of @page.

function.name: gtk_assistant_get_pages
function.description: Gets a list model of the assistant pages.
function.return: A list model of the pages.

function.name: gtk_assistant_insert_page
function.description: Inserts a page in the @assistant at a given position.

parameter.name: position
parameter.parameter_description: the index (starting at 0) at which to insert the page, or -1 to append the page to the @assistant

function.return: the index (starting from 0) of the inserted page

function.name: gtk_assistant_new
function.description: Creates a new #GtkAssistant.

function.name: gtk_assistant_next_page
function.description:
Navigate to the next page.
It is a programming error to call this function when there is no next page.
This function is for use when creating pages of the #GTK_ASSISTANT_PAGE_CUSTOM type.

function.name: gtk_assistant_page_get_child
function.description: Returns the child to which @page belongs.

function.name: gtk_assistant_prepend_page
function.description: Prepends a page to the @assistant.
function.return: the index (starting at 0) of the inserted page

function.name: gtk_assistant_previous_page
function.description:
Navigate to the previous visited page.
It is a programming error to call this function when no previous page is available.
This function is for use when creating pages of the #GTK_ASSISTANT_PAGE_CUSTOM type.

function.name: gtk_assistant_remove_action_widget
function.description: Removes a widget from the action area of a #GtkAssistant.

function.name: gtk_assistant_remove_page
function.description: Removes the @page_num’s page from @assistant.

parameter.name: page_num
parameter.parameter_description: the index of a page in the @assistant, or -1 to remove the last page

function.name: gtk_assistant_set_current_page
function.description:
Switches the page to @page_num.
Note that this will only be necessary in custom buttons, as the @assistant flow can be set with gtk_assistant_set_forward_page_func().

parameter.name: page_num
parameter.parameter_description: index of the page to switch to, starting from 0. If negative, the last page will be used. If greater than the number of pages in the @assistant, nothing will be done.

function.name: gtk_assistant_set_forward_page_func
function.description:
Sets the page forwarding function to be @page_func.
This function will be used to determine what will be the next page when the user presses the forward button. Setting @page_func to %NULL will make the assistant to use the default forward function, which just goes to the next visible page.

parameter.name: page_func
parameter.parameter_description: the #GtkAssistantPageFunc, or %NULL to use the default one

function.name: gtk_assistant_set_page_complete
function.description:
Sets whether @page contents are complete.
This will make @assistant update the buttons state to be able to continue the task.

parameter.name: complete
parameter.parameter_description: the completeness status of the page

function.name: gtk_assistant_set_page_title
function.description:
Sets a title for @page.
The title is displayed in the header area of the assistant when @page is the current page.

function.name: gtk_assistant_set_page_type
function.description:
Sets the page type for @page.
The page type determines the page behavior in the @assistant.

function.name: gtk_assistant_update_buttons_state
function.description:
Forces @assistant to recompute the buttons state.
GTK automatically takes care of this in most situations, e.g. when the user goes to a different page, or when the visibility or completeness of a page changes.
One situation where it can be necessary to call this function is when changing a value on the current page affects the future page flow of the assistant.

function.name: gtk_at_context_create
function.description:
Creates a new #GtkATContext instance for the given accessible role, accessible instance, and display connection.
The #GtkATContext implementation being instantiated will depend on the platform.

parameter.name: accessible_role
parameter.parameter_description: the accessible role used by the #GtkATContext

function.name: gtk_at_context_get_accessible
function.description: Retrieves the #GtkAccessible using this context.

function.name: gtk_at_context_get_accessible_role
function.description: Retrieves the accessible role of this context.

function.name: gtk_bin_layout_new
function.description: Creates a new #GtkBinLayout instance.

function.name: gtk_bitset_add
function.description: Adds @value to @self if it wasn't part of it before.
function.return: %TRUE if @value was not part of @self and @self was changed.

function.name: gtk_bitset_add_range
function.description: Adds all values from @start (inclusive) to @start + @n_items (exclusive) in @self.

parameter.name: n_items
parameter.parameter_description: number of consecutive values to add

function.name: gtk_bitset_add_range_closed
function.description: Adds the closed range [@first, @last], so @first, @last and all values in between. @first must be smaller than @last.

function.name: gtk_bitset_add_rectangle
function.description: Interprets the values as a 2-dimensional boolean grid with the given @stride and inside that grid, adds a rectangle with the given @width and @height.

function.name: gtk_bitset_contains
function.description: Checks if the given @value has been added to @bitset

function.name: gtk_bitset_copy
function.description: Creates a copy of @self.
function.return: A new bitset that contains the same values as @self

function.name: gtk_bitset_difference
function.description:
Sets @self to be the symmetric difference of @self and @other, that is set @self to contain all values that were either contained in @self or in @other, but not in both. This operation is also called an XOR.
It is allowed for @self and @other to be the same bitset. The bitset will be emptied in that case.

parameter.name: other
parameter.parameter_description: the #GtkBitset to compute the difference from

function.name: gtk_bitset_equals
function.description: Returns %TRUE if @self and @other contain the same values.
function.return: %TRUE if @self and @other contain the same values

function.name: gtk_bitset_get_maximum
function.description: Returns the largest value in @self. If @self is empty, 0 is returned.

function.name: gtk_bitset_get_minimum
function.description: Returns the smallest value in @self. If @self is empty, G_MAXUINT is returned.

function.name: gtk_bitset_get_nth
function.description:
Returns the value of the @nth item in self.
If @nth is >= the size of @self, 0 is returned.

parameter.name: nth
parameter.parameter_description: index of the item to get

function.return: the value of the @nth item in @self

function.name: gtk_bitset_get_size
function.description:
Gets the number of values that were added to the set. For example, if the set is empty, 0 is returned.
Note that this function returns a #guint64, because when all values are set, the return value is #G_MAXUINT + 1. Unless you are sure this cannot happen (it can't with #GListModel), be sure to use a 64bit type.
function.return: The number of values in the set.

function.name: gtk_bitset_get_size_in_range
function.description:
Gets the number of values that are part of the set from @first to @last (inclusive).
Note that this function returns a #guint64, because when all values are set, the return value is #G_MAXUINT + 1. Unless you are sure this cannot happen (it can't with #GListModel), be sure to use a 64bit type.
function.return: The number of values in the set from @first to @last.

function.name: gtk_bitset_intersect
function.description:
Sets @self to be the intersection of @self and @other, that is remove all values from @self that are not part of @other.
It is allowed for @self and @other to be the same bitset. Nothing will happen in that case.

function.name: gtk_bitset_is_empty
function.description: Check if no value is contained in bitset.

function.name: gtk_bitset_iter_get_value
function.description:
Gets the current value that @iter points to.
If @iter is not valid and gtk_bitset_iter_is_valid() returns %FALSE, this function returns 0.
function.return: The current value pointer to by @iter

function.name: gtk_bitset_iter_init_at
function.description: Initializes @iter to point to @target. If @target is not found, finds the next value after it. If no value >= @target exists in @set, this function returns %FALSE.

parameter.name: target
parameter.parameter_description: target value to start iterating at

parameter.name: value
parameter.parameter_description: Set to the found value in @set

function.name: gtk_bitset_iter_init_first
function.description: Initializes an iterator for @set and points it to the first value in @set. If @set is empty, %FALSE is returned and @value is set to %G_MAXUINT.

parameter.name: value
parameter.parameter_description: Set to the first value in @set

function.name: gtk_bitset_iter_init_last
function.description: Initializes an iterator for @set and points it to the last value in @set. If @set is empty, %FALSE is returned.

parameter.name: value
parameter.parameter_description: Set to the last value in @set

function.name: gtk_bitset_iter_is_valid
function.description: Checks if @iter points to a valid value.
function.return: %TRUE if @iter points to a valid value

function.name: gtk_bitset_iter_next
gtk_bitset_iter_previous
gtk_bitset_new_empty
function.description: Creates a new empty bitset.

function.name: gtk_bitset_new_range
function.description: Creates a bitset with the given range set.

parameter.name: n_items
parameter.parameter_description: number of consecutive values to add

function.name: gtk_bitset_ref
function.description: Acquires a reference on the given #GtkBitset.

function.name: gtk_bitset_remove
function.description: Removes @value from @self if it was part of it before.
function.return: %TRUE if @value was part of @self and @self was changed.

function.name: gtk_bitset_remove_all
function.description: Removes all values from the bitset so that it is empty again.

function.name: gtk_bitset_remove_range
function.description: Removes all values from @start (inclusive) to @start + @n_items (exclusive) in @self.

parameter.name: n_items
parameter.parameter_description: number of consecutive values to remove

function.name: gtk_bitset_remove_range_closed
function.description: Removes the closed range [@first, @last], so @first, @last and all values in between. @first must be smaller than @last.

function.name: gtk_bitset_remove_rectangle
function.description: Interprets the values as a 2-dimensional boolean grid with the given @stride and inside that grid, removes a rectangle with the given @width and @height.

function.name: gtk_bitset_shift_left
function.description: Shifts all values in @self to the left by @amount. Values smaller than @amount are discarded.

parameter.name: amount
parameter.parameter_description: amount to shift all values to the left

function.name: gtk_bitset_shift_right
function.description: Shifts all values in @self to the right by @amount. Values that end up too large to be held in a #guint are discarded.

parameter.name: amount
parameter.parameter_description: amount to shift all values to the right

function.name: gtk_bitset_splice
function.description:
This is a support function for #GListModel handling, by mirroring the #GlistModel::items-changed signal.
First, it "cuts" the values from @position to @removed from the bitset. That is, it removes all those values and shifts all larger values to the left by @removed places.
Then, it "pastes" new room into the bitset by shifting all values larger than @position by @added spaces to the right. This frees up space that can then be filled.

function.name: gtk_bitset_subtract
function.description:
Sets @self to be the subtraction of @other from @self, that is remove all values from @self that are part of @other.
It is allowed for @self and @other to be the same bitset. The bitset will be emptied in that case.

function.name: gtk_bitset_union
function.description:
Sets @self to be the union of @self and @other, that is add all values from @other into @self that weren't part of it.
It is allowed for @self and @other to be the same bitset. Nothing will happen in that case.

function.name: gtk_bitset_unref
function.description:
Releases a reference on the given #GtkBitset.
If the reference was the last, the resources associated to the @self are freed.

function.name: gtk_bookmark_list_get_attributes
function.description: Gets the attributes queried on the children.

function.name: gtk_bookmark_list_get_filename
function.description: Returns the filename of the bookmark file that this list is loading.

function.name: gtk_bookmark_list_get_io_priority
function.description: Gets the IO priority set via gtk_bookmark_list_set_io_priority().

function.name: gtk_bookmark_list_is_loading
function.description:
Returns %TRUE if the files are currently being loaded.
Files will be added to @self from time to time while loading is going on. The order in which are added is undefined and may change in between runs.

function.name: gtk_bookmark_list_new
function.description: Creates a new #GtkBookmarkList with the given @attributes.

function.name: gtk_bookmark_list_set_attributes
function.description:
Sets the @attributes to be enumerated and starts the enumeration.
If @attributes is %NULL, no attributes will be queried, but a list of #GFileInfos will still be created.

function.name: gtk_bookmark_list_set_io_priority
function.description:
Sets the IO priority to use while loading files.
The default IO priority is %G_PRIORITY_DEFAULT.

function.name: gtk_bool_filter_get_expression
function.description: Gets the expression that the filter uses to evaluate if an item should be filtered.

function.name: gtk_bool_filter_get_invert
function.description: Returns whether the filter inverts the expression.

function.name: gtk_bool_filter_new
function.description: Creates a new bool filter.

parameter.name: expression
parameter.parameter_description: The expression to evaluate or %NULL for none

function.name: gtk_bool_filter_set_expression
function.description: Sets the expression that the filter uses to check if items should be filtered. The expression must have a value type of #G_TYPE_BOOLEAN.

function.name: gtk_bool_filter_set_invert
function.description: Sets whether the filter should invert the expression.

function.name: gtk_border_copy
function.description: Copies a #GtkBorder-struct.

function.name: gtk_border_free
function.description: Frees a #GtkBorder-struct.

function.name: gtk_border_new
function.description: Allocates a new #GtkBorder-struct and initializes its elements to zero.
function.return: a newly allocated #GtkBorder-struct. Free with gtk_border_free()

function.name: gtk_box_append
function.description: Adds @child as the last child to @box.

function.name: gtk_box_get_baseline_position
function.description: Gets the value set by gtk_box_set_baseline_position().

function.name: gtk_box_get_homogeneous
function.description: Returns whether the box is homogeneous (all children are the same size). See gtk_box_set_homogeneous().

function.name: gtk_box_get_spacing
function.description: Gets the value set by gtk_box_set_spacing().

function.name: gtk_box_insert_child_after
