function.description: Inserts @child in the position after @sibling in the list of @box children. If @sibling is %NULL, insert @child at the first position.

parameter.name: sibling
parameter.parameter_description: the sibling to move @child after, or %NULL

function.name: gtk_box_layout_get_baseline_position
function.description: Gets the value set by gtk_box_layout_set_baseline_position().

function.name: gtk_box_layout_get_homogeneous
function.description:
Returns whether the layout is set to be homogeneous.
Return: %TRUE if the layout is homogeneous

function.name: gtk_box_layout_get_spacing
function.description: Returns the space that @box_layout puts between children.

function.name: gtk_box_layout_new
function.description: Creates a new box layout.

parameter.name: orientation
parameter.parameter_description: the orientation for the new layout

function.name: gtk_box_layout_set_baseline_position
function.description:
Sets the baseline position of a box layout.
The baseline position affects only horizontal boxes with at least one baseline aligned child. If there is more vertical space available than requested, and the baseline is not allocated by the parent then the given @position is used to allocate the baseline within the extra space available.

function.name: gtk_box_layout_set_homogeneous
function.description: Sets whether the box layout will allocate the same size to all children.

parameter.name: homogeneous
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE to set the box layout as homogeneous

function.name: gtk_box_layout_set_spacing
function.description: Sets how much spacing to put between children.

parameter.name: spacing
parameter.parameter_description: the spacing to apply between children

function.name: gtk_box_new
function.description: Creates a new #GtkBox.

parameter.name: spacing
parameter.parameter_description: the number of pixels to place by default between children.

function.name: gtk_box_prepend
function.description: Adds @child as the first child to @box.

function.name: gtk_box_remove
function.description: Removes a child widget from @box, after it has been added with gtk_box_append(), gtk_box_prepend(), or gtk_box_insert_child_after().

function.name: gtk_box_reorder_child_after
function.description: Moves @child to the position after @sibling in the list of @box children. If @sibling is %NULL, move @child to the first position.

parameter.name: child
parameter.parameter_description: the #GtkWidget to move, must be a child of @box

parameter.name: sibling
parameter.parameter_description: the sibling to move @child after, or %NULL

function.name: gtk_box_set_baseline_position
function.description: Sets the baseline position of a box. This affects only horizontal boxes with at least one baseline aligned child. If there is more vertical space available than requested, and the baseline is not allocated by the parent then @position is used to allocate the baseline wrt the extra space available.

function.name: gtk_box_set_homogeneous
function.description: Sets the #GtkBox:homogeneous property of @box, controlling whether or not all children of @box are given equal space in the box.

parameter.name: homogeneous
parameter.parameter_description: a boolean value, %TRUE to create equal allotments, %FALSE for variable allotments

function.name: gtk_box_set_spacing
function.description: Sets the #GtkBox:spacing property of @box, which is the number of pixels to place between children of @box.

parameter.name: spacing
parameter.parameter_description: the number of pixels to put between children

function.name: gtk_buildable_get_buildable_id
function.description:
Gets the ID of the @buildable object.
#GtkBuilder sets the name based on the [GtkBuilder UI definition][BUILDER-UI] used to construct the @buildable.

function.name: gtk_buildable_parse_context_get_element
function.description:
Retrieves the name of the currently open element.
If called from the start_element or end_element handlers this will give the element_name as passed to those functions. For the parent elements, see gtk_buildable_parse_context_get_element_stack().
function.return: the name of the currently open element, or %NULL

function.name: gtk_buildable_parse_context_get_element_stack
function.description:
Retrieves the element stack from the internal state of the parser.
The returned #GPtrArray is an array of strings where the last item is the currently open tag (as would be returned by gtk_buildable_parse_context_get_element()) and the previous item is its immediate parent.
This function is intended to be used in the start_element and end_element handlers where gtk_buildable_parse_context_get_element() would merely return the name of the element that is being processed.
function.return: the element stack, which must not be modified

function.name: gtk_buildable_parse_context_get_position
function.description: Retrieves the current line number and the number of the character on that line. Intended for use in error messages; there are no strict semantics for what constitutes the "current" line number other than "the best number we could come up with for error messages."

parameter.name: line_number
parameter.parameter_description: return location for a line number, or %NULL

parameter.name: char_number
parameter.parameter_description: return location for a char-on-line number, or %NULL

function.name: gtk_buildable_parse_context_pop
function.description:
Completes the process of a temporary sub-parser redirection.
This function exists to collect the user_data allocated by a matching call to gtk_buildable_parse_context_push(). It must be called in the end_element handler corresponding to the start_element handler during which gtk_buildable_parse_context_push() was called. You must not call this function from the error callback -- the @user_data is provided directly to the callback in that case.
This function is not intended to be directly called by users interested in invoking subparsers. Instead, it is intended to be used by the subparsers themselves to implement a higher-level interface.
function.return: the user data passed to gtk_buildable_parse_context_push()

function.name: gtk_buildable_parse_context_push
function.description:
Temporarily redirects markup data to a sub-parser.
This function may only be called from the start_element handler of a #GtkBuildableParser. It must be matched with a corresponding call to gtk_buildable_parse_context_pop() in the matching end_element handler (except in the case that the parser aborts due to an error).
All tags, text and other data between the matching tags is redirected to the subparser given by @parser. @user_data is used as the user_data for that parser. @user_data is also passed to the error callback in the event that an error occurs. This includes errors that occur in subparsers of the subparser.
The end tag matching the start tag for which this call was made is handled by the previous parser (which is given its own user_data) which is why gtk_buildable_parse_context_pop() is provided to allow "one last access" to the @user_data provided to this function. In the case of error, the @user_data provided here is passed directly to the error callback of the subparser and gtk_buildable_parse_context_pop() should not be called. In either case, if @user_data was allocated then it ought to be freed from both of these locations.
This function is not intended to be directly called by users interested in invoking subparsers. Instead, it is intended to be used by the subparsers themselves to implement a higher-level interface.
For an example of how to use this, see g_markup_parse_context_push() which has the same kind of API.

parameter.name: user_data
parameter.parameter_description: user data to pass to #GtkBuildableParser functions

function.name: gtk_builder_add_from_file
function.description:
Parses a file containing a [GtkBuilder UI definition][BUILDER-UI] and merges it with the current contents of @builder.
Most users will probably want to use gtk_builder_new_from_file().
If an error occurs, 0 will be returned and @error will be assigned a #GError from the #GTK_BUILDER_ERROR, #G_MARKUP_ERROR or #G_FILE_ERROR domain.
It’s not really reasonable to attempt to handle failures of this call. You should not use this function with untrusted files (ie: files that are not part of your application). Broken #GtkBuilder files can easily crash your program, and it’s possible that memory was leaked leading up to the reported failure. The only reasonable thing to do when an error is detected is to call g_error().

parameter.name: filename
parameter.parameter_description: the name of the file to parse

parameter.name: error
parameter.parameter_description: return location for an error, or %NULL

function.return: %TRUE on success, %FALSE if an error occurred

function.name: gtk_builder_add_from_resource
function.description:
Parses a resource file containing a [GtkBuilder UI definition][BUILDER-UI] and merges it with the current contents of @builder.
Most users will probably want to use gtk_builder_new_from_resource().
If an error occurs, 0 will be returned and @error will be assigned a #GError from the #GTK_BUILDER_ERROR, #G_MARKUP_ERROR or #G_RESOURCE_ERROR domain.
It’s not really reasonable to attempt to handle failures of this call. The only reasonable thing to do when an error is detected is to call g_error().

parameter.name: resource_path
parameter.parameter_description: the path of the resource file to parse

parameter.name: error
parameter.parameter_description: return location for an error, or %NULL

function.return: %TRUE on success, %FALSE if an error occurred

function.name: gtk_builder_add_from_string
function.description:
Parses a string containing a [GtkBuilder UI definition][BUILDER-UI] and merges it with the current contents of @builder.
Most users will probably want to use gtk_builder_new_from_string().
Upon errors %FALSE will be returned and @error will be assigned a #GError from the #GTK_BUILDER_ERROR, #G_MARKUP_ERROR or #G_VARIANT_PARSE_ERROR domain.
It’s not really reasonable to attempt to handle failures of this call. The only reasonable thing to do when an error is detected is to call g_error().

parameter.name: length
parameter.parameter_description: the length of @buffer (may be -1 if @buffer is nul-terminated)

parameter.name: error
parameter.parameter_description: return location for an error, or %NULL

function.return: %TRUE on success, %FALSE if an error occurred

function.name: gtk_builder_add_objects_from_file
function.description:
Parses a file containing a [GtkBuilder UI definition][BUILDER-UI] building only the requested objects and merges them with the current contents of @builder.
Upon errors 0 will be returned and @error will be assigned a #GError from the #GTK_BUILDER_ERROR, #G_MARKUP_ERROR or #G_FILE_ERROR domain.
If you are adding an object that depends on an object that is not its child (for instance a #GtkTreeView that depends on its #GtkTreeModel), you have to explicitly list all of them in @object_ids.

parameter.name: filename
parameter.parameter_description: the name of the file to parse

parameter.name: object_ids
parameter.parameter_description: nul-terminated array of objects to build

parameter.name: error
parameter.parameter_description: return location for an error, or %NULL

function.return: %TRUE on success, %FALSE if an error occurred

function.name: gtk_builder_add_objects_from_resource
function.description:
Parses a resource file containing a [GtkBuilder UI definition][BUILDER-UI] building only the requested objects and merges them with the current contents of @builder.
Upon errors 0 will be returned and @error will be assigned a #GError from the #GTK_BUILDER_ERROR, #G_MARKUP_ERROR or #G_RESOURCE_ERROR domain.
If you are adding an object that depends on an object that is not its child (for instance a #GtkTreeView that depends on its #GtkTreeModel), you have to explicitly list all of them in @object_ids.

parameter.name: resource_path
parameter.parameter_description: the path of the resource file to parse

parameter.name: object_ids
parameter.parameter_description: nul-terminated array of objects to build

parameter.name: error
parameter.parameter_description: return location for an error, or %NULL

function.return: %TRUE on success, %FALSE if an error occurred

function.name: gtk_builder_add_objects_from_string
function.description:
Parses a string containing a [GtkBuilder UI definition][BUILDER-UI] building only the requested objects and merges them with the current contents of @builder.
Upon errors %FALSE will be returned and @error will be assigned a #GError from the #GTK_BUILDER_ERROR or #G_MARKUP_ERROR domain.
If you are adding an object that depends on an object that is not its child (for instance a #GtkTreeView that depends on its #GtkTreeModel), you have to explicitly list all of them in @object_ids.

parameter.name: length
parameter.parameter_description: the length of @buffer (may be -1 if @buffer is nul-terminated)

parameter.name: object_ids
parameter.parameter_description: nul-terminated array of objects to build

parameter.name: error
parameter.parameter_description: return location for an error, or %NULL

function.return: %TRUE on success, %FALSE if an error occurred

function.name: gtk_builder_create_closure
function.description:
Creates a closure to invoke the function called @function_name, by using the create_closure() implementation of @builder's #GtkBuilderScope.
If no closure could be created, %NULL will be returned and @error will be set.

parameter.name: function_name
parameter.parameter_description: name of the function to look up

parameter.name: object
parameter.parameter_description: Object to create the closure with

parameter.name: error
parameter.parameter_description: return location for an error, or %NULL

function.name: gtk_builder_cscope_add_callback_symbol
function.description:
Adds the @callback_symbol to the scope of @builder under the given @callback_name.
Using this function overrides the behavior of gtk_builder_create_closure() for any callback symbols that are added. Using this method allows for better encapsulation as it does not require that callback symbols be declared in the global namespace.

parameter.name: callback_name
parameter.parameter_description: The name of the callback, as expected in the XML

function.name: gtk_builder_cscope_add_callback_symbols
function.description: A convenience function to add many callbacks instead of calling gtk_builder_cscope_add_callback_symbol() for each symbol.

parameter.name: first_callback_name
parameter.parameter_description: The name of the callback, as expected in the XML

parameter.name: Varargs
parameter.parameter_description: A list of callback name and callback symbol pairs terminated with %NULL

function.name: gtk_builder_cscope_lookup_callback_symbol
function.description: Fetches a symbol previously added to @self with gtk_builder_cscope_add_callback_symbol().
function.return: The callback symbol in @builder for @callback_name, or %NULL

function.name: gtk_builder_cscope_new
function.description:
Creates a new #GtkBuilderCScope object to use with future #GtkBuilder instances.
Calling this function is only necessary if you want to add custom callbacks via gtk_builder_cscope_add_callback_symbol().

function.name: gtk_builder_expose_object
function.description: Add @object to the @builder object pool so it can be referenced just like any other object built by builder.

parameter.name: name
parameter.parameter_description: the name of the object exposed to the builder

function.name: gtk_builder_extend_with_template
function.description:
Main private entry point for building composite container components from template XML.
This is exported purely to let gtk-builder-tool validate templates, applications have no need to call this function.

parameter.name: object
parameter.parameter_description: the object that is being extended

parameter.name: template_type
parameter.parameter_description: the type that the template is for

parameter.name: length
parameter.parameter_description: the length of @buffer (may be -1 if @buffer is nul-terminated)

parameter.name: error
parameter.parameter_description: return location for an error, or %NULL

function.return: A positive value on success, 0 if an error occurred

function.name: gtk_builder_get_current_object
function.description: Gets the current object set via gtk_builder_set_current_object().

function.name: gtk_builder_get_object
function.description: Gets the object named @name. Note that this function does not increment the reference count of the returned object.
function.return: the object named @name or %NULL if it could not be found in the object tree.

function.name: gtk_builder_get_objects
function.description: Gets all objects that have been constructed by @builder. Note that this function does not increment the reference counts of the returned objects.
function.return: a newly-allocated #GSList containing all the objects constructed by the #GtkBuilder instance. It should be freed by g_slist_free()

function.name: gtk_builder_get_scope
function.description:
Gets the scope in use that was set via gtk_builder_set_scope().
See the #GtkBuilderScope documentation for details.

function.name: gtk_builder_get_translation_domain
function.description: Gets the translation domain of @builder.
function.return: the translation domain or %NULL in case it was never set or explicitly unset via gtk_builder_set_translation_domain(). This string is owned by the builder object and must not be modified or freed.

function.name: gtk_builder_get_type_from_name
function.description: Looks up a type by name, using the virtual function that #GtkBuilder has for that purpose. This is mainly used when implementing the #GtkBuildable interface on a type.
function.return: the #GType found for @type_name or #G_TYPE_INVALID if no type was found

function.name: gtk_builder_list_item_factory_get_bytes
function.description: Gets the data used as the #GtkBuilder UI template for constructing listitems.

function.name: gtk_builder_list_item_factory_get_resource
function.description: If the data references a resource, gets the path of that resource.
function.return: The path to the resource or %NULL if none

function.name: gtk_builder_list_item_factory_get_scope
function.description: Gets the scope used when constructing listitems.
function.return: The scope used when constructing listitems

function.name: gtk_builder_list_item_factory_new_from_bytes
function.description: Creates s new #GtkBuilderListItemFactory that instantiates widgets using @bytes as the data to pass to #GtkBuilder.

parameter.name: scope
parameter.parameter_description: A scope to use when instantiating

parameter.name: bytes
parameter.parameter_description: the bytes containing the ui file to instantiate

function.name: gtk_builder_list_item_factory_new_from_resource
function.description: Creates s new #GtkBuilderListItemFactory that instantiates widgets using data read from the given @resource_path to pass to #GtkBuilder.

parameter.name: scope
parameter.parameter_description: A scope to use when instantiating

parameter.name: resource_path
parameter.parameter_description: valid path to a resource that contains the data

function.name: gtk_builder_new
function.description:
Creates a new empty builder object.
This function is only useful if you intend to make multiple calls to gtk_builder_add_from_file(), gtk_builder_add_from_resource() or gtk_builder_add_from_string() in order to merge multiple UI descriptions into a single builder.
Most users will probably want to use gtk_builder_new_from_file(), gtk_builder_new_from_resource() or gtk_builder_new_from_string().

function.name: gtk_builder_new_from_file
function.description:
Builds the [GtkBuilder UI definition][BUILDER-UI] in the file @filename.
If there is an error opening the file or parsing the description then the program will be aborted. You should only ever attempt to parse user interface descriptions that are shipped as part of your program.

parameter.name: filename
parameter.parameter_description: filename of user interface description file

function.name: gtk_builder_new_from_resource
function.description:
Builds the [GtkBuilder UI definition][BUILDER-UI] at @resource_path.
If there is an error locating the resource or parsing the description, then the program will be aborted.

function.name: gtk_builder_new_from_string
function.description:
Builds the user interface described by @string (in the [GtkBuilder UI definition][BUILDER-UI] format).
If @string is %NULL-terminated, then @length should be -1. If @length is not -1, then it is the length of @string.
If there is an error parsing @string then the program will be aborted. You should not attempt to parse user interface description from untrusted sources.
function.return: a #GtkBuilder containing the interface described by @string

function.name: gtk_builder_set_current_object
function.description:
Sets the current object for the @builder. The current object can be thought of as the `this` object that the builder is working for and will often be used as the default object when an object is optional.
gtk_widget_init_template() for example will set the current object to the widget the template is inited for. For functions like gtk_builder_new_from_resource(), the current object will be %NULL.

parameter.name: current_object
parameter.parameter_description: the new current object or %NULL for none

function.name: gtk_builder_set_scope
function.description:
Sets the scope the builder should operate in.
If @scope is %NULL a new #GtkBuilderCScope will be created.
See the #GtkBuilderScope documentation for details.

parameter.name: scope
parameter.parameter_description: the scope to use or %NULL for the default

function.name: gtk_builder_set_translation_domain
function.description: Sets the translation domain of @builder. See #GtkBuilder:translation-domain.

function.name: gtk_builder_value_from_string
function.description:
This function demarshals a value from a string. This function calls g_value_init() on the @value argument, so it need not be initialised beforehand.
This function can handle char, uchar, boolean, int, uint, long, ulong, enum, flags, float, double, string, #GdkRGBA and #GtkAdjustment type values. Support for #GtkWidget type values is still to come.
Upon errors %FALSE will be returned and @error will be assigned a #GError from the #GTK_BUILDER_ERROR domain.

parameter.name: string
parameter.parameter_description: the string representation of the value

parameter.name: value
parameter.parameter_description: the #GValue to store the result in

parameter.name: error
parameter.parameter_description: return location for an error, or %NULL

function.name: gtk_builder_value_from_string_type
function.description:
Like gtk_builder_value_from_string(), this function demarshals a value from a string, but takes a #GType instead of #GParamSpec. This function calls g_value_init() on the @value argument, so it need not be initialised beforehand.
Upon errors %FALSE will be returned and @error will be assigned a #GError from the #GTK_BUILDER_ERROR domain.

parameter.name: string
parameter.parameter_description: the string representation of the value

parameter.name: value
parameter.parameter_description: the #GValue to store the result in

parameter.name: error
parameter.parameter_description: return location for an error, or %NULL

function.name: gtk_button_get_child
function.description: Gets the child widget of @button.

function.name: gtk_button_get_has_frame
function.description: Returns whether the button has a frame.
function.return: %TRUE if the button has a frame

function.name: gtk_button_get_icon_name
function.description: Returns the icon name set via gtk_button_set_icon_name().
function.return: The icon name set via gtk_button_set_icon_name()

function.name: gtk_button_get_label
function.description: Fetches the text from the label of the button, as set by gtk_button_set_label(). If the label text has not been set the return value will be %NULL. This will be the case if you create an empty button with gtk_button_new() to use as a container.
function.return: The text of the label widget. This string is owned by the widget and must not be modified or freed.

function.name: gtk_button_get_use_underline
function.description: Returns whether an embedded underline in the button label indicates a mnemonic. See gtk_button_set_use_underline().
function.return: %TRUE if an embedded underline in the button label indicates the mnemonic accelerator keys.

function.name: gtk_button_new
function.description: Creates a new #GtkButton widget. To add a child widget to the button, use gtk_button_set_child().

function.name: gtk_button_new_from_icon_name
function.description:
Creates a new button containing an icon from the current icon theme.
If the icon name isn’t known, a “broken image” icon will be displayed instead. If the current icon theme is changed, the icon will be updated appropriately.
function.return: a new #GtkButton displaying the themed icon

function.name: gtk_button_new_with_label
function.description: Creates a #GtkButton widget with a #GtkLabel child containing the given text.

parameter.name: label
parameter.parameter_description: The text you want the #GtkLabel to hold.

function.name: gtk_button_new_with_mnemonic
function.description: Creates a new #GtkButton containing a label. If characters in @label are preceded by an underscore, they are underlined. If you need a literal underscore character in a label, use “__” (two underscores). The first underlined character represents a keyboard accelerator called a mnemonic. Pressing Alt and that key activates the button.

parameter.name: label
parameter.parameter_description: The text of the button, with an underscore in front of the mnemonic character

function.name: gtk_button_set_child
function.description: Sets the child widget of @button.

function.name: gtk_button_set_has_frame
function.description: Sets the style of the button. Buttons can has a flat appearance or have a frame drawn around them.

parameter.name: has_frame
parameter.parameter_description: whether the button should have a visible frame

function.name: gtk_button_set_icon_name
function.description: Adds a #GtkImage with the given icon name as a child. If @button already contains a child widget, that child widget will be removed and replaced with the image.

function.name: gtk_button_set_label
function.description:
Sets the text of the label of the button to @label.
This will also clear any previously set labels.

function.name: gtk_button_set_use_underline
function.description: If true, an underline in the text of the button label indicates the next character should be used for the mnemonic accelerator key.

parameter.name: use_underline
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE if underlines in the text indicate mnemonics

function.name: gtk_cell_area_activate

parameter.name: cell_area
parameter.parameter_description: the size and location of @area relative to @widget’s allocation

parameter.parameter_description: return location for the first cell property, followed optionally by more name/return location pairs, followed by %NULL

function.name: gtk_cell_area_cell_get_property
function.description: Gets the value of a cell property for @renderer in @area.

parameter.name: property_name
parameter.parameter_description: the name of the property to get

parameter.name: value
parameter.parameter_description: a location to return the value

function.name: gtk_cell_area_cell_get_valist
function.description: Gets the values of one or more cell properties for @renderer in @area.

parameter.name: first_property_name
parameter.parameter_description: the name of the first property to get

parameter.name: var_args
parameter.parameter_description: return location for the first property, followed optionally by more name/return location pairs, followed by %NULL

function.name: gtk_cell_area_cell_set
function.description: Sets one or more cell properties for @cell in @area.

parameter.name: renderer
parameter.parameter_description: a #GtkCellRenderer which is a cell inside @area

parameter.name: first_prop_name
parameter.parameter_description: the name of the first cell property to set

parameter.name: Varargs
parameter.parameter_description: a %NULL-terminated list of property names and values, starting with @first_prop_name

function.name: gtk_cell_area_cell_set_property
function.description: Sets a cell property for @renderer in @area.

parameter.name: property_name
parameter.parameter_description: the name of the cell property to set

parameter.name: value
parameter.parameter_description: the value to set the cell property to

function.name: gtk_cell_area_cell_set_valist
function.description: Sets one or more cell properties for @renderer in @area.

parameter.name: first_property_name
parameter.parameter_description: the name of the first cell property to set

parameter.name: var_args
parameter.parameter_description: a %NULL-terminated list of property names and values, starting with @first_prop_name

function.name: gtk_cell_area_class_find_cell_property
function.description: Finds a cell property of a cell area class by name.

parameter.name: property_name
parameter.parameter_description: the name of the child property to find

function.return: the #GParamSpec of the child property or %NULL if @aclass has no child property with that name.

function.name: gtk_cell_area_class_install_cell_property
function.description: Installs a cell property on a cell area class.

function.name: gtk_cell_area_class_list_cell_properties
function.description: Returns all cell properties of a cell area class.

parameter.name: n_properties
parameter.parameter_description: location to return the number of cell properties found

function.return: a newly allocated %NULL-terminated array of #GParamSpec*. The array must be freed with g_free().

function.name: gtk_cell_area_context_allocate
function.description:
Allocates a width and/or a height for all rows which are to be rendered with @context.
Usually allocation is performed only horizontally or sometimes vertically since a group of rows are usually rendered side by side vertically or horizontally and share either the same width or the same height. Sometimes they are allocated in both horizontal and vertical orientations producing a homogeneous effect of the rows. This is generally the case for #GtkTreeView when #GtkTreeView:fixed-height-mode is enabled.

parameter.name: width
parameter.parameter_description: the allocated width for all #GtkTreeModel rows rendered with @context, or -1.

parameter.name: height
parameter.parameter_description: the allocated height for all #GtkTreeModel rows rendered with @context, or -1.

function.name: gtk_cell_area_context_get_allocation
function.description:
Fetches the current allocation size for @context.
If the context was not allocated in width or height, or if the context was recently reset with gtk_cell_area_context_reset(), the returned value will be -1.

parameter.name: width
parameter.parameter_description: location to store the allocated width, or %NULL

parameter.name: height
parameter.parameter_description: location to store the allocated height, or %NULL

function.name: gtk_cell_area_context_get_area
function.description:
Fetches the #GtkCellArea this @context was created by.
This is generally unneeded by layouting widgets; however, it is important for the context implementation itself to fetch information about the area it is being used for.
For instance at #GtkCellAreaContextClass.allocate() time it’s important to know details about any cell spacing that the #GtkCellArea is configured with in order to compute a proper allocation.
function.return: the #GtkCellArea this context was created by.

function.name: gtk_cell_area_context_get_preferred_height
function.description:
Gets the accumulative preferred height for all rows which have been requested with this context.
After gtk_cell_area_context_reset() is called and/or before ever requesting the size of a #GtkCellArea, the returned values are 0.

parameter.name: minimum_height
parameter.parameter_description: location to store the minimum height, or %NULL

parameter.name: natural_height
parameter.parameter_description: location to store the natural height, or %NULL

function.name: gtk_cell_area_context_get_preferred_height_for_width
function.description:
Gets the accumulative preferred height for @width for all rows which have been requested for the same said @width with this context.
After gtk_cell_area_context_reset() is called and/or before ever requesting the size of a #GtkCellArea, the returned values are -1.

parameter.name: minimum_height
parameter.parameter_description: location to store the minimum height, or %NULL

parameter.name: natural_height
parameter.parameter_description: location to store the natural height, or %NULL

function.name: gtk_cell_area_context_get_preferred_width
function.description:
Gets the accumulative preferred width for all rows which have been requested with this context.
After gtk_cell_area_context_reset() is called and/or before ever requesting the size of a #GtkCellArea, the returned values are 0.

parameter.name: minimum_width
parameter.parameter_description: location to store the minimum width, or %NULL

parameter.name: natural_width
parameter.parameter_description: location to store the natural width, or %NULL

function.name: gtk_cell_area_context_get_preferred_width_for_height
function.description:
Gets the accumulative preferred width for @height for all rows which have been requested for the same said @height with this context.
After gtk_cell_area_context_reset() is called and/or before ever requesting the size of a #GtkCellArea, the returned values are -1.

parameter.name: minimum_width
parameter.parameter_description: location to store the minimum width, or %NULL

parameter.name: natural_width
parameter.parameter_description: location to store the natural width, or %NULL

function.name: gtk_cell_area_context_push_preferred_height
function.description:
Causes the minimum and/or natural height to grow if the new proposed sizes exceed the current minimum and natural height.
This is used by #GtkCellAreaContext implementations during the request process over a series of #GtkTreeModel rows to progressively push the requested height over a series of gtk_cell_area_get_preferred_height() requests.

parameter.name: minimum_height
parameter.parameter_description: the proposed new minimum height for @context

parameter.name: natural_height
parameter.parameter_description: the proposed new natural height for @context

function.name: gtk_cell_area_context_push_preferred_width
function.description:
Causes the minimum and/or natural width to grow if the new proposed sizes exceed the current minimum and natural width.
This is used by #GtkCellAreaContext implementations during the request process over a series of #GtkTreeModel rows to progressively push the requested width over a series of gtk_cell_area_get_preferred_width() requests.

parameter.name: minimum_width
parameter.parameter_description: the proposed new minimum width for @context

parameter.name: natural_width
parameter.parameter_description: the proposed new natural width for @context

function.name: gtk_cell_area_context_reset
function.description:
Resets any previously cached request and allocation data.
When underlying #GtkTreeModel data changes its important to reset the context if the content size is allowed to shrink. If the content size is only allowed to grow (this is usually an option for views rendering large data stores as a measure of optimization), then only the row that changed or was inserted needs to be (re)requested with gtk_cell_area_get_preferred_width().
When the new overall size of the context requires that the allocated size changes (or whenever this allocation changes at all), the variable row sizes need to be re-requested for every row.
For instance, if the rows are displayed all with the same width from top to bottom then a change in the allocated width necessitates a recalculation of all the displayed row heights using gtk_cell_area_get_preferred_height_for_width().

function.name: gtk_cell_area_copy_context
function.description:
This is sometimes needed for cases where rows need to share alignments in one orientation but may be separately grouped in the opposing orientation.
For instance, #GtkIconView creates all icons (rows) to have the same width and the cells theirin to have the same horizontal alignments. However each row of icons may have a separate collective height. #GtkIconView uses this to request the heights of each row based on a context which was already used to request all the row widths that are to be displayed.

function.name: gtk_cell_area_create_context
function.description: Creates a #GtkCellAreaContext to be used with @area for all purposes. #GtkCellAreaContext stores geometry information for rows for which it was operated on, it is important to use the same context for the same row of data at all times (i.e. one should render and handle events with the same #GtkCellAreaContext which was used to request the size of those rows of data).
function.return: a newly created #GtkCellAreaContext which can be used with @area.

function.name: gtk_cell_area_event
function.description: Delegates event handling to a #GtkCellArea.

parameter.name: context
parameter.parameter_description: the #GtkCellAreaContext for this row of data.

function.return: %TRUE if the event was handled by @area.

function.name: gtk_cell_area_focus
function.description:
This should be called by the @area’s owning layout widget when focus is to be passed to @area, or moved within @area for a given @direction and row data.
Implementing #GtkCellArea classes should implement this method to receive and navigate focus in its own way particular to how it lays out cells.
function.return: %TRUE if focus remains inside @area as a result of this call.

function.name: gtk_cell_area_foreach
function.description: Calls @callback for every #GtkCellRenderer in @area.

function.name: gtk_cell_area_foreach_alloc
function.description: Calls @callback for every #GtkCellRenderer in @area with the allocated rectangle inside @cell_area.

parameter.name: context
parameter.parameter_description: the #GtkCellAreaContext for this row of data.

parameter.name: cell_area
parameter.parameter_description: the @widget relative coordinates and size for @area

parameter.name: background_area
parameter.parameter_description: the @widget relative coordinates of the background area

function.name: gtk_cell_area_get_cell_allocation
function.description: Derives the allocation of @renderer inside @area if @area were to be renderered in @cell_area.

parameter.name: context
parameter.parameter_description: the #GtkCellAreaContext used to hold sizes for @area.

parameter.name: renderer
parameter.parameter_description: the #GtkCellRenderer to get the allocation for

parameter.name: cell_area
parameter.parameter_description: the whole allocated area for @area in @widget for this row

parameter.name: allocation
parameter.parameter_description: where to store the allocation for @renderer

function.name: gtk_cell_area_get_cell_at_position
function.description: Gets the #GtkCellRenderer at @x and @y coordinates inside @area and optionally returns the full cell allocation for it inside @cell_area.

parameter.name: context
parameter.parameter_description: the #GtkCellAreaContext used to hold sizes for @area.

parameter.name: cell_area
parameter.parameter_description: the whole allocated area for @area in @widget for this row

parameter.name: alloc_area
parameter.parameter_description: where to store the inner allocated area of the returned cell renderer, or %NULL.

function.name: gtk_cell_area_get_current_path_string
function.description: Gets the current #GtkTreePath string for the currently applied #GtkTreeIter, this is implicitly updated when gtk_cell_area_apply_attributes() is called and can be used to interact with renderers from #GtkCellArea subclasses.
function.return: The current #GtkTreePath string for the current attributes applied to @area. This string belongs to the area and should not be freed.

function.name: gtk_cell_area_get_edit_widget
function.description: Gets the #GtkCellEditable widget currently used to edit the currently edited cell.

function.name: gtk_cell_area_get_edited_cell
function.description: Gets the #GtkCellRenderer in @area that is currently being edited.

function.name: gtk_cell_area_get_focus_cell
function.description: Retrieves the currently focused cell for @area

function.name: gtk_cell_area_get_focus_from_sibling
function.description:
Gets the #GtkCellRenderer which is expected to be focusable for which @renderer is, or may be a sibling.
This is handy for #GtkCellArea subclasses when handling events, after determining the renderer at the event location it can then chose to activate the focus cell for which the event cell may have been a sibling.
function.return: the #GtkCellRenderer for which @renderer is a sibling, or %NULL.

function.name: gtk_cell_area_get_focus_siblings
function.description: Gets the focus sibling cell renderers for @renderer.
function.return: A #GList of #GtkCellRenderers. The returned list is internal and should not be freed.

function.name: gtk_cell_area_get_preferred_height

parameter.name: context
parameter.parameter_description: the #GtkCellAreaContext to perform this request with

parameter.name: minimum_height
parameter.parameter_description: location to store the minimum height, or %NULL

parameter.name: natural_height
parameter.parameter_description: location to store the natural height, or %NULL

function.name: gtk_cell_area_get_preferred_height_for_width

parameter.name: context
parameter.parameter_description: the #GtkCellAreaContext which has already been requested for widths.

parameter.name: width
parameter.parameter_description: the width for which to check the height of this area

parameter.name: minimum_height
parameter.parameter_description: location to store the minimum height, or %NULL

parameter.name: natural_height
parameter.parameter_description: location to store the natural height, or %NULL

function.name: gtk_cell_area_get_preferred_width

parameter.name: context
parameter.parameter_description: the #GtkCellAreaContext to perform this request with

parameter.name: minimum_width
parameter.parameter_description: location to store the minimum width, or %NULL

parameter.name: natural_width
parameter.parameter_description: location to store the natural width, or %NULL

function.name: gtk_cell_area_get_preferred_width_for_height

parameter.name: context
parameter.parameter_description: the #GtkCellAreaContext which has already been requested for widths.

parameter.name: height
parameter.parameter_description: the height for which to check the width of this area

parameter.name: minimum_width
parameter.parameter_description: location to store the minimum width, or %NULL

parameter.name: natural_width
parameter.parameter_description: location to store the natural width, or %NULL

function.name: gtk_cell_area_get_request_mode
function.description: Gets whether the area prefers a height-for-width layout or a width-for-height layout.

function.name: gtk_cell_area_has_renderer
function.description: Checks if @area contains @renderer.

function.name: gtk_cell_area_inner_cell_area
function.description: This is a convenience function for #GtkCellArea implementations to get the inner area where a given #GtkCellRenderer will be rendered. It removes any padding previously added by gtk_cell_area_request_renderer().

parameter.name: cell_area
parameter.parameter_description: the @widget relative coordinates where one of @area’s cells is to be placed

parameter.name: inner_area
parameter.parameter_description: the return location for the inner cell area

function.name: gtk_cell_area_is_activatable
function.description: Returns whether the area can do anything when activated, after applying new attributes to @area.
function.return: whether @area can do anything when activated.

function.name: gtk_cell_area_is_focus_sibling
function.description: Returns whether @sibling is one of @renderer’s focus siblings (see gtk_cell_area_add_focus_sibling()).

parameter.name: sibling
parameter.parameter_description: the #GtkCellRenderer to check against @renderer’s sibling list

function.return: %TRUE if @sibling is a focus sibling of @renderer

function.name: gtk_cell_area_remove
function.description: Removes @renderer from @area.

function.name: gtk_cell_area_remove_focus_sibling
function.description: Removes @sibling from @renderer’s focus sibling list (see gtk_cell_area_add_focus_sibling()).

parameter.name: sibling
parameter.parameter_description: the #GtkCellRenderer to remove from @renderer’s focus area

function.name: gtk_cell_area_request_renderer
function.description: This is a convenience function for #GtkCellArea implementations to request size for cell renderers. It’s important to use this function to request size and then use gtk_cell_area_inner_cell_area() at render and event time since this function will add padding around the cell for focus painting.

parameter.name: orientation
parameter.parameter_description: the #GtkOrientation in which to request size

parameter.name: for_size
parameter.parameter_description: the allocation contextual size to request for, or -1 if the base request for the orientation is to be returned.

parameter.name: minimum_size
parameter.parameter_description: location to store the minimum size, or %NULL

parameter.name: natural_size
parameter.parameter_description: location to store the natural size, or %NULL

function.name: gtk_cell_area_set_focus_cell
function.description:
Explicitly sets the currently focused cell to @renderer.
This is generally called by implementations of #GtkCellAreaClass.focus() or #GtkCellAreaClass.event(), however it can also be used to implement functions such as gtk_tree_view_set_cursor_on_cell().

function.name: gtk_cell_area_snapshot
function.description: Snapshots @area’s cells according to @area’s layout onto at the given coordinates.

parameter.name: context
parameter.parameter_description: the #GtkCellAreaContext for this row of data.

parameter.name: paint_focus
parameter.parameter_description: whether @area should paint focus on focused cells for focused rows or not.

function.name: gtk_cell_area_stop_editing
function.description:
Explicitly stops the editing of the currently edited cell.
If @canceled is %TRUE, the currently edited cell renderer will emit the ::editing-canceled signal, otherwise the the ::editing-done signal will be emitted on the current edit widget.
See gtk_cell_area_get_edited_cell() and gtk_cell_area_get_edit_widget().

function.name: gtk_cell_editable_editing_done
function.description: Emits the #GtkCellEditable::editing-done signal.

function.name: gtk_cell_editable_remove_widget
function.description: Emits the #GtkCellEditable::remove-widget signal.

function.name: gtk_cell_editable_start_editing
function.description:
Begins editing on a @cell_editable.
The #GtkCellRenderer for the cell creates and returns a #GtkCellEditable from gtk_cell_renderer_start_editing(), configured for the #GtkCellRenderer type.
gtk_cell_editable_start_editing() can then set up @cell_editable suitably for editing a cell, e.g. making the Esc key emit #GtkCellEditable::editing-done.
Note that the @cell_editable is created on-demand for the current edit; its lifetime is temporary and does not persist across other edits and/or cells.

parameter.name: event
parameter.parameter_description: The #GdkEvent that began the editing process, or %NULL if editing was initiated programmatically

function.name: gtk_cell_layout_add_attribute
function.description:
Adds an attribute mapping to the list in @cell_layout.
The @column is the column of the model to get a value from, and the @attribute is the parameter on @cell to be set from the value. So for example if column 2 of the model contains strings, you could have the “text” attribute of a #GtkCellRendererText get its values from column 2.

parameter.name: column
parameter.parameter_description: the column position on the model to get the attribute from

function.name: gtk_cell_layout_clear
function.description: Unsets all the mappings on all renderers on @cell_layout and removes all renderers from @cell_layout.

function.name: gtk_cell_layout_clear_attributes
function.description: Clears all existing attributes previously set with gtk_cell_layout_set_attributes().

parameter.name: cell
parameter.parameter_description: a #GtkCellRenderer to clear the attribute mapping on

function.name: gtk_cell_layout_get_area
function.description: Returns the underlying #GtkCellArea which might be @cell_layout if called on a #GtkCellArea or might be %NULL if no #GtkCellArea is used by @cell_layout.
function.return: the cell area used by @cell_layout, or %NULL in case no cell area is used.

function.name: gtk_cell_layout_get_cells
function.description: Returns the cell renderers which have been added to @cell_layout.
function.return: a list of cell renderers. The list, but not the renderers has been newly allocated and should be freed with g_list_free() when no longer needed.

function.name: gtk_cell_layout_pack_end
function.description:
Adds the @cell to the end of @cell_layout. If @expand is %FALSE, then the @cell is allocated no more space than it needs. Any unused space is divided evenly between cells for which @expand is %TRUE.
Note that reusing the same cell renderer is not supported.

parameter.name: expand
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE if @cell is to be given extra space allocated to @cell_layout

function.name: gtk_cell_layout_pack_start
function.description:
Packs the @cell into the beginning of @cell_layout. If @expand is %FALSE, then the @cell is allocated no more space than it needs. Any unused space is divided evenly between cells for which @expand is %TRUE.
Note that reusing the same cell renderer is not supported.

parameter.name: expand
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE if @cell is to be given extra space allocated to @cell_layout

function.name: gtk_cell_layout_reorder
function.description:
Re-inserts @cell at @position.
Note that @cell has already to be packed into @cell_layout for this to function properly.

function.name: gtk_cell_layout_set_attributes
function.description:
Sets the attributes in list as the attributes of @cell_layout.
The attributes should be in attribute/column order, as in gtk_cell_layout_add_attribute(). All existing attributes are removed, and replaced with the new attributes.

function.name: gtk_cell_layout_set_cell_data_func
gtk_cell_renderer_accel_new
function.description: Creates a new #GtkCellRendererAccel.

function.name: gtk_cell_renderer_activate
function.description: Passes an activate event to the cell renderer for possible processing. Some cell renderers may use events; for example, #GtkCellRendererToggle toggles when it gets a mouse click.

parameter.name: path
parameter.parameter_description: widget-dependent string representation of the event location; e.g. for #GtkTreeView, a string representation of #GtkTreePath

parameter.name: background_area
parameter.parameter_description: background area as passed to gtk_cell_renderer_render()

parameter.name: cell_area
parameter.parameter_description: cell area as passed to gtk_cell_renderer_render()

function.name: gtk_cell_renderer_combo_new
function.description: Creates a new #GtkCellRendererCombo. Adjust how text is drawn using object properties. Object properties can be set globally (with g_object_set()). Also, with #GtkTreeViewColumn, you can bind a property to a value in a #GtkTreeModel. For example, you can bind the “text” property on the cell renderer to a string value in the model, thus rendering a different string in each row of the #GtkTreeView.

function.name: gtk_cell_renderer_get_aligned_area

parameter.name: height
parameter.parameter_description: the size which is available for allocation

parameter.name: minimum_width
parameter.parameter_description: location for storing the minimum size, or %NULL

parameter.name: natural_width

function.name: gtk_cell_renderer_get_request_mode
function.description: Gets whether the cell renderer prefers a height-for-width layout or a width-for-height layout.

function.name: gtk_cell_renderer_is_activatable

function.name: gtk_cell_renderer_pixbuf_new

Informs the cell renderer that the editing is stopped. If @canceled is %TRUE, the cell renderer will emit the #GtkCellRenderer::editing-canceled signal.

function.name: gtk_cell_renderer_text_new
function.description: Creates a new #GtkCellRendererText. Adjust how text is drawn using object properties. Object properties can be set globally (with g_object_set()). Also, with #GtkTreeViewColumn, you can bind a property to a value in a #GtkTreeModel. For example, you can bind the “text” property on the cell renderer to a string value in the model, thus rendering a different string in each row of the #GtkTreeView

function.name: gtk_cell_renderer_text_set_fixed_height_from_font
function.description: Sets the height of a renderer to explicitly be determined by the “font” and “y_pad” property set on it. Further changes in these properties do not affect the height, so they must be accompanied by a subsequent call to this function. Using this function is inflexible, and should really only be used if calculating the size of a cell is too slow (ie, a massive number of cells displayed). If @number_of_rows is -1, then the fixed height is unset, and the height is determined by the properties again.

parameter.name: number_of_rows
parameter.parameter_description: Number of rows of text each cell renderer is allocated, or -1

function.name: gtk_cell_renderer_toggle_new
function.description: Creates a new #GtkCellRendererToggle. Adjust rendering parameters using object properties. Object properties can be set globally (with g_object_set()). Also, with #GtkTreeViewColumn, you can bind a property to a value in a #GtkTreeModel. For example, you can bind the “active” property on the cell renderer to a boolean value in the model, thus causing the check button to reflect the state of the model.

function.name: gtk_cell_renderer_toggle_set_radio
function.description: If @radio is %TRUE, the cell renderer renders a radio toggle (i.e. a toggle in a group of mutually-exclusive toggles). If %FALSE, it renders a check toggle (a standalone boolean option). This can be set globally for the cell renderer, or changed just before rendering each cell in the model (for #GtkTreeView, you set up a per-row setting using #GtkTreeViewColumn to associate model columns with cell renderer properties).

parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE to make the toggle look like a radio button

function.description: Returns the current value of the #GtkCheckButton:active property.
function.return: The value of the #GtkCheckButton:active property. See gtk_check_button_set_active() for details on how to set a new value.

function.description: Returns whether the check button is in an inconsistent state.
function.return: %TRUE if @check_button is currently in an 'in between' state, %FALSE otherwise.

function.name: gtk_check_button_get_label
function.description: Returns the label of the checkbutton.
function.return: The label @self shows next to the indicator. If no label is shown, %NULL will be returned.

function.name: gtk_check_button_get_use_underline
function.description: Returns the current value of the #GtkCheckButton:use-underline property.
function.return: The value of the #GtkCheckButton:use-underline property. See gtk_check_button_set_use_underline() for details on how to set a new value.

function.name: gtk_check_button_new
function.description: Creates a new #GtkCheckButton.

function.name: gtk_check_button_new_with_label
function.description: Creates a new #GtkCheckButton with a #GtkLabel next to it, if @label is non-%NULL.

parameter.name: label
parameter.parameter_description: the text for the check button.

function.name: gtk_check_button_new_with_mnemonic
function.description: Creates a new #GtkCheckButton containing a label. Underscores in @label indicate the mnemonic for the check button.

parameter.name: label
parameter.parameter_description: The text of the button, with an underscore in front of the mnemonic character

function.name: gtk_check_button_set_active
function.description:
Sets the new value of the #GtkCheckButton:active property. See also gtk_check_button_get_active().
Setting #GtkCheckButton:active to %TRUE will add the `:checked:` state to both the checkbutton and the indicator CSS node.

function.name: gtk_check_button_set_group
function.description:
Adds @self to the group of @group. In a group of multiple check buttons, only one button can be active at a time.
Setting the group of a check button also changes the css name of the indicator widget's CSS node to 'radio'.
The behavior of a checkbutton in a group is also commonly known as a 'radio button'.
Note that the same effect can be achieved via the #GtkActionable api, by using the same action with parameter type and state type 's' for all buttons in the group, and giving each button its own target value.

parameter.name: group
parameter.parameter_description: another #GtkCheckButton to form a group with

function.name: gtk_check_button_set_inconsistent
function.description: If the user has selected a range of elements (such as some text or spreadsheet cells) that are affected by a check button, and the current values in that range are inconsistent, you may want to display the toggle in an "in between" state. Normally you would turn off the inconsistent state again if the user checks the check button. This has to be done manually, gtk_check_button_set_inconsistent only affects visual appearance, not the semantics of the button.

function.name: gtk_check_button_set_label
function.description: Sets the text of @self. If #GtkCheckButton:use-underline is %TRUE, the underscore in @label is interpreted as mnemonic indicator, see gtk_check_button_set_use_underline() for details on this behavior.

parameter.name: label
parameter.parameter_description: The text shown next to the indicator, or %NULL to show no text

function.name: gtk_check_button_set_use_underline
function.description:
Sets the new value of the #GtkCheckButton:use-underline property. See also gtk_check_button_get_use_underline().
If @setting is %TRUE, an underscore character in @self's label indicates a mnemonic accelerator key. This behavior is similar to #GtkLabel:use-underline.

function.name: gtk_check_version
function.description:
Checks that the GTK library in use is compatible with the given version. Generally you would pass in the constants %GTK_MAJOR_VERSION, %GTK_MINOR_VERSION, %GTK_MICRO_VERSION as the three arguments to this function; that produces a check that the library in use is compatible with the version of GTK the application or module was compiled against.
Compatibility is defined by two things: first the version of the running library is newer than the version @required_major.required_minor.@required_micro. Second the running library must be binary compatible with the version @required_major.required_minor.@required_micro (same major version.)
This function is primarily for GTK modules; the module can call this function to check that it wasn’t loaded into an incompatible version of GTK. However, such a check isn’t completely reliable, since the module may be linked against an old version of GTK and calling the old version of gtk_check_version(), but still get loaded into an application using a newer version of GTK.
function.return: %NULL if the GTK library is compatible with the given version, or a string describing the version mismatch. The returned string is owned by GTK and should not be modified or freed.

function.description: Gets whether the dialog is modal.

function.name: gtk_color_button_get_title
function.description: Gets the title of the color selection dialog.
function.return: An internal string, do not free the return value

function.name: gtk_color_button_new
function.description:
Creates a new color button.
This returns a widget in the form of a small button containing a swatch representing the current selected color. When the button is clicked, a color-selection dialog will open, allowing the user to select a color. The swatch will be updated to reflect the new color when the user finishes.

function.name: gtk_color_button_new_with_rgba
function.description: Creates a new color button.

parameter.name: rgba
parameter.parameter_description: A #GdkRGBA to set the current color with

function.name: gtk_color_button_set_modal
function.description: Sets whether the dialog should be modal.

function.name: gtk_color_button_set_title
function.description: Sets the title for the color selection dialog.

function.name: gtk_color_chooser_add_palette
function.description:
Adds a palette to the color chooser. If @orientation is horizontal, the colors are grouped in rows, with @colors_per_line colors in each row. If @horizontal is %FALSE, the colors are grouped in columns instead.
The default color palette of #GtkColorChooserWidget has 27 colors, organized in columns of 3 colors. The default gray palette has 9 grays in a single row.
The layout of the color chooser widget works best when the palettes have 9-10 columns.
Calling this function for the first time has the side effect of removing the default color and gray palettes from the color chooser.
If @colors is %NULL, removes all previously added palettes.

parameter.name: orientation
parameter.parameter_description: %GTK_ORIENTATION_HORIZONTAL if the palette should be displayed in rows, %GTK_ORIENTATION_VERTICAL for columns

parameter.name: colors_per_line
parameter.parameter_description: the number of colors to show in each row/column

parameter.name: n_colors
parameter.parameter_description: the total number of elements in @colors

parameter.name: colors
parameter.parameter_description: the colors of the palette, or %NULL

function.description: Creates a new #GtkColorChooserDialog.

Creates a new #GtkColumnViewColumn that uses the given @factory for mapping items to widgets.
You most likely want to call gtk_column_add_column() next.
The function takes ownership of the argument, so you can write code like ``` column = gtk_column_view_column_new (_("Name"), gtk_builder_list_item_factory_new_from_resource ("/name.ui")); ```

This sorter can be made active by clicking on the column header, or by calling gtk_column_view_sort_by_column().
See gtk_column_view_get_sorter() for the necessary steps for setting up customizable sorting for #GtkColumnView.

Sets the sorting of the view.
This function should be used to set up the initial sorting. At runtime, users can change the sorting of a column view by clicking on the list headers.
This call only has an effect if the sorter returned by gtk_column_view_get_sorter() is set on a sort model, and gtk_column_view_column_set_sorter() has been called on @column to associate a sorter with the column.
If @column is %NULL, the view will be unsorted.

function.name: gtk_combo_box_get_active
function.description: Returns the index of the currently active item, or -1 if there’s no active item. If the model is a non-flat treemodel, and the active item is not an immediate child of the root of the tree, this function returns `gtk_tree_path_get_indices (path)[0]`, where `path` is the #GtkTreePath of the active item.
function.return: An integer which is the index of the currently active item, or -1 if there’s no active item.

function.name: gtk_combo_box_get_active_id
function.description:
Returns the ID of the active row of @combo_box. This value is taken from the active row and the column specified by the #GtkComboBox:id-column property of @combo_box (see gtk_combo_box_set_id_column()).
The returned value is an interned string which means that you can compare the pointer by value to other interned strings and that you must not free it.
If the #GtkComboBox:id-column property of @combo_box is not set, or if no row is active, or if the active row has a %NULL ID value, then %NULL is returned.
function.return: the ID of the active row, or %NULL

function.name: gtk_combo_box_get_active_iter
function.description: Sets @iter to point to the currently active item, if any item is active. Otherwise, @iter is left unchanged.

function.name: gtk_combo_box_get_button_sensitivity
function.description: Returns whether the combo box sets the dropdown button sensitive or not when there are no items in the model.
function.return: %GTK_SENSITIVITY_ON if the dropdown button is sensitive when the model is empty, %GTK_SENSITIVITY_OFF if the button is always insensitive or %GTK_SENSITIVITY_AUTO if it is only sensitive as long as the model has one item to be selected.

function.name: gtk_combo_box_get_child
function.description: Gets the child widget of @combo_box.

function.name: gtk_combo_box_get_entry_text_column
function.description: Returns the column which @combo_box is using to get the strings from to display in the internal entry.
function.return: A column in the data source model of @combo_box.

function.name: gtk_combo_box_get_has_entry
function.description: Returns whether the combo box has an entry.
function.return: whether there is an entry in @combo_box.

function.name: gtk_combo_box_get_id_column
function.description: Returns the column which @combo_box is using to get string IDs for values from.
function.return: A column in the data source model of @combo_box.

function.name: gtk_combo_box_get_model
function.description: Returns the #GtkTreeModel which is acting as data source for @combo_box.
function.return: A #GtkTreeModel which was passed during construction.

function.name: gtk_combo_box_get_popup_fixed_width
function.description: Gets whether the popup uses a fixed width matching the allocated width of the combo box.
function.return: %TRUE if the popup uses a fixed width

function.name: gtk_combo_box_get_row_separator_func
function.description: Returns the current row separator function.

function.name: gtk_combo_box_new
function.description: Creates a new empty #GtkComboBox.

function.name: gtk_combo_box_new_with_entry
function.description: Creates a new empty #GtkComboBox with an entry.

function.name: gtk_combo_box_new_with_model
function.description: Creates a new #GtkComboBox with the model initialized to @model.

function.name: gtk_combo_box_new_with_model_and_entry
function.description: Creates a new empty #GtkComboBox with an entry and with the model initialized to @model.

function.name: gtk_combo_box_popdown
gtk_combo_box_popup
function.description:
Pops up the menu or dropdown list of @combo_box.
This function is mostly intended for use by accessibility technologies; applications should have little use for it.
Before calling this, @combo_box must be mapped, or nothing will happen.

function.name: gtk_combo_box_popup_for_device
function.description: Pops up the menu of @combo_box. Note that currently this does not do anything with the device, as it was previously only used for list-mode combo boxes, and those were removed in GTK 4. However, it is retained in case similar functionality is added back later.

function.name: gtk_combo_box_set_active
function.description: Sets the active item of @combo_box to be the item at @index.

parameter.name: index_
parameter.parameter_description: An index in the model passed during construction, or -1 to have no active item

function.name: gtk_combo_box_set_active_id
function.description:
Changes the active row of @combo_box to the one that has an ID equal to @active_id, or unsets the active row if @active_id is %NULL. Rows having a %NULL ID string cannot be made active by this function.
If the #GtkComboBox:id-column property of @combo_box is unset or if no row has the given ID then the function does nothing and returns %FALSE.

parameter.name: active_id
parameter.parameter_description: the ID of the row to select, or %NULL

function.name: gtk_combo_box_set_active_iter
function.description: Sets the current active item to be the one referenced by @iter, or unsets the active item if @iter is %NULL.

function.name: gtk_combo_box_set_button_sensitivity
function.description: Sets whether the dropdown button of the combo box should be always sensitive (%GTK_SENSITIVITY_ON), never sensitive (%GTK_SENSITIVITY_OFF) or only if there is at least one item to display (%GTK_SENSITIVITY_AUTO).

parameter.name: sensitivity
parameter.parameter_description: specify the sensitivity of the dropdown button

function.name: gtk_combo_box_set_child
function.description: Sets the child widget of @combo_box.

function.name: gtk_combo_box_set_entry_text_column
function.description:
Sets the model column which @combo_box should use to get strings from to be @text_column. The column @text_column in the model of @combo_box must be of type %G_TYPE_STRING.
This is only relevant if @combo_box has been created with #GtkComboBox:has-entry as %TRUE.

parameter.name: text_column
parameter.parameter_description: A column in @model to get the strings from for the internal entry

function.name: gtk_combo_box_set_id_column
function.description: Sets the model column which @combo_box should use to get string IDs for values from. The column @id_column in the model of @combo_box must be of type %G_TYPE_STRING.

parameter.name: id_column
parameter.parameter_description: A column in @model to get string IDs for values from

function.name: gtk_combo_box_set_model
function.description:
Sets the model used by @combo_box to be @model. Will unset a previously set model (if applicable). If model is %NULL, then it will unset the model.
Note that this function does not clear the cell renderers, you have to call gtk_cell_layout_clear() yourself if you need to set up different cell renderers for the new model.

function.name: gtk_combo_box_set_popup_fixed_width
function.description: Specifies whether the popup’s width should be a fixed width matching the allocated width of the combo box.

parameter.name: fixed
parameter.parameter_description: whether to use a fixed popup width

function.name: gtk_combo_box_set_row_separator_func
function.description: Sets the row separator function, which is used to determine whether a row should be drawn as a separator. If the row separator function is %NULL, no separators are drawn. This is the default value.

parameter.name: data
parameter.parameter_description: user data to pass to @func, or %NULL

function.name: gtk_combo_box_text_append
function.description:
Appends @text to the list of strings stored in @combo_box. If @id is non-%NULL then it is used as the ID of the row.
This is the same as calling gtk_combo_box_text_insert() with a position of -1.

parameter.name: id
parameter.parameter_description: a string ID for this value, or %NULL

function.name: gtk_combo_box_text_append_text
function.description:
Appends @text to the list of strings stored in @combo_box.
This is the same as calling gtk_combo_box_text_insert_text() with a position of -1.

function.name: gtk_combo_box_text_get_active_text
function.description: Returns the currently active string in @combo_box, or %NULL if none is selected. If @combo_box contains an entry, this function will return its contents (which will not necessarily be an item from the list).
function.return: a newly allocated string containing the currently active text. Must be freed with g_free().

function.name: gtk_combo_box_text_insert
function.description:
Inserts @text at @position in the list of strings stored in @combo_box. If @id is non-%NULL then it is used as the ID of the row. See #GtkComboBox:id-column.
If @position is negative then @text is appended.

parameter.name: id
parameter.parameter_description: a string ID for this value, or %NULL

function.name: gtk_combo_box_text_insert_text
function.description:
Inserts @text at @position in the list of strings stored in @combo_box.
If @position is negative then @text is appended.
This is the same as calling gtk_combo_box_text_insert() with a %NULL ID string.

function.name: gtk_combo_box_text_new
function.description: Creates a new #GtkComboBoxText, which is a #GtkComboBox just displaying strings.

function.name: gtk_combo_box_text_new_with_entry
function.description: Creates a new #GtkComboBoxText, which is a #GtkComboBox just displaying strings. The combo box created by this function has an entry.

function.name: gtk_combo_box_text_prepend
function.description:
Prepends @text to the list of strings stored in @combo_box. If @id is non-%NULL then it is used as the ID of the row.
This is the same as calling gtk_combo_box_text_insert() with a position of 0.

parameter.name: id
parameter.parameter_description: a string ID for this value, or %NULL

function.name: gtk_combo_box_text_prepend_text
function.description:
Prepends @text to the list of strings stored in @combo_box.
This is the same as calling gtk_combo_box_text_insert_text() with a position of 0.

function.name: gtk_combo_box_text_remove
function.description: Removes the string at @position from @combo_box.

parameter.name: position
parameter.parameter_description: Index of the item to remove

function.name: gtk_combo_box_text_remove_all
function.description: Removes all the text entries from the combo box.

function.name: gtk_constant_expression_get_value
function.description: Gets the value that a constant expression evaluates to.

function.name: gtk_constant_expression_new
function.description: Creates a GtkExpression that evaluates to the object given by the arguments.

parameter.name: Varargs
parameter.parameter_description: arguments to create the object from

function.name: gtk_constant_expression_new_for_value
function.description: Creates an expression that always evaluates to the given @value.

function.name: gtk_constraint_get_constant
function.description: Retrieves the constant factor added to the source attributes' value.

function.name: gtk_constraint_get_multiplier
function.description: Retrieves the multiplication factor applied to the source attribute's value.

function.name: gtk_constraint_get_relation
function.description: The order relation between the terms of the @constraint.

function.name: gtk_constraint_get_source
function.description:
Retrieves the #GtkConstraintTarget used as the source for @constraint.
If the #GtkConstraint:source property is set to %NULL, the @constraint will use the #GtkConstraintLayout's widget.

function.name: gtk_constraint_get_source_attribute
function.description: Retrieves the attribute of the source to be read by the @constraint.

function.name: gtk_constraint_get_strength
function.description: Retrieves the strength of the constraint.

function.name: gtk_constraint_get_target
function.description:
Retrieves the #GtkConstraintTarget used as the target for @constraint.
If the #GtkConstraint:target property is set to %NULL, the @constraint will use the #GtkConstraintLayout's widget.

function.name: gtk_constraint_get_target_attribute
function.description: Retrieves the attribute of the target to be set by the @constraint.

function.name: gtk_constraint_guide_get_max_size
function.description: Gets the maximum size of @guide.

parameter.name: width
parameter.parameter_description: return location for the maximum width, or %NULL

parameter.name: height
parameter.parameter_description: return location for the maximum height, or %NULL

function.name: gtk_constraint_guide_get_min_size
function.description: Gets the minimum size of @guide.

parameter.name: width
parameter.parameter_description: return location for the minimum width, or %NULL

parameter.name: height
parameter.parameter_description: return location for the minimum height, or %NULL

function.name: gtk_constraint_guide_get_name
function.description: Retrieves the name set using gtk_constraint_guide_set_name().

function.name: gtk_constraint_guide_get_nat_size
function.description: Gets the natural size of @guide.

parameter.name: width
parameter.parameter_description: return location for the natural width, or %NULL

parameter.name: height
parameter.parameter_description: return location for the natural height, or %NULL

function.name: gtk_constraint_guide_get_strength
function.description: Retrieves the strength set using gtk_constraint_guide_set_strength().
function.return: the strength of the constraint on the natural size

function.name: gtk_constraint_guide_new
function.description:
Creates a new #GtkConstraintGuide object.
Return: a new #GtkConstraintGuide object.

function.name: gtk_constraint_guide_set_max_size
function.description:
Sets the maximum size of @guide.
If @guide is attached to a #GtkConstraintLayout, the constraints will be updated to reflect the new size.

parameter.name: width
parameter.parameter_description: the new maximum width, or -1 to not change it

parameter.name: height
parameter.parameter_description: the new maximum height, or -1 to not change it

function.name: gtk_constraint_guide_set_min_size
function.description:
Sets the minimum size of @guide.
If @guide is attached to a #GtkConstraintLayout, the constraints will be updated to reflect the new size.

parameter.name: width
parameter.parameter_description: the new minimum width, or -1 to not change it

parameter.name: height
parameter.parameter_description: the new minimum height, or -1 to not change it

function.name: gtk_constraint_guide_set_name
function.description:
Sets a name for the given #GtkConstraintGuide.
The name is useful for debugging purposes.

function.name: gtk_constraint_guide_set_nat_size
function.description:
Sets the natural size of @guide.
If @guide is attached to a #GtkConstraintLayout, the constraints will be updated to reflect the new size.

parameter.name: width
parameter.parameter_description: the new natural width, or -1 to not change it

parameter.name: height
parameter.parameter_description: the new natural height, or -1 to not change it

function.name: gtk_constraint_guide_set_strength
function.description: Sets the strength of the constraint on the natural size of the given #GtkConstraintGuide.

function.name: gtk_constraint_is_attached
function.description: Checks whether the @constraint is attached to a #GtkConstraintLayout, and it is contributing to the layout.

function.name: gtk_constraint_is_constant
function.description: Checks whether the @constraint describes a relation between an attribute on the #GtkConstraint:target and a constant value.
function.return: %TRUE if the constraint is a constant relation

function.name: gtk_constraint_is_required
function.description: Checks whether the @constraint is a required relation for solving the constraint layout.

function.name: gtk_constraint_layout_add_constraint
function.description:
Adds a #GtkConstraint to the layout manager.
The #GtkConstraint:source and #GtkConstraint:target properties of @constraint can be:
- set to %NULL to indicate that the constraint refers to the widget using @layout - set to the #GtkWidget using @layout - set to a child of the #GtkWidget using @layout - set to a guide that is part of @layout
The @layout acquires the ownership of @constraint after calling this function.

function.name: gtk_constraint_layout_add_constraints_from_description
function.description:
Creates a list of constraints they formal description using a compact description syntax called VFL, or "Visual Format Language".
This function is a convenience wrapper around gtk_constraint_layout_add_constraints_from_descriptionv(), using variadic arguments to populate the view/target map.

parameter.name: lines
