parameter.parameter_description: an array of Visual Format Language lines defining a set of constraints

parameter.name: hspacing
parameter.parameter_description: default horizontal spacing value, or -1 for the fallback value

parameter.name: vspacing
parameter.parameter_description: default vertical spacing value, or -1 for the fallback value

parameter.name: first_view
parameter.parameter_description: the name of a view in the VFL description, followed by the #GtkConstraintTarget to which it maps

parameter.name: Varargs
parameter.parameter_description: a %NULL-terminated list of view names and #GtkConstraintTargets

function.return: the list of #GtkConstraints that were added to the layout

function.name: gtk_constraint_layout_add_constraints_from_descriptionv

parameter.name: lines
parameter.parameter_description: an array of Visual Format Language lines defining a set of constraints

parameter.name: hspacing
parameter.parameter_description: default horizontal spacing value, or -1 for the fallback value

parameter.name: vspacing
parameter.parameter_description: default vertical spacing value, or -1 for the fallback value

parameter.name: views
parameter.parameter_description: a dictionary of [ name, target ] pairs; the `name` keys map to the view names in the VFL lines, while the `target` values map to children of the widget using a #GtkConstraintLayout, or guides

function.return: the list of #GtkConstraints that were added to the layout

function.name: gtk_constraint_layout_add_guide
function.description:
Adds a guide to @layout. A guide can be used as the source or target of constraints, like a widget, but it is not visible.
The @layout acquires the ownership of @guide after calling this function.

function.name: gtk_constraint_layout_new
function.description: Creates a new #GtkConstraintLayout layout manager.

function.name: gtk_constraint_layout_observe_constraints
function.description:
Returns a #GListModel to track the constraints that are part of @layout.
Calling this function will enable extra internal bookkeeping to track constraints and emit signals on the returned listmodel. It may slow down operations a lot.
Applications should try hard to avoid calling this function because of the slowdowns.

function.name: gtk_constraint_layout_observe_guides
function.description:
Returns a #GListModel to track the guides that are part of @layout.
Calling this function will enable extra internal bookkeeping to track guides and emit signals on the returned listmodel. It may slow down operations a lot.
Applications should try hard to avoid calling this function because of the slowdowns.

function.name: gtk_constraint_layout_remove_all_constraints
function.description: Removes all constraints from the layout manager.

function.name: gtk_constraint_layout_remove_constraint
function.description: Removes @constraint from the layout manager, so that it no longer influences the layout.

function.name: gtk_constraint_layout_remove_guide
function.description: Removes @guide from the layout manager, so that it no longer influences the layout.

function.name: gtk_constraint_new
function.description: Creates a new #GtkConstraint representing a relation between a layout attribute on a source and a layout attribute on a target.

parameter.name: target_attribute
parameter.parameter_description: the attribute of @target to be set

parameter.name: source_attribute
parameter.parameter_description: the attribute of @source to be read

parameter.name: multiplier
parameter.parameter_description: a multiplication factor to be applied to @source_attribute

parameter.name: constant
parameter.parameter_description: a constant factor to be added to @source_attribute

function.name: gtk_constraint_new_constant
function.description: Creates a new #GtkConstraint representing a relation between a layout attribute on a target and a constant value.

parameter.name: target_attribute
parameter.parameter_description: the attribute of @target to be set

parameter.name: constant
parameter.parameter_description: a constant factor to be set on @target_attribute

function.name: gtk_css_node_new
function.description: Creates a new CSS node.

function.name: gtk_css_parser_consume_ident
function.description: If the current token is an identifier, consumes it and returns its name. If the current token is not an identifier, an error is emitted and %NULL is returned.
function.return: the name of the consumed identifier or %NULL on error

function.name: gtk_css_parser_consume_string
function.description: If the current token is a string, consumes it and return the string. If the current token is not a string, an error is emitted and %NULL is returned.
function.return: the name of the consumed string or %NULL on error

function.name: gtk_css_parser_consume_url
function.description: If the parser matches the <url> token from the [CSS specification](https://drafts.csswg.org/css-values-4/#url-value), consumes it, resolves the URL and returns the resulting #GFile. On failure, an error is emitted and %NULL is returned.
function.return: the resulting URL or %NULL on error

function.name: gtk_css_parser_get_block_location
function.description:
Queries the start location of the token that started the current block that is being parsed.
If no block is currently parsed, the beginning of the document is returned.
function.return: The start location of the current block

function.name: gtk_css_parser_get_end_location
function.description:
Queries the location of the current token.
This function will return the location of the end of the current token. In the case a token has been consumed, but no new token has been queried yet via gtk_css_parser_peek_token() or gtk_css_parser_get_token(), the previous token's end location will be returned.
This function may return the same location as gtk_css_parser_get_start_location() - in particular at the beginning and end of the document.

function.name: gtk_css_parser_get_file
function.description: Gets the file being parsed. If no file is associated with @self - for example when raw data is parsed - %NULL is returned.

function.name: gtk_css_parser_get_start_location
function.description:
Queries the location of the current token.
This function will return the location of the start of the current token. In the case a token has been consumed, but no new token has been queried yet via gtk_css_parser_peek_token() or gtk_css_parser_get_token(), the previous token's start location will be returned.
This function may return the same location as gtk_css_parser_get_end_location() - in particular at the beginning and end of the document.

function.name: gtk_css_parser_has_function
function.description: Checks if the next token is a function with the given @name.
function.return: %TRUE if the next token is a function with the given @name

function.name: gtk_css_parser_has_ident
function.description: Checks if the next token is an identifier with the given @name.
function.return: %TRUE if the next token is an identifier with the given @name

function.name: gtk_css_parser_has_token
function.description: Checks if the next token is of @token_type.

parameter.name: token_type
parameter.parameter_description: type of the token to check

function.return: %TRUE if the next token is of @token_type

function.name: gtk_css_parser_resolve_url
function.description: Resolves a given URL against the parser's location.
function.return: a new #GFile for the resolved URL or %NULL if the URI cannot be resolved.

function.name: gtk_css_parser_try_at_keyword
function.description: Checks if the current token is an at-keyword token with the given @keyword. If that is the case, the token is consumed and %TRUE is returned.

parameter.name: keyword
parameter.parameter_description: name of keyword to check for

function.return: %TRUE if the token matched and was consumed.

function.name: gtk_css_parser_try_delim
function.description:
Checks if the current token is a delimiter matching the given @codepoint. If that is the case, the token is consumed and %TRUE is returned.
Keep in mind that not every unicode codepoint can be a delim token.
function.return: %TRUE if the token matched and was consumed.

function.name: gtk_css_parser_try_ident
function.return: %TRUE if the token matched and was consumed.

function.name: gtk_css_parser_try_token
gtk_css_provider_load_from_data
function.description: Loads @data into @css_provider, and by doing so clears any previously loaded information.

parameter.name: length

function.name: gtk_css_provider_load_from_file
function.description: Loads the data contained in @file into @css_provider, making it clear any previously loaded information.

parameter.name: file
parameter.parameter_description: #GFile pointing to a file to load

function.name: gtk_css_provider_load_from_path
function.description: Loads the data contained in @path into @css_provider, making it clear any previously loaded information.

parameter.name: path
parameter.parameter_description: the path of a filename to load, in the GLib filename encoding

function.name: gtk_css_provider_load_from_resource
function.description:
Loads the data contained in the resource at @resource_path into the #GtkCssProvider, clearing any previously loaded information.
To track errors while loading CSS, connect to the #GtkCssProvider::parsing-error signal.

function.name: gtk_css_provider_load_named
function.description: Loads a theme from the usual theme paths. The actual process of finding the theme might change between releases, but it is guaranteed that this function uses the same mechanism to load the theme that GTK uses for loading its own theme.

parameter.name: variant
parameter.parameter_description: variant to load, for example, "dark", or %NULL for the default

function.name: gtk_css_provider_new
function.description: Returns a newly created #GtkCssProvider.

function.name: gtk_css_provider_to_string
function.description:
Converts the @provider into a string representation in CSS format.
Using gtk_css_provider_load_from_data() with the return value from this function on a new provider created with gtk_css_provider_new() will basically create a duplicate of this @provider.

parameter.name: provider
parameter.parameter_description: the provider to write to a string

function.name: gtk_css_section_get_end_location
function.description: Returns the location in the CSS document where this section ends.
function.return: The end location of this section

function.name: gtk_css_section_get_file
function.return: the #GFile that @section was parsed from or %NULL if @section was parsed from other data

function.name: gtk_css_section_get_parent
function.description: Gets the parent section for the given @section. The parent section is the section that contains this @section. A special case are sections of type #GTK_CSS_SECTION_DOCUMENT. Their parent will either be %NULL if they are the original CSS document that was loaded by gtk_css_provider_load_from_file() or a section of type #GTK_CSS_SECTION_IMPORT if it was loaded with an import rule from a different file.
function.return: the parent section or %NULL if none

function.name: gtk_css_section_get_start_location
function.description: Returns the location in the CSS document where this section starts.
function.return: The start location of this section

function.name: gtk_css_section_new

parameter.name: file
parameter.parameter_description: The file this section refers to

function.name: gtk_css_section_print
function.description: Prints the @section into @string in a human-readable form. This is a form like `gtk.css:32:1-23` to denote line 32, characters 1 to 23 in the file gtk.css.

function.name: gtk_css_section_ref
function.description: Increments the reference count on @section.

function.name: gtk_css_section_to_string
function.description: Prints the section into a human-readable text form using gtk_css_section_print().

function.name: gtk_css_section_unref
function.description: Decrements the reference count on @section, freeing the structure if the reference count reaches 0.

function.name: gtk_css_selector_matches
function.description: Checks if the @selector matches the given @node.

function.name: gtk_css_value_get_dynamic_value
function.description:
Gets the dynamic value for a given timestamp. If @monotonic_time is 0, the default value is returned.
See gtk_css_value_is_dynamic() for details about dynamic values.

parameter.name: monotonic_time
parameter.parameter_description: the timestamp for which to get the dynamic value

function.return: The dynamic value for @value at the given timestamp

function.name: gtk_css_value_is_dynamic
function.description:
A "dynamic" value has a different value at different times. This means that the value needs to be animated when time is progressing.
Examples of dynamic values are animated images, such as videos or dynamic shaders.
Use gtk_css_value_get_dynamic_value() to get the value for a given timestamp.

function.name: gtk_custom_filter_new
function.description:
Creates a new filter using the given @match_func to filter items.
If @match_func is %NULL, the filter matches all items.
If the filter func changes its filtering behavior, gtk_filter_changed() needs to be called.

function.name: gtk_custom_filter_set_filter_func
function.description:
Sets (or unsets) the function used for filtering items.
If @match_func is %NULL, the filter matches all items.
If the filter func changes its filtering behavior, gtk_filter_changed() needs to be called.
If a previous function was set, its @user_destroy will be called now.

function.name: gtk_custom_layout_new
function.description:
Creates a new legacy layout manager.
Legacy layout managers map to the old #GtkWidget size negotiation virtual functions, and are meant to be used during the transition from layout containers to layout manager delegates.

parameter.name: request_mode
parameter.parameter_description: a function to retrieve the #GtkSizeRequestMode of the widget using the layout; the default request mode is %GTK_SIZE_REQUEST_CONSTANT_SIZE

parameter.name: measure
parameter.parameter_description: a function to measure the widget using the layout manager

parameter.name: allocate
parameter.parameter_description: a function to allocate the children of the widget using the layout manager

function.name: gtk_custom_paper_unix_dialog_new
function.description: Creates a new custom paper dialog.

parameter.name: title
parameter.parameter_description: the title of the dialog, or %NULL

parameter.name: parent
parameter.parameter_description: transient parent of the dialog, or %NULL

function.name: gtk_custom_sorter_new
gtk_custom_sorter_set_sort_func
function.description:
Sets (or unsets) the function used for sorting items.
If @sort_func is %NULL, all items are considered equal.
If the sort func changes its sorting behavior, gtk_sorter_changed() needs to be called.
If a previous function was set, its @user_destroy will be called now.

function.name: gtk_dialog_add_action_widget
function.description: Adds an activatable widget to the action area of a #GtkDialog, connecting a signal handler that will emit the #GtkDialog::response signal on the dialog when the widget is activated. The widget is appended to the end of the dialog’s action area. If you want to add a non-activatable widget, simply pack it into the @action_area field of the #GtkDialog struct.

function.name: gtk_dialog_add_button
function.description: Adds a button with the given text and sets things up so that clicking the button will emit the #GtkDialog::response signal with the given @response_id. The button is appended to the end of the dialog’s action area. The button widget is returned, but usually you don’t need it.

function.name: gtk_dialog_add_buttons
function.description: Adds more buttons, same as calling gtk_dialog_add_button() repeatedly. The variable argument list should be %NULL-terminated as with gtk_dialog_new_with_buttons(). Each button must have both text and response ID.

parameter.name: Varargs
parameter.parameter_description: response ID for first button, then more text-response_id pairs

function.name: gtk_dialog_get_content_area
function.description: Returns the content area of @dialog.

function.name: gtk_dialog_get_header_bar
function.description: Returns the header bar of @dialog. Note that the headerbar is only used by the dialog if the #GtkDialog:use-header-bar property is %TRUE.

function.name: gtk_dialog_get_response_for_widget
function.description: Gets the response id of a widget in the action area of a dialog.

parameter.name: widget
parameter.parameter_description: a widget in the action area of @dialog

function.return: the response id of @widget, or %GTK_RESPONSE_NONE if @widget doesn’t have a response id set.

function.name: gtk_dialog_get_widget_for_response
function.description: Gets the widget button that uses the given response ID in the action area of a dialog.

parameter.name: response_id
parameter.parameter_description: the response ID used by the @dialog widget

function.return: the @widget button that uses the given @response_id, or %NULL.

function.name: gtk_dialog_new
function.description:
Creates a new dialog box.
Widgets should not be packed into this #GtkWindow directly, but into the @content_area and @action_area, as described above.

function.name: gtk_dialog_new_with_buttons
function.description:
Creates a new #GtkDialog with title @title (or %NULL for the default title; see gtk_window_set_title()) and transient parent @parent (or %NULL for none; see gtk_window_set_transient_for()). The @flags argument can be used to make the dialog modal (#GTK_DIALOG_MODAL) and/or to have it destroyed along with its transient parent (#GTK_DIALOG_DESTROY_WITH_PARENT). After @flags, button text/response ID pairs should be listed, with a %NULL pointer ending the list. Button text can be arbitrary text. A response ID can be any positive number, or one of the values in the #GtkResponseType enumeration. If the user clicks one of these dialog buttons, #GtkDialog will emit the #GtkDialog::response signal with the corresponding response ID. If a #GtkDialog receives a delete event, it will emit ::response with a response ID of #GTK_RESPONSE_DELETE_EVENT. However, destroying a dialog does not emit the ::response signal; so be careful relying on ::response when using the #GTK_DIALOG_DESTROY_WITH_PARENT flag. Buttons are from left to right, so the first button in the list will be the leftmost button in the dialog.
Here’s a simple example: |[<!-- language="C" --> GtkWindow *main_app_window; // Window the dialog should show up on GtkWidget *dialog; GtkDialogFlags flags = GTK_DIALOG_MODAL | GTK_DIALOG_DESTROY_WITH_PARENT; dialog = gtk_dialog_new_with_buttons ("My dialog", main_app_window, flags, _("_OK"), GTK_RESPONSE_ACCEPT, _("_Cancel"), GTK_RESPONSE_REJECT, NULL); ]|

parameter.name: parent
parameter.parameter_description: Transient parent of the dialog, or %NULL

parameter.name: first_button_text
parameter.parameter_description: text to go in first button, or %NULL

parameter.name: Varargs
parameter.parameter_description: response ID for first button, then additional buttons, ending with %NULL

function.name: gtk_dialog_response
function.description:
Emits the #GtkDialog::response signal with the given response ID.
Used to indicate that the user has responded to the dialog in some way.

function.name: gtk_dialog_set_default_response
function.description: Sets the last widget in the dialog’s action area with the given @response_id as the default widget for the dialog. Pressing “Enter” normally activates the default widget.

function.name: gtk_dialog_set_response_sensitive
function.description: Calls `gtk_widget_set_sensitive (widget, @setting)` for each widget in the dialog’s action area with the given @response_id. A convenient way to sensitize/desensitize dialog buttons.

function.name: gtk_directory_list_get_attributes
function.description: Gets the attributes queried on the children.

function.name: gtk_directory_list_get_error
function.description:
Gets the loading error, if any.
If an error occurs during the loading process, the loading process will finish and this property allows querying the error that happened. This error will persist until a file is loaded again.
An error being set does not mean that no files were loaded, and all successfully queried files will remain in the list.
function.return: The loading error or %NULL if loading finished successfully.

function.name: gtk_directory_list_get_file
function.description: Gets the file whose children are currently enumerated.
function.return: The file whose children are enumerated

function.name: gtk_directory_list_get_io_priority
function.description: Gets the IO priority set via gtk_directory_list_set_io_priority().

function.name: gtk_directory_list_get_monitored
function.description: Returns whether the directory list is monitoring the directory for changes.

function.name: gtk_directory_list_is_loading
function.description:
Returns %TRUE if the children enumeration is currently in progress.
Files will be added to @self from time to time while loading is going on. The order in which are added is undefined and may change in between runs.

function.name: gtk_directory_list_new
function.description: Creates a new #GtkDirectoryList querying the given @file with the given @attributes.

function.name: gtk_directory_list_set_attributes
function.description:
Sets the @attributes to be enumerated and starts the enumeration.
If @attributes is %NULL, no attributes will be queried, but a list of #GFileInfos will still be created.

function.name: gtk_directory_list_set_file
function.description:
Sets the @file to be enumerated and starts the enumeration.
If @file is %NULL, the result will be an empty list.

function.name: gtk_directory_list_set_io_priority
function.description:
Sets the IO priority to use while loading directories.
Setting the priority while @self is loading will reprioritize the ongoing load as soon as possible.
The default IO priority is %G_PRIORITY_DEFAULT, which is higher than the GTK redraw priority. If you are loading a lot of directories in parallel, lowering it to something like %G_PRIORITY_DEFAULT_IDLE may increase responsiveness.

function.name: gtk_directory_list_set_monitored
function.description:
Sets whether the directory list will monitor the directory for changes. If monitoring is enabled, the #GListModel::items-changed signal will be emitted when the directory contents change.
When monitoring is turned on after the initial creation of the directory list, the directory is reloaded to avoid missing files that appeared between the initial loading and when monitoring was turned on.

parameter.name: monitored
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE to monitor the directory for changes

function.name: gtk_disable_setlocale
function.description:
Prevents gtk_init(), gtk_init_check() and gtk_parse_args() from automatically calling `setlocale (LC_ALL, "")`. You would want to use this function if you wanted to set the locale for your program to something other than the user’s locale, or if you wanted to set different values for different locale categories.
Most programs should not need to call this function.

function.name: gtk_distribute_natural_allocation
function.description:
Distributes @extra_space to child @sizes by bringing smaller children up to natural size first.
The remaining space will be added to the @minimum_size member of the GtkRequestedSize struct. If all sizes reach their natural size then the remaining space is returned.

parameter.name: extra_space
parameter.parameter_description: Extra space to redistribute among children after subtracting minimum sizes and any child padding from the overall allocation

parameter.name: n_requested_sizes
parameter.parameter_description: Number of requests to fit into the allocation

parameter.name: sizes
parameter.parameter_description: An array of structs with a client pointer and a minimum/natural size in the orientation of the allocation.

function.return: The remainder of @extra_space after redistributing space to @sizes.

function.name: gtk_drag_check_threshold
function.description: Checks to see if a mouse drag starting at (@start_x, @start_y) and ending at (@current_x, @current_y) has passed the GTK drag threshold, and thus should trigger the beginning of a drag-and-drop operation.

parameter.name: start_x
parameter.parameter_description: X coordinate of start of drag

parameter.name: start_y
parameter.parameter_description: Y coordinate of start of drag

function.return: %TRUE if the drag threshold has been passed.

function.name: gtk_drag_icon_create_widget_for_value
function.description:
Creates a widget that can be used as a drag icon for the given @value.
Supported types include strings, #GdkRGBA and #GtkTextBuffer. If GTK does not know how to create a widget for a given value, it will return %NULL.
This method is used to set the default drag icon on drag'n'drop operations started by #GtkDragSource, so you don't need to set a drag icon using this function there.
function.return: A new #GtkWidget for displaying @value as a drag icon.

function.name: gtk_drag_icon_get_child
function.description: Gets the widget currently used as drag icon.
function.return: The drag icon or %NULL if none.

function.name: gtk_drag_icon_get_for_drag
function.description:
Gets the #GtkDragIcon in use with @drag.
If no drag icon exists yet, a new one will be created and shown.

function.name: gtk_drag_icon_set_child
function.description: Sets the widget to display as the drag icon.

function.name: gtk_drag_icon_set_from_paintable
function.description: Creates a #GtkDragIcon that shows @paintable, and associates it with the drag operation. The hotspot position on the paintable is aligned with the hotspot of the cursor.

function.name: gtk_drag_source_drag_cancel
function.description: Cancels a currently ongoing drag operation.

function.name: gtk_drag_source_get_actions
function.description: Gets the actions that are currently set on the #GtkDragSource.

function.name: gtk_drag_source_get_content
function.description: Gets the current content provider of a #GtkDragSource.

function.name: gtk_drag_source_get_drag
function.description: Returns the underlying #GdkDrag object for an ongoing drag.
function.return: the #GdkDrag of the current drag operation, or %NULL

function.name: gtk_drag_source_new
function.description: Creates a new #GtkDragSource object.

function.name: gtk_drag_source_set_actions
function.description:
Sets the actions on the #GtkDragSource.
During a DND operation, the actions are offered to potential drop targets. If @actions include %GDK_ACTION_MOVE, you need to listen to the #GtkDragSource::drag-end signal and handle @delete_data being %TRUE.
This function can be called before a drag is started, or in a handler for the #GtkDragSource::prepare signal.

function.name: gtk_drag_source_set_content
function.description:
Sets a content provider on a #GtkDragSource.
When the data is requested in the cause of a DND operation, it will be obtained from the content provider.
This function can be called before a drag is started, or in a handler for the #GtkDragSource::prepare signal.
You may consider setting the content provider back to %NULL in a #GtkDragSource::drag-end signal handler.

function.name: gtk_drag_source_set_icon
function.description:
Sets a paintable to use as icon during DND operations.
The hotspot coordinates determine the point on the icon that gets aligned with the hotspot of the cursor.
If @paintable is %NULL, a default icon is used.
This function can be called before a drag is started, or in a #GtkDragSource::prepare or #GtkDragSource::drag-begin signal handler.

parameter.name: paintable
parameter.parameter_description: the #GdkPaintable to use as icon, or %NULL

parameter.name: hot_x
parameter.parameter_description: the hotspot X coordinate on the icon

parameter.name: hot_y
parameter.parameter_description: the hotspot Y coordinate on the icon

function.name: gtk_drawing_area_get_content_height
function.description: Retrieves the value previously set via gtk_drawing_area_set_content_height().
function.return: The height requested for content of the drawing area

function.name: gtk_drawing_area_get_content_width
function.description: Retrieves the value previously set via gtk_drawing_area_set_content_width().
function.return: The width requested for content of the drawing area

function.name: gtk_drawing_area_new
function.description: Creates a new drawing area.

function.name: gtk_drawing_area_set_content_height
function.description:
Sets the desired height of the contents of the drawing area. Note that because widgets may be allocated larger sizes than they requested, it is possible that the actual height passed to your draw function is larger than the height set here. You can use gtk_widget_set_valign() to avoid that.
If the height is set to 0 (the default), the drawing area may disappear.

function.name: gtk_drawing_area_set_content_width
function.description:
Sets the desired width of the contents of the drawing area. Note that because widgets may be allocated larger sizes than they requested, it is possible that the actual width passed to your draw function is larger than the width set here. You can use gtk_widget_set_halign() to avoid that.
If the width is set to 0 (the default), the drawing area may disappear.

function.name: gtk_drawing_area_set_draw_func
function.description:
Setting a draw function is the main thing you want to do when using a drawing area. It is called whenever GTK needs to draw the contents of the drawing area to the screen.
The draw function will be called during the drawing stage of GTK. In the drawing stage it is not allowed to change properties of any GTK widgets or call any functions that would cause any properties to be changed. You should restrict yourself exclusively to drawing your contents in the draw function.
If what you are drawing does change, call gtk_widget_queue_draw() on the drawing area. This will cause a redraw and will call @draw_func again.

parameter.name: draw_func
parameter.parameter_description: callback that lets you draw the drawing area's contents

function.name: gtk_drop_controller_motion_contains_pointer
function.description: Returns the value of the GtkDropControllerMotion:contains-pointer property.
function.return: %TRUE if a dragging pointer is within @self or one of its children.

function.name: gtk_drop_controller_motion_get_drop
function.description: Returns the value of the GtkDropControllerMotion:drop property.
function.return: The #GdkDrop currently happening within @self or %NULL if none

function.name: gtk_drop_controller_motion_is_pointer
function.description: Returns the value of the GtkDropControllerMotion:is-pointer property.
function.return: %TRUE if a dragging pointer is within @self but not one of its children

function.name: gtk_drop_controller_motion_new
function.description: Creates a new event controller that will handle pointer motion events during drag and drop.

function.name: gtk_drop_down_get_enable_search
function.description: Returns whether search is enabled.
function.return: %TRUE if the popup includes a search entry

function.name: gtk_drop_down_get_expression
function.description: Gets the expression set with gtk_drop_down_set_expression().

function.name: gtk_drop_down_get_factory
function.description:
Gets the factory that's currently used to populate list items.
The factory returned by this function is always used for the item in the button. It is also used for items in the popup if #GtkDropDown:list-factory is not set.

function.name: gtk_drop_down_get_list_factory
function.description: Gets the factory that's currently used to populate list items in the popup.

function.name: gtk_drop_down_get_model
function.description: Gets the model that provides the displayed items.

function.name: gtk_drop_down_get_selected
function.description: Gets the position of the selected item.
function.return: the position of the selected item, or #GTK_INVALID_LIST_POSITION if not item is selected

function.name: gtk_drop_down_get_selected_item
function.description: Gets the selected item. If no item is selected, %NULL is returned.

function.name: gtk_drop_down_new
function.description:
Creates a new #GtkDropDown.
You may want to call gtk_drop_down_set_factory() to set up a way to map its items to widgets.

parameter.name: model
parameter.parameter_description: the model to use or %NULL for none

parameter.name: expression
parameter.parameter_description: the expression to use or %NULL for none

function.name: gtk_drop_down_new_from_strings
function.description: Creates a new #GtkDropDown that is populated with the strings in @strings.

parameter.name: strings
parameter.parameter_description: The strings to put in the dropdown

function.name: gtk_drop_down_set_enable_search
function.description:
Sets whether a search entry will be shown in the popup that allows to search for items in the list.
Note that #GtkDropDown:expression must be set for search to work.

function.name: gtk_drop_down_set_expression
function.description: Sets the expression that gets evaluated to obtain strings from items when searching in the popup. The expression must have a value type of #G_TYPE_STRING.

function.name: gtk_drop_down_set_factory
function.description: Sets the #GtkListItemFactory to use for populating list items.

parameter.name: factory
parameter.parameter_description: the factory to use or %NULL for none

function.name: gtk_drop_down_set_list_factory
function.description: Sets the #GtkListItemFactory to use for populating list items in the popup.

parameter.name: factory
parameter.parameter_description: the factory to use or %NULL for none

function.name: gtk_drop_down_set_model
function.description: Sets the #GListModel to use.

parameter.name: model
parameter.parameter_description: the model to use or %NULL for none

function.name: gtk_drop_down_set_selected
function.description: Selects the item at the given position.

parameter.name: position
parameter.parameter_description: the position of the item to select, or #GTK_INVALID_LIST_POSITION

function.name: gtk_drop_target_async_get_actions
function.description: Gets the actions that this drop target supports.
function.return: the actions that this drop target supports

function.name: gtk_drop_target_async_get_formats
function.description:
Gets the data formats that this drop target accepts.
If the result is %NULL, all formats are expected to be supported.

function.name: gtk_drop_target_async_new
function.description: Creates a new #GtkDropTargetAsync object.

function.name: gtk_drop_target_async_reject_drop
function.description:
Sets the @drop as not accepted on this drag site.
This function should be used when delaying the decision on whether to accept a drag or not until after reading the data.

parameter.name: drop
parameter.parameter_description: the #GdkDrop of an ongoing drag operation

function.name: gtk_drop_target_async_set_actions
function.description: Sets the actions that this drop target supports.

function.name: gtk_drop_target_async_set_formats
function.description: Sets the data formats that this drop target will accept.

parameter.name: formats
parameter.parameter_description: the supported data formats or %NULL for any format.

function.name: gtk_drop_target_get_actions
function.description: Gets the actions that this drop target supports.
function.return: the actions that this drop target supports

function.name: gtk_drop_target_get_drop
function.description:
Gets the currently handled drop operation.
If no drop operation is going on, %NULL is returned.

function.name: gtk_drop_target_get_formats
function.description:
Gets the data formats that this drop target accepts.
If the result is %NULL, all formats are expected to be supported.

function.name: gtk_drop_target_get_gtypes
function.description: Gets the list of supported #GTypes for @self. If no type have been set, %NULL will be returned.

parameter.name: n_types
parameter.parameter_description: optional pointer to take the number of #GTypes contained in the return value

function.return: %G_TYPE_INVALID-terminated array of types included in @formats or %NULL if none.

function.name: gtk_drop_target_get_preload
function.description: Gets the value of the GtkDropTarget:preload property.
function.return: %TRUE if drop data should be preloaded

function.name: gtk_drop_target_get_value
function.description: Gets the value of the GtkDropTarget:value property.

function.name: gtk_drop_target_new
function.description:
Creates a new #GtkDropTarget object.
If the drop target should support more than 1 type, pass %G_TYPE_INVALID for @type and then call gtk_drop_target_set_gtypes().

function.name: gtk_drop_target_reject
function.description:
Rejects the ongoing drop operation.
If no drop operation is ongoing - when GdkDropTarget:drop returns %NULL - this function does nothing.
This function should be used when delaying the decision on whether to accept a drag or not until after reading the data.

function.name: gtk_drop_target_set_actions
function.description: Sets the actions that this drop target supports.

function.name: gtk_drop_target_set_gtypes
function.description:
Sets the supported #GTypes for this drop target.
The GtkDropTarget::drop signal will

parameter.name: types
parameter.parameter_description: all supported #GTypes that can be dropped

function.name: gtk_drop_target_set_preload
function.description: Sets the GtkDropTarget:preload property.

function.name: gtk_editable_delegate_get_property
function.description:
Gets a property of the #GtkEditable delegate for @object.
This is helper function that should be called in get_property, before handling your own properties.

function.name: gtk_editable_delegate_set_property
function.description:
Sets a property on the #GtkEditable delegate for @object.
This is a helper function that should be called in set_property, before handling your own properties.

function.name: gtk_editable_delete_selection
function.description: Deletes the currently selected text of the editable. This call doesn’t do anything if there is no selected text.

function.name: gtk_editable_delete_text
function.description:
Deletes a sequence of characters. The characters that are deleted are those characters at positions from @start_pos up to, but not including @end_pos. If @end_pos is negative, then the characters deleted are those from @start_pos to the end of the text.
Note that the positions are specified in characters, not bytes.

function.name: gtk_editable_finish_delegate
function.description:
Undoes the setup done by gtk_editable_init_delegate().
This is a helper function that should be called from dispose, before removing the delegate object.

function.name: gtk_editable_get_alignment
function.description: Gets the value set by gtk_editable_set_alignment().

function.name: gtk_editable_get_chars
function.description:
Retrieves a sequence of characters. The characters that are retrieved are those characters at positions from @start_pos up to, but not including @end_pos. If @end_pos is negative, then the characters retrieved are those characters from @start_pos to the end of the text.
Note that positions are specified in characters, not bytes.
function.return: a pointer to the contents of the widget as a string. This string is allocated by the #GtkEditable implementation and should be freed by the caller.

function.name: gtk_editable_get_delegate
function.description: Gets the #GtkEditable that @editable is delegating its implementation to. Typically, the delegate is a #GtkText widget.

function.name: gtk_editable_get_editable
function.description: Retrieves whether @editable is editable. See gtk_editable_set_editable().

function.name: gtk_editable_get_enable_undo
function.description: Gets if undo/redo actions are enabled for @editable

function.name: gtk_editable_get_max_width_chars
function.description: Retrieves the desired maximum width of @editable, in characters. See gtk_editable_set_max_width_chars().
function.return: the maximum width of the entry, in characters

function.name: gtk_editable_get_position
function.description:
Retrieves the current position of the cursor relative to the start of the content of the editable.
Note that this position is in characters, not in bytes.

function.name: gtk_editable_get_selection_bounds

parameter.name: start_pos
parameter.parameter_description: location to store the starting position, or %NULL

parameter.name: end_pos
parameter.parameter_description: location to store the end position, or %NULL

function.return: %TRUE if there is a non-empty selection, %FALSE otherwise

function.name: gtk_editable_get_text
function.description: Retrieves the contents of @editable. The returned string is owned by GTK and must not be modified or freed.
function.return: a pointer to the contents of the editable.

function.name: gtk_editable_get_width_chars
function.description: Gets the value set by gtk_editable_set_width_chars().
function.return: number of chars to request space for, or negative if unset

function.name: gtk_editable_init_delegate
function.description:
Sets up a delegate for #GtkEditable, assuming that the get_delegate vfunc in the #GtkEditable interface has been set up for the @editable's type.
This is a helper function that should be called in instance init, after creating the delegate object.

function.name: gtk_editable_insert_text
function.description:
Inserts @length bytes of @text into the contents of the widget, at position @position.
Note that the position is in characters, not in bytes. The function updates @position to point after the newly inserted text.

parameter.name: length
parameter.parameter_description: the length of the text in bytes, or -1

parameter.name: position
parameter.parameter_description: location of the position text will be inserted at

function.name: gtk_editable_install_properties
function.description:
Installs the GtkEditable properties for @class.
This is a helper function that should be called in class_init, after installing your own properties.
To handle the properties in your set_property and get_property functions, you can either use gtk_editable_delegate_set_property() and gtk_editable_delegate_get_property() (if you are using a delegate), or remember the @first_prop offset and add it to the values in the #GtkEditableProperties enumeration to get the property IDs for these properties.

parameter.name: first_prop
parameter.parameter_description: property ID to use for the first property

function.return: the number of properties that were installed

function.name: gtk_editable_label_get_editing
function.description: Returns whether the label is currently in “editing mode”.
function.return: %TRUE if @self is currently in editing mode

function.name: gtk_editable_label_new
function.description: Creates a new #GtkEditableLabel widget.

function.name: gtk_editable_label_start_editing
function.description: Switches the label into “editing mode”.

function.name: gtk_editable_label_stop_editing
function.description: Switches the label out of “editing mode”. If @commit is %TRUE, the resulting text is kept as the #GtkEditable:text property value, otherwise the resulting text is discarded and the label will keep its previous #GtkEditable:text property value.

parameter.name: commit
parameter.parameter_description: whether to set the edited text on the label

function.name: gtk_editable_select_region
function.description:
Selects a region of text.
The characters that are selected are those characters at positions from @start_pos up to, but not including @end_pos. If @end_pos is negative, then the characters selected are those characters from @start_pos to the end of the text.
Note that positions are specified in characters, not bytes.

function.name: gtk_editable_set_alignment
function.description:
Sets the alignment for the contents of the editable.
This controls the horizontal positioning of the contents when the displayed text is shorter than the width of the editable.

parameter.name: xalign
parameter.parameter_description: The horizontal alignment, from 0 (left) to 1 (right). Reversed for RTL layouts

function.name: gtk_editable_set_editable
function.description: Determines if the user can edit the text in the editable widget or not.

parameter.name: is_editable
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE if the user is allowed to edit the text in the widget

function.name: gtk_editable_set_enable_undo
function.description:
If enabled, changes to @editable will be saved for undo/redo actions.
This results in an additional copy of text changes and are not stored in secure memory. As such, undo is forcefully disabled when #GtkText:visibility is set to %FALSE.

function.name: gtk_editable_set_max_width_chars
function.description: Sets the desired maximum width in characters of @editable.

parameter.name: n_chars
parameter.parameter_description: the new desired maximum width, in characters

function.name: gtk_editable_set_position
function.description:
Sets the cursor position in the editable to the given value.
The cursor is displayed before the character with the given (base 0) index in the contents of the editable. The value must be less than or equal to the number of characters in the editable. A value of -1 indicates that the position should be set after the last character of the editable. Note that @position is in characters, not in bytes.

function.name: gtk_editable_set_text
function.description: Sets the text in the editable to the given value, replacing the current contents.

function.name: gtk_editable_set_width_chars
function.description:
Changes the size request of the editable to be about the right size for @n_chars characters.
Note that it changes the size request, the size can still be affected by how you pack the widget into containers. If @n_chars is -1, the size reverts to the default size.

function.name: gtk_emoji_chooser_new
function.description: Creates a new #GtkEmojiChooser.

function.name: gtk_entry_buffer_delete_text
function.description:
Deletes a sequence of characters from the buffer. @n_chars characters are deleted starting at @position. If @n_chars is negative, then all characters until the end of the text are deleted.
If @position or @n_chars are out of bounds, then they are coerced to sane values.
Note that the positions are specified in characters, not bytes.

parameter.name: position
parameter.parameter_description: position at which to delete text

function.name: gtk_entry_buffer_emit_deleted_text
function.description: Used when subclassing #GtkEntryBuffer

parameter.name: position
parameter.parameter_description: position at which text was deleted

function.name: gtk_entry_buffer_emit_inserted_text
function.description: Used when subclassing #GtkEntryBuffer

parameter.name: position
parameter.parameter_description: position at which text was inserted

function.name: gtk_entry_buffer_get_bytes
function.description: Retrieves the length in bytes of the buffer. See gtk_entry_buffer_get_length().
function.return: The byte length of the buffer.

function.name: gtk_entry_buffer_get_length
function.description: Retrieves the length in characters of the buffer.
function.return: The number of characters in the buffer.

function.name: gtk_entry_buffer_get_max_length
function.description: Retrieves the maximum allowed length of the text in @buffer. See gtk_entry_buffer_set_max_length().
function.return: the maximum allowed number of characters in #GtkEntryBuffer, or 0 if there is no maximum.

function.name: gtk_entry_buffer_get_text
function.description:
Retrieves the contents of the buffer.
The memory pointer returned by this call will not change unless this object emits a signal, or is finalized.
function.return: a pointer to the contents of the widget as a string. This string points to internally allocated storage in the buffer and must not be freed, modified or stored.

function.name: gtk_entry_buffer_insert_text
function.description:
Inserts @n_chars characters of @chars into the contents of the buffer, at position @position.
If @n_chars is negative, then characters from chars will be inserted until a null-terminator is found. If @position or @n_chars are out of bounds, or the maximum buffer text length is exceeded, then they are coerced to sane values.
Note that the position and length are in characters, not in bytes.

parameter.name: position
parameter.parameter_description: the position at which to insert text.

parameter.name: chars
parameter.parameter_description: the text to insert into the buffer.

parameter.name: n_chars
parameter.parameter_description: the length of the text in characters, or -1

function.return: The number of characters actually inserted.

function.name: gtk_entry_buffer_new
function.description:
Create a new GtkEntryBuffer object.
Optionally, specify initial text to set in the buffer.

function.name: gtk_entry_buffer_set_max_length
function.description: Sets the maximum allowed length of the contents of the buffer. If the current contents are longer than the given length, then they will be truncated to fit.

parameter.name: max_length
parameter.parameter_description: the maximum length of the entry buffer, or 0 for no maximum. (other than the maximum length of entries.) The value passed in will be clamped to the range 0-65536.

function.name: gtk_entry_buffer_set_text
function.description:
Sets the text in the buffer.
This is roughly equivalent to calling gtk_entry_buffer_delete_text() and gtk_entry_buffer_insert_text().
Note that @n_chars is in characters, not in bytes.

parameter.name: n_chars
parameter.parameter_description: the number of characters in @text, or -1

function.name: gtk_entry_completion_complete
function.description: Requests a completion operation, or in other words a refiltering of the current list with completions, using the current key. The completion list view will be updated accordingly.

function.name: gtk_entry_completion_compute_prefix
function.description: Computes the common prefix that is shared by all rows in @completion that start with @key. If no row matches @key, %NULL will be returned. Note that a text column must have been set for this function to work, see gtk_entry_completion_set_text_column() for details.
function.return: The common prefix all rows starting with @key or %NULL if no row matches @key.

function.name: gtk_entry_completion_get_completion_prefix
function.description: Get the original text entered by the user that triggered the completion or %NULL if there’s no completion ongoing.
function.return: the prefix for the current completion

function.name: gtk_entry_completion_get_entry
function.description: Gets the entry @completion has been attached to.
function.return: The entry @completion has been attached to

function.name: gtk_entry_completion_get_inline_completion
function.description: Returns whether the common prefix of the possible completions should be automatically inserted in the entry.
function.return: %TRUE if inline completion is turned on

function.name: gtk_entry_completion_get_inline_selection
function.description: Returns %TRUE if inline-selection mode is turned on.

function.name: gtk_entry_completion_get_minimum_key_length
function.description: Returns the minimum key length as set for @completion.
function.return: The currently used minimum key length

function.name: gtk_entry_completion_get_model
function.description: Returns the model the #GtkEntryCompletion is using as data source. Returns %NULL if the model is unset.
function.return: A #GtkTreeModel, or %NULL if none is currently being used

function.name: gtk_entry_completion_get_popup_completion
function.description: Returns whether the completions should be presented in a popup window.
function.return: %TRUE if popup completion is turned on

function.name: gtk_entry_completion_get_popup_set_width
function.description: Returns whether the completion popup window will be resized to the width of the entry.
function.return: %TRUE if the popup window will be resized to the width of the entry

function.name: gtk_entry_completion_get_popup_single_match
function.description: Returns whether the completion popup window will appear even if there is only a single match.
function.return: %TRUE if the popup window will appear regardless of the number of matches

function.name: gtk_entry_completion_get_text_column
function.description: Returns the column in the model of @completion to get strings from.

function.name: gtk_entry_completion_insert_prefix
function.description: Requests a prefix insertion.

function.name: gtk_entry_completion_new
function.description: Creates a new #GtkEntryCompletion object.

function.name: gtk_entry_completion_new_with_area
function.description: Creates a new #GtkEntryCompletion object using the specified @area to layout cells in the underlying #GtkTreeViewColumn for the drop-down menu.

function.name: gtk_entry_completion_set_inline_completion
function.description: Sets whether the common prefix of the possible completions should be automatically inserted in the entry.

function.name: gtk_entry_completion_set_inline_selection
function.description: Sets whether it is possible to cycle through the possible completions inside the entry.

function.name: gtk_entry_completion_set_match_func
function.description: Sets the match function for @completion to be @func. The match function is used to determine if a row should or should not be in the completion list.

function.name: gtk_entry_completion_set_minimum_key_length
function.description: Requires the length of the search key for @completion to be at least @length. This is useful for long lists, where completing using a small key takes a lot of time and will come up with meaningless results anyway (ie, a too large dataset).

parameter.name: length
parameter.parameter_description: the minimum length of the key in order to start completing

function.name: gtk_entry_completion_set_model
function.description: Sets the model for a #GtkEntryCompletion. If @completion already has a model set, it will remove it before setting the new model. If model is %NULL, then it will unset the model.

function.name: gtk_entry_completion_set_popup_completion
function.description: Sets whether the completions should be presented in a popup window.

function.name: gtk_entry_completion_set_popup_set_width
function.description: Sets whether the completion popup window will be resized to be the same width as the entry.

parameter.name: popup_set_width
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE to make the width of the popup the same as the entry

function.name: gtk_entry_completion_set_popup_single_match
function.description: Sets whether the completion popup window will appear even if there is only a single match. You may want to set this to %FALSE if you are using [inline completion][GtkEntryCompletion--inline-completion].

parameter.name: popup_single_match
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE if the popup should appear even for a single match

function.name: gtk_entry_completion_set_text_column
function.description:
Convenience function for setting up the most used case of this code: a completion list with just strings. This function will set up @completion to have a list displaying all (and just) strings in the completion list, and to get those strings from @column in the model of @completion.
This functions creates and adds a #GtkCellRendererText for the selected column. If you need to set the text column, but don't want the cell renderer, use g_object_set() to set the #GtkEntryCompletion:text-column property directly.

parameter.name: column
parameter.parameter_description: the column in the model of @completion to get strings from

function.name: gtk_entry_get_activates_default
function.description: Retrieves the value set by gtk_entry_set_activates_default().
function.return: %TRUE if the entry will activate the default widget

function.name: gtk_entry_get_alignment
function.description: Gets the value set by gtk_entry_set_alignment().

function.name: gtk_entry_get_attributes
function.description: Gets the attribute list that was set on the entry using gtk_entry_set_attributes(), if any.
function.return: the attribute list, or %NULL if none was set.

function.name: gtk_entry_get_buffer
function.description: Get the #GtkEntryBuffer object which holds the text for this widget.

function.name: gtk_entry_get_completion
function.description: Returns the auxiliary completion object currently in use by @entry.
function.return: The auxiliary completion object currently in use by @entry.

function.name: gtk_entry_get_current_icon_drag_source
function.description: Returns the index of the icon which is the source of the current DND operation, or -1.
function.return: index of the icon which is the source of the current DND operation, or -1.

function.name: gtk_entry_get_extra_menu
function.description: Gets the menu model set with gtk_entry_set_extra_menu().

function.name: gtk_entry_get_has_frame
function.description: Gets the value set by gtk_entry_set_has_frame().
function.return: whether the entry has a beveled frame

function.name: gtk_entry_get_icon_activatable
function.description: Returns whether the icon is activatable.

function.name: gtk_entry_get_icon_area
function.description:
Gets the area where entry’s icon at @icon_pos is drawn. This function is useful when drawing something to the entry in a draw callback.
If the entry is not realized or has no icon at the given position, @icon_area is filled with zeros. Otherwise, @icon_area will be filled with the icon's allocation, relative to @entry's allocation.

parameter.name: icon_area
parameter.parameter_description: Return location for the icon’s area

function.name: gtk_entry_get_icon_at_pos
function.description: Finds the icon at the given position and return its index. The position’s coordinates are relative to the @entry’s top left corner. If @x, @y doesn’t lie inside an icon, -1 is returned. This function is intended for use in a #GtkWidget::query-tooltip signal handler.

parameter.name: x
parameter.parameter_description: the x coordinate of the position to find, relative to @entry

parameter.name: y
parameter.parameter_description: the y coordinate of the position to find, relative to @entry

function.return: the index of the icon at the given position, or -1

function.name: gtk_entry_get_icon_gicon
function.description: Retrieves the #GIcon used for the icon, or %NULL if there is no icon or if the icon was set by some other method (e.g., by paintable or icon name).
function.return: A #GIcon, or %NULL if no icon is set or if the icon is not a #GIcon

function.name: gtk_entry_get_icon_name
function.description: Retrieves the icon name used for the icon, or %NULL if there is no icon or if the icon was set by some other method (e.g., by paintable or gicon).
function.return: An icon name, or %NULL if no icon is set or if the icon wasn’t set from an icon name

function.name: gtk_entry_get_icon_paintable
function.description:
Retrieves the #GdkPaintable used for the icon.
If no #GdkPaintable was used for the icon, %NULL is returned.
function.return: A #GdkPaintable, or %NULL if no icon is set for this position or the icon set is not a #GdkPaintable.

function.name: gtk_entry_get_icon_sensitive
function.description: Returns whether the icon appears sensitive or insensitive.

function.name: gtk_entry_get_icon_storage_type
function.description: Gets the type of representation being used by the icon to store image data. If the icon has no image data, the return value will be %GTK_IMAGE_EMPTY.

function.name: gtk_entry_get_icon_tooltip_markup
function.description: Gets the contents of the tooltip on the icon at the specified position in @entry.
function.return: the tooltip text, or %NULL. Free the returned string with g_free() when done.

function.name: gtk_entry_get_icon_tooltip_text
function.description: Gets the contents of the tooltip on the icon at the specified position in @entry.
function.return: the tooltip text, or %NULL. Free the returned string with g_free() when done.

function.name: gtk_entry_get_input_hints
function.description: Gets the value of the #GtkEntry:input-hints property.

function.name: gtk_entry_get_input_purpose
function.description: Gets the value of the #GtkEntry:input-purpose property.

function.name: gtk_entry_get_invisible_char
function.description: Retrieves the character displayed in place of the real characters for entries with visibility set to false. See gtk_entry_set_invisible_char().
function.return: the current invisible char, or 0, if the entry does not show invisible text at all.

function.name: gtk_entry_get_max_length
function.description:
Retrieves the maximum allowed length of the text in @entry. See gtk_entry_set_max_length().
This is equivalent to getting @entry's #GtkEntryBuffer and calling gtk_entry_buffer_get_max_length() on it.
function.return: the maximum allowed number of characters in #GtkEntry, or 0 if there is no maximum.

function.name: gtk_entry_get_overwrite_mode
function.description: Gets the value set by gtk_entry_set_overwrite_mode().
function.return: whether the text is overwritten when typing.

function.name: gtk_entry_get_placeholder_text
function.description: Retrieves the text that will be displayed when @entry is empty and unfocused
function.return: a pointer to the placeholder text as a string. This string points to internally allocated storage in the widget and must not be freed, modified or stored. If no placeholder text has been set, %NULL will be returned.

function.name: gtk_entry_get_progress_fraction
function.description: Returns the current fraction of the task that’s been completed. See gtk_entry_set_progress_fraction().

function.name: gtk_entry_get_progress_pulse_step
function.description: Retrieves the pulse step set with gtk_entry_set_progress_pulse_step().

function.name: gtk_entry_get_tabs
function.description: Gets the tabstops that were set on the entry using gtk_entry_set_tabs(), if any.
function.return: the tabstops, or %NULL if none was set.

function.name: gtk_entry_get_text_length
function.description:
Retrieves the current length of the text in @entry.
This is equivalent to getting @entry's #GtkEntryBuffer and calling gtk_entry_buffer_get_length() on it.
function.return: the current number of characters in #GtkEntry, or 0 if there are none.

function.name: gtk_entry_get_visibility
function.description: Retrieves whether the text in @entry is visible. See gtk_entry_set_visibility().
function.return: %TRUE if the text is currently visible

function.name: gtk_entry_grab_focus_without_selecting
function.description:
Causes @entry to have keyboard focus.
It behaves like gtk_widget_grab_focus(), except that it doesn't select the contents of the entry. You only want to call this on some special entries which the user usually doesn't want to replace all text in, such as search-as-you-type entries.

function.name: gtk_entry_new
function.description: Creates a new entry.

function.name: gtk_entry_new_with_buffer
function.description: Creates a new entry with the specified text buffer.

parameter.name: buffer
parameter.parameter_description: The buffer to use for the new #GtkEntry.

function.name: gtk_entry_progress_pulse
function.description: Indicates that some progress is made, but you don’t know how much. Causes the entry’s progress indicator to enter “activity mode,” where a block bounces back and forth. Each call to gtk_entry_progress_pulse() causes the block to move by a little bit (the amount of movement per pulse is determined by gtk_entry_set_progress_pulse_step()).

function.name: gtk_entry_reset_im_context
function.description:
Reset the input method context of the entry if needed.
This can be necessary in the case where modifying the buffer would confuse on-going input method behavior.

function.name: gtk_entry_set_activates_default
function.description: If @setting is %TRUE, pressing Enter in the @entry will activate the default widget for the window containing the entry. This usually means that the dialog box containing the entry will be closed, since the default widget is usually one of the dialog buttons.

parameter.name: setting
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE to activate window’s default widget on Enter keypress

function.name: gtk_entry_set_alignment
function.description: Sets the alignment for the contents of the entry. This controls the horizontal positioning of the contents when the displayed text is shorter than the width of the entry.

parameter.name: xalign
parameter.parameter_description: The horizontal alignment, from 0 (left) to 1 (right). Reversed for RTL layouts

function.name: gtk_entry_set_attributes
function.description: Sets a #PangoAttrList; the attributes in the list are applied to the entry text.

function.name: gtk_entry_set_buffer
function.description: Set the #GtkEntryBuffer object which holds the text for this widget.

function.name: gtk_entry_set_completion
gtk_entry_set_extra_menu
function.description: Sets a menu model to add when constructing the context menu for @entry.

function.name: gtk_entry_set_has_frame
function.description: Sets whether the entry has a beveled frame around it.

function.name: gtk_entry_set_icon_activatable
function.description: Sets whether the icon is activatable.

parameter.name: activatable
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE if the icon should be activatable

function.name: gtk_entry_set_icon_drag_source
function.description: Sets up the icon at the given position so that GTK will start a drag operation when the user clicks and drags the icon.

parameter.name: actions
parameter.parameter_description: a bitmask of the allowed drag actions

function.name: gtk_entry_set_icon_from_gicon
function.description:
Sets the icon shown in the entry at the specified position from the current icon theme. If the icon isn’t known, a “broken image” icon will be displayed instead.
If @icon is %NULL, no icon will be shown in the specified position.

parameter.name: icon_pos
parameter.parameter_description: The position at which to set the icon

function.name: gtk_entry_set_icon_from_icon_name
function.description:
Sets the icon shown in the entry at the specified position from the current icon theme.
If the icon name isn’t known, a “broken image” icon will be displayed instead.
If @icon_name is %NULL, no icon will be shown in the specified position.

parameter.name: icon_pos
parameter.parameter_description: The position at which to set the icon

function.name: gtk_entry_set_icon_from_paintable
function.description:
Sets the icon shown in the specified position using a #GdkPaintable
If @paintable is %NULL, no icon will be shown in the specified position.

function.name: gtk_entry_set_icon_sensitive
function.description: Sets the sensitivity for the specified icon.

parameter.name: sensitive
parameter.parameter_description: Specifies whether the icon should appear sensitive or insensitive

function.name: gtk_entry_set_icon_tooltip_markup
function.description:
Sets @tooltip as the contents of the tooltip for the icon at the specified position. @tooltip is assumed to be marked up with the [Pango text markup language][PangoMarkupFormat].
Use %NULL for @tooltip to remove an existing tooltip.
See also gtk_widget_set_tooltip_markup() and gtk_entry_set_icon_tooltip_text().

parameter.name: tooltip
parameter.parameter_description: the contents of the tooltip for the icon, or %NULL

function.name: gtk_entry_set_icon_tooltip_text
function.description:
Sets @tooltip as the contents of the tooltip for the icon at the specified position.
Use %NULL for @tooltip to remove an existing tooltip.
See also gtk_widget_set_tooltip_text() and gtk_entry_set_icon_tooltip_markup().
If you unset the widget tooltip via gtk_widget_set_tooltip_text() or gtk_widget_set_tooltip_markup(), this sets GtkWidget:has-tooltip to %FALSE, which suppresses icon tooltips too. You can resolve this by then calling gtk_widget_set_has_tooltip() to set GtkWidget:has-tooltip back to %TRUE, or setting at least one non-empty tooltip on any icon achieves the same result.

parameter.name: tooltip
parameter.parameter_description: the contents of the tooltip for the icon, or %NULL

function.name: gtk_entry_set_input_hints
function.description: Sets the #GtkEntry:input-hints property, which allows input methods to fine-tune their behaviour.

function.name: gtk_entry_set_input_purpose
function.description: Sets the #GtkEntry:input-purpose property which can be used by on-screen keyboards and other input methods to adjust their behaviour.

function.name: gtk_entry_set_invisible_char
function.description: Sets the character to use in place of the actual text when gtk_entry_set_visibility() has been called to set text visibility to %FALSE. i.e. this is the character used in “password mode” to show the user how many characters have been typed. By default, GTK picks the best invisible char available in the current font. If you set the invisible char to 0, then the user will get no feedback at all; there will be no text on the screen as they type.

function.name: gtk_entry_set_max_length
function.description:
Sets the maximum allowed length of the contents of the widget. If the current contents are longer than the given length, then they will be truncated to fit.
This is equivalent to getting @entry's #GtkEntryBuffer and calling gtk_entry_buffer_set_max_length() on it. ]|

parameter.name: max
parameter.parameter_description: the maximum length of the entry, or 0 for no maximum. (other than the maximum length of entries.) The value passed in will be clamped to the range 0-65536.

function.name: gtk_entry_set_overwrite_mode
function.description: Sets whether the text is overwritten when typing in the #GtkEntry.

function.name: gtk_entry_set_placeholder_text
function.description: Sets text to be displayed in @entry when it is empty. This can be used to give a visual hint of the expected contents of the #GtkEntry.

parameter.name: text
parameter.parameter_description: a string to be displayed when @entry is empty and unfocused, or %NULL

function.name: gtk_entry_set_progress_fraction
function.description: Causes the entry’s progress indicator to “fill in” the given fraction of the bar. The fraction should be between 0.0 and 1.0, inclusive.

parameter.name: fraction
parameter.parameter_description: fraction of the task that’s been completed

function.name: gtk_entry_set_progress_pulse_step
function.description: Sets the fraction of total entry width to move the progress bouncing block for each call to gtk_entry_progress_pulse().

function.name: gtk_entry_set_tabs
function.description: Sets a #PangoTabArray; the tabstops in the array are applied to the entry text.

function.name: gtk_entry_set_visibility
function.description:
Sets whether the contents of the entry are visible or not. When visibility is set to %FALSE, characters are displayed as the invisible char, and will also appear that way when the text in the entry widget is copied elsewhere.
By default, GTK picks the best invisible character available in the current font, but it can be changed with gtk_entry_set_invisible_char().
Note that you probably want to set #GtkEntry:input-purpose to %GTK_INPUT_PURPOSE_PASSWORD or %GTK_INPUT_PURPOSE_PIN to inform input methods about the purpose of this entry, in addition to setting visibility to %FALSE.

parameter.name: visible
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE if the contents of the entry are displayed as plaintext

function.name: gtk_entry_unset_invisible_char
function.description: Unsets the invisible char previously set with gtk_entry_set_invisible_char(). So that the default invisible char is used again.

function.name: gtk_enumerate_printers
function.description: Calls a function for all #GtkPrinters. If @func returns %TRUE, the enumeration is stopped.

parameter.name: func
parameter.parameter_description: a function to call for each printer

parameter.name: destroy
parameter.parameter_description: function to call if @data is no longer needed

parameter.name: wait
parameter.parameter_description: if %TRUE, wait in a recursive mainloop until all printers are enumerated; otherwise return early

function.name: gtk_event_controller_focus_contains_focus
function.description: Returns the value of the GtkEventControllerFocus:contains-focus property.
function.return: %TRUE if focus is within @self or one of its children

function.name: gtk_event_controller_focus_is_focus
function.description: Returns the value of the GtkEventControllerFocus:is-focus property.
function.return: %TRUE if focus is within @self but not one of its children

function.name: gtk_event_controller_focus_new
function.description: Creates a new event controller that will handle focus events.

function.name: gtk_event_controller_get_current_event
function.description: Returns the event that is currently being handled by the controller, and %NULL at other times.
function.return: the event is current handled by @controller

function.name: gtk_event_controller_get_current_event_device
function.description: Returns the device of the event that is currently being handled by the controller, and %NULL otherwise.
function.return: device of the event is current handled by @controller

function.name: gtk_event_controller_get_current_event_state
function.description: Returns the modifier state of the event that is currently being handled by the controller, and 0 otherwise.
function.return: modifier state of the event is current handled by @controller

function.name: gtk_event_controller_get_current_event_time
function.description: Returns the timestamp of the event that is currently being handled by the controller, and 0 otherwise.
function.return: timestamp of the event is current handled by @controller

function.name: gtk_event_controller_get_name
function.description: Gets the name of @controller.

function.name: gtk_event_controller_get_propagation_limit
function.description: Gets the propagation limit of the event controller.

function.name: gtk_event_controller_get_propagation_phase
function.description: Gets the propagation phase at which @controller handles events.

function.name: gtk_event_controller_get_widget
function.description: Returns the #GtkWidget this controller relates to.

function.name: gtk_event_controller_key_forward
function.description:
Forwards the current event of this @controller to a @widget.
This function can only be used in handlers for the #GtkEventControllerKey::key-pressed, #GtkEventControllerKey::key-released or #GtkEventControllerKey::modifiers signals.

function.name: gtk_event_controller_key_get_group
function.description: Gets the key group of the current event of this @controller. See gdk_key_event_get_group().

function.name: gtk_event_controller_key_get_im_context
function.description: Gets the input method context of the key @controller.

function.name: gtk_event_controller_key_new
function.description: Creates a new event controller that will handle key events.

function.name: gtk_event_controller_key_set_im_context
function.description: Sets the input method context of the key @controller.

function.name: gtk_event_controller_legacy_new
function.description: Creates a new legacy event controller.

function.name: gtk_event_controller_motion_contains_pointer
function.description: Returns the value of the GtkEventControllerMotion:contains-pointer property.
function.return: %TRUE if a pointer is within @self or one of its children

function.name: gtk_event_controller_motion_is_pointer
function.description: Returns the value of the GtkEventControllerMotion:is-pointer property.
function.return: %TRUE if a pointer is within @self but not one of its children

function.name: gtk_event_controller_motion_new
function.description: Creates a new event controller that will handle motion events.

function.name: gtk_event_controller_reset
function.description: Resets the @controller to a clean state. Every interaction the controller did through gtk_event_controller_handle_event() will be dropped at this point.

function.name: gtk_event_controller_scroll_get_flags
function.description: Gets the flags conditioning the scroll controller behavior.

function.name: gtk_event_controller_scroll_new
function.description: Creates a new event controller that will handle scroll events.

function.name: gtk_event_controller_scroll_set_flags
function.description: Sets the flags conditioning scroll controller behavior.

function.name: gtk_event_controller_set_name
function.description: Sets a name on the controller that can be used for debugging.

function.name: gtk_event_controller_set_propagation_limit
function.description:
Sets the event propagation limit on the event controller.
If the limit is set to %GTK_LIMIT_SAME_NATIVE, the controller won't handle events that are targeted at widgets on a different surface, such as popovers.

function.name: gtk_event_controller_set_propagation_phase
function.description:
Sets the propagation phase at which a controller handles events.
If @phase is %GTK_PHASE_NONE, no automatic event handling will be performed, but other additional gesture maintenance will. In that phase, the events can be managed by calling gtk_event_controller_handle_event().

function.name: gtk_every_filter_new
function.description:
Creates a new empty "every" filter. Use gtk_multi_filter_append() to add filters to it.
This filter matches an item if each of the filters added to it matches the item. In particular, this means that if no filter has been added to it, the filter matches every item.

function.name: gtk_expander_get_child
function.description: Gets the child widget of @expander.

function.name: gtk_expander_get_expanded
function.description:
Queries a #GtkExpander and returns its current state. Returns %TRUE if the child widget is revealed.
See gtk_expander_set_expanded().
function.return: the current state of the expander

function.name: gtk_expander_get_label
function.description:
Fetches the text from a label widget including any embedded underlines indicating mnemonics and Pango markup, as set by gtk_expander_set_label(). If the label text has not been set the return value will be %NULL. This will be the case if you create an empty button with gtk_button_new() to use as a container.
Note that this function behaved differently in versions prior to 2.14 and used to return the label text stripped of embedded underlines indicating mnemonics and Pango markup. This problem can be avoided by fetching the label text directly from the label widget.
function.return: The text of the label widget. This string is owned by the widget and must not be modified or freed.

function.name: gtk_expander_get_label_widget
function.description: Retrieves the label widget for the frame. See gtk_expander_set_label_widget().
function.return: the label widget, or %NULL if there is none

function.name: gtk_expander_get_resize_toplevel
function.description: Returns whether the expander will resize the toplevel widget containing the expander upon resizing and collpasing.

function.name: gtk_expander_get_use_markup
function.description: Returns whether the label’s text is interpreted as marked up with the [Pango text markup language][PangoMarkupFormat]. See gtk_expander_set_use_markup().
function.return: %TRUE if the label’s text will be parsed for markup

function.name: gtk_expander_get_use_underline
function.description: Returns whether an embedded underline in the expander label indicates a mnemonic. See gtk_expander_set_use_underline().
function.return: %TRUE if an embedded underline in the expander label indicates the mnemonic accelerator keys

function.name: gtk_expander_new
