function.description: Creates a new expander using @label as the text of the label.

function.name: gtk_expander_new_with_mnemonic
function.description: Creates a new expander using @label as the text of the label. If characters in @label are preceded by an underscore, they are underlined. If you need a literal underscore character in a label, use “__” (two underscores). The first underlined character represents a keyboard accelerator called a mnemonic. Pressing Alt and that key activates the button.

parameter.name: label
parameter.parameter_description: the text of the label with an underscore in front of the mnemonic character

function.name: gtk_expander_set_child
function.description: Sets the child widget of @expander.

function.name: gtk_expander_set_expanded
function.description: Sets the state of the expander. Set to %TRUE, if you want the child widget to be revealed, and %FALSE if you want the child widget to be hidden.

parameter.name: expanded
parameter.parameter_description: whether the child widget is revealed

function.name: gtk_expander_set_label
function.description:
Sets the text of the label of the expander to @label.
This will also clear any previously set labels.

function.name: gtk_expander_set_label_widget
function.description: Set the label widget for the expander. This is the widget that will appear embedded alongside the expander arrow.

function.name: gtk_expander_set_resize_toplevel
function.description: Sets whether the expander will resize the toplevel widget containing the expander upon resizing and collpasing.

function.name: gtk_expander_set_use_markup
function.description: Sets whether the text of the label contains markup in [Pango’s text markup language][PangoMarkupFormat]. See gtk_label_set_markup().

parameter.name: use_markup
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE if the label’s text should be parsed for markup

function.name: gtk_expander_set_use_underline
function.description: If true, an underline in the text of the expander label indicates the next character should be used for the mnemonic accelerator key.

parameter.name: use_underline
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE if underlines in the text indicate mnemonics

function.name: gtk_expression_bind
function.description:
Bind @target's property named @property to @self.
The value that @self evaluates to is set via g_object_set() on @target. This is repeated whenever @self changes to ensure that the object's property stays synchronized with @self.
If @self's evaluation fails, @target's @property is not updated. You can ensure that this doesn't happen by using a fallback expression.
Note that this function takes ownership of @self. If you want to keep it around, you should gtk_expression_ref() it beforehand.

parameter.name: target
parameter.parameter_description: the target object to bind to

parameter.name: property
parameter.parameter_description: name of the property on @target to bind to

parameter.name: this_
parameter.parameter_description: the this argument for the evaluation of @self

function.name: gtk_expression_evaluate
function.description:
Evaluates the given expression and on success stores the result in @value. The #GType of @value will be the type given by gtk_expression_get_value_type().
It is possible that expressions cannot be evaluated - for example when the expression references objects that have been destroyed or set to %NULL. In that case @value will remain empty and %FALSE will be returned.

parameter.name: this_
parameter.parameter_description: the this argument for the evaluation

function.return: %TRUE if the expression could be evaluated

function.name: gtk_expression_get_value_type
function.description: Gets the #GType that this expression evaluates to. This type is constant and will not change over the lifetime of this expression.

function.name: gtk_expression_is_static
function.description:
Checks if the expression is static.
A static expression will never change its result when gtk_expression_evaluate() is called on it with the same arguments.
That means a call to gtk_expression_watch() is not necessary because it will never trigger a notify.

function.name: gtk_expression_ref
function.description: Acquires a reference on the given #GtkExpression.

function.name: gtk_expression_unref
function.description:
Releases a reference on the given #GtkExpression.
If the reference was the last, the resources associated to the @self are freed.

function.name: gtk_expression_watch
function.description:
Installs a watch for the given @expression that calls the @notify function whenever the evaluation of @self may have changed.
GTK cannot guarantee that the evaluation did indeed change when the @notify gets invoked, but it guarantees the opposite: When it did in fact change, the @notify will be invoked.

parameter.name: notify
parameter.parameter_description: callback to invoke when the expression changes

parameter.name: user_data
parameter.parameter_description: user data to pass to @notify callback

function.return: The newly installed watch. Note that the only reference held to the watch will be released when the watch is unwatched which can happen automatically, and not just via gtk_expression_watch_unwatch(). You should call gtk_expression_watch_ref() if you want to keep the watch around.

function.name: gtk_expression_watch_evaluate
function.description:
Evaluates the watched expression and on success stores the result in @value.
This is equivalent to calling gtk_expression_evaluate() with the expression and this pointer originally used to create @watch.
function.return: %TRUE if the expression could be evaluated and @value was set

function.name: gtk_expression_watch_ref
function.description: Acquires a reference on the given #GtkExpressionWatch.

function.name: gtk_expression_watch_unref
function.description:
Releases a reference on the given #GtkExpressionWatch.
If the reference was the last, the resources associated to @self are freed.

function.name: gtk_expression_watch_unwatch
function.description: Stops watching an expression that was established via gtk_expression_watch().

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_add_choice
function.description: Adds a 'choice' to the file chooser. This is typically implemented as a combobox or, for boolean choices, as a checkbutton. You can select a value using gtk_file_chooser_set_choice() before the dialog is shown, and you can obtain the user-selected value in the ::response signal handler using gtk_file_chooser_get_choice().

parameter.name: label
parameter.parameter_description: user-visible label for the added choice

parameter.name: options
parameter.parameter_description: ids for the options of the choice, or %NULL for a boolean choice

parameter.name: option_labels
parameter.parameter_description: user-visible labels for the options, must be the same length as @options

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_add_filter
function.description:
Adds @filter to the list of filters that the user can select between. When a filter is selected, only files that are passed by that filter are displayed.
Note that the @chooser takes ownership of the filter if it is floating, so you have to ref and sink it if you want to keep a reference.

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_add_shortcut_folder
function.description: Adds a folder to be displayed with the shortcut folders in a file chooser.

parameter.name: folder
parameter.parameter_description: a #GFile for the folder to add

function.return: %TRUE if the folder could be added successfully, %FALSE otherwise.

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_dialog_new
function.description: Creates a new #GtkFileChooserDialog. This function is analogous to gtk_dialog_new_with_buttons().

parameter.name: parent
parameter.parameter_description: Transient parent of the dialog, or %NULL

parameter.name: action
parameter.parameter_description: Open or save mode for the dialog

parameter.name: first_button_text
parameter.parameter_description: text to go in the first button, or %NULL

parameter.name: Varargs
parameter.parameter_description: response ID for the first button, then additional (button, id) pairs, ending with %NULL

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_error_quark
function.description: Registers an error quark for #GtkFileChooser if necessary.
function.return: The error quark used for #GtkFileChooser errors.

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_get_action
function.description: Gets the type of operation that the file chooser is performing; see gtk_file_chooser_set_action().
function.return: the action that the file selector is performing

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_get_choice
function.description: Gets the currently selected option in the 'choice' with the given ID.

parameter.name: id
parameter.parameter_description: the ID of the choice to get

function.return: the ID of the currently selected option

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_get_create_folders
function.description: Gets whether file chooser will offer to create new folders. See gtk_file_chooser_set_create_folders().
function.return: %TRUE if the Create Folder button should be displayed.

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_get_current_folder
function.description: Gets the current folder of @chooser as #GFile.

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_get_current_name
function.description:
Gets the current name in the file selector, as entered by the user in the text entry for “Name”.
This is meant to be used in save dialogs, to get the currently typed filename when the file itself does not exist yet.
function.return: The raw text from the file chooser’s “Name” entry. Free this with g_free(). Note that this string is not a full pathname or URI; it is whatever the contents of the entry are. Note also that this string is in UTF-8 encoding, which is not necessarily the system’s encoding for filenames.

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_get_file
function.description:
Gets the #GFile for the currently selected file in the file selector. If multiple files are selected, one of the files will be returned at random.
If the file chooser is in folder mode, this function returns the selected folder.
function.return: a selected #GFile. You own the returned file; use g_object_unref() to release it.

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_get_files
function.description: Lists all the selected files and subfolders in the current folder of @chooser as #GFile.
function.return: a list model containing a #GFile for each selected file and subfolder in the current folder. Free the returned list with g_object_unref().

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_get_filter
function.description: Gets the current filter; see gtk_file_chooser_set_filter().

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_get_filters
function.description:
Gets the current set of user-selectable filters, as a list model; see gtk_file_chooser_add_filter(), gtk_file_chooser_remove_filter().
You should not modify the returned list model. Future changes to @chooser may or may not affect the returned model.
function.return: a #GListModel containing the current set of user-selectable filters.

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_get_select_multiple
function.description: Gets whether multiple files can be selected in the file selector. See gtk_file_chooser_set_select_multiple().
function.return: %TRUE if multiple files can be selected.

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_get_shortcut_folders
function.description:
Queries the list of shortcut folders in the file chooser, as set by gtk_file_chooser_add_shortcut_folder().
You should not modify the returned list model. Future changes to @chooser may or may not affect the returned model.

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_native_get_accept_label
function.description: Retrieves the custom label text for the accept button.
function.return: The custom label, or %NULL for the default. This string is owned by GTK+ and should not be modified or freed

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_native_get_cancel_label
function.description: Retrieves the custom label text for the cancel button.
function.return: The custom label, or %NULL for the default. This string is owned by GTK+ and should not be modified or freed

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_native_new
function.description: Creates a new #GtkFileChooserNative.

parameter.name: parent
parameter.parameter_description: Transient parent of the native, or %NULL

parameter.name: action
parameter.parameter_description: Open or save mode for the dialog

parameter.name: accept_label
parameter.parameter_description: text to go in the accept button, or %NULL for the default

parameter.name: cancel_label
parameter.parameter_description: text to go in the cancel button, or %NULL for the default

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_native_set_accept_label
function.description:
Sets the custom label text for the accept button.
If characters in @label are preceded by an underscore, they are underlined. If you need a literal underscore character in a label, use “__” (two underscores). The first underlined character represents a keyboard accelerator called a mnemonic. Pressing Alt and that key activates the button.

parameter.name: accept_label
parameter.parameter_description: custom label or %NULL for the default

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_native_set_cancel_label
function.description:
Sets the custom label text for the cancel button.
If characters in @label are preceded by an underscore, they are underlined. If you need a literal underscore character in a label, use “__” (two underscores). The first underlined character represents a keyboard accelerator called a mnemonic. Pressing Alt and that key activates the button.

parameter.name: cancel_label
parameter.parameter_description: custom label or %NULL for the default

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_remove_choice
function.description: Removes a 'choice' that has been added with gtk_file_chooser_add_choice().

parameter.name: id
parameter.parameter_description: the ID of the choice to remove

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_remove_filter
function.description: Removes @filter from the list of filters that the user can select between.

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_remove_shortcut_folder
function.description: Removes a folder from the shortcut folders in a file chooser.

parameter.name: folder
parameter.parameter_description: a #GFile for the folder to remove

function.return: %TRUE if the folder could be removed successfully, %FALSE otherwise.

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_set_action
function.description: Sets the type of operation that the chooser is performing; the user interface is adapted to suit the selected action. For example, an option to create a new folder might be shown if the action is %GTK_FILE_CHOOSER_ACTION_SAVE but not if the action is %GTK_FILE_CHOOSER_ACTION_OPEN.

parameter.name: action
parameter.parameter_description: the action that the file selector is performing

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_set_choice
function.description: Selects an option in a 'choice' that has been added with gtk_file_chooser_add_choice(). For a boolean choice, the possible options are "true" and "false".

parameter.name: id
parameter.parameter_description: the ID of the choice to set

parameter.name: option
parameter.parameter_description: the ID of the option to select

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_set_create_folders
function.description: Sets whether file chooser will offer to create new folders. This is only relevant if the action is not set to be %GTK_FILE_CHOOSER_ACTION_OPEN.

parameter.name: create_folders
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE if the Create Folder button should be displayed

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_set_current_folder
function.description: Sets the current folder for @chooser from a #GFile.
function.return: %TRUE if the folder could be changed successfully, %FALSE otherwise.

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_set_current_name
function.description:
Sets the current name in the file selector, as if entered by the user. Note that the name passed in here is a UTF-8 string rather than a filename. This function is meant for such uses as a suggested name in a “Save As...” dialog. You can pass “Untitled.doc” or a similarly suitable suggestion for the @name.
If you want to preselect a particular existing file, you should use gtk_file_chooser_set_file() instead.
Please see the documentation for those functions for an example of using gtk_file_chooser_set_current_name() as well.

parameter.name: name
parameter.parameter_description: the filename to use, as a UTF-8 string

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_set_file

parameter.name: error
parameter.parameter_description: location to store the error, or %NULL to ignore errors.

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_set_filter
function.description: Sets the current filter; only the files that pass the filter will be displayed. If the user-selectable list of filters is non-empty, then the filter should be one of the filters in that list. Setting the current filter when the list of filters is empty is useful if you want to restrict the displayed set of files without letting the user change it.

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_set_select_multiple
function.description: Sets whether multiple files can be selected in the file selector. This is only relevant if the action is set to be %GTK_FILE_CHOOSER_ACTION_OPEN or %GTK_FILE_CHOOSER_ACTION_SELECT_FOLDER.

parameter.name: select_multiple
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE if multiple files can be selected.

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_widget_new
function.description: Creates a new #GtkFileChooserWidget. This is a file chooser widget that can be embedded in custom windows, and it is the same widget that is used by #GtkFileChooserDialog.

parameter.name: action
parameter.parameter_description: Open or save mode for the widget

function.name: gtk_file_filter_add_mime_type
function.description: Adds a rule allowing a given mime type to @filter.

function.name: gtk_file_filter_add_pattern
function.description: Adds a rule allowing a shell style glob to a filter.

function.name: gtk_file_filter_add_pixbuf_formats
function.description:
Adds a rule allowing image files in the formats supported by GdkPixbuf.
This is equivalent to calling gtk_file_filter_add_mime_type() for all the supported mime types.

function.name: gtk_file_filter_get_attributes
function.description:
Gets the attributes that need to be filled in for the #GFileInfo passed to this filter.
This function will not typically be used by applications; it is intended principally for use in the implementation of #GtkFileChooser.

function.name: gtk_file_filter_get_name
function.description: Gets the human-readable name for the filter. See gtk_file_filter_set_name().
function.return: The human-readable name of the filter, or %NULL. This value is owned by GTK and must not be modified or freed.

function.name: gtk_file_filter_new
gtk_file_filter_new_from_gvariant
function.description: Deserialize a file filter from an a{sv} variant in the format produced by gtk_file_filter_to_gvariant().

function.name: gtk_file_filter_set_name
function.description: Sets a human-readable name of the filter; this is the string that will be displayed in the file chooser if there is a selectable list of filters.

parameter.name: name
parameter.parameter_description: the human-readable-name for the filter, or %NULL to remove any existing name.

function.name: gtk_file_filter_to_gvariant
function.description: Serialize a file filter to an a{sv} variant.

function.name: gtk_filter_changed
function.description:
Emits the #GtkFilter::changed signal to notify all users of the filter that the filter changed. Users of the filter should then check items again via gtk_filter_match().
Depending on the @change parameter, not all items need to be changed, but only some. Refer to the #GtkFilterChange documentation for details.
This function is intended for implementors of #GtkFilter subclasses and should not be called from other functions.

function.name: gtk_filter_get_strictness
function.description:
Gets the known strictness of @filters. If the strictness is not known, %GTK_FILTER_MATCH_SOME is returned.
This value may change after emission of the #GtkFilter::changed signal.
This function is meant purely for optimization purposes, filters can choose to omit implementing it, but #GtkFilterListModel uses it.

function.name: gtk_filter_list_model_get_filter
function.description: Gets the #GtkFilter currently set on @self.
function.return: The filter currently in use or %NULL if the list isn't filtered

function.name: gtk_filter_list_model_get_incremental
function.description: Returns whether incremental filtering was enabled via gtk_filter_list_model_set_incremental().

function.name: gtk_filter_list_model_get_model
function.description: Gets the model currently filtered or %NULL if none.

function.name: gtk_filter_list_model_get_pending
function.return: The number of items not yet filtered

function.name: gtk_filter_list_model_new
function.description: Creates a new #GtkFilterListModel that will filter @model using the given @filter.

parameter.name: filter
parameter.parameter_description: filter or %NULL to not filter items

function.name: gtk_filter_list_model_set_filter
function.description: Sets the filter used to filter items.

parameter.name: filter
parameter.parameter_description: filter to use or %NULL to not filter items

function.name: gtk_filter_list_model_set_incremental
function.description:
When incremental filtering is enabled, the GtkFilterListModel will not run filters immediately, but will instead queue an idle handler that incrementally filters the items and adds them to the list. This of course means that items are not instantly added to the list, but only appear incrementally.
When your filter blocks the UI while filtering, you might consider turning this on. Depending on your model and filters, this may become interesting around 10,000 to 100,000 items.
By default, incremental filtering is disabled.
See gtk_filter_list_model_get_pending() for progress information about an ongoing incremental filtering operation.

function.name: gtk_filter_list_model_set_model
function.description:
Sets the model to be filtered.
Note that GTK makes no effort to ensure that @model conforms to the item type of @self. It assumes that the caller knows what they are doing and have set up an appropriate filter to ensure that item types match.

function.name: gtk_filter_match
function.description: Checks if the given @item is matched by the filter or not.
function.return: %TRUE if the filter matches the item and a filter model should keep it, %FALSE if not.

function.name: gtk_fixed_get_child_position
function.description:
Retrieves the translation transformation of the given child #GtkWidget in the given #GtkFixed container.
See also: gtk_fixed_get_child_transform().

function.name: gtk_fixed_get_child_transform
function.description: Retrieves the transformation for @widget set using gtk_fixed_set_child_transform().
function.return: a #GskTransform or %NULL in case no transform has been set on @widget

function.name: gtk_fixed_layout_child_get_transform
function.description: Retrieves the transformation of the child of a #GtkFixedLayout.

function.name: gtk_fixed_layout_child_set_transform
function.description: Sets the transformation of the child of a #GtkFixedLayout.

function.name: gtk_fixed_layout_new
function.description: Creates a new #GtkFixedLayout.

function.name: gtk_fixed_move
function.description: Sets a translation transformation to the given @x and @y coordinates to the child @widget of the given #GtkFixed container.

parameter.name: x
parameter.parameter_description: the horizontal position to move the widget to.

parameter.name: y
parameter.parameter_description: the vertical position to move the widget to.

function.name: gtk_fixed_new
function.description: Creates a new #GtkFixed.

function.name: gtk_fixed_put
function.description: Adds a widget to a #GtkFixed container and assigns a translation transformation to the given @x and @y coordinates to it.

parameter.name: x
parameter.parameter_description: the horizontal position to place the widget at.

parameter.name: y
parameter.parameter_description: the vertical position to place the widget at.

function.name: gtk_fixed_remove
function.description: Removes a child from @fixed, after it has been added with gtk_fixed_put().

function.name: gtk_fixed_set_child_transform
function.description:
Sets the transformation for @widget.
This is a convenience function that retrieves the #GtkFixedLayoutChild instance associated to @widget and calls gtk_fixed_layout_child_set_transform().

parameter.name: transform
parameter.parameter_description: the transformation assigned to @widget or %NULL to reset @widget's transform

function.name: gtk_flatten_list_model_get_model
function.description: Gets the model set via gtk_flatten_list_model_set_model().

function.name: gtk_flatten_list_model_get_model_for_item
function.description: Returns the model containing the item at the given position.
function.return: the model containing the item at @position

function.name: gtk_flatten_list_model_new
function.description: Creates a new #GtkFlattenListModel that flattens @list.

function.name: gtk_flatten_list_model_set_model
function.description: Sets a new model to be flattened.

function.name: gtk_flow_box_bind_model
function.description:
Binds @model to @box.
If @box was already bound to a model, that previous binding is destroyed.
The contents of @box are cleared and then filled with widgets that represent items from @model. @box is updated whenever @model changes. If @model is %NULL, @box is left empty.
It is undefined to add or remove widgets directly (for example, with gtk_flow_box_insert()) while @box is bound to a model.
Note that using a model is incompatible with the filtering and sorting functionality in GtkFlowBox. When using a model, filtering and sorting should be implemented by the model.

parameter.name: create_widget_func
parameter.parameter_description: a function that creates widgets for items

function.name: gtk_flow_box_child_changed
function.description:
Marks @child as changed, causing any state that depends on this to be updated. This affects sorting and filtering.
Note that calls to this method must be in sync with the data used for the sorting and filtering functions. For instance, if the list is mirroring some external data set, and *two* children changed in the external data set when you call gtk_flow_box_child_changed() on the first child, the sort function must only read the new data for the first of the two changed children, otherwise the resorting of the children will be wrong.
This generally means that if you don’t fully control the data model, you have to duplicate the data that affects the sorting and filtering functions into the widgets themselves. Another alternative is to call gtk_flow_box_invalidate_sort() on any model change, but that is more expensive.

function.name: gtk_flow_box_child_get_child
function.description: Gets the child widget of @self.

function.name: gtk_flow_box_child_get_index
function.description: Gets the current index of the @child in its #GtkFlowBox container.
function.return: the index of the @child, or -1 if the @child is not in a flow box.

function.name: gtk_flow_box_child_is_selected
function.description: Returns whether the @child is currently selected in its #GtkFlowBox container.

function.name: gtk_flow_box_child_new
function.description: Creates a new #GtkFlowBoxChild, to be used as a child of a #GtkFlowBox.

function.name: gtk_flow_box_child_set_child
function.description: Sets the child widget of @self.

function.name: gtk_flow_box_get_activate_on_single_click
function.description: Returns whether children activate on single clicks.
function.return: %TRUE if children are activated on single click, %FALSE otherwise

function.name: gtk_flow_box_get_child_at_index
function.description: Gets the nth child in the @box.
function.return: the child widget, which will always be a #GtkFlowBoxChild or %NULL in case no child widget with the given index exists.

function.name: gtk_flow_box_get_child_at_pos
function.description: Gets the child in the (@x, @y) position. Both @x and @y are assumed to be relative to the origin of @box.

parameter.name: x
parameter.parameter_description: the x coordinate of the child

parameter.name: y
parameter.parameter_description: the y coordinate of the child

function.return: the child widget, which will always be a #GtkFlowBoxChild or %NULL in case no child widget exists for the given x and y coordinates.

function.name: gtk_flow_box_get_column_spacing
function.description: Gets the horizontal spacing.

function.name: gtk_flow_box_get_homogeneous
function.description: Returns whether the box is homogeneous (all children are the same size). See gtk_box_set_homogeneous().

function.name: gtk_flow_box_get_max_children_per_line
function.description: Gets the maximum number of children per line.
function.return: the maximum number of children per line

function.name: gtk_flow_box_get_min_children_per_line
function.description: Gets the minimum number of children per line.
function.return: the minimum number of children per line

function.name: gtk_flow_box_get_row_spacing
function.description: Gets the vertical spacing.

function.name: gtk_flow_box_get_selected_children
function.description: Creates a list of all selected children.
function.return: A #GList containing the #GtkWidget for each selected child. Free with g_list_free() when done.

function.name: gtk_flow_box_get_selection_mode
function.description: Gets the selection mode of @box.

function.name: gtk_flow_box_insert
function.description:
Inserts the @widget into @box at @position.
If a sort function is set, the widget will actually be inserted at the calculated position.
If @position is -1, or larger than the total number of children in the @box, then the @widget will be appended to the end.

function.name: gtk_flow_box_invalidate_filter
function.description:
Updates the filtering for all children.
Call this function when the result of the filter function on the @box is changed due ot an external factor. For instance, this would be used if the filter function just looked for a specific search term, and the entry with the string has changed.

function.name: gtk_flow_box_invalidate_sort
gtk_flow_box_new
function.description: Creates a GtkFlowBox.

function.name: gtk_flow_box_remove
function.description: Removes a child from @box.

function.name: gtk_flow_box_select_all
function.description: Select all children of @box, if the selection mode allows it.

function.name: gtk_flow_box_select_child
function.description: Selects a single child of @box, if the selection mode allows it.

function.name: gtk_flow_box_selected_foreach
function.description:
Calls a function for each selected child.
Note that the selection cannot be modified from within this function.

parameter.name: func
parameter.parameter_description: the function to call for each selected child

parameter.name: data
parameter.parameter_description: user data to pass to the function

function.name: gtk_flow_box_set_activate_on_single_click
function.description: If @single is %TRUE, children will be activated when you click on them, otherwise you need to double-click.

parameter.name: single
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE to emit child-activated on a single click

function.name: gtk_flow_box_set_column_spacing
function.description: Sets the horizontal space to add between children. See the #GtkFlowBox:column-spacing property.

function.name: gtk_flow_box_set_filter_func
function.description:
By setting a filter function on the @box one can decide dynamically which of the children to show. For instance, to implement a search function that only shows the children matching the search terms.
The @filter_func will be called for each child after the call, and it will continue to be called each time a child changes (via gtk_flow_box_child_changed()) or when gtk_flow_box_invalidate_filter() is called.
Note that using a filter function is incompatible with using a model (see gtk_flow_box_bind_model()).

parameter.name: filter_func
parameter.parameter_description: callback that lets you filter which children to show

function.name: gtk_flow_box_set_hadjustment
function.description:
Hooks up an adjustment to focus handling in @box. The adjustment is also used for autoscrolling during rubberband selection. See gtk_scrolled_window_get_hadjustment() for a typical way of obtaining the adjustment, and gtk_flow_box_set_vadjustment()for setting the vertical adjustment.
The adjustments have to be in pixel units and in the same coordinate system as the allocation for immediate children of the box.

parameter.name: adjustment
parameter.parameter_description: an adjustment which should be adjusted when the focus is moved among the descendents of @container

function.name: gtk_flow_box_set_homogeneous
function.description: Sets the #GtkFlowBox:homogeneous property of @box, controlling whether or not all children of @box are given equal space in the box.

parameter.name: homogeneous
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE to create equal allotments, %FALSE for variable allotments

function.name: gtk_flow_box_set_max_children_per_line
function.description:
Sets the maximum number of children to request and allocate space for in @box’s orientation.
Setting the maximum number of children per line limits the overall natural size request to be no more than @n_children children long in the given orientation.

parameter.name: n_children
parameter.parameter_description: the maximum number of children per line

function.name: gtk_flow_box_set_min_children_per_line
function.description: Sets the minimum number of children to line up in @box’s orientation before flowing.

parameter.name: n_children
parameter.parameter_description: the minimum number of children per line

function.name: gtk_flow_box_set_row_spacing
function.description: Sets the vertical space to add between children. See the #GtkFlowBox:row-spacing property.

function.name: gtk_flow_box_set_selection_mode
function.description: Sets how selection works in @box. See #GtkSelectionMode for details.

function.name: gtk_flow_box_set_sort_func
function.description:
By setting a sort function on the @box, one can dynamically reorder the children of the box, based on the contents of the children.
The @sort_func will be called for each child after the call, and will continue to be called each time a child changes (via gtk_flow_box_child_changed()) and when gtk_flow_box_invalidate_sort() is called.
Note that using a sort function is incompatible with using a model (see gtk_flow_box_bind_model()).

function.name: gtk_flow_box_set_vadjustment
function.description:
Hooks up an adjustment to focus handling in @box. The adjustment is also used for autoscrolling during rubberband selection. See gtk_scrolled_window_get_vadjustment() for a typical way of obtaining the adjustment, and gtk_flow_box_set_hadjustment()for setting the horizontal adjustment.
The adjustments have to be in pixel units and in the same coordinate system as the allocation for immediate children of the box.

parameter.name: adjustment
parameter.parameter_description: an adjustment which should be adjusted when the focus is moved among the descendents of @container

function.name: gtk_flow_box_unselect_all
function.description: Unselect all children of @box, if the selection mode allows it.

function.name: gtk_flow_box_unselect_child
function.description: Unselects a single child of @box, if the selection mode allows it.

function.name: gtk_font_chooser_get_font
function.description:
Gets the currently-selected font name.
Note that this can be a different string than what you set with gtk_font_chooser_set_font(), as the font chooser widget may normalize font names and thus return a string with a different structure. For example, “Helvetica Italic Bold 12” could be normalized to “Helvetica Bold Italic 12”.
Use pango_font_description_equal() if you want to compare two font descriptions.
function.return: A string with the name of the current font, or %NULL if no font is selected. You must free this string with g_free().

function.name: gtk_font_chooser_get_font_desc
function.description:
Gets the currently-selected font.
Note that this can be a different string than what you set with gtk_font_chooser_set_font(), as the font chooser widget may normalize font names and thus return a string with a different structure. For example, “Helvetica Italic Bold 12” could be normalized to “Helvetica Bold Italic 12”.
Use pango_font_description_equal() if you want to compare two font descriptions.
function.return: A #PangoFontDescription for the current font, or %NULL if no font is selected.

function.name: gtk_font_chooser_get_font_face
function.description:
Gets the #PangoFontFace representing the selected font group details (i.e. family, slant, weight, width, etc).
If the selected font is not installed, returns %NULL.

function.name: gtk_font_chooser_get_font_family
function.description:
Gets the #PangoFontFamily representing the selected font family. Font families are a collection of font faces.
If the selected font is not installed, returns %NULL.
function.return: A #PangoFontFamily representing the selected font family, or %NULL. The returned object is owned by @fontchooser and must not be modified or freed.

function.name: gtk_gesture_get_bounding_box
function.description:
If there are touch sequences being currently handled by @gesture, this function returns %TRUE and fills in @rect with the bounding box containing all active touches. Otherwise, %FALSE will be returned.
Note: This function will yield unexpected results on touchpad gestures. Since there is no correlation between physical and pixel distances, these will look as if constrained in an infinitely small area, @rect width and height will thus be 0 regardless of the number of touchpoints.

parameter.name: rect
parameter.parameter_description: bounding box containing all active touches.

function.return: %TRUE if there are active touches, %FALSE otherwise

function.name: gtk_gesture_get_bounding_box_center
function.description: If there are touch sequences being currently handled by @gesture, this function returns %TRUE and fills in @x and @y with the center of the bounding box containing all active touches. Otherwise, %FALSE will be returned.

parameter.name: x
parameter.parameter_description: X coordinate for the bounding box center

parameter.name: y
parameter.parameter_description: Y coordinate for the bounding box center

function.return: %FALSE if no active touches are present, %TRUE otherwise

function.name: gtk_gesture_get_group
function.description: Returns all gestures in the group of @gesture
function.return: The list of #GtkGestures, free with g_list_free()

function.name: gtk_gesture_get_last_event
function.description:
Returns the last event that was processed for @sequence.
Note that the returned pointer is only valid as long as the @sequence is still interpreted by the @gesture. If in doubt, you should make a copy of the event.

function.name: gtk_gesture_get_last_updated_sequence
function.description: Returns the #GdkEventSequence that was last updated on @gesture.

function.name: gtk_gesture_get_point
function.description: If @sequence is currently being interpreted by @gesture, this function returns %TRUE and fills in @x and @y with the last coordinates stored for that event sequence. The coordinates are always relative to the widget allocation.

parameter.name: x
parameter.parameter_description: return location for X axis of the sequence coordinates

parameter.name: y
parameter.parameter_description: return location for Y axis of the sequence coordinates

function.name: gtk_gesture_get_sequence_state
function.description: Returns the @sequence state, as seen by @gesture.

function.name: gtk_gesture_get_sequences
function.description: Returns the list of #GdkEventSequences currently being interpreted by @gesture.
function.return: A list of #GdkEventSequences, the list elements are owned by GTK and must not be freed or modified, the list itself must be deleted through g_list_free()

function.name: gtk_gesture_group
function.description:
Adds @gesture to the same group than @group_gesture. Gestures are by default isolated in their own groups.
Both gestures must have been added to the same widget before they can be grouped.
When gestures are grouped, the state of #GdkEventSequences is kept in sync for all of those, so calling gtk_gesture_set_sequence_state(), on one will transfer the same value to the others.
Groups also perform an "implicit grabbing" of sequences, if a #GdkEventSequence state is set to #GTK_EVENT_SEQUENCE_CLAIMED on one group, every other gesture group attached to the same #GtkWidget will switch the state for that sequence to #GTK_EVENT_SEQUENCE_DENIED.

function.name: gtk_gesture_handles_sequence
function.description: Returns %TRUE if @gesture is currently handling events corresponding to @sequence.

function.name: gtk_gesture_is_active
function.description: Returns %TRUE if the gesture is currently active. A gesture is active meanwhile there are touch sequences interacting with it.

function.name: gtk_gesture_is_grouped_with
function.description: Returns %TRUE if both gestures pertain to the same group.

function.name: gtk_gesture_is_recognized
function.description: Returns %TRUE if the gesture is currently recognized. A gesture is recognized if there are as many interacting touch sequences as required by @gesture.

function.name: gtk_gesture_long_press_get_delay_factor
function.description: Returns the delay factor as set by gtk_gesture_long_press_set_delay_factor().

function.name: gtk_gesture_long_press_new
function.description: Returns a newly created #GtkGesture that recognizes long presses.

function.name: gtk_gesture_long_press_set_delay_factor
function.description: Applies the given delay factor. The default long press time will be multiplied by this value. Valid values are in the range [0.5..2.0].

function.name: gtk_gesture_pan_get_orientation
function.description: Returns the orientation of the pan gestures that this @gesture expects.
function.return: the expected orientation for pan gestures

function.name: gtk_gesture_pan_new
function.description: Returns a newly created #GtkGesture that recognizes pan gestures.

function.name: gtk_gesture_pan_set_orientation
function.description: Sets the orientation to be expected on pan gestures.

function.name: gtk_gesture_rotate_get_angle_delta
function.description: If @gesture is active, this function returns the angle difference in radians since the gesture was first recognized. If @gesture is not active, 0 is returned.

function.name: gtk_gesture_rotate_new
function.description: Returns a newly created #GtkGesture that recognizes 2-touch rotation gestures.

function.name: gtk_gesture_set_sequence_state
function.description:
Sets the state of @sequence in @gesture. Sequences start in state #GTK_EVENT_SEQUENCE_NONE, and whenever they change state, they can never go back to that state. Likewise, sequences in state #GTK_EVENT_SEQUENCE_DENIED cannot turn back to a not denied state. With these rules, the lifetime of an event sequence is constrained to the next four:
* None * None → Denied * None → Claimed * None → Claimed → Denied
Note: Due to event handling ordering, it may be unsafe to set the state on another gesture within a #GtkGesture::begin signal handler, as the callback might be executed before the other gesture knows about the sequence. A safe way to perform this could be:
|[ static void first_gesture_begin_cb (GtkGesture *first_gesture, GdkEventSequence *sequence, gpointer user_data) { gtk_gesture_set_sequence_state (first_gesture, sequence, GTK_EVENT_SEQUENCE_CLAIMED); gtk_gesture_set_sequence_state (second_gesture, sequence, GTK_EVENT_SEQUENCE_DENIED); }
static void second_gesture_begin_cb (GtkGesture *second_gesture, GdkEventSequence *sequence, gpointer user_data) { if (gtk_gesture_get_sequence_state (first_gesture, sequence) == GTK_EVENT_SEQUENCE_CLAIMED) gtk_gesture_set_sequence_state (second_gesture, sequence, GTK_EVENT_SEQUENCE_DENIED); } ]|
If both gestures are in the same group, just set the state on the gesture emitting the event, the sequence will be already be initialized to the group's global state when the second gesture processes the event.
function.return: %TRUE if @sequence is handled by @gesture, and the state is changed successfully

function.name: gtk_gesture_set_state
function.description: Sets the state of all sequences that @gesture is currently interacting with. See gtk_gesture_set_sequence_state() for more details on sequence states.
function.return: %TRUE if the state of at least one sequence was changed successfully

function.name: gtk_gesture_single_get_button
function.description: Returns the button number @gesture listens for, or 0 if @gesture reacts to any button press.
function.return: The button number, or 0 for any button

function.name: gtk_gesture_single_get_current_button
function.description: Returns the button number currently interacting with @gesture, or 0 if there is none.

function.name: gtk_gesture_single_get_current_sequence
function.description: Returns the event sequence currently interacting with @gesture. This is only meaningful if gtk_gesture_is_active() returns %TRUE.

function.name: gtk_gesture_single_get_exclusive
function.description: Gets whether a gesture is exclusive. For more information, see gtk_gesture_single_set_exclusive().

function.name: gtk_gesture_single_get_touch_only
function.description: Returns %TRUE if the gesture is only triggered by touch events.
function.return: %TRUE if the gesture only handles touch events

function.name: gtk_gesture_single_set_button
function.description: Sets the button number @gesture listens to. If non-0, every button press from a different button number will be ignored. Touch events implicitly match with button 1.

parameter.name: button
parameter.parameter_description: button number to listen to, or 0 for any button

function.name: gtk_gesture_single_set_exclusive
function.description: Sets whether @gesture is exclusive. An exclusive gesture will only handle pointer and "pointer emulated" touch events, so at any given time, there is only one sequence able to interact with those.

function.name: gtk_gesture_single_set_touch_only
function.description: If @touch_only is %TRUE, @gesture will only handle events of type #GDK_TOUCH_BEGIN, #GDK_TOUCH_UPDATE or #GDK_TOUCH_END. If %FALSE, mouse events will be handled too.

function.name: gtk_gesture_stylus_get_axes
function.description: Returns the current values for the requested @axes. This function must be called from either the #GtkGestureStylus::down, #GtkGestureStylus::motion, #GtkGestureStylus::up or #GtkGestureStylus::proximity signals.

parameter.name: axes
parameter.parameter_description: array of requested axes, terminated with #GDK_AXIS_IGNORE

parameter.name: values
parameter.parameter_description: return location for the axis values

function.return: %TRUE if there is a current value for the axes

function.name: gtk_gesture_stylus_get_axis
function.description:
Returns the current value for the requested @axis.
This function must be called from the handler of one of the #GtkGestureStylus::down, #GtkGestureStylus::motion, #GtkGestureStylus::up or #GtkGestureStylus::proximity signals.

parameter.name: value
parameter.parameter_description: return location for the axis value

function.return: %TRUE if there is a current value for the axis

function.name: gtk_gesture_stylus_get_backlog
function.description:
By default, GTK will limit rate of input events. On stylus input where accuracy of strokes is paramount, this function returns the accumulated coordinate/timing state before the emission of the current #GtkGestureStylus::motion signal.
This function may only be called within a #GtkGestureStylus::motion signal handler, the state given in this signal and obtainable through gtk_gesture_stylus_get_axis() call express the latest (most up-to-date) state in motion history.
The @backlog is provided in chronological order.

parameter.name: backlog
parameter.parameter_description: coordinates and times for the backlog events

parameter.name: n_elems
parameter.parameter_description: return location for the number of elements

function.return: %TRUE if there is a backlog to unfold in the current state.

function.name: gtk_gesture_stylus_get_device_tool
function.description: Returns the #GdkDeviceTool currently driving input through this gesture. This function must be called from either the #GtkGestureStylus::down, #GtkGestureStylus::motion, #GtkGestureStylus::up or #GtkGestureStylus::proximity signal handlers.

function.name: gtk_gesture_stylus_new
function.description: Creates a new #GtkGestureStylus.

function.name: gtk_gesture_swipe_get_velocity

parameter.name: velocity_x
parameter.parameter_description: return value for the velocity in the X axis, in pixels/sec

parameter.name: velocity_y
parameter.parameter_description: return value for the velocity in the Y axis, in pixels/sec

function.name: gtk_gesture_swipe_new
function.description: Returns a newly created #GtkGesture that recognizes swipes.

function.name: gtk_gesture_ungroup
function.description: Separates @gesture into an isolated group.

function.name: gtk_gesture_zoom_get_scale_delta
function.description: If @gesture is active, this function returns the zooming difference since the gesture was recognized (hence the starting point is considered 1:1). If @gesture is not active, 1 is returned.

function.name: gtk_gesture_zoom_new
function.description: Returns a newly created #GtkGesture that recognizes zoom in/out gestures (usually known as pinch/zoom).

function.name: gtk_get_binary_age
function.description: Returns the binary age as passed to `libtool` when building the GTK library the process is running against. If `libtool` means nothing to you, don't worry about it.
function.return: the binary age of the GTK library

function.name: gtk_get_debug_flags
function.description:
Returns the GTK debug flags that are currently active.
This function is intended for GTK modules that want to adjust their debug output based on GTK debug flags.

function.name: gtk_get_default_language
function.description:
Returns the #PangoLanguage for the default language currently in effect. (Note that this can change over the life of an application.) The default language is derived from the current locale. It determines, for example, whether GTK uses the right-to-left or left-to-right text direction.
This function is equivalent to pango_language_get_default(). See that function for details.
function.return: the default language as a #PangoLanguage, must not be freed

function.name: gtk_get_event_widget
function.description: If @event is %NULL or the event was not associated with any widget, returns %NULL, otherwise returns the widget that received the event originally.
function.return: the widget that originally received @event, or %NULL

function.name: gtk_get_interface_age
function.description: Returns the interface age as passed to `libtool` when building the GTK library the process is running against. If `libtool` means nothing to you, don't worry about it.
function.return: the interface age of the GTK library

function.name: gtk_get_locale_direction
function.description:
Get the direction of the current locale. This is the expected reading direction for text and UI.
This function depends on the current locale being set with setlocale() and will default to setting the %GTK_TEXT_DIR_LTR direction otherwise. %GTK_TEXT_DIR_NONE will never be returned.
GTK sets the default text direction according to the locale during gtk_init(), and you should normally use gtk_widget_get_direction() or gtk_widget_get_default_direction() to obtain the current direction.
This function is only needed rare cases when the locale is changed after GTK has already been initialized. In this case, you can use it to update the default text direction as follows:
|[<!-- language="C" --> setlocale (LC_ALL, new_locale); direction = gtk_get_locale_direction (); gtk_widget_set_default_direction (direction); ]|

function.name: gtk_get_major_version
function.description:
Returns the major version number of the GTK library. (e.g. in GTK version 3.1.5 this is 3.)
This function is in the library, so it represents the GTK library your code is running against. Contrast with the %GTK_MAJOR_VERSION macro, which represents the major version of the GTK headers you have included when compiling your code.
function.return: the major version number of the GTK library

function.name: gtk_get_micro_version
function.description:
Returns the micro version number of the GTK library. (e.g. in GTK version 3.1.5 this is 5.)
This function is in the library, so it represents the GTK library your code is are running against. Contrast with the %GTK_MICRO_VERSION macro, which represents the micro version of the GTK headers you have included when compiling your code.
function.return: the micro version number of the GTK library

function.name: gtk_get_minor_version
function.description:
Returns the minor version number of the GTK library. (e.g. in GTK version 3.1.5 this is 1.)
This function is in the library, so it represents the GTK library your code is are running against. Contrast with the %GTK_MINOR_VERSION macro, which represents the minor version of the GTK headers you have included when compiling your code.
function.return: the minor version number of the GTK library

function.name: gtk_gl_area_attach_buffers
function.description:
Ensures that the @area framebuffer object is made the current draw and read target, and that all the required buffers for the @area are created and bound to the framebuffer.
This function is automatically called before emitting the #GtkGLArea::render signal, and doesn't normally need to be called by application code.

function.name: gtk_gl_area_get_auto_render
function.description: Returns whether the area is in auto render mode or not.
function.return: %TRUE if the @area is auto rendering, %FALSE otherwise

function.name: gtk_gl_area_get_context
function.description: Retrieves the #GdkGLContext used by @area.

function.name: gtk_gl_area_get_error
function.description: Gets the current error set on the @area.

function.name: gtk_gl_area_get_has_depth_buffer
function.description: Returns whether the area has a depth buffer.
function.return: %TRUE if the @area has a depth buffer, %FALSE otherwise

function.name: gtk_gl_area_get_has_stencil_buffer
function.description: Returns whether the area has a stencil buffer.
function.return: %TRUE if the @area has a stencil buffer, %FALSE otherwise

function.name: gtk_gl_area_get_required_version
function.description: Retrieves the required version of OpenGL set using gtk_gl_area_set_required_version().

parameter.name: major
parameter.parameter_description: return location for the required major version

parameter.name: minor
parameter.parameter_description: return location for the required minor version

function.name: gtk_gl_area_get_use_es
function.description: Retrieves the value set by gtk_gl_area_set_use_es().
function.return: %TRUE if the #GtkGLArea should create an OpenGL ES context and %FALSE otherwise

function.name: gtk_gl_area_make_current
function.description:
Ensures that the #GdkGLContext used by @area is associated with the #GtkGLArea.
This function is automatically called before emitting the #GtkGLArea::render signal, and doesn't normally need to be called by application code.

function.name: gtk_gl_area_new
function.description: Creates a new #GtkGLArea widget.

function.name: gtk_gl_area_queue_render
function.description:
Marks the currently rendered data (if any) as invalid, and queues a redraw of the widget, ensuring that the #GtkGLArea::render signal is emitted during the draw.
This is only needed when the gtk_gl_area_set_auto_render() has been called with a %FALSE value. The default behaviour is to emit #GtkGLArea::render on each draw.

function.name: gtk_gl_area_set_auto_render
function.description:
If @auto_render is %TRUE the #GtkGLArea::render signal will be emitted every time the widget draws. This is the default and is useful if drawing the widget is faster.
If @auto_render is %FALSE the data from previous rendering is kept around and will be used for drawing the widget the next time, unless the window is resized. In order to force a rendering gtk_gl_area_queue_render() must be called. This mode is useful when the scene changes seldom, but takes a long time to redraw.

function.name: gtk_gl_area_set_error
function.description: Sets an error on the area which will be shown instead of the GL rendering. This is useful in the #GtkGLArea::create-context signal if GL context creation fails.

parameter.name: error
parameter.parameter_description: a new #GError, or %NULL to unset the error

function.name: gtk_gl_area_set_has_depth_buffer
function.description: If @has_depth_buffer is %TRUE the widget will allocate and enable a depth buffer for the target framebuffer. Otherwise there will be none.

function.name: gtk_gl_area_set_has_stencil_buffer
function.description: If @has_stencil_buffer is %TRUE the widget will allocate and enable a stencil buffer for the target framebuffer. Otherwise there will be none.

function.name: gtk_gl_area_set_required_version
function.description:
Sets the required version of OpenGL to be used when creating the context for the widget.
This function must be called before the area has been realized.

function.name: gtk_gl_area_set_use_es
function.description:
Sets whether the @area should create an OpenGL or an OpenGL ES context.
You should check the capabilities of the #GdkGLContext before drawing with either API.

parameter.name: use_es
parameter.parameter_description: whether to use OpenGL or OpenGL ES

function.name: gtk_grab_add
function.description:
Makes @widget the current grabbed widget.
This means that interaction with other widgets in the same application is blocked and mouse as well as keyboard events are delivered to this widget.
If @widget is not sensitive, it is not set as the current grabbed widget and this function does nothing.

parameter.name: widget
parameter.parameter_description: The widget that grabs keyboard and pointer events

function.name: gtk_grab_remove
function.description:
Removes the grab from the given widget.
You have to pair calls to gtk_grab_add() and gtk_grab_remove().
If @widget does not have the grab, this function does nothing.

parameter.name: widget
parameter.parameter_description: The widget which gives up the grab

function.name: gtk_grid_attach
function.description:
Adds a widget to the grid.
The position of @child is determined by @column and @row. The number of “cells” that @child will occupy is determined by @width and @height.

parameter.name: column
parameter.parameter_description: the column number to attach the left side of @child to

parameter.name: row
parameter.parameter_description: the row number to attach the top side of @child to

parameter.name: width
parameter.parameter_description: the number of columns that @child will span

parameter.name: height
parameter.parameter_description: the number of rows that @child will span

function.name: gtk_grid_attach_next_to
function.description:
Adds a widget to the grid.
The widget is placed next to @sibling, on the side determined by @side. When @sibling is %NULL, the widget is placed in row (for left or right placement) or column 0 (for top or bottom placement), at the end indicated by @side.
Attaching widgets labeled [1], [2], [3] with @sibling == %NULL and @side == %GTK_POS_LEFT yields a layout of [3][2][1].

parameter.name: sibling
parameter.parameter_description: the child of @grid that @child will be placed next to, or %NULL to place @child at the beginning or end

parameter.name: side
parameter.parameter_description: the side of @sibling that @child is positioned next to

parameter.name: width
parameter.parameter_description: the number of columns that @child will span

parameter.name: height
parameter.parameter_description: the number of rows that @child will span

function.name: gtk_grid_get_baseline_row
function.description: Returns which row defines the global baseline of @grid.
function.return: the row index defining the global baseline

function.name: gtk_grid_get_child_at
function.description: Gets the child of @grid whose area covers the grid cell at @column, @row.

parameter.name: column
parameter.parameter_description: the left edge of the cell

parameter.name: row
parameter.parameter_description: the top edge of the cell

function.return: the child at the given position, or %NULL

function.name: gtk_grid_get_column_homogeneous
function.description: Returns whether all columns of @grid have the same width.
function.return: whether all columns of @grid have the same width.

function.name: gtk_grid_get_column_spacing
function.description: Returns the amount of space between the columns of @grid.

function.name: gtk_grid_get_row_baseline_position
function.description: Returns the baseline position of @row as set by gtk_grid_set_row_baseline_position() or the default value %GTK_BASELINE_POSITION_CENTER.

function.name: gtk_grid_get_row_homogeneous
function.description: Returns whether all rows of @grid have the same height.
function.return: whether all rows of @grid have the same height.

function.name: gtk_grid_get_row_spacing
function.description: Returns the amount of space between the rows of @grid.

function.name: gtk_grid_insert_column
function.description:
Inserts a column at the specified position.
Children which are attached at or to the right of this position are moved one column to the right. Children which span across this position are grown to span the new column.

parameter.name: position
parameter.parameter_description: the position to insert the column at

function.name: gtk_grid_insert_next_to
function.description:
Inserts a row or column at the specified position.
The new row or column is placed next to @sibling, on the side determined by @side. If @side is %GTK_POS_TOP or %GTK_POS_BOTTOM, a row is inserted. If @side is %GTK_POS_LEFT of %GTK_POS_RIGHT, a column is inserted.

parameter.name: sibling
parameter.parameter_description: the child of @grid that the new row or column will be placed next to

parameter.name: side
parameter.parameter_description: the side of @sibling that @child is positioned next to

function.name: gtk_grid_insert_row
function.description:
Inserts a row at the specified position.
Children which are attached at or below this position are moved one row down. Children which span across this position are grown to span the new row.

parameter.name: position
parameter.parameter_description: the position to insert the row at

function.name: gtk_grid_layout_child_get_column
function.description: Retrieves the column number to which @child attaches its left side.

function.name: gtk_grid_layout_child_get_column_span
function.description: Retrieves the number of columns that @child spans to.

function.name: gtk_grid_layout_child_get_row
function.description: Retrieves the row number to which @child attaches its top side.

function.name: gtk_grid_layout_child_get_row_span
function.description: Retrieves the number of rows that @child spans to.

function.name: gtk_grid_layout_child_set_column
function.description: Sets the column number to attach the left side of @child.

function.name: gtk_grid_layout_child_set_column_span
function.description: Sets the number of columns @child spans to.

function.name: gtk_grid_layout_child_set_row
function.description: Sets the row to place @child in.

function.name: gtk_grid_layout_child_set_row_span
function.description: Sets the number of rows @child spans to.

function.name: gtk_grid_layout_get_baseline_row
function.description: Retrieves the row set with gtk_grid_layout_set_baseline_row().

function.name: gtk_grid_layout_get_column_homogeneous
function.description: Checks whether all columns of @grid should have the same width.
function.return: %TRUE if the columns are homogeneous, and %FALSE otherwise

function.name: gtk_grid_layout_get_column_spacing
function.description: Retrieves the spacing set with gtk_grid_layout_set_column_spacing().

function.name: gtk_grid_layout_get_row_baseline_position
function.description: Returns the baseline position of @row as set by gtk_grid_layout_set_row_baseline_position(), or the default value of %GTK_BASELINE_POSITION_CENTER.

function.name: gtk_grid_layout_get_row_homogeneous
function.description: Checks whether all rows of @grid should have the same height.
function.return: %TRUE if the rows are homogeneous, and %FALSE otherwise

function.name: gtk_grid_layout_get_row_spacing
function.description: Retrieves the spacing set with gtk_grid_layout_set_row_spacing().

function.name: gtk_grid_layout_new
function.description: Creates a new #GtkGridLayout.

function.name: gtk_grid_layout_set_baseline_row
function.description:
Sets which row defines the global baseline for the entire grid.
Each row in the grid can have its own local baseline, but only one of those is global, meaning it will be the baseline in the parent of the @grid.

function.name: gtk_grid_layout_set_column_homogeneous
function.description: Sets whether all columns of @grid should have the same width.

function.name: gtk_grid_layout_set_column_spacing
function.description: Sets the amount of space to insert between consecutive columns.

parameter.name: spacing
parameter.parameter_description: the amount of space between columns, in pixels

function.name: gtk_grid_layout_set_row_baseline_position
function.description: Sets how the baseline should be positioned on @row of the grid, in case that row is assigned more space than is requested.

function.name: gtk_grid_layout_set_row_homogeneous
function.description: Sets whether all rows of @grid should have the same height.

function.name: gtk_grid_layout_set_row_spacing
function.description: Sets the amount of space to insert between consecutive rows.

parameter.name: spacing
parameter.parameter_description: the amount of space between rows, in pixels

function.name: gtk_grid_new
function.description: Creates a new grid widget.

function.name: gtk_grid_query_child
function.description: Queries the attach points and spans of @child inside the given #GtkGrid.

parameter.name: column
parameter.parameter_description: the column used to attach the left side of @child

parameter.name: row
parameter.parameter_description: the row used to attach the top side of @child

function.name: gtk_grid_remove
function.description: Removes a child from @grid, after it has been added with gtk_grid_attach() or gtk_grid_attach_next_to().

function.name: gtk_grid_remove_column
function.description:
Removes a column from the grid.
Children that are placed in this column are removed, spanning children that overlap this column have their width reduced by one, and children after the column are moved to the left.

parameter.name: position
parameter.parameter_description: the position of the column to remove

function.name: gtk_grid_remove_row
function.description:
Removes a row from the grid.
Children that are placed in this row are removed, spanning children that overlap this row have their height reduced by one, and children below the row are moved up.

parameter.name: position
parameter.parameter_description: the position of the row to remove

function.name: gtk_grid_set_baseline_row
function.description: Sets which row defines the global baseline for the entire grid. Each row in the grid can have its own local baseline, but only one of those is global, meaning it will be the baseline in the parent of the @grid.

function.name: gtk_grid_set_column_homogeneous
function.description: Sets whether all columns of @grid will have the same width.

function.name: gtk_grid_set_column_spacing
function.description: Sets the amount of space between columns of @grid.

parameter.name: spacing
parameter.parameter_description: the amount of space to insert between columns

function.name: gtk_grid_set_row_baseline_position
function.description: Sets how the baseline should be positioned on @row of the grid, in case that row is assigned more space than is requested.

function.name: gtk_grid_set_row_homogeneous
function.description: Sets whether all rows of @grid will have the same height.

function.name: gtk_grid_set_row_spacing
function.description: Sets the amount of space between rows of @grid.

parameter.name: spacing
parameter.parameter_description: the amount of space to insert between rows

function.name: gtk_grid_view_get_enable_rubberband
function.description: Returns whether rows can be selected by dragging with the mouse.

function.name: gtk_grid_view_get_factory
function.description: Gets the factory that's currently used to populate list items.

function.name: gtk_grid_view_get_max_columns
function.description: Gets the maximum number of columns that the grid will use.

function.name: gtk_grid_view_get_min_columns
function.description: Gets the minimum number of columns that the grid will use.

function.name: gtk_grid_view_get_model
function.description: Gets the model that's currently used to read the items displayed.

function.name: gtk_grid_view_get_single_click_activate
function.description: Returns whether items will be activated on single click and selected on hover.
function.return: %TRUE if items are activated on single click

function.name: gtk_grid_view_new
function.description:
Creates a new #GtkGridView that uses the given @factory for mapping items to widgets.
The function takes ownership of the arguments, so you can write code like ``` grid_view = gtk_grid_view_new (create_model (), gtk_builder_list_item_factory_new_from_resource ("/resource.ui")); ```

parameter.name: factory
parameter.parameter_description: The factory to populate items with, or %NULL

function.return: a new #GtkGridView using the given @model and @factory

function.name: gtk_grid_view_set_enable_rubberband
function.description: Sets whether selections can be changed by dragging with the mouse.

function.name: gtk_grid_view_set_factory
function.description: Sets the #GtkListItemFactory to use for populating list items.

parameter.name: factory
parameter.parameter_description: the factory to use or %NULL for none

function.name: gtk_grid_view_set_max_columns
function.description:
Sets the maximum number of columns to use. This number must be at least 1.
If @max_columns is smaller than the minimum set via gtk_grid_view_set_min_columns(), that value is used instead.

function.name: gtk_grid_view_set_min_columns
function.description:
Sets the minimum number of columns to use. This number must be at least 1.
If @min_columns is smaller than the minimum set via gtk_grid_view_set_max_columns(), that value is ignored.

function.name: gtk_grid_view_set_model
function.description: Sets the #GtkSelectionModel to use for

parameter.name: model
parameter.parameter_description: the model to use or %NULL for none

function.name: gtk_grid_view_set_single_click_activate
function.description: Sets whether items should be activated on single click and selected on hover.

parameter.name: single_click_activate
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE to activate items on single click

function.name: gtk_header_bar_get_decoration_layout
function.description: Gets the decoration layout set with gtk_header_bar_set_decoration_layout().

function.name: gtk_header_bar_get_show_title_buttons
function.description: Returns whether this header bar shows the standard window title buttons.

function.name: gtk_header_bar_get_title_widget
function.description: Retrieves the title widget of the header. See gtk_header_bar_set_title_widget().
function.return: the title widget of the header, or %NULL if none has been set explicitly.

function.name: gtk_header_bar_new
function.description: Creates a new #GtkHeaderBar widget.

function.name: gtk_header_bar_pack_end
function.description: Adds @child to @bar, packed with reference to the end of the @bar.

function.name: gtk_header_bar_pack_start
function.description: Adds @child to @bar, packed with reference to the start of the @bar.

function.name: gtk_header_bar_remove
function.description: Removes a child from @bar, after it has been added with gtk_header_bar_pack_start(), gtk_header_bar_pack_end() or gtk_header_bar_set_title_widget().

function.name: gtk_header_bar_set_decoration_layout
function.description:
Sets the decoration layout for this header bar, overriding the #GtkSettings:gtk-decoration-layout setting.
There can be valid reasons for overriding the setting, such as a header bar design that does not allow for buttons to take room on the right, or only offers room for a single close button. Split header bars are another example for overriding the setting.
The format of the string is button names, separated by commas. A colon separates the buttons that should appear on the left from those on the right. Recognized button names are minimize, maximize, close and icon (the window icon).
For example, “icon:minimize,maximize,close” specifies a icon on the left, and minimize, maximize and close buttons on the right.

parameter.name: layout
parameter.parameter_description: a decoration layout, or %NULL to unset the layout

function.name: gtk_header_bar_set_show_title_buttons
function.description: Sets whether this header bar shows the standard window title buttons including close, maximize, and minimize.

function.name: gtk_header_bar_set_title_widget
function.description:
Sets the title for the #GtkHeaderBar.
When set to %NULL, the headerbar will display the title of the window it is contained in.
The title should help a user identify the current view. To achieve the same style as the builtin title, use the “title” style class.
You should set the title widget to %NULL, for the window title label to be visible again.

parameter.name: title_widget
parameter.parameter_description: a widget to use for a title

function.name: gtk_hsv_to_rgb

parameter.name: r
parameter.parameter_description: Return value for the red component

parameter.name: g
parameter.parameter_description: Return value for the green component

parameter.name: b
parameter.parameter_description: Return value for the blue component

function.name: gtk_icon_paintable_get_file
function.description: Gets the #GFile that was used to load the icon, or %NULL if the icon was not loaded from a file.
function.return: the #GFile for the icon, or %NULL. Free with g_object_unref().

function.name: gtk_icon_paintable_get_icon_name
function.description:
Get the icon name being used for this icon.
When an icon looked up in the icon theme was not available, the icon theme may use fallback icons - either those specified to gtk_icon_theme_lookup_icon() or the always-available "image-missing". The icon chosen is returned by this function.
If the icon was created without an icon theme, this function returns %NULL.
function.return: the themed icon-name for the icon, or %NULL if its not a themed icon.

function.name: gtk_icon_paintable_is_symbolic
function.description:
Checks if the icon is symbolic or not. This currently uses only the file name and not the file contents for determining this. This behaviour may change in the future.
Note that to render a symbolic #GtkIconPaintable properly (with recoloring), you have to set its icon name on a #GtkImage.
function.return: %TRUE if the icon is symbolic, %FALSE otherwise

function.name: gtk_icon_paintable_new_for_file
function.description: Creates a #GtkIconPaintable for a file with a given size and scale #GtkIconPaintable. The icon can then be rendered by using it as a #GdkPaintable.
function.return: a #GtkIconPaintable containing for the icon. Unref with g_object_unref()

function.name: gtk_icon_paintable_snapshot_with_colors
function.description: This is similar to the implementation of gdk_paintable_snapshot(), but if the icon is symbolic it will be recolored with the specified colors (which usually comes from the theme).

parameter.name: foreground_color
parameter.parameter_description: a #GdkRGBA representing the foreground color of the icon or %NULL to use the default color.

parameter.name: success_color
parameter.parameter_description: a #GdkRGBA representing the warning color of the icon or %NULL to use the default color

parameter.name: warning_color
parameter.parameter_description: a #GdkRGBA representing the warning color of the icon or %NULL to use the default color

parameter.name: error_color
parameter.parameter_description: a #GdkRGBA representing the error color of the icon or %NULL to use the default color (allow-none)

function.name: gtk_icon_theme_add_resource_path
function.description:
Adds a resource path that will be looked at when looking for icons, similar to search paths.
See gtk_icon_theme_set_resource_path().
This function should be used to make application-specific icons available as part of the icon theme.

function.name: gtk_icon_theme_add_search_path
function.description: Appends a directory to the search path. See gtk_icon_theme_set_search_path().

parameter.name: path
parameter.parameter_description: directory name to append to the icon path

function.name: gtk_icon_theme_get_display
function.description: Returns the display that the GtkIconTheme object was created for.

function.name: gtk_icon_theme_get_for_display
function.description: Gets the icon theme object associated with @display; if this function has not previously been called for the given display, a new icon theme object will be created and associated with the display. Icon theme objects are fairly expensive to create, so using this function is usually a better choice than calling than gtk_icon_theme_new() and setting the display yourself; by using this function a single icon theme object will be shared between users.
function.return: A unique #GtkIconTheme associated with the given display. This icon theme is associated with the display and can be used as long as the display is open. Do not ref or unref it.

function.name: gtk_icon_theme_get_icon_names
function.description: Lists the names of icons in the current icon theme.
function.return: a string array holding the names of all the icons in the theme. You must free the array using g_strfreev().

function.name: gtk_icon_theme_get_icon_sizes
function.description: Returns an array of integers describing the sizes at which the icon is available without scaling. A size of -1 means that the icon is available in a scalable format. The array is zero-terminated.
function.return: A newly allocated array describing the sizes at which the icon is available. The array should be freed with g_free() when it is no longer needed.

function.name: gtk_icon_theme_get_resource_path
function.description:
Gets the current resource path.
See gtk_icon_theme_set_resource_path().
function.return: A list of resource paths or %NULL. The returned value should be freed with g_strfreev().

function.name: gtk_icon_theme_get_search_path
function.description: Gets the current search path. See gtk_icon_theme_set_search_path().
function.return: a list of icon theme path directories or %NULL. The returned value should be freed with g_strfreev().

function.name: gtk_icon_theme_get_theme_name
function.description: Gets the current icon theme name.

function.name: gtk_icon_theme_has_icon
function.description: Checks whether an icon theme includes an icon for a particular name.

function.name: gtk_icon_theme_lookup_by_gicon
function.description: Looks up a icon for a desired size and window scale, returning a #GtkIconPaintable. The icon can then be rendered by using it as a #GdkPaintable, or you can get information such as the filename and size.
