parameter.name: direction
parameter.parameter_description: text direction the icon will be displayed in

parameter.name: flags
parameter.parameter_description: flags modifying the behavior of the icon lookup

function.return: a #GtkIconPaintable containing information about the icon. Unref with g_object_unref()

function.name: gtk_icon_theme_lookup_icon
function.description:
Looks up a named icon for a desired size and window scale, returning a #GtkIconPaintable. The icon can then be rendered by using it as a #GdkPaintable, or you can get information such as the filename and size.
If the available @icon_name is not available and @fallbacks are provided, they will be tried in order.
If no matching icon is found, then a paintable that renders the "missing icon" icon is returned. If you need to do something else for missing icons you need to use gtk_icon_theme_has_icon().
Note that you probably want to listen for icon theme changes and update the icon. This is usually done by overriding the #GtkWidgetClass.css-changed() function.

parameter.name: icon_name
parameter.parameter_description: the name of the icon to lookup

parameter.name: scale
parameter.parameter_description: the window scale this will be displayed on

parameter.name: direction
parameter.parameter_description: text direction the icon will be displayed in

parameter.name: flags
parameter.parameter_description: flags modifying the behavior of the icon lookup

function.name: gtk_icon_theme_new
function.description: Creates a new icon theme object. Icon theme objects are used to lookup up an icon by name in a particular icon theme. Usually, you’ll want to use gtk_icon_theme_get_for_display() rather than creating a new icon theme object for scratch.

function.name: gtk_icon_theme_set_resource_path
function.description:
Sets the resource paths that will be looked at when looking for icons, similar to search paths.
The resources are considered as part of the hicolor icon theme and must be located in subdirectories that are defined in the hicolor icon theme, such as `@path/16x16/actions/run.png` or `@path/scalable/actions/run.svg`.
Icons that are directly placed in the resource path instead of a subdirectory are also considered as ultimate fallback, but they are treated like unthemed icons.

parameter.name: path
parameter.parameter_description: NULL-terminated array of resource paths that are searched for icons

function.name: gtk_icon_theme_set_search_path
function.description:
Sets the search path for the icon theme object. When looking for an icon theme, GTK will search for a subdirectory of one or more of the directories in @path with the same name as the icon theme containing an index.theme file. (Themes from multiple of the path elements are combined to allow themes to be extended by adding icons in the user’s home directory.)
In addition if an icon found isn’t found either in the current icon theme or the default icon theme, and an image file with the right name is found directly in one of the elements of @path, then that image will be used for the icon name. (This is legacy feature, and new icons should be put into the fallback icon theme, which is called hicolor, rather than directly on the icon path.)

parameter.name: path
parameter.parameter_description: NULL-terminated array of directories that are searched for icon themes

function.name: gtk_icon_theme_set_theme_name
function.description: Sets the name of the icon theme that the #GtkIconTheme object uses overriding system configuration. This function cannot be called on the icon theme objects returned from gtk_icon_theme_get_for_display().

parameter.name: theme_name
parameter.parameter_description: name of icon theme to use instead of configured theme, or %NULL to unset a previously set custom theme

function.name: gtk_icon_view_create_drag_icon
function.description: Creates a #cairo_surface_t representation of the item at @path. This image is used for a drag icon.
function.return: a newly-allocated surface of the drag icon.

function.name: gtk_icon_view_enable_model_drag_dest
function.description: Turns @icon_view into a drop destination for automatic DND. Calling this method sets #GtkIconView:reorderable to %FALSE.

parameter.name: formats
parameter.parameter_description: the formats that the drag will support

parameter.name: actions
parameter.parameter_description: the bitmask of possible actions for a drag to this widget

function.name: gtk_icon_view_enable_model_drag_source
function.description: Turns @icon_view into a drag source for automatic DND. Calling this method sets #GtkIconView:reorderable to %FALSE.

parameter.name: start_button_mask
parameter.parameter_description: Mask of allowed buttons to start drag

parameter.name: formats
parameter.parameter_description: the formats that the drag will support

parameter.name: actions
parameter.parameter_description: the bitmask of possible actions for a drag from this widget

function.name: gtk_icon_view_get_activate_on_single_click
function.description: Gets the setting set by gtk_icon_view_set_activate_on_single_click().
function.return: %TRUE if item-activated will be emitted on a single click

function.name: gtk_icon_view_get_cell_rect

parameter.name: rect
parameter.parameter_description: rectangle to fill with cell rect

function.return: %FALSE if there is no such item, %TRUE otherwise

function.name: gtk_icon_view_get_column_spacing
function.description: Returns the value of the ::column-spacing property.

function.name: gtk_icon_view_get_columns
function.description: Returns the value of the ::columns property.

function.name: gtk_icon_view_get_cursor
function.description:
Fills in @path and @cell with the current cursor path and cell. If the cursor isn’t currently set, then *@path will be %NULL. If no cell currently has focus, then *@cell will be %NULL.
The returned #GtkTreePath must be freed with gtk_tree_path_free().

parameter.name: path
parameter.parameter_description: Return location for the current cursor path, or %NULL

parameter.name: cell
parameter.parameter_description: Return location the current focus cell, or %NULL

function.name: gtk_icon_view_get_dest_item_at_pos
function.description: Determines the destination item for a given position.

parameter.name: drag_x
parameter.parameter_description: the position to determine the destination item for

parameter.name: drag_y
parameter.parameter_description: the position to determine the destination item for

parameter.name: path
parameter.parameter_description: Return location for the path of the item, or %NULL.

parameter.name: pos
parameter.parameter_description: Return location for the drop position, or %NULL

function.return: whether there is an item at the given position.

function.name: gtk_icon_view_get_drag_dest_item
function.description: Gets information about the item that is highlighted for feedback.

parameter.name: path
parameter.parameter_description: Return location for the path of the highlighted item, or %NULL.

parameter.name: pos
parameter.parameter_description: Return location for the drop position, or %NULL

function.name: gtk_icon_view_get_item_at_pos
function.description: Gets the path and cell for the icon at the given position.

parameter.name: x
parameter.parameter_description: The x position to be identified

parameter.name: y
parameter.parameter_description: The y position to be identified

parameter.name: path
parameter.parameter_description: Return location for the path, or %NULL

parameter.name: cell
parameter.parameter_description: Return location for the renderer responsible for the cell at (@x, @y), or %NULL

function.return: %TRUE if an item exists at the specified position

function.name: gtk_icon_view_get_item_column
function.description: Gets the column in which the item @path is currently displayed. Column numbers start at 0.
function.return: The column in which the item is displayed

function.name: gtk_icon_view_get_item_orientation
function.description: Returns the value of the ::item-orientation property which determines whether the labels are drawn beside the icons instead of below.
function.return: the relative position of texts and icons

function.name: gtk_icon_view_get_item_padding
function.description: Returns the value of the ::item-padding property.

function.name: gtk_icon_view_get_item_row
function.description: Gets the row in which the item @path is currently displayed. Row numbers start at 0.
function.return: The row in which the item is displayed

function.name: gtk_icon_view_get_item_width
function.description: Returns the value of the ::item-width property.
function.return: the width of a single item, or -1

function.name: gtk_icon_view_get_margin
function.description: Returns the value of the ::margin property.

function.name: gtk_icon_view_get_markup_column
function.description: Returns the column with markup text for @icon_view.
function.return: the markup column, or -1 if it’s unset.

function.name: gtk_icon_view_get_model
function.description: Returns the model the #GtkIconView is based on. Returns %NULL if the model is unset.
function.return: A #GtkTreeModel, or %NULL if none is currently being used.

function.name: gtk_icon_view_get_path_at_pos
function.description: Gets the path for the icon at the given position.

parameter.name: x
parameter.parameter_description: The x position to be identified

parameter.name: y
parameter.parameter_description: The y position to be identified

function.return: The #GtkTreePath corresponding to the icon or %NULL if no icon exists at that position.

function.name: gtk_icon_view_get_pixbuf_column
function.description: Returns the column with pixbufs for @icon_view.
function.return: the pixbuf column, or -1 if it’s unset.

function.name: gtk_icon_view_get_reorderable
function.description: Retrieves whether the user can reorder the list via drag-and-drop. See gtk_icon_view_set_reorderable().
function.return: %TRUE if the list can be reordered.

function.name: gtk_icon_view_get_row_spacing
function.description: Returns the value of the ::row-spacing property.

function.name: gtk_icon_view_get_selected_items
function.description:
Creates a list of paths of all selected items. Additionally, if you are planning on modifying the model after calling this function, you may want to convert the returned list into a list of #GtkTreeRowReferences. To do this, you can use gtk_tree_row_reference_new().
To free the return value, use: |[<!-- language="C" --> g_list_free_full (list, (GDestroyNotify) gtk_tree_path_free); ]|
function.return: A #GList containing a #GtkTreePath for each selected row.

function.name: gtk_icon_view_get_selection_mode
function.description: Gets the selection mode of the @icon_view.

function.name: gtk_icon_view_get_spacing
function.description: Returns the value of the ::spacing property.

function.name: gtk_icon_view_get_text_column
function.description: Returns the column with text for @icon_view.
function.return: the text column, or -1 if it’s unset.

function.name: gtk_icon_view_get_tooltip_column
function.description: Returns the column of @icon_view’s model which is being used for displaying tooltips on @icon_view’s rows.
function.return: the index of the tooltip column that is currently being used, or -1 if this is disabled.

function.name: gtk_icon_view_get_tooltip_context
function.description:
This function is supposed to be used in a #GtkWidget::query-tooltip signal handler for #GtkIconView. The @x, @y and @keyboard_tip values which are received in the signal handler, should be passed to this function without modification.
The return value indicates whether there is an icon view item at the given coordinates (%TRUE) or not (%FALSE) for mouse tooltips. For keyboard tooltips the item returned will be the cursor item. When %TRUE, then any of @model, @path and @iter which have been provided will be set to point to that row and the corresponding model.

parameter.name: x
parameter.parameter_description: the x coordinate (relative to widget coordinates)

parameter.name: y
parameter.parameter_description: the y coordinate (relative to widget coordinates)

parameter.name: keyboard_tip
parameter.parameter_description: whether this is a keyboard tooltip or not

parameter.name: model
parameter.parameter_description: a pointer to receive a #GtkTreeModel or %NULL

parameter.name: path
parameter.parameter_description: a pointer to receive a #GtkTreePath or %NULL

parameter.name: iter
parameter.parameter_description: a pointer to receive a #GtkTreeIter or %NULL

function.return: whether or not the given tooltip context points to an item

function.name: gtk_icon_view_get_visible_range
function.description:
Sets @start_path and @end_path to be the first and last visible path. Note that there may be invisible paths in between.
Both paths should be freed with gtk_tree_path_free() after use.

parameter.name: start_path
parameter.parameter_description: Return location for start of region, or %NULL

parameter.name: end_path
parameter.parameter_description: Return location for end of region, or %NULL

function.return: %TRUE, if valid paths were placed in @start_path and @end_path

function.name: gtk_icon_view_item_activated
function.description: Activates the item determined by @path.

function.name: gtk_icon_view_new
function.description: Creates a new #GtkIconView widget

function.name: gtk_icon_view_new_with_area
function.description: Creates a new #GtkIconView widget using the specified @area to layout cells inside the icons.

parameter.name: area
parameter.parameter_description: the #GtkCellArea to use to layout cells

function.name: gtk_icon_view_new_with_model
function.description: Creates a new #GtkIconView widget with the model @model.

function.name: gtk_icon_view_path_is_selected
function.description: Returns %TRUE if the icon pointed to by @path is currently selected. If @path does not point to a valid location, %FALSE is returned.

function.name: gtk_icon_view_scroll_to_path
function.description:
Moves the alignments of @icon_view to the position specified by @path. @row_align determines where the row is placed, and @col_align determines where @column is placed. Both are expected to be between 0.0 and 1.0. 0.0 means left/top alignment, 1.0 means right/bottom alignment, 0.5 means center.
If @use_align is %FALSE, then the alignment arguments are ignored, and the tree does the minimum amount of work to scroll the item onto the screen. This means that the item will be scrolled to the edge closest to its current position. If the item is currently visible on the screen, nothing is done.
This function only works if the model is set, and @path is a valid row on the model. If the model changes before the @icon_view is realized, the centered path will be modified to reflect this change.

parameter.name: path
parameter.parameter_description: The path of the item to move to.

parameter.name: use_align
parameter.parameter_description: whether to use alignment arguments, or %FALSE.

parameter.name: row_align
parameter.parameter_description: The vertical alignment of the item specified by @path.

parameter.name: col_align
parameter.parameter_description: The horizontal alignment of the item specified by @path.

function.name: gtk_icon_view_select_all
function.description: Selects all the icons. @icon_view must has its selection mode set to #GTK_SELECTION_MULTIPLE.

function.name: gtk_icon_view_select_path
function.description: Selects the row at @path.

function.name: gtk_icon_view_selected_foreach
function.description: Calls a function for each selected icon. Note that the model or selection cannot be modified from within this function.

parameter.name: func
parameter.parameter_description: The function to call for each selected icon.

parameter.name: data
parameter.parameter_description: User data to pass to the function.

function.name: gtk_icon_view_set_activate_on_single_click
function.description: Causes the #GtkIconView::item-activated signal to be emitted on a single click instead of a double click.

parameter.name: single
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE to emit item-activated on a single click

function.name: gtk_icon_view_set_column_spacing
function.description: Sets the ::column-spacing property which specifies the space which is inserted between the columns of the icon view.

function.name: gtk_icon_view_set_columns
function.description: Sets the ::columns property which determines in how many columns the icons are arranged. If @columns is -1, the number of columns will be chosen automatically to fill the available area.

function.name: gtk_icon_view_set_cursor
function.description:
Sets the current keyboard focus to be at @path, and selects it. This is useful when you want to focus the user’s attention on a particular item. If @cell is not %NULL, then focus is given to the cell specified by it. Additionally, if @start_editing is %TRUE, then editing should be started in the specified cell.
This function is often followed by `gtk_widget_grab_focus (icon_view)` in order to give keyboard focus to the widget. Please note that editing can only happen when the widget is realized.

parameter.name: cell
parameter.parameter_description: One of the cell renderers of @icon_view, or %NULL

parameter.name: start_editing
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE if the specified cell should start being edited.

function.name: gtk_icon_view_set_drag_dest_item
function.description: Sets the item that is highlighted for feedback.

parameter.name: path
parameter.parameter_description: The path of the item to highlight, or %NULL.

parameter.name: pos
parameter.parameter_description: Specifies where to drop, relative to the item

function.name: gtk_icon_view_set_item_orientation
function.description: Sets the ::item-orientation property which determines whether the labels are drawn beside the icons instead of below.

parameter.name: orientation
parameter.parameter_description: the relative position of texts and icons

function.name: gtk_icon_view_set_item_padding
function.description: Sets the #GtkIconView:item-padding property which specifies the padding around each of the icon view’s items.

function.name: gtk_icon_view_set_item_width
function.description: Sets the ::item-width property which specifies the width to use for each item. If it is set to -1, the icon view will automatically determine a suitable item size.

function.name: gtk_icon_view_set_margin
function.description: Sets the ::margin property which specifies the space which is inserted at the top, bottom, left and right of the icon view.

function.name: gtk_icon_view_set_markup_column
function.description: Sets the column with markup information for @icon_view to be @column. The markup column must be of type #G_TYPE_STRING. If the markup column is set to something, it overrides the text column set by gtk_icon_view_set_text_column().

parameter.name: column
parameter.parameter_description: A column in the currently used model, or -1 to display no text

function.name: gtk_icon_view_set_model
function.description: Sets the model for a #GtkIconView. If the @icon_view already has a model set, it will remove it before setting the new model. If @model is %NULL, then it will unset the old model.

function.name: gtk_icon_view_set_pixbuf_column
function.description: Sets the column with pixbufs for @icon_view to be @column. The pixbuf column must be of type #GDK_TYPE_PIXBUF

parameter.name: column
parameter.parameter_description: A column in the currently used model, or -1 to disable

function.name: gtk_icon_view_set_reorderable
function.description:
This function is a convenience function to allow you to reorder models that support the #GtkTreeDragSourceIface and the #GtkTreeDragDestIface. Both #GtkTreeStore and #GtkListStore support these. If @reorderable is %TRUE, then the user can reorder the model by dragging and dropping rows. The developer can listen to these changes by connecting to the model's row_inserted and row_deleted signals. The reordering is implemented by setting up the icon view as a drag source and destination. Therefore, drag and drop can not be used in a reorderable view for any other purpose.
This function does not give you any degree of control over the order -- any reordering is allowed. If more control is needed, you should probably handle drag and drop manually.

parameter.name: reorderable
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE, if the list of items can be reordered.

function.name: gtk_icon_view_set_row_spacing
function.description: Sets the ::row-spacing property which specifies the space which is inserted between the rows of the icon view.

function.name: gtk_icon_view_set_selection_mode
function.description: Sets the selection mode of the @icon_view.

function.name: gtk_icon_view_set_spacing
function.description: Sets the ::spacing property which specifies the space which is inserted between the cells (i.e. the icon and the text) of an item.

function.name: gtk_icon_view_set_text_column
function.description: Sets the column with text for @icon_view to be @column. The text column must be of type #G_TYPE_STRING.

parameter.name: column
parameter.parameter_description: A column in the currently used model, or -1 to display no text

function.name: gtk_icon_view_set_tooltip_cell
function.description:
Sets the tip area of @tooltip to the area which @cell occupies in the item pointed to by @path. See also gtk_tooltip_set_tip_area().
See also gtk_icon_view_set_tooltip_column() for a simpler alternative.

function.name: gtk_icon_view_set_tooltip_column
function.description:
If you only plan to have simple (text-only) tooltips on full items, you can use this function to have #GtkIconView handle these automatically for you. @column should be set to the column in @icon_view’s model containing the tooltip texts, or -1 to disable this feature.
When enabled, #GtkWidget:has-tooltip will be set to %TRUE and @icon_view will connect a #GtkWidget::query-tooltip signal handler.
Note that the signal handler sets the text with gtk_tooltip_set_markup(), so &, <, etc have to be escaped in the text.

parameter.name: column
parameter.parameter_description: an integer, which is a valid column number for @icon_view’s model

function.name: gtk_icon_view_set_tooltip_item
function.description: Sets the tip area of @tooltip to be the area covered by the item at @path. See also gtk_icon_view_set_tooltip_column() for a simpler alternative. See also gtk_tooltip_set_tip_area().

function.name: gtk_icon_view_unselect_all
function.description: Unselects all the icons.

function.name: gtk_icon_view_unselect_path
function.description: Unselects the row at @path.

function.name: gtk_icon_view_unset_model_drag_dest
function.description: Undoes the effect of gtk_icon_view_enable_model_drag_dest(). Calling this method sets #GtkIconView:reorderable to %FALSE.

function.name: gtk_icon_view_unset_model_drag_source
function.description: Undoes the effect of gtk_icon_view_enable_model_drag_source(). Calling this method sets #GtkIconView:reorderable to %FALSE.

function.name: gtk_im_context_delete_surrounding
function.description:
Asks the widget that the input context is attached to delete characters around the cursor position by emitting the GtkIMContext::delete_surrounding signal. Note that @offset and @n_chars are in characters not in bytes which differs from the usage other places in #GtkIMContext.
In order to use this function, you should first call gtk_im_context_get_surrounding() to get the current context, and call this function immediately afterwards to make sure that you know what you are deleting. You should also account for the fact that even if the signal was handled, the input context might not have deleted all the characters that were requested to be deleted.
This function is used by an input method that wants to make subsitutions in the existing text in response to new input. It is not useful for applications.

parameter.name: offset
parameter.parameter_description: offset from cursor position in chars; a negative value means start before the cursor.

function.name: gtk_im_context_filter_key
function.description: Allow an input method to forward key press and release events to another input method, without necessarily having a GdkEvent available.

parameter.name: press
parameter.parameter_description: whether to forward a key press or release event

parameter.name: surface
parameter.parameter_description: the surface the event is for

parameter.name: device
parameter.parameter_description: the device that the event is for

parameter.name: group
parameter.parameter_description: the active keyboard group for the event

function.return: %TRUE if the input method handled the key event.

function.name: gtk_im_context_filter_keypress
function.description: Allow an input method to internally handle key press and release events. If this function returns %TRUE, then no further processing should be done for this key event.
function.return: %TRUE if the input method handled the key event.

function.name: gtk_im_context_focus_in
function.description: Notify the input method that the widget to which this input context corresponds has gained focus. The input method may, for example, change the displayed feedback to reflect this change.

function.name: gtk_im_context_focus_out
function.description: Notify the input method that the widget to which this input context corresponds has lost focus. The input method may, for example, change the displayed feedback or reset the contexts state to reflect this change.

function.name: gtk_im_context_get_preedit_string
function.description: Retrieve the current preedit string for the input context, and a list of attributes to apply to the string. This string should be displayed inserted at the insertion point.

parameter.name: str
parameter.parameter_description: location to store the retrieved string. The string retrieved must be freed with g_free().

parameter.name: attrs
parameter.parameter_description: location to store the retrieved attribute list. When you are done with this list, you must unreference it with pango_attr_list_unref().

parameter.name: cursor_pos
parameter.parameter_description: location to store position of cursor (in characters) within the preedit string.

function.name: gtk_im_context_get_surrounding
function.description:
Retrieves context around the insertion point. Input methods typically want context in order to constrain input text based on existing text; this is important for languages such as Thai where only some sequences of characters are allowed.
This function is implemented by emitting the GtkIMContext::retrieve_surrounding signal on the input method; in response to this signal, a widget should provide as much context as is available, up to an entire paragraph, by calling gtk_im_context_set_surrounding(). Note that there is no obligation for a widget to respond to the ::retrieve_surrounding signal, so input methods must be prepared to function without context.

parameter.name: text
parameter.parameter_description: location to store a UTF-8 encoded string of text holding context around the insertion point. If the function returns %TRUE, then you must free the result stored in this location with g_free().

parameter.name: cursor_index
parameter.parameter_description: location to store byte index of the insertion cursor within @text.

function.return: %TRUE if surrounding text was provided; in this case you must free the result stored in *text.

function.name: gtk_im_context_reset
function.description: Notify the input method that a change such as a change in cursor position has been made. This will typically cause the input method to clear the preedit state.

function.name: gtk_im_context_set_client_widget
function.description: Set the client window for the input context; this is the #GtkWidget holding the input focus. This widget is used in order to correctly position status windows, and may also be used for purposes internal to the input method.

parameter.name: widget
parameter.parameter_description: the client widget. This may be %NULL to indicate that the previous client widget no longer exists.

function.name: gtk_im_context_set_cursor_location
function.description: Notify the input method that a change in cursor position has been made. The location is relative to the client window.

function.name: gtk_im_context_set_surrounding
function.description: Sets surrounding context around the insertion point and preedit string. This function is expected to be called in response to the GtkIMContext::retrieve_surrounding signal, and will likely have no effect if called at other times.

parameter.name: text
len
parameter.parameter_description: the length of @text, or -1 if @text is nul-terminated

parameter.name: cursor_index
parameter.parameter_description: the byte index of the insertion cursor within @text.

function.name: gtk_im_context_set_use_preedit
function.description: Sets whether the IM context should use the preedit string to display feedback. If @use_preedit is FALSE (default is TRUE), then the IM context may use some other method to display feedback, such as displaying it in a child of the root window.

parameter.name: use_preedit
parameter.parameter_description: whether the IM context should use the preedit string.

function.name: gtk_im_context_simple_add_compose_file
function.description: Adds an additional table from the X11 compose file.

function.name: gtk_im_context_simple_add_table
function.description:
Adds an additional table to search to the input context. Each row of the table consists of @max_seq_len key symbols followed by two #guint16 interpreted as the high and low words of a #gunicode value. Tables are searched starting from the last added.
The table must be sorted in dictionary order on the numeric value of the key symbol fields. (Values beyond the length of the sequence should be zero.)

parameter.name: max_seq_len
parameter.parameter_description: Maximum length of a sequence in the table (cannot be greater than #GTK_MAX_COMPOSE_LEN)

parameter.name: n_seqs
parameter.parameter_description: number of sequences in the table

function.name: gtk_im_context_simple_new
function.description: Creates a new #GtkIMContextSimple.

function.name: gtk_im_multicontext_get_context_id
function.description: Gets the id of the currently active delegate of the @context.
function.return: the id of the currently active delegate

function.name: gtk_im_multicontext_new
function.description: Creates a new #GtkIMMulticontext.

function.name: gtk_im_multicontext_set_context_id
function.description:
Sets the context id for @context.
This causes the currently active delegate of @context to be replaced by the delegate corresponding to the new context id.

function.name: gtk_image_clear
function.description: Resets the image to be empty.

function.name: gtk_image_get_gicon
function.description:
Gets the #GIcon and size being displayed by the #GtkImage. The storage type of the image must be %GTK_IMAGE_EMPTY or %GTK_IMAGE_GICON (see gtk_image_get_storage_type()). The caller of this function does not own a reference to the returned #GIcon.
Note: This function was changed in 3.94 not to use out parameters anymore, but return the GIcon directly. See gtk_image_get_icon_size() for a way to get the icon size.

function.name: gtk_image_get_icon_name
function.description:
Gets the icon name and size being displayed by the #GtkImage. The storage type of the image must be %GTK_IMAGE_EMPTY or %GTK_IMAGE_ICON_NAME (see gtk_image_get_storage_type()). The returned string is owned by the #GtkImage and should not be freed.
Note: This function was changed in 3.94 not to use out parameters anymore, but return the icon name directly. See gtk_image_get_icon_size() for a way to get the icon size.

function.name: gtk_image_get_icon_size
function.description: Gets the icon size used by the @image when rendering icons.
function.return: the image size used by icons

function.name: gtk_image_get_paintable
function.description: Gets the image #GdkPaintable being displayed by the #GtkImage. The storage type of the image must be %GTK_IMAGE_EMPTY or %GTK_IMAGE_PAINTABLE (see gtk_image_get_storage_type()). The caller of this function does not own a reference to the returned paintable.
function.return: the displayed paintable, or %NULL if the image is empty

function.name: gtk_image_get_pixel_size
function.description: Gets the pixel size used for named icons.
function.return: the pixel size used for named icons.

function.name: gtk_image_get_storage_type
function.description: Gets the type of representation being used by the #GtkImage to store image data. If the #GtkImage has no image data, the return value will be %GTK_IMAGE_EMPTY.

function.name: gtk_image_new
function.description: Creates a new empty #GtkImage widget.

function.name: gtk_image_new_from_file
function.description:
Creates a new #GtkImage displaying the file @filename. If the file isn’t found or can’t be loaded, the resulting #GtkImage will display a “broken image” icon. This function never returns %NULL, it always returns a valid #GtkImage widget.
If you need to detect failures to load the file, use gdk_texture_new_from_file() to load the file yourself, then create the #GtkImage from the texture.
The storage type (gtk_image_get_storage_type()) of the returned image is not defined, it will be whatever is appropriate for displaying the file.

function.name: gtk_image_new_from_gicon
function.description:
Creates a #GtkImage displaying an icon from the current icon theme. If the icon name isn’t known, a “broken image” icon will be displayed instead. If the current icon theme is changed, the icon will be updated appropriately.
Note: Before 3.94, this function was taking an extra icon size argument. See gtk_image_set_icon_size() for another way to set the icon size.
function.return: a new #GtkImage displaying the themed icon

function.name: gtk_image_new_from_icon_name
function.description:
Creates a #GtkImage displaying an icon from the current icon theme. If the icon name isn’t known, a “broken image” icon will be displayed instead. If the current icon theme is changed, the icon will be updated appropriately.
Note: Before 3.94, this function was taking an extra icon size argument. See gtk_image_set_icon_size() for another way to set the icon size.
function.return: a new #GtkImage displaying the themed icon

function.name: gtk_image_new_from_paintable
function.description:
Creates a new #GtkImage displaying @paintable. The #GtkImage does not assume a reference to the paintable; you still need to unref it if you own references. #GtkImage will add its own reference rather than adopting yours.
The #GtkImage will track changes to the @paintable and update its size and contents in response to it.

function.name: gtk_image_new_from_pixbuf
function.description:
Creates a new #GtkImage displaying @pixbuf. The #GtkImage does not assume a reference to the pixbuf; you still need to unref it if you own references. #GtkImage will add its own reference rather than adopting yours.
This is a helper for gtk_image_new_from_paintable(), and you can't get back the exact pixbuf once this is called, only a texture.
Note that this function just creates an #GtkImage from the pixbuf. The #GtkImage created will not react to state changes. Should you want that, you should use gtk_image_new_from_icon_name().

function.name: gtk_image_new_from_resource
function.description:
Creates a new #GtkImage displaying the resource file @resource_path. If the file isn’t found or can’t be loaded, the resulting #GtkImage will display a “broken image” icon. This function never returns %NULL, it always returns a valid #GtkImage widget.
If you need to detect failures to load the file, use gdk_pixbuf_new_from_file() to load the file yourself, then create the #GtkImage from the pixbuf.
The storage type (gtk_image_get_storage_type()) of the returned image is not defined, it will be whatever is appropriate for displaying the file.

function.name: gtk_image_set_from_file
function.description: See gtk_image_new_from_file() for details.

function.name: gtk_image_set_from_gicon
function.description:
See gtk_image_new_from_gicon() for details.
Note: Before 3.94, this function was taking an extra icon size argument. See gtk_image_set_icon_size() for another way to set the icon size.

function.name: gtk_image_set_from_icon_name
function.description:
See gtk_image_new_from_icon_name() for details.
Note: Before 3.94, this function was taking an extra icon size argument. See gtk_image_set_icon_size() for another way to set the icon size.

function.name: gtk_image_set_from_paintable
function.description: See gtk_image_new_from_paintable() for details.

function.name: gtk_image_set_from_pixbuf
function.description:
See gtk_image_new_from_pixbuf() for details.
Note: This is a helper for gtk_image_set_from_paintable(), and you can't get back the exact pixbuf once this is called, only a paintable.

function.name: gtk_image_set_from_resource
function.description: See gtk_image_new_from_resource() for details.

function.name: gtk_image_set_icon_size
function.description: Suggests an icon size to the theme for named icons.

function.name: gtk_image_set_pixel_size
function.description: Sets the pixel size to use for named icons. If the pixel size is set to a value != -1, it is used instead of the icon size set by gtk_image_set_from_icon_name().

function.name: gtk_info_bar_add_action_widget
function.description: Add an activatable widget to the action area of a #GtkInfoBar, connecting a signal handler that will emit the #GtkInfoBar::response signal on the message area when the widget is activated. The widget is appended to the end of the message areas action area.

function.name: gtk_info_bar_add_button
function.description: Adds a button with the given text and sets things up so that clicking the button will emit the “response” signal with the given response_id. The button is appended to the end of the info bars's action area. The button widget is returned, but usually you don't need it.

function.name: gtk_info_bar_add_buttons
function.description: Adds more buttons, same as calling gtk_info_bar_add_button() repeatedly. The variable argument list should be %NULL-terminated as with gtk_info_bar_new_with_buttons(). Each button must have both text and response ID.

parameter.name: Varargs
parameter.parameter_description: response ID for first button, then more text-response_id pairs, ending with %NULL

function.name: gtk_info_bar_add_child
function.description: Adds a widget to the content area of the info bar.

function.name: gtk_info_bar_get_message_type
function.description: Returns the message type of the message area.
function.return: the message type of the message area.

function.name: gtk_info_bar_get_revealed
function.description: Returns whether the info bar is currently revealed.
function.return: the current value of the #GtkInfoBar:revealed property

function.name: gtk_info_bar_get_show_close_button
function.description: Returns whether the widget will display a standard close button.
function.return: %TRUE if the widget displays standard close button

function.name: gtk_info_bar_new
function.description: Creates a new #GtkInfoBar object.

function.name: gtk_info_bar_new_with_buttons
function.description: Creates a new #GtkInfoBar with buttons. Button text/response ID pairs should be listed, with a %NULL pointer ending the list. A response ID can be any positive number, or one of the values in the #GtkResponseType enumeration. If the user clicks one of these dialog buttons, GtkInfoBar will emit the “response” signal with the corresponding response ID.

parameter.name: first_button_text
parameter.parameter_description: ext to go in first button, or %NULL

parameter.name: Varargs
parameter.parameter_description: response ID for first button, then additional buttons, ending with %NULL

function.name: gtk_info_bar_remove_action_widget
function.description: Removes a widget from the action area of @info_bar, after it been put there by a call to gtk_info_bar_add_action_widget() or gtk_info_bar_add_button().

function.name: gtk_info_bar_remove_child
function.description: Removes a widget from the content area of the info bar, after it has been added with gtk_info_bar_add_child().

parameter.name: widget
parameter.parameter_description: a child that has been added to the content area

function.name: gtk_info_bar_response
function.description: Emits the “response” signal with the given @response_id.

function.name: gtk_info_bar_set_default_response
function.description:
Sets the last widget in the info bar’s action area with the given response_id as the default widget for the dialog. Pressing “Enter” normally activates the default widget.
Note that this function currently requires @info_bar to be added to a widget hierarchy.

function.name: gtk_info_bar_set_message_type
function.description:
Sets the message type of the message area.
GTK uses this type to determine how the message is displayed.

function.name: gtk_info_bar_set_response_sensitive
function.description: Calls gtk_widget_set_sensitive (widget, setting) for each widget in the info bars’s action area with the given response_id. A convenient way to sensitize/desensitize dialog buttons.

function.name: gtk_info_bar_set_revealed
function.description:
Sets the #GtkInfoBar:revealed property to @revealed. Changing this will make @info_bar reveal (%TRUE) or conceal (%FALSE) itself via a sliding transition.
Note: this does not show or hide @info_bar in the #GtkWidget:visible sense, so revealing has no effect if #GtkWidget:visible is %FALSE.

parameter.name: revealed
parameter.parameter_description: The new value of the property

function.name: gtk_info_bar_set_show_close_button
function.description: If true, a standard close button is shown. When clicked it emits the response %GTK_RESPONSE_CLOSE.

function.name: gtk_init
function.description:
Call this function before using any other GTK functions in your GUI applications. It will initialize everything needed to operate the toolkit and parses some standard command line options.
If you are using #GtkApplication, you don't have to call gtk_init() or gtk_init_check(); the #GApplication::startup handler does it for you.
This function will terminate your program if it was unable to initialize the windowing system for some reason. If you want your program to fall back to a textual interface you want to call gtk_init_check() instead.
GTK calls `signal (SIGPIPE, SIG_IGN)` during initialization, to ignore SIGPIPE signals, since these are almost never wanted in graphical applications. If you do need to handle SIGPIPE for some reason, reset the handler after gtk_init(), but notice that other libraries (e.g. libdbus or gvfs) might do similar things.

function.name: gtk_init_check
function.description:
This function does the same work as gtk_init() with only a single change: It does not terminate the program if the windowing system can’t be initialized. Instead it returns %FALSE on failure.
This way the application can fall back to some other means of communication with the user - for example a curses or command line interface.
function.return: %TRUE if the windowing system has been successfully initialized, %FALSE otherwise

function.name: gtk_is_initialized
function.description: Use this function to check if GTK has been initialized with gtk_init() or gtk_init_check().

function.name: gtk_keyval_trigger_get_keyval
function.description: Gets the keyval that must be pressed to succeed triggering @self.

function.name: gtk_keyval_trigger_get_modifiers
function.description: Gets the modifiers that must be present to succeed triggering @self.

function.name: gtk_keyval_trigger_new
function.description: Creates a #GtkShortcutTrigger that will trigger whenever the key with the given @keyval and @modifiers is pressed.

parameter.name: modifiers
parameter.parameter_description: the modifiers that need to be present

function.name: gtk_label_get_attributes
function.description: Gets the attribute list that was set on the label using gtk_label_set_attributes(), if any. This function does not reflect attributes that come from the labels markup (see gtk_label_set_markup()). If you want to get the effective attributes for the label, use pango_layout_get_attribute (gtk_label_get_layout (self)).
function.return: the attribute list, or %NULL if none was set.

function.name: gtk_label_get_current_uri
function.description:
Returns the URI for the currently active link in the label. The active link is the one under the mouse pointer or, in a selectable label, the link in which the text cursor is currently positioned.
This function is intended for use in a #GtkLabel::activate-link handler or for use in a #GtkWidget::query-tooltip handler.
function.return: the currently active URI or %NULL if there is none. The string is owned by GTK and must not be freed or modified.

function.name: gtk_label_get_ellipsize
function.description: Returns the ellipsizing position of the label. See gtk_label_set_ellipsize().

function.name: gtk_label_get_extra_menu
function.description: Gets the menu model set with gtk_label_set_extra_menu().

function.name: gtk_label_get_justify
function.description: Returns the justification of the label. See gtk_label_set_justify().

function.name: gtk_label_get_label
function.description: Fetches the text from a label widget including any embedded underlines indicating mnemonics and Pango markup. (See gtk_label_get_text()).
function.return: the text of the label widget. This string is owned by the widget and must not be modified or freed.

function.name: gtk_label_get_layout
function.description: Gets the #PangoLayout used to display the label. The layout is useful to e.g. convert text positions to pixel positions, in combination with gtk_label_get_layout_offsets(). The returned layout is owned by the @label so need not be freed by the caller. The @label is free to recreate its layout at any time, so it should be considered read-only.

function.name: gtk_label_get_layout_offsets
function.description: Obtains the coordinates where the label will draw the #PangoLayout representing the text in the label; useful to convert mouse events into coordinates inside the #PangoLayout, e.g. to take some action if some part of the label is clicked. Remember when using the #PangoLayout functions you need to convert to and from pixels using PANGO_PIXELS() or #PANGO_SCALE.

parameter.name: x
parameter.parameter_description: location to store X offset of layout, or %NULL

parameter.name: y
parameter.parameter_description: location to store Y offset of layout, or %NULL

function.name: gtk_label_get_lines
function.description: Gets the number of lines to which an ellipsized, wrapping label should be limited. See gtk_label_set_lines().

function.name: gtk_label_get_max_width_chars
function.description: Retrieves the desired maximum width of @label, in characters. See gtk_label_set_width_chars().
function.return: the maximum width of the label in characters.

function.name: gtk_label_get_measuring_layout
function.description: Gets a layout that can be used for measuring sizes. The returned layout will be identical to the label’s layout except for the layout’s width, which will be set to @width. Do not modify the returned layout.

parameter.name: existing_layout
parameter.parameter_description: %NULL or an existing layout already in use.

parameter.name: width
parameter.parameter_description: the width to measure with in pango units, or -1 for infinite

function.return: a new reference to a pango layout

function.name: gtk_label_get_mnemonic_keyval
function.description: If the label has been set so that it has a mnemonic key this function returns the keyval used for the mnemonic accelerator. If there is no mnemonic set up it returns #GDK_KEY_VoidSymbol.
function.return: GDK keyval usable for accelerators, or #GDK_KEY_VoidSymbol

function.name: gtk_label_get_mnemonic_widget
function.description: Retrieves the target of the mnemonic (keyboard shortcut) of this label. See gtk_label_set_mnemonic_widget().
function.return: the target of the label’s mnemonic, or %NULL if none has been set and the default algorithm will be used.

function.name: gtk_label_get_selectable
function.description: Gets the value set by gtk_label_set_selectable().
function.return: %TRUE if the user can copy text from the label

function.name: gtk_label_get_selection_bounds
function.description: Gets the selected range of characters in the label, returning %TRUE if there’s a selection.

parameter.name: start
parameter.parameter_description: return location for start of selection, as a character offset

parameter.name: end
parameter.parameter_description: return location for end of selection, as a character offset

function.name: gtk_label_get_single_line_mode
function.description: Returns whether the label is in single line mode.
function.return: %TRUE when the label is in single line mode.

function.name: gtk_label_get_text
function.description: Fetches the text from a label widget, as displayed on the screen. This does not include any embedded underlines indicating mnemonics or Pango markup. (See gtk_label_get_label())
function.return: the text in the label widget. This is the internal string used by the label, and must not be modified.

function.name: gtk_label_get_use_markup
function.description: Returns whether the label’s text is interpreted as marked up with the [Pango text markup language][PangoMarkupFormat]. See gtk_label_set_use_markup ().
function.return: %TRUE if the label’s text will be parsed for markup.

function.name: gtk_label_get_use_underline
function.description: Returns whether an embedded underline in the label indicates a mnemonic. See gtk_label_set_use_underline().
function.return: %TRUE whether an embedded underline in the label indicates the mnemonic accelerator keys.

function.name: gtk_label_get_width_chars
function.description: Retrieves the desired width of @label, in characters. See gtk_label_set_width_chars().
function.return: the width of the label in characters.

function.name: gtk_label_get_wrap
function.description: Returns whether lines in the label are automatically wrapped. See gtk_label_set_wrap().
function.return: %TRUE if the lines of the label are automatically wrapped.

function.name: gtk_label_get_wrap_mode
function.description: Returns line wrap mode used by the label. See gtk_label_set_wrap_mode().
function.return: %TRUE if the lines of the label are automatically wrapped.

function.name: gtk_label_get_xalign
function.description: Gets the #GtkLabel:xalign property for @label.

function.name: gtk_label_get_yalign
function.description: Gets the #GtkLabel:yalign property for @label.

function.name: gtk_label_new
function.description: Creates a new label with the given text inside it. You can pass %NULL to get an empty label widget.

function.name: gtk_label_new_with_mnemonic
function.description:
Creates a new #GtkLabel, containing the text in @str.
If characters in @str are preceded by an underscore, they are underlined. If you need a literal underscore character in a label, use '__' (two underscores). The first underlined character represents a keyboard accelerator called a mnemonic. The mnemonic key can be used to activate another widget, chosen automatically, or explicitly using gtk_label_set_mnemonic_widget().
If gtk_label_set_mnemonic_widget() is not called, then the first activatable ancestor of the #GtkLabel will be chosen as the mnemonic widget. For instance, if the label is inside a button or menu item, the button or menu item will automatically become the mnemonic widget and be activated by the mnemonic.

parameter.name: str
parameter.parameter_description: The text of the label, with an underscore in front of the mnemonic character

function.name: gtk_label_select_region
function.description: Selects a range of characters in the label, if the label is selectable. See gtk_label_set_selectable(). If the label is not selectable, this function has no effect. If @start_offset or @end_offset are -1, then the end of the label will be substituted.

function.name: gtk_label_set_attributes
function.description:
Sets a #PangoAttrList; the attributes in the list are applied to the label text.
The attributes set with this function will be applied and merged with any other attributes previously effected by way of the #GtkLabel:use-underline or #GtkLabel:use-markup properties. While it is not recommended to mix markup strings with manually set attributes, if you must; know that the attributes will be applied to the label after the markup string is parsed.

function.name: gtk_label_set_ellipsize
function.description: Sets the mode used to ellipsize (add an ellipsis: "...") to the text if there is not enough space to render the entire string.

function.name: gtk_label_set_extra_menu
function.description: Sets a menu model to add when constructing the context menu for @label.

function.name: gtk_label_set_justify
function.description: Sets the alignment of the lines in the text of the label relative to each other. %GTK_JUSTIFY_LEFT is the default value when the widget is first created with gtk_label_new(). If you instead want to set the alignment of the label as a whole, use gtk_widget_set_halign() instead. gtk_label_set_justify() has no effect on labels containing only a single line.

function.name: gtk_label_set_label
function.description: Sets the text of the label. The label is interpreted as including embedded underlines and/or Pango markup depending on the values of the #GtkLabel:use-underline and #GtkLabel:use-markup properties.

parameter.name: str
parameter.parameter_description: the new text to set for the label

function.name: gtk_label_set_lines
function.description: Sets the number of lines to which an ellipsized, wrapping label should be limited. This has no effect if the label is not wrapping or ellipsized. Set this to -1 if you don’t want to limit the number of lines.

parameter.name: lines
parameter.parameter_description: the desired number of lines, or -1

function.name: gtk_label_set_markup
gtk_label_set_markup_with_mnemonic
function.description:
Parses @str which is marked up with the [Pango text markup language][PangoMarkupFormat], setting the label’s text and attribute list based on the parse results. If characters in @str are preceded by an underscore, they are underlined indicating that they represent a keyboard accelerator called a mnemonic.
The mnemonic key can be used to activate another widget, chosen automatically, or explicitly using gtk_label_set_mnemonic_widget().

function.name: gtk_label_set_max_width_chars
function.description: Sets the desired maximum width in characters of @label to @n_chars.

parameter.name: n_chars
parameter.parameter_description: the new desired maximum width, in characters.

function.name: gtk_label_set_mnemonic_widget
function.description:
If the label has been set so that it has a mnemonic key (using i.e. gtk_label_set_markup_with_mnemonic(), gtk_label_set_text_with_mnemonic(), gtk_label_new_with_mnemonic() or the “use_underline” property) the label can be associated with a widget that is the target of the mnemonic. When the label is inside a widget (like a #GtkButton or a #GtkNotebook tab) it is automatically associated with the correct widget, but sometimes (i.e. when the target is a #GtkEntry next to the label) you need to set it explicitly using this function.
The target widget will be accelerated by emitting the GtkWidget::mnemonic-activate signal on it. The default handler for this signal will activate the widget if there are no mnemonic collisions and toggle focus between the colliding widgets otherwise.

function.name: gtk_label_set_selectable
function.description: Selectable labels allow the user to select text from the label, for copy-and-paste.

parameter.name: setting
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE to allow selecting text in the label

function.name: gtk_label_set_single_line_mode
function.description: Sets whether the label is in single line mode.

parameter.name: single_line_mode
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE if the label should be in single line mode

function.name: gtk_label_set_text
function.description:
Sets the text within the #GtkLabel widget. It overwrites any text that was there before.
This function will clear any previously set mnemonic accelerators, and set the #GtkLabel:use-underline property to %FALSE as a side effect.
This function will set the #GtkLabel:use-markup property to %FALSE as a side effect.
See also: gtk_label_set_markup()

parameter.name: str
parameter.parameter_description: The text you want to set

function.name: gtk_label_set_text_with_mnemonic
function.description: Sets the label’s text from the string @str. If characters in @str are preceded by an underscore, they are underlined indicating that they represent a keyboard accelerator called a mnemonic. The mnemonic key can be used to activate another widget, chosen automatically, or explicitly using gtk_label_set_mnemonic_widget().

function.name: gtk_label_set_use_markup
function.description: Sets whether the text of the label contains markup in [Pango’s text markup language][PangoMarkupFormat]. See gtk_label_set_markup().

parameter.name: setting
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE if the label’s text should be parsed for markup.

function.name: gtk_label_set_use_underline
function.description: If true, an underline in the text indicates the next character should be used for the mnemonic accelerator key.

parameter.name: setting
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE if underlines in the text indicate mnemonics

function.name: gtk_label_set_width_chars
function.description: Sets the desired width in characters of @label to @n_chars.

parameter.name: n_chars
parameter.parameter_description: the new desired width, in characters.

function.name: gtk_label_set_wrap
function.description:
Toggles line wrapping within the #GtkLabel widget. %TRUE makes it break lines if text exceeds the widget’s size. %FALSE lets the text get cut off by the edge of the widget if it exceeds the widget size.
Note that setting line wrapping to %TRUE does not make the label wrap at its parent container’s width, because GTK widgets conceptually can’t make their requisition depend on the parent container’s size. For a label that wraps at a specific position, set the label’s width using gtk_widget_set_size_request().

function.name: gtk_label_set_wrap_mode
function.description: If line wrapping is on (see gtk_label_set_wrap()) this controls how the line wrapping is done. The default is %PANGO_WRAP_WORD which means wrap on word boundaries.

function.name: gtk_label_set_xalign
function.description: Sets the #GtkLabel:xalign property for @label.

parameter.name: xalign
parameter.parameter_description: the new xalign value, between 0 and 1

function.name: gtk_label_set_yalign
function.description: Sets the #GtkLabel:yalign property for @label.

parameter.name: yalign
parameter.parameter_description: the new yalign value, between 0 and 1

function.name: gtk_layout_child_get_child_widget
function.description: Retrieves the #GtkWidget associated to the given @layout_child.

function.name: gtk_layout_child_get_layout_manager
function.description: Retrieves the #GtkLayoutManager instance that created the given @layout_child.

function.name: gtk_layout_manager_allocate
function.description: This function assigns the given @width, @height, and @baseline to a @widget, and computes the position and sizes of the children of the @widget using the layout management policy of @manager.

parameter.name: baseline
parameter.parameter_description: the baseline position of the @widget, or -1

function.name: gtk_layout_manager_get_layout_child
function.description:
Retrieves a #GtkLayoutChild instance for the #GtkLayoutManager, creating one if necessary.
The @child widget must be a child of the widget using @manager.
The #GtkLayoutChild instance is owned by the #GtkLayoutManager, and is guaranteed to exist as long as @child is a child of the #GtkWidget using the given #GtkLayoutManager.

function.name: gtk_layout_manager_get_request_mode
function.description: Retrieves the request mode of @manager.

function.name: gtk_layout_manager_get_widget
function.description: Retrieves the #GtkWidget using the given #GtkLayoutManager.

function.name: gtk_layout_manager_layout_changed
function.description:
Queues a resize on the #GtkWidget using @manager, if any.
This function should be called by subclasses of #GtkLayoutManager in response to changes to their layout management policies.

function.name: gtk_layout_manager_measure
function.description:
Measures the size of the @widget using @manager, for the given @orientation and size.
See [GtkWidget's geometry management section][geometry-management] for more details.

parameter.name: for_size
parameter.parameter_description: Size for the opposite of @orientation; for instance, if the @orientation is %GTK_ORIENTATION_HORIZONTAL, this is the height of the widget; if the @orientation is %GTK_ORIENTATION_VERTICAL, this is the width of the widget. This allows to measure the height for the given width, and the width for the given height. Use -1 if the size is not known

parameter.name: minimum
parameter.parameter_description: the minimum size for the given size and orientation

parameter.name: natural
parameter.parameter_description: the natural, or preferred size for the given size and orientation

parameter.name: minimum_baseline
parameter.parameter_description: the baseline position for the minimum size

parameter.name: natural_baseline
parameter.parameter_description: the baseline position for the natural size

function.name: gtk_level_bar_add_offset_value
function.description: Adds a new offset marker on @self at the position specified by @value. When the bar value is in the interval topped by @value (or between @value and #GtkLevelBar:max-value in case the offset is the last one on the bar) a style class named `level-`@name will be applied when rendering the level bar fill. If another offset marker named @name exists, its value will be replaced by @value.

parameter.name: name
parameter.parameter_description: the name of the new offset

parameter.name: value
parameter.parameter_description: the value for the new offset

function.name: gtk_level_bar_get_inverted
function.description: Return the value of the #GtkLevelBar:inverted property.
function.return: %TRUE if the level bar is inverted

function.name: gtk_level_bar_get_max_value
function.description: Returns the value of the #GtkLevelBar:max-value property.

function.name: gtk_level_bar_get_min_value
function.description: Returns the value of the #GtkLevelBar:min-value property.

function.name: gtk_level_bar_get_mode
function.description: Returns the value of the #GtkLevelBar:mode property.

function.name: gtk_level_bar_get_offset_value
function.description: Fetches the value specified for the offset marker @name in @self, returning %TRUE in case an offset named @name was found.

parameter.name: name
parameter.parameter_description: the name of an offset in the bar

parameter.name: value
parameter.parameter_description: location where to store the value

function.return: %TRUE if the specified offset is found

function.name: gtk_level_bar_get_value
function.description: Returns the value of the #GtkLevelBar:value property.
function.return: a value in the interval between #GtkLevelBar:min-value and #GtkLevelBar:max-value

function.name: gtk_level_bar_new
function.description: Creates a new #GtkLevelBar.

function.name: gtk_level_bar_new_for_interval
function.description: Utility constructor that creates a new #GtkLevelBar for the specified interval.

function.name: gtk_level_bar_remove_offset_value
function.description: Removes an offset marker previously added with gtk_level_bar_add_offset_value().

parameter.name: name
parameter.parameter_description: the name of an offset in the bar

function.name: gtk_level_bar_set_inverted
function.description: Sets the value of the #GtkLevelBar:inverted property.

function.name: gtk_level_bar_set_max_value
function.description:
Sets the value of the #GtkLevelBar:max-value property.
You probably want to update preexisting level offsets after calling this function.

function.name: gtk_level_bar_set_min_value
function.description:
Sets the value of the #GtkLevelBar:min-value property.
You probably want to update preexisting level offsets after calling this function.

function.name: gtk_level_bar_set_mode
function.description: Sets the value of the #GtkLevelBar:mode property.

function.name: gtk_level_bar_set_value
function.description: Sets the value of the #GtkLevelBar:value property.

parameter.name: value
parameter.parameter_description: a value in the interval between #GtkLevelBar:min-value and #GtkLevelBar:max-value

function.name: gtk_link_button_get_uri
function.description: Retrieves the URI set using gtk_link_button_set_uri().
function.return: a valid URI. The returned string is owned by the link button and should not be modified or freed.

function.name: gtk_link_button_get_visited
function.description:
Retrieves the “visited” state of the URI where the #GtkLinkButton points. The button becomes visited when it is clicked. If the URI is changed on the button, the “visited” state is unset again.
The state may also be changed using gtk_link_button_set_visited().
function.return: %TRUE if the link has been visited, %FALSE otherwise

function.name: gtk_link_button_new
function.description: Creates a new #GtkLinkButton with the URI as its text.

function.name: gtk_link_button_new_with_label
function.description: Creates a new #GtkLinkButton containing a label.

function.name: gtk_link_button_set_uri
function.description: Sets @uri as the URI where the #GtkLinkButton points. As a side-effect this unsets the “visited” state of the button.

function.name: gtk_link_button_set_visited
function.description: Sets the “visited” state of the URI where the #GtkLinkButton points. See gtk_link_button_get_visited() for more details.

function.name: gtk_list_base_set_anchor_max_widgets
function.description:
Sets how many widgets should be kept alive around the anchor. The number of these widgets determines how many items can be displayed and must be chosen to be large enough to cover the allocation but should be kept as small as possible for performance reasons.
There will be @center widgets allocated around the anchor evenly distributed according to the anchor's alignment - if the anchor is at the start, all these widgets will be allocated behind it, if it's at the end, all the widgets will be allocated in front of it.
Addditionally, there will be @above_below widgets allocated both before and after the sencter widgets, so the total number of widgets kept alive is 2 * above_below + center + 1.

parameter.name: center
parameter.parameter_description: the number of widgets in the middle

function.name: gtk_list_base_size_allocate_child
function.description: Allocates a child widget in the list coordinate system, but with the coordinates already offset by the scroll offset.

parameter.name: x
parameter.parameter_description: top left coordinate in the across direction

parameter.name: y
parameter.parameter_description: top right coordinate in the along direction

function.name: gtk_list_box_append
function.description: Append a widget to the list. If a sort function is set, the widget will actually be inserted at the calculated position.

function.name: gtk_list_box_bind_model
function.description:
Binds @model to @box.
If @box was already bound to a model, that previous binding is destroyed.
The contents of @box are cleared and then filled with widgets that represent items from @model. @box is updated whenever @model changes. If @model is %NULL, @box is left empty.
It is undefined to add or remove widgets directly (for example, with gtk_list_box_insert()) while @box is bound to a model.
Note that using a model is incompatible with the filtering and sorting functionality in GtkListBox. When using a model, filtering and sorting should be implemented by the model.

parameter.name: create_widget_func
parameter.parameter_description: a function that creates widgets for items or %NULL in case you also passed %NULL as @model

function.name: gtk_list_box_drag_highlight_row
function.description:
This is a helper function for implementing DnD onto a #GtkListBox. The passed in @row will be highlighted by setting the #GTK_STATE_FLAG_DROP_ACTIVE state and any previously highlighted row will be unhighlighted.
The row will also be unhighlighted when the widget gets a drag leave event.

function.name: gtk_list_box_drag_unhighlight_row
function.description: If a row has previously been highlighted via gtk_list_box_drag_highlight_row() it will have the highlight removed.

function.name: gtk_list_box_get_activate_on_single_click
function.description: Returns whether rows activate on single clicks.
function.return: %TRUE if rows are activated on single click, %FALSE otherwise

function.name: gtk_list_box_get_adjustment
function.description: Gets the adjustment (if any) that the widget uses to for vertical scrolling.

function.name: gtk_list_box_get_row_at_index
function.description: Gets the n-th child in the list (not counting headers). If @_index is negative or larger than the number of items in the list, %NULL is returned.

function.name: gtk_list_box_get_row_at_y
function.description: Gets the row at the @y position.
function.return: the row or %NULL in case no row exists for the given y coordinate.

function.name: gtk_list_box_get_selected_row
function.description:
Gets the selected row.
Note that the box may allow multiple selection, in which case you should use gtk_list_box_selected_foreach() to find all selected rows.

function.name: gtk_list_box_get_selected_rows
function.description: Creates a list of all selected children.
function.return: A #GList containing the #GtkWidget for each selected child. Free with g_list_free() when done.

function.name: gtk_list_box_get_selection_mode
function.description: Gets the selection mode of the listbox.

function.name: gtk_list_box_get_show_separators
function.description: Returns whether the list box should show separators between rows.
function.return: %TRUE if the list box shows separators

function.name: gtk_list_box_insert
function.description:
Insert the @child into the @box at @position. If a sort function is set, the widget will actually be inserted at the calculated position.
If @position is -1, or larger than the total number of items in the @box, then the @child will be appended to the end.

function.name: gtk_list_box_invalidate_filter
function.description: Update the filtering for all rows. Call this when result of the filter function on the @box is changed due to an external factor. For instance, this would be used if the filter function just looked for a specific search string and the entry with the search string has changed.

function.name: gtk_list_box_invalidate_headers
function.description: Update the separators for all rows. Call this when result of the header function on the @box is changed due to an external factor.

function.name: gtk_list_box_invalidate_sort
function.description: Update the sorting for all rows. Call this when result of the sort function on the @box is changed due to an external factor.

function.name: gtk_list_box_new
function.description: Creates a new #GtkListBox container.

function.name: gtk_list_box_prepend
function.description: Prepend a widget to the list. If a sort function is set, the widget will actually be inserted at the calculated position.

function.name: gtk_list_box_remove
function.description: Removes a child from @box.

function.name: gtk_list_box_row_changed
function.description:
Marks @row as changed, causing any state that depends on this to be updated. This affects sorting, filtering and headers.
Note that calls to this method must be in sync with the data used for the row functions. For instance, if the list is mirroring some external data set, and *two* rows changed in the external data set then when you call gtk_list_box_row_changed() on the first row the sort function must only read the new data for the first of the two changed rows, otherwise the resorting of the rows will be wrong.
This generally means that if you don’t fully control the data model you have to duplicate the data that affects the listbox row functions into the row widgets themselves. Another alternative is to call gtk_list_box_invalidate_sort() on any model change, but that is more expensive.

function.name: gtk_list_box_row_get_activatable
function.description: Gets the value of the #GtkListBoxRow:activatable property for this row.

function.name: gtk_list_box_row_get_child
function.description: Gets the child widget of @row.

function.name: gtk_list_box_row_get_header
function.description: Returns the current header of the @row. This can be used in a #GtkListBoxUpdateHeaderFunc to see if there is a header set already, and if so to update the state of it.
function.return: the current header, or %NULL if none

function.name: gtk_list_box_row_get_index
function.description: Gets the current index of the @row in its #GtkListBox container.
function.return: the index of the @row, or -1 if the @row is not in a listbox

function.name: gtk_list_box_row_get_selectable
function.description: Gets the value of the #GtkListBoxRow:selectable property for this row.

function.name: gtk_list_box_row_is_selected
function.description: Returns whether the child is currently selected in its #GtkListBox container.

function.name: gtk_list_box_row_new
function.description: Creates a new #GtkListBoxRow, to be used as a child of a #GtkListBox.

function.name: gtk_list_box_row_set_activatable
function.description: Set the #GtkListBoxRow:activatable property for this row.

parameter.name: activatable
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE to mark the row as activatable

function.name: gtk_list_box_row_set_child
function.description: Sets the child widget of @self.

function.name: gtk_list_box_row_set_header
function.description: Sets the current header of the @row. This is only allowed to be called from a #GtkListBoxUpdateHeaderFunc. It will replace any existing header in the row, and be shown in front of the row in the listbox.

function.name: gtk_list_box_row_set_selectable
function.description: Set the #GtkListBoxRow:selectable property for this row.

parameter.name: selectable
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE to mark the row as selectable

function.name: gtk_list_box_select_all
function.description: Select all children of @box, if the selection mode allows it.

function.name: gtk_list_box_select_row
function.description: Make @row the currently selected row.

function.name: gtk_list_box_selected_foreach
function.description:
Calls a function for each selected child.
Note that the selection cannot be modified from within this function.

parameter.name: func
parameter.parameter_description: the function to call for each selected child

parameter.name: data
parameter.parameter_description: user data to pass to the function

function.name: gtk_list_box_set_activate_on_single_click
function.description: If @single is %TRUE, rows will be activated when you click on them, otherwise you need to double-click.

function.name: gtk_list_box_set_adjustment
function.description:
Sets the adjustment (if any) that the widget uses to for vertical scrolling. For instance, this is used to get the page size for PageUp/Down key handling.
In the normal case when the @box is packed inside a #GtkScrolledWindow the adjustment from that will be picked up automatically, so there is no need to manually do that.

function.name: gtk_list_box_set_filter_func
function.description:
By setting a filter function on the @box one can decide dynamically which of the rows to show. For instance, to implement a search function on a list that filters the original list to only show the matching rows.
The @filter_func will be called for each row after the call, and it will continue to be called each time a row changes (via gtk_list_box_row_changed()) or when gtk_list_box_invalidate_filter() is called.
Note that using a filter function is incompatible with using a model (see gtk_list_box_bind_model()).

parameter.name: filter_func
parameter.parameter_description: callback that lets you filter which rows to show

function.name: gtk_list_box_set_header_func
function.description:
By setting a header function on the @box one can dynamically add headers in front of rows, depending on the contents of the row and its position in the list. For instance, one could use it to add headers in front of the first item of a new kind, in a list sorted by the kind.
The @update_header can look at the current header widget using gtk_list_box_row_get_header() and either update the state of the widget as needed, or set a new one using gtk_list_box_row_set_header(). If no header is needed, set the header to %NULL.
Note that you may get many calls @update_header to this for a particular row when e.g. changing things that don’t affect the header. In this case it is important for performance to not blindly replace an existing header with an identical one.
The @update_header function will be called for each row after the call, and it will continue to be called each time a row changes (via gtk_list_box_row_changed()) and when the row before changes (either by gtk_list_box_row_changed() on the previous row, or when the previous row becomes a different row). It is also called for all rows when gtk_list_box_invalidate_headers() is called.

parameter.name: update_header
parameter.parameter_description: callback that lets you add row headers

function.name: gtk_list_box_set_placeholder
function.description: Sets the placeholder widget that is shown in the list when it doesn't display any visible children.

function.name: gtk_list_box_set_selection_mode
function.description: Sets how selection works in the listbox. See #GtkSelectionMode for details.

function.name: gtk_list_box_set_show_separators
function.description: Sets whether the list box should show separators between rows.

function.name: gtk_list_box_set_sort_func
function.description:
By setting a sort function on the @box one can dynamically reorder the rows of the list, based on the contents of the rows.
The @sort_func will be called for each row after the call, and will continue to be called each time a row changes (via gtk_list_box_row_changed()) and when gtk_list_box_invalidate_sort() is called.
Note that using a sort function is incompatible with using a model (see gtk_list_box_bind_model()).

function.name: gtk_list_box_unselect_all
function.description: Unselect all children of @box, if the selection mode allows it.

function.name: gtk_list_box_unselect_row
function.description: Unselects a single row of @box, if the selection mode allows it.

function.name: gtk_list_item_get_activatable
function.description: Checks if a list item has been set to be activatable via gtk_list_item_set_activatable().

function.name: gtk_list_item_get_child
function.description: Gets the child previously set via gtk_list_item_set_child() or %NULL if none was set.

function.name: gtk_list_item_get_item
function.description: Gets the item that is currently displayed in model that @self is currently bound to or %NULL if @self is unbound.

function.name: gtk_list_item_get_position
function.description: Gets the position in the model that @self currently displays. If @self is unbound, %GTK_INVALID_LIST_POSITION is returned.

function.name: gtk_list_item_get_selectable
function.description:
Checks if a list item has been set to be selectable via gtk_list_item_set_selectable().
