Do not confuse this function with gtk_list_item_get_selected().

function.name: gtk_list_item_get_selected
function.description: Checks if the item is displayed as selected. The selected state is maintained by the container and its list model and cannot be set otherwise.

function.name: gtk_list_item_manager_move_list_item
function.description:
Moves the widget to represent a new position in the listmodel without releasing the item.
This is most useful when scrolling.

parameter.name: list_item
parameter.parameter_description: an acquired #GtkListItem that should be moved to represent a different row

parameter.name: position
parameter.parameter_description: the new position of that list item

function.name: gtk_list_item_manager_try_acquire_list_item_from_change
function.description: Like gtk_list_item_manager_acquire_list_item(), but only tries to acquire list items from those previously released as part of @change. If no matching list item is found, %NULL is returned and the caller should use gtk_list_item_manager_acquire_list_item().

parameter.name: position
parameter.parameter_description: the row in the model to create a list item for

parameter.name: prev_sibling
parameter.parameter_description: the widget this widget should be inserted after or %NULL if it should be the first widget

function.return: a properly setup widget to use in @position or %NULL if no item for reuse existed

function.name: gtk_list_item_manager_update_list_item
function.description: Updates the position of the given @item. This function must be called whenever the position of an item changes, like when new items are added before it.

parameter.name: position
parameter.parameter_description: the new position of that list item

function.name: gtk_list_item_set_activatable
function.description:
Sets @self to be activatable.
If an item is activatable, double-clicking on the item, using the Return key or calling gtk_widget_activate() will activate the item. Activating instructs the containing view to handle activation. #GtkListView for example will be emitting the #GtkListView::activate signal.
By default, list items are activatable

parameter.name: activatable
parameter.parameter_description: if the item should be activatable

function.name: gtk_list_item_set_child
function.description:
Sets the child to be used for this listitem.
This function is typically called by applications when setting up a listitem so that the widget can be reused when binding it multiple times.

parameter.name: child
parameter.parameter_description: The list item's child or %NULL to unset

function.name: gtk_list_item_set_selectable
function.description:
Sets @self to be selectable. If an item is selectable, clicking on the item or using the keyboard will try to select or unselect the item. If this succeeds is up to the model to determine, as it is managing the selected state.
Note that this means that making an item non-selectable has no influence on the selected state at all. A non-selectable item may still be selected.
By default, list items are selectable. When rebinding them to a new item, they will also be reset to be selectable by GTK.

parameter.name: selectable
parameter.parameter_description: if the item should be selectable

function.name: gtk_list_store_append
function.description: Appends a new row to @list_store. @iter will be changed to point to this new row. The row will be empty after this function is called. To fill in values, you need to call gtk_list_store_set() or gtk_list_store_set_value().

parameter.name: iter
parameter.parameter_description: An unset #GtkTreeIter to set to the appended row

function.name: gtk_list_store_clear
function.description: Removes all rows from the list store.

function.name: gtk_list_store_insert
function.description: Creates a new row at @position. @iter will be changed to point to this new row. If @position is -1 or is larger than the number of rows on the list, then the new row will be appended to the list. The row will be empty after this function is called. To fill in values, you need to call gtk_list_store_set() or gtk_list_store_set_value().

parameter.name: iter
parameter.parameter_description: An unset #GtkTreeIter to set to the new row

parameter.name: position
parameter.parameter_description: position to insert the new row, or -1 for last

function.name: gtk_list_store_insert_after
function.description: Inserts a new row after @sibling. If @sibling is %NULL, then the row will be prepended to the beginning of the list. @iter will be changed to point to this new row. The row will be empty after this function is called. To fill in values, you need to call gtk_list_store_set() or gtk_list_store_set_value().

parameter.name: iter
parameter.parameter_description: An unset #GtkTreeIter to set to the new row

function.name: gtk_list_store_insert_before
function.description: Inserts a new row before @sibling. If @sibling is %NULL, then the row will be appended to the end of the list. @iter will be changed to point to this new row. The row will be empty after this function is called. To fill in values, you need to call gtk_list_store_set() or gtk_list_store_set_value().

parameter.name: iter
parameter.parameter_description: An unset #GtkTreeIter to set to the new row

function.name: gtk_list_store_insert_with_values
function.description:
Creates a new row at @position. @iter will be changed to point to this new row. If @position is -1, or larger than the number of rows in the list, then the new row will be appended to the list. The row will be filled with the values given to this function.
Calling `gtk_list_store_insert_with_values (list_store, iter, position...)` has the same effect as calling |[<!-- language="C" --> static void insert_value (GtkListStore *list_store, GtkTreeIter *iter, int position) { gtk_list_store_insert (list_store, iter, position); gtk_list_store_set (list_store, iter // ... ); } ]| with the difference that the former will only emit a row_inserted signal, while the latter will emit row_inserted, row_changed and, if the list store is sorted, rows_reordered. Since emitting the rows_reordered signal repeatedly can affect the performance of the program, gtk_list_store_insert_with_values() should generally be preferred when inserting rows in a sorted list store.

parameter.name: iter
parameter.parameter_description: An unset #GtkTreeIter to set to the new row, or %NULL

parameter.name: position
parameter.parameter_description: position to insert the new row, or -1 to append after existing rows

parameter.name: Varargs
parameter.parameter_description: pairs of column number and value, terminated with -1

function.name: gtk_list_store_insert_with_valuesv
function.description: A variant of gtk_list_store_insert_with_values() which takes the columns and values as two arrays, instead of varargs. This function is mainly intended for language-bindings.

parameter.name: iter
parameter.parameter_description: An unset #GtkTreeIter to set to the new row, or %NULL.

parameter.name: position
parameter.parameter_description: position to insert the new row, or -1 for last

parameter.name: n_values
parameter.parameter_description: the length of the @columns and @values arrays

function.name: gtk_list_store_iter_is_valid
function.description:
> This function is slow. Only use it for debugging and/or testing > purposes.
Checks if the given iter is a valid iter for this #GtkListStore.
function.return: %TRUE if the iter is valid, %FALSE if the iter is invalid.

function.name: gtk_list_store_move_after
function.description: Moves @iter in @store to the position after @position. Note that this function only works with unsorted stores. If @position is %NULL, @iter will be moved to the start of the list.

function.name: gtk_list_store_move_before
function.description: Moves @iter in @store to the position before @position. Note that this function only works with unsorted stores. If @position is %NULL, @iter will be moved to the end of the list.

function.name: gtk_list_store_new
function.description:
Creates a new list store as with @n_columns columns each of the types passed in. Note that only types derived from standard GObject fundamental types are supported.
As an example, `gtk_list_store_new (3, G_TYPE_INT, G_TYPE_STRING, GDK_TYPE_TEXTURE);` will create a new #GtkListStore with three columns, of type int, string and #GdkTexture, respectively.

parameter.name: n_columns
parameter.parameter_description: number of columns in the list store

parameter.name: Varargs
parameter.parameter_description: all #GType types for the columns, from first to last

function.name: gtk_list_store_newv
function.description: Non-vararg creation function. Used primarily by language bindings.

parameter.name: n_columns
parameter.parameter_description: number of columns in the list store

parameter.name: types
parameter.parameter_description: an array of #GType types for the columns, from first to last

function.name: gtk_list_store_prepend
function.description: Prepends a new row to @list_store. @iter will be changed to point to this new row. The row will be empty after this function is called. To fill in values, you need to call gtk_list_store_set() or gtk_list_store_set_value().

parameter.name: iter
parameter.parameter_description: An unset #GtkTreeIter to set to the prepend row

function.name: gtk_list_store_remove
gtk_list_store_reorder
function.description: Reorders @store to follow the order indicated by @new_order. Note that this function only works with unsorted stores.

parameter.name: new_order
parameter.parameter_description: an array of integers mapping the new position of each child to its old position before the re-ordering, i.e. @new_order`[newpos] = oldpos`. It must have exactly as many items as the list store’s length.

function.name: gtk_list_store_set
function.description:
Sets the value of one or more cells in the row referenced by @iter. The variable argument list should contain integer column numbers, each column number followed by the value to be set. The list is terminated by a -1. For example, to set column 0 with type %G_TYPE_STRING to “Foo”, you would write `gtk_list_store_set (store, iter, 0, "Foo", -1)`.
The value will be referenced by the store if it is a %G_TYPE_OBJECT, and it will be copied if it is a %G_TYPE_STRING or %G_TYPE_BOXED.

parameter.name: Varargs
parameter.parameter_description: pairs of column number and value, terminated with -1

function.name: gtk_list_store_set_column_types
function.description: This function is meant primarily for #GObjects that inherit from #GtkListStore, and should only be used when constructing a new #GtkListStore. It will not function after a row has been added, or a method on the #GtkTreeModel interface is called.

parameter.name: n_columns
parameter.parameter_description: Number of columns for the list store

function.name: gtk_list_store_set_valist
function.description: See gtk_list_store_set(); this version takes a va_list for use by language bindings.

parameter.name: iter
parameter.parameter_description: A valid #GtkTreeIter for the row being modified

function.name: gtk_list_store_set_value
function.description: Sets the data in the cell specified by @iter and @column. The type of @value must be convertible to the type of the column.

parameter.name: iter
parameter.parameter_description: A valid #GtkTreeIter for the row being modified

function.name: gtk_list_store_set_valuesv
function.description: A variant of gtk_list_store_set_valist() which takes the columns and values as two arrays, instead of varargs. This function is mainly intended for language-bindings and in case the number of columns to change is not known until run-time.

parameter.name: iter
parameter.parameter_description: A valid #GtkTreeIter for the row being modified

parameter.name: n_values
parameter.parameter_description: the length of the @columns and @values arrays

function.name: gtk_list_store_swap
function.description: Swaps @a and @b in @store. Note that this function only works with unsorted stores.

function.name: gtk_list_view_get_enable_rubberband
function.description: Returns whether rows can be selected by dragging with the mouse.

function.name: gtk_list_view_get_factory
function.description: Gets the factory that's currently used to populate list items.

function.name: gtk_list_view_get_model
function.description: Gets the model that's currently used to read the items displayed.

function.name: gtk_list_view_get_show_separators
function.description: Returns whether the list box should show separators between rows.
function.return: %TRUE if the list box shows separators

function.name: gtk_list_view_get_single_click_activate
function.description: Returns whether rows will be activated on single click and selected on hover.
function.return: %TRUE if rows are activated on single click

function.name: gtk_list_view_new
function.description:
Creates a new #GtkListView that uses the given @factory for mapping items to widgets.
The function takes ownership of the arguments, so you can write code like ``` list_view = gtk_list_view_new (create_model (), gtk_builder_list_item_factory_new_from_resource ("/resource.ui")); ```

parameter.name: factory
parameter.parameter_description: The factory to populate items with, or %NULL

function.return: a new #GtkListView using the given @model and @factory

function.name: gtk_list_view_set_enable_rubberband
function.description: Sets whether selections can be changed by dragging with the mouse.

function.name: gtk_list_view_set_factory
function.description: Sets the #GtkListItemFactory to use for populating list items.

parameter.name: factory
parameter.parameter_description: the factory to use or %NULL for none

function.name: gtk_list_view_set_model
function.description: Sets the #GtkSelectionModel to use.

parameter.name: model
parameter.parameter_description: the model to use or %NULL for none

function.name: gtk_list_view_set_show_separators
function.description: Sets whether the list box should show separators between rows.

function.name: gtk_list_view_set_single_click_activate
function.description: Sets whether rows should be activated on single click and selected on hover.

parameter.name: single_click_activate
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE to activate items on single click

function.name: gtk_lock_button_get_permission
function.description: Obtains the #GPermission object that controls @button.

function.name: gtk_lock_button_new
function.description: Creates a new lock button which reflects the @permission.

function.name: gtk_lock_button_set_permission
function.description: Sets the #GPermission object that controls @button.

function.name: gtk_map_list_model_get_model
function.description: Gets the model that is currently being mapped or %NULL if none.

function.name: gtk_map_list_model_has_map
function.description: Checks if a map function is currently set on @self
function.return: %TRUE if a map function is set

function.name: gtk_map_list_model_new
function.description: Creates a new #GtkMapListModel for the given arguments.

parameter.name: model
parameter.parameter_description: The model to map or %NULL for none

parameter.name: map_func
parameter.parameter_description: map function or %NULL to not map items

function.name: gtk_map_list_model_set_map_func
function.description:
Sets the function used to map items. The function will be called whenever an item needs to be mapped and must return the item to use for the given input item.
Note that #GtkMapListModel may call this function multiple times on the same item, because it may delete items it doesn't need anymore.
GTK makes no effort to ensure that @map_func conforms to the item type of @self. It assumes that the caller knows what they are doing and the map function returns items of the appropriate type.

parameter.name: map_func
parameter.parameter_description: map function or %NULL to not map items

function.name: gtk_map_list_model_set_model
function.description:
Sets the model to be mapped.
GTK makes no effort to ensure that @model conforms to the item type expected by the map function. It assumes that the caller knows what they are doing and have set up an appropriate map function.

function.name: gtk_media_controls_get_media_stream
function.description: Gets the media stream managed by @controls or %NULL if none.

function.name: gtk_media_controls_new
function.description: Creates a new #GtkMediaControls managing the @stream passed to it.

parameter.name: stream
parameter.parameter_description: a #GtkMediaStream to manage or %NULL for none.

function.name: gtk_media_controls_set_media_stream
function.description: Sets the stream that is controlled by @controls.

function.name: gtk_media_file_clear
function.description: Resets the media file to be empty.

function.name: gtk_media_file_get_file
function.description:
Returns the file that @self is currently playing from.
When @self is not playing or not playing from a file, %NULL is returned.
function.return: The currently playing file or %NULL if not playing from a file.

function.name: gtk_media_file_get_input_stream
function.description:
Returns the stream that @self is currently playing from.
When @self is not playing or not playing from a stream, %NULL is returned.
function.return: The currently playing stream or %NULL if not playing from a stream.

function.name: gtk_media_file_new
function.description: Creates a new empty media file.

function.name: gtk_media_file_new_for_file
function.description: Creates a new media file to play @file.

function.name: gtk_media_file_new_for_filename
function.description: This is a utility function that converts the given @filename to a #GFile and calls gtk_media_file_new_for_file().

function.name: gtk_media_file_new_for_input_stream
function.description: Creates a new media file to play @stream. If you want the resulting media to be seekable, the stream should implement the #GSeekable interface.

function.name: gtk_media_file_new_for_resource
function.description: This is a utility function that converts the given @resource to a #GFile and calls gtk_media_file_new_for_file().

function.name: gtk_media_file_set_file
function.description:
If any file is still playing, stop playing it.
Then start playing the given @file.

function.name: gtk_media_file_set_filename
function.description: This is a utility function that converts the given @filename to a #GFile and calls gtk_media_file_set_file().

function.name: gtk_media_file_set_input_stream
function.description:
If anything is still playing, stop playing it. Then start playing the given @stream.
Full control about the @stream is assumed for the duration of playback. The stream will not bt be closed.

function.name: gtk_media_file_set_resource
function.description: This is a utility function that converts the given @resource_path to a #GFile and calls gtk_media_file_set_file().

function.name: gtk_media_stream_ended
function.description: Pauses the media stream and marks it as ended. This is a hint only, calls to GtkMediaStream.play() may still happen.

function.name: gtk_media_stream_error
function.description:
Sets @self into an error state using a printf()-style format string.
This is a utility function that calls gtk_media_stream_gerror(). See that function for details.

function.name: gtk_media_stream_error_valist
function.description:
Sets @self into an error state using a printf()-style format string.
This is a utility function that calls gtk_media_stream_gerror(). See that function for details.

parameter.name: args
parameter.parameter_description: #va_list of parameters for the message format

function.name: gtk_media_stream_gerror
function.description:
Sets @self into an error state. This will pause the stream (you can check for an error via gtk_media_stream_get_error() in your GtkMediaStream.pause() implementation), abort pending seeks and mark the stream as prepared.
if the stream is already in an error state, this call will be ignored and the existing error will be retained. FIXME: Or do we want to set the new error?
To unset an error, the stream must be reset via a call to gtk_media_stream_unprepared().

function.name: gtk_media_stream_get_duration
function.description: Gets the duration of the stream. If the duration is not known, 0 will be returned.
function.return: the duration of the stream or 0 if not known.

function.name: gtk_media_stream_get_ended
function.description: Returns whether the streams playback is finished.

function.name: gtk_media_stream_get_error
function.description:
If the stream is in an error state, returns the #GError explaining that state. Any type of error can be reported here depending on the implementation of the media stream.
A media stream in an error cannot be operated on, calls like gtk_media_stream_play() or gtk_media_stream_seek() will not have any effect.
#GtkMediaStream itself does not provide a way to unset an error, but implementations may provide options. For example, a #GtkMediaFile will unset errors when a new source is set with ie gtk_media_file_set_file().
function.return: %NULL if not in an error state or the #GError of the stream

function.name: gtk_media_stream_get_loop
function.description: Returns whether the stream is set to loop. See gtk_media_stream_set_loop() for details.

function.name: gtk_media_stream_get_muted
function.description: Returns whether the audio for the stream is muted. See gtk_media_stream_set_muted() for details.

function.name: gtk_media_stream_get_playing
function.description: Return whether the stream is currently playing.

function.name: gtk_media_stream_get_timestamp
function.description: Returns the current presentation timestamp in microseconds.

function.name: gtk_media_stream_get_volume
function.description: Returns the volume of the audio for the stream. See gtk_media_stream_set_volume() for details.
function.return: volume of the stream from 0.0 to 1.0

function.name: gtk_media_stream_has_audio
function.description: Returns whether the stream has audio.

function.name: gtk_media_stream_has_video
function.description: Returns whether the stream has video.

function.name: gtk_media_stream_is_prepared
function.description: Returns whether the stream has finished initializing and existence of audio and video is known.

function.name: gtk_media_stream_is_seekable
function.description:
Checks if a stream may be seekable.
This is meant to be a hint. Streams may not allow seeking even if this function returns %TRUE. However, if this function returns %FALSE, streams are guaranteed to not be seekable and user interfaces may hide controls that allow seeking.
It is allowed to call gtk_media_stream_seek() on a non-seekable stream, though it will not do anything.
function.return: %TRUE if the stream may support seeking

function.name: gtk_media_stream_is_seeking
function.description: Checks if there is currently a seek operation going on.
function.return: %TRUE if a seek operation is ongoing.

function.name: gtk_media_stream_pause
function.description: Pauses playback of the stream. If the stream is not playing, do nothing.

function.name: gtk_media_stream_play
function.description: Starts playing the stream. If the stream is in error or already playing, do nothing.

function.name: gtk_media_stream_prepared
function.description:
Called by #GtkMediaStream implementations to advertise the stream being ready to play and providing details about the stream.
Note that the arguments are hints. If the stream implementation cannot determine the correct values, it is better to err on the side of caution and return %TRUE. User interfaces will use those values to determine what controls to show.
This function may not be called again until the stream has been reset via gtk_media_stream_unprepared().

parameter.name: has_audio
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE if the stream should advertise audio support

parameter.name: has_video
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE if the stream should advertise video support

parameter.name: seekable
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE if the stream should advertise seekability

parameter.name: duration
parameter.parameter_description: The duration of the stream or 0 if unknown

function.name: gtk_media_stream_realize
function.description:
Called by users to attach the media stream to a #GdkSurface they manage. The stream can then access the resources of @surface for its rendering purposes. In particular, media streams might want to create #GdkGLContexts or sync to the #GdkFrameClock.
Whoever calls this function is responsible for calling gtk_media_stream_unrealize() before either the stream or @surface get destroyed.
Multiple calls to this function may happen from different users of the video, even with the same @surface. Each of these calls must be followed by its own call to gtk_media_stream_unrealize().
It is not required to call this function to make a media stream work.

function.name: gtk_media_stream_seek
function.description:
Start a seek operation on @self to @timestamp. If @timestamp is out of range, it will be clamped.
Seek operations may not finish instantly. While a seek operation is in process, the GtkMediaStream:seeking property will be set.
When calling gtk_media_stream_seek() during an ongoing seek operation, the new seek will override any pending seek.

function.name: gtk_media_stream_seek_failed
function.description:
Ends a seek operation started via GtkMediaStream.seek() as a failure. This will not cause an error on the stream and will assume that playback continues as if no seek had happened.
See gtk_media_stream_seek_success() for the other way of ending a seek.

function.name: gtk_media_stream_seek_success
function.description:
Ends a seek operation started via GtkMediaStream.seek() successfully. This function will unset the GtkMediaStream:ended property if it was set.
See gtk_media_stream_seek_failed() for the other way of ending a seek.

function.name: gtk_media_stream_set_loop
function.description:
Sets whether the stream should loop, ie restart playback from the beginning instead of stopping at the end.
Not all streams may support looping, in particular non-seekable streams. Those streams will ignore the loop setting and just end.

function.name: gtk_media_stream_set_muted
function.description:
Sets whether the audio stream should be muted. Muting a stream will cause no audio to be played, but it does not modify the volume. This means that muting and then unmuting the stream will restore the volume settings.
If the stream has no audio, calling this function will still work but it will not have an audible effect.

parameter.name: muted
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE if the stream should be muted

function.name: gtk_media_stream_set_playing
function.description: Starts or pauses playback of the stream.

parameter.name: playing
parameter.parameter_description: whether to start or pause playback

function.name: gtk_media_stream_set_volume
function.description:
Sets the volume of the audio stream. This function call will work even if the stream is muted.
The given @volume should range from 0.0 for silence to 1.0 for as loud as possible. Values outside of this range will be clamped to the nearest value.
If the stream has no audio or is muted, calling this function will still work but it will not have an immediate audible effect. When the stream is unmuted, the new volume setting will take effect.

parameter.name: volume
parameter.parameter_description: New volume of the stream from 0.0 to 1.0

function.name: gtk_media_stream_unprepared
function.description:
Resets a given media stream implementation. gtk_media_stream_prepared() can now be called again.
This function will also reset any error state the stream was in.

function.name: gtk_media_stream_unrealize
function.description: Undoes a previous call to gtk_media_stream_realize() and causes the stream to release all resources it had allocated from @surface.

parameter.name: surface
parameter.parameter_description: the #GdkSurface the stream was realized with

function.name: gtk_media_stream_update
function.description: Media stream implementations should regularly call this function to update the timestamp reported by the stream. It is up to implementations to call this at the frequency they deem appropriate.

function.name: gtk_menu_button_get_direction
function.description: Returns the direction the popup will be pointing at when popped up.

function.name: gtk_menu_button_get_has_frame
function.description: Returns whether the button has a frame.
function.return: %TRUE if the button has a frame

function.name: gtk_menu_button_get_icon_name
function.description: Gets the name of the icon shown in the button.
function.return: the name of the icon shown in the button

function.name: gtk_menu_button_get_label
function.description: Gets the label shown in the button
function.return: the label shown in the button

function.name: gtk_menu_button_get_menu_model
function.description: Returns the #GMenuModel used to generate the popup.

function.name: gtk_menu_button_get_popover
function.description: Returns the #GtkPopover that pops out of the button. If the button is not using a #GtkPopover, this function returns %NULL.

function.name: gtk_menu_button_get_use_underline
function.description: Returns whether an embedded underline in the text indicates a mnemonic. See gtk_menu_button_set_use_underline().
function.return: %TRUE whether an embedded underline in the text indicates the mnemonic accelerator keys.

function.name: gtk_menu_button_new
function.description: Creates a new #GtkMenuButton widget with downwards-pointing arrow as the only child. You can replace the child widget with another #GtkWidget should you wish to.

function.name: gtk_menu_button_popdown
function.description: Dismiss the menu.

function.name: gtk_menu_button_popup
function.description: Pop up the menu.

function.name: gtk_menu_button_set_create_popup_func
function.description:
Sets @func to be called when a popup is about to be shown. @func should use one of
- gtk_menu_button_set_popover() - gtk_menu_button_set_menu_model()
to set a popup for @menu_button. If @func is non-%NULL, @menu_button will always be sensitive.
Using this function will not reset the menu widget attached to @menu_button. Instead, this can be done manually in @func.

parameter.name: func
parameter.parameter_description: function to call when a popuop is about to be shown, but none has been provided via other means, or %NULL to reset to default behavior.

function.name: gtk_menu_button_set_direction
function.description:
Sets the direction in which the popup will be popped up, as well as changing the arrow’s direction. The child will not be changed to an arrow if it was customized.
If the does not fit in the available space in the given direction, GTK will its best to keep it inside the screen and fully visible.
If you pass %GTK_ARROW_NONE for a @direction, the popup will behave as if you passed %GTK_ARROW_DOWN (although you won’t see any arrows).

function.name: gtk_menu_button_set_has_frame
function.description: Sets the style of the button.

parameter.name: has_frame
parameter.parameter_description: whether the button should have a visible frame

function.name: gtk_menu_button_set_icon_name
function.description: Sets the name of an icon to show inside the menu button.

function.name: gtk_menu_button_set_label
function.description: Sets the label to show inside the menu button.

function.name: gtk_menu_button_set_menu_model
function.description:
Sets the #GMenuModel from which the popup will be constructed, or %NULL to dissociate any existing menu model and disable the button.
A #GtkPopover will be created from the menu model with gtk_popover_menu_new_from_model(). Actions will be connected as documented for this function.
If #GtkMenuButton:popover is already set, it will be dissociated from the @menu_button, and the property is set to %NULL.

parameter.name: menu_model
parameter.parameter_description: a #GMenuModel, or %NULL to unset and disable the button

function.name: gtk_menu_button_set_popover
function.description:
Sets the #GtkPopover that will be popped up when the @menu_button is clicked, or %NULL to dissociate any existing popover and disable the button.
If #GtkMenuButton:menu-model is set, the menu model is dissociated from the @menu_button, and the property is set to %NULL.

parameter.name: popover
parameter.parameter_description: a #GtkPopover, or %NULL to unset and disable the button

function.name: gtk_menu_button_set_use_underline
function.description: If true, an underline in the text indicates the next character should be used for the mnemonic accelerator key.

parameter.name: use_underline
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE if underlines in the text indicate mnemonics

function.name: gtk_message_dialog_format_secondary_markup

parameter.name: message_format
parameter.parameter_description: printf()-style markup string (see [Pango markup format][PangoMarkupFormat]), or %NULL

function.name: gtk_message_dialog_format_secondary_text
function.description: Sets the secondary text of the message dialog to be @message_format (with printf()-style).

function.name: gtk_message_dialog_get_message_area
function.description: Returns the message area of the dialog. This is the box where the dialog’s primary and secondary labels are packed. You can add your own extra content to that box and it will appear below those labels. See gtk_dialog_get_content_area() for the corresponding function in the parent #GtkDialog.
function.return: A #GtkBox corresponding to the “message area” in the @message_dialog.

function.name: gtk_message_dialog_new
function.description: Creates a new message dialog, which is a simple dialog with some text the user may want to see. When the user clicks a button a “response” signal is emitted with response IDs from #GtkResponseType. See #GtkDialog for more details.

function.name: gtk_message_dialog_new_with_markup
function.description:
Creates a new message dialog, which is a simple dialog with some text that is marked up with the [Pango text markup language][PangoMarkupFormat]. When the user clicks a button a “response” signal is emitted with response IDs from #GtkResponseType. See #GtkDialog for more details.
Special XML characters in the printf() arguments passed to this function will automatically be escaped as necessary. (See g_markup_printf_escaped() for how this is implemented.) Usually this is what you want, but if you have an existing Pango markup string that you want to use literally as the label, then you need to use gtk_message_dialog_set_markup() instead, since you can’t pass the markup string either as the format (it might contain “%” characters) or as a string argument. |[<!-- language="C" --> GtkWidget *dialog; GtkDialogFlags flags = GTK_DIALOG_DESTROY_WITH_PARENT; dialog = gtk_message_dialog_new (parent_window, flags, GTK_MESSAGE_ERROR, GTK_BUTTONS_CLOSE, NULL); gtk_message_dialog_set_markup (GTK_MESSAGE_DIALOG (dialog), markup); ]|

function.name: gtk_message_dialog_set_markup
function.description: Sets the text of the message dialog to be @str, which is marked up with the [Pango text markup language][PangoMarkupFormat].

function.name: gtk_mnemonic_action_get
function.description: Gets the mnemonic action. This is an action that calls gtk_widget_mnemonic_activate() on the given widget upon activation.

function.name: gtk_mnemonic_trigger_get_keyval
function.description: Gets the keyval that must be pressed to succeed triggering @self.

function.name: gtk_mnemonic_trigger_new
function.description:
Creates a #GtkShortcutTrigger that will trigger whenever the key with the given @keyval is pressed and mnemonics have been activated.
Mnemonics are activated by calling code when a key event with the right modifiers is detected.

function.name: gtk_model_button_new
function.description: Creates a new GtkModelButton.

function.name: gtk_mount_operation_get_display
function.description: Gets the display on which windows of the #GtkMountOperation will be shown.
function.return: the display on which windows of @op are shown

function.name: gtk_mount_operation_get_parent
function.description: Gets the transient parent used by the #GtkMountOperation
function.return: the transient parent for windows shown by @op

function.name: gtk_mount_operation_is_showing
function.description: Returns whether the #GtkMountOperation is currently displaying a window.
function.return: %TRUE if @op is currently displaying a window

function.name: gtk_mount_operation_new
function.description: Creates a new #GtkMountOperation

parameter.name: parent
parameter.parameter_description: transient parent of the window, or %NULL

function.name: gtk_mount_operation_set_display
function.description: Sets the display to show windows of the #GtkMountOperation on.

function.name: gtk_mount_operation_set_parent
function.description: Sets the transient parent for windows shown by the #GtkMountOperation.

parameter.name: parent
parameter.parameter_description: transient parent of the window, or %NULL

function.name: gtk_multi_filter_append
function.description: Adds a @filter to @self to use for matching.

function.name: gtk_multi_filter_remove
function.description: Removes the filter at the given @position from the list of filters used by @self. If @position is larger than the number of filters, nothing happens and the function returns.

function.name: gtk_multi_selection_get_model
function.description: Returns the underlying model of @self.

function.name: gtk_multi_selection_new
function.description: Creates a new selection to handle @model.

function.name: gtk_multi_selection_set_model
function.description: Sets the model that @self should wrap. If @model is %NULL, @self will be empty.

function.name: gtk_multi_sorter_append
function.description: Add @sorter to @self to use for sorting at the end. @self will consult all existing sorters before it will sort with the given @sorter.

function.name: gtk_multi_sorter_new
function.description:
Creates a new multi sorter.
This sorter compares items by trying each of the sorters in turn, until one returns non-zero. In particular, if no sorter has been added to it, it will always compare items as equal.

function.name: gtk_multi_sorter_remove
function.description:
Removes the sorter at the given @position from the list of sorter used by @self.
If @position is larger than the number of sorters, nothing happens.

function.name: gtk_named_action_get_action_name
function.description: Returns the name of the action that will be activated.
function.return: the name of the action to activate

function.name: gtk_named_action_new
function.description:
Creates an action that when activated, activates the action given by the detailed @name on the widget passing the given arguments to it.
See gtk_widget_insert_action_group() for how to add actions to widgets.

parameter.name: name
parameter.parameter_description: the detailed name of the action

function.name: gtk_native_dialog_destroy
function.description:
Destroys a dialog.
When a dialog is destroyed, it will break any references it holds to other objects. If it is visible it will be hidden and any underlying window system resources will be destroyed.
Note that this does not release any reference to the object (as opposed to destroying a GtkWindow) because there is no reference from the windowing system to the #GtkNativeDialog.

function.name: gtk_native_dialog_get_modal
function.description: Returns whether the dialog is modal. See gtk_native_dialog_set_modal().
function.return: %TRUE if the dialog is set to be modal

function.name: gtk_native_dialog_get_title
function.description: Gets the title of the #GtkNativeDialog.
function.return: the title of the dialog, or %NULL if none has been set explicitly. The returned string is owned by the widget and must not be modified or freed.

function.name: gtk_native_dialog_get_transient_for
function.description: Fetches the transient parent for this window. See gtk_native_dialog_set_transient_for().
function.return: the transient parent for this window, or %NULL if no transient parent has been set.

function.name: gtk_native_dialog_get_visible
function.description: Determines whether the dialog is visible.

function.name: gtk_native_dialog_hide
function.description:
Hides the dialog if it is visilbe, aborting any interaction. Once this is called the #GtkNativeDialog::response signal will not be emitted until after the next call to gtk_native_dialog_show().
If the dialog is not visible this does nothing.

function.name: gtk_native_dialog_set_modal
function.description: Sets a dialog modal or non-modal. Modal dialogs prevent interaction with other windows in the same application. To keep modal dialogs on top of main application windows, use gtk_native_dialog_set_transient_for() to make the dialog transient for the parent; most [window managers][gtk-X11-arch] will then disallow lowering the dialog below the parent.

function.name: gtk_native_dialog_set_title
function.description: Sets the title of the #GtkNativeDialog.

function.name: gtk_native_dialog_set_transient_for
function.description:
Dialog windows should be set transient for the main application window they were spawned from. This allows [window managers][gtk-X11-arch] to e.g. keep the dialog on top of the main window, or center the dialog over the main window.
Passing %NULL for @parent unsets the current transient window.

function.name: gtk_native_dialog_show
function.description:
Shows the dialog on the display, allowing the user to interact with it. When the user accepts the state of the dialog the dialog will be automatically hidden and the #GtkNativeDialog::response signal will be emitted.
Multiple calls while the dialog is visible will be ignored.

function.name: gtk_native_get_for_surface
function.description: Finds the GtkNative associated with the surface.

function.name: gtk_native_get_renderer
function.description: Returns the renderer that is used for this #GtkNative.

function.name: gtk_native_get_surface
function.description: Returns the surface of this #GtkNative.

function.name: gtk_native_get_surface_transform
function.description: Retrieves the surface transform of @self. This is the translation from @self's surface coordinates into @self's widget coordinates.

parameter.name: x
parameter.parameter_description: return location for the x coordinate

parameter.name: y
parameter.parameter_description: return location for the y coordinate

function.name: gtk_native_realize
function.description: Realizes a #GtkNative.

function.name: gtk_native_unrealize
function.description: Unrealizes a #GtkNative.

function.name: gtk_never_trigger_get
function.description: Gets the never trigger. This is a singleton for a trigger that never triggers. Use this trigger instead of %NULL because it implements all virtual functions.

function.name: gtk_no_selection_get_model
function.description: Gets the model that @self is wrapping.

function.name: gtk_no_selection_new
function.description: Creates a new selection to handle @model.

function.name: gtk_no_selection_set_model
function.description: Sets the model that @self should wrap. If @model is %NULL, this model will be empty.

function.name: gtk_notebook_append_page
function.description: Appends a page to @notebook.

parameter.name: child
parameter.parameter_description: the #GtkWidget to use as the contents of the page

parameter.name: tab_label
parameter.parameter_description: the #GtkWidget to be used as the label for the page, or %NULL to use the default label, “page N”

function.return: the index (starting from 0) of the appended page in the notebook, or -1 if function fails

function.name: gtk_notebook_append_page_menu
function.description: Appends a page to @notebook, specifying the widget to use as the label in the popup menu.

parameter.name: child
parameter.parameter_description: the #GtkWidget to use as the contents of the page

parameter.name: tab_label
parameter.parameter_description: the #GtkWidget to be used as the label for the page, or %NULL to use the default label, “page N”

parameter.name: menu_label
parameter.parameter_description: the widget to use as a label for the page-switch menu, if that is enabled. If %NULL, and @tab_label is a #GtkLabel or %NULL, then the menu label will be a newly created label with the same text as @tab_label; if @tab_label is not a #GtkLabel, @menu_label must be specified if the page-switch menu is to be used.

function.return: the index (starting from 0) of the appended page in the notebook, or -1 if function fails

function.name: gtk_notebook_detach_tab
function.description:
Removes the child from the notebook.
This function is very similar to gtk_notebook_remove_page(), but additionally informs the notebook that the removal is happening as part of a tab DND operation, which should not be cancelled.

function.name: gtk_notebook_get_action_widget
function.description: Gets one of the action widgets. See gtk_notebook_set_action_widget().

parameter.name: pack_type
parameter.parameter_description: pack type of the action widget to receive

function.return: The action widget with the given @pack_type or %NULL when this action widget has not been set

function.name: gtk_notebook_get_current_page
function.description: Returns the page number of the current page.
function.return: the index (starting from 0) of the current page in the notebook. If the notebook has no pages, then -1 will be returned.

function.name: gtk_notebook_get_group_name
function.description: Gets the current group name for @notebook.
function.return: the group name, or %NULL if none is set

function.name: gtk_notebook_get_menu_label
function.description: Retrieves the menu label widget of the page containing @child.

parameter.name: child
parameter.parameter_description: a widget contained in a page of @notebook

function.return: the menu label, or %NULL if the notebook page does not have a menu label other than the default (the tab label).

function.name: gtk_notebook_get_menu_label_text
function.description: Retrieves the text of the menu label for the page containing @child.

parameter.name: child
parameter.parameter_description: the child widget of a page of the notebook.

function.return: the text of the tab label, or %NULL if the widget does not have a menu label other than the default menu label, or the menu label widget is not a #GtkLabel. The string is owned by the widget and must not be freed.

function.name: gtk_notebook_get_n_pages
function.description: Gets the number of pages in a notebook.
function.return: the number of pages in the notebook

function.name: gtk_notebook_get_nth_page
function.description: Returns the child widget contained in page number @page_num.

parameter.name: page_num
parameter.parameter_description: the index of a page in the notebook, or -1 to get the last page

function.return: the child widget, or %NULL if @page_num is out of bounds

function.name: gtk_notebook_get_page
function.description: Returns the #GtkNotebookPage for @child.

function.name: gtk_notebook_get_pages
function.description: Returns a #GListModel that contains the pages of the notebook, and can be used to keep an up-to-date view.

function.name: gtk_notebook_get_scrollable
function.description: Returns whether the tab label area has arrows for scrolling. See gtk_notebook_set_scrollable().
function.return: %TRUE if arrows for scrolling are present

function.name: gtk_notebook_get_show_border
function.description: Returns whether a bevel will be drawn around the notebook pages. See gtk_notebook_set_show_border().

function.name: gtk_notebook_get_show_tabs
function.description: Returns whether the tabs of the notebook are shown. See gtk_notebook_set_show_tabs().

function.name: gtk_notebook_get_tab_detachable
function.description: Returns whether the tab contents can be detached from @notebook.

function.name: gtk_notebook_get_tab_label
function.description: Returns the tab label widget for the page @child. %NULL is returned if @child is not in @notebook or if no tab label has specifically been set for @child.

function.name: gtk_notebook_get_tab_label_text
function.description: Retrieves the text of the tab label for the page containing @child.

parameter.name: child
parameter.parameter_description: a widget contained in a page of @notebook

function.return: the text of the tab label, or %NULL if the tab label widget is not a #GtkLabel. The string is owned by the widget and must not be freed.

function.name: gtk_notebook_get_tab_pos
function.description: Gets the edge at which the tabs for switching pages in the notebook are drawn.
function.return: the edge at which the tabs are drawn

function.name: gtk_notebook_get_tab_reorderable
function.description: Gets whether the tab can be reordered via drag and drop or not.

function.name: gtk_notebook_insert_page
function.description: Insert a page into @notebook at the given position.

parameter.name: child
parameter.parameter_description: the #GtkWidget to use as the contents of the page

parameter.name: tab_label
parameter.parameter_description: the #GtkWidget to be used as the label for the page, or %NULL to use the default label, “page N”

parameter.name: position
parameter.parameter_description: the index (starting at 0) at which to insert the page, or -1 to append the page after all other pages

function.return: the index (starting from 0) of the inserted page in the notebook, or -1 if function fails

function.name: gtk_notebook_insert_page_menu
function.description: Insert a page into @notebook at the given position, specifying the widget to use as the label in the popup menu.

parameter.name: child
parameter.parameter_description: the #GtkWidget to use as the contents of the page

parameter.name: tab_label
parameter.parameter_description: the #GtkWidget to be used as the label for the page, or %NULL to use the default label, “page N”

parameter.name: menu_label
parameter.parameter_description: the widget to use as a label for the page-switch menu, if that is enabled. If %NULL, and @tab_label is a #GtkLabel or %NULL, then the menu label will be a newly created label with the same text as @tab_label; if @tab_label is not a #GtkLabel, @menu_label must be specified if the page-switch menu is to be used.

parameter.name: position
parameter.parameter_description: the index (starting at 0) at which to insert the page, or -1 to append the page after all other pages.

function.return: the index (starting from 0) of the inserted page in the notebook

function.name: gtk_notebook_new
function.description: Creates a new #GtkNotebook widget with no pages.

function.name: gtk_notebook_next_page
function.description: Switches to the next page. Nothing happens if the current page is the last page.

function.name: gtk_notebook_page_get_child
function.description: Returns the notebook child to which @page belongs.

function.name: gtk_notebook_page_num
function.description: Finds the index of the page which contains the given child widget.
function.return: the index of the page containing @child, or -1 if @child is not in the notebook

function.name: gtk_notebook_popup_disable
function.description: Disables the popup menu.

function.name: gtk_notebook_popup_enable
function.description: Enables the popup menu: if the user clicks with the right mouse button on the tab labels, a menu with all the pages will be popped up.

function.name: gtk_notebook_prepend_page
function.description: Prepends a page to @notebook.

parameter.name: child
parameter.parameter_description: the #GtkWidget to use as the contents of the page

parameter.name: tab_label
parameter.parameter_description: the #GtkWidget to be used as the label for the page, or %NULL to use the default label, “page N”

function.return: the index (starting from 0) of the prepended page in the notebook, or -1 if function fails

function.name: gtk_notebook_prepend_page_menu
function.description: Prepends a page to @notebook, specifying the widget to use as the label in the popup menu.

parameter.name: child
parameter.parameter_description: the #GtkWidget to use as the contents of the page

parameter.name: tab_label
parameter.parameter_description: the #GtkWidget to be used as the label for the page, or %NULL to use the default label, “page N”

parameter.name: menu_label
parameter.parameter_description: the widget to use as a label for the page-switch menu, if that is enabled. If %NULL, and @tab_label is a #GtkLabel or %NULL, then the menu label will be a newly created label with the same text as @tab_label; if @tab_label is not a #GtkLabel, @menu_label must be specified if the page-switch menu is to be used.

function.return: the index (starting from 0) of the prepended page in the notebook, or -1 if function fails

function.name: gtk_notebook_prev_page
function.description: Switches to the previous page. Nothing happens if the current page is the first page.

function.name: gtk_notebook_remove_page
function.description: Removes a page from the notebook given its index in the notebook.

parameter.name: page_num
parameter.parameter_description: the index of a notebook page, starting from 0. If -1, the last page will be removed.

function.name: gtk_notebook_reorder_child
function.description: Reorders the page containing @child, so that it appears in position @position. If @position is greater than or equal to the number of children in the list or negative, @child will be moved to the end of the list.

parameter.name: position
parameter.parameter_description: the new position, or -1 to move to the end

function.name: gtk_notebook_set_action_widget
function.description: Sets @widget as one of the action widgets. Depending on the pack type the widget will be placed before or after the tabs. You can use a #GtkBox if you need to pack more than one widget on the same side.

parameter.name: pack_type
parameter.parameter_description: pack type of the action widget

function.name: gtk_notebook_set_current_page
function.description:
Switches to the page number @page_num.
Note that due to historical reasons, GtkNotebook refuses to switch to a page unless the child widget is visible. Therefore, it is recommended to show child widgets before adding them to a notebook.

parameter.name: page_num
parameter.parameter_description: index of the page to switch to, starting from 0. If negative, the last page will be used. If greater than the number of pages in the notebook, nothing will be done.

function.name: gtk_notebook_set_group_name
function.description:
Sets a group name for @notebook.
Notebooks with the same name will be able to exchange tabs via drag and drop. A notebook with a %NULL group name will not be able to exchange tabs with any other notebook.

parameter.name: group_name
parameter.parameter_description: the name of the notebook group, or %NULL to unset it

function.name: gtk_notebook_set_menu_label
function.description: Changes the menu label for the page containing @child.

parameter.name: menu_label
parameter.parameter_description: the menu label, or %NULL for default

function.name: gtk_notebook_set_menu_label_text
function.description: Creates a new label and sets it as the menu label of @child.

function.name: gtk_notebook_set_scrollable
function.description: Sets whether the tab label area will have arrows for scrolling if there are too many tabs to fit in the area.

parameter.name: scrollable
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE if scroll arrows should be added

function.name: gtk_notebook_set_show_border
function.description: Sets whether a bevel will be drawn around the notebook pages. This only has a visual effect when the tabs are not shown. See gtk_notebook_set_show_tabs().

parameter.name: show_border
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE if a bevel should be drawn around the notebook

function.name: gtk_notebook_set_show_tabs
function.description: Sets whether to show the tabs for the notebook or not.

parameter.name: show_tabs
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE if the tabs should be shown

function.name: gtk_notebook_set_tab_detachable

parameter.name: detachable
parameter.parameter_description: whether the tab is detachable or not

function.name: gtk_notebook_set_tab_label
function.description: Changes the tab label for @child. If %NULL is specified for @tab_label, then the page will have the label “page N”.

parameter.name: tab_label
parameter.parameter_description: the tab label widget to use, or %NULL for default tab label

function.name: gtk_notebook_set_tab_label_text
function.description: Creates a new label and sets it as the tab label for the page containing @child.

function.name: gtk_notebook_set_tab_pos
function.description: Sets the edge at which the tabs for switching pages in the notebook are drawn.

parameter.name: pos
parameter.parameter_description: the edge to draw the tabs at

function.name: gtk_notebook_set_tab_reorderable
function.description: Sets whether the notebook tab can be reordered via drag and drop or not.

parameter.name: reorderable
parameter.parameter_description: whether the tab is reorderable or not

function.name: gtk_nothing_action_get
function.description: Gets the nothing action. This is an action that does nothing and where activating it always fails.

function.name: gtk_numeric_sorter_get_expression
function.description: Gets the expression that is evaluated to obtain numbers from items.

function.name: gtk_numeric_sorter_get_sort_order
function.description: Gets whether this sorter will sort smaller numbers first.

function.name: gtk_numeric_sorter_new
function.description:
Creates a new numeric sorter using the given @expression.
Smaller numbers will be sorted first. You can call gtk_numeric_sorter_set_sort_order() to change this.

function.name: gtk_numeric_sorter_set_expression
function.description:
Sets the expression that is evaluated to obtain numbers from items.
Unless an expression is set on @self, the sorter will always compare items as invalid.
The expression must have a return type that can be compared numerically, such as #G_TYPE_INT or #G_TYPE_DOUBLE.

function.name: gtk_numeric_sorter_set_sort_order
function.description: Sets whether to sort smaller numbers before larger ones.

parameter.name: sort_order
parameter.parameter_description: whether to sort smaller numbers first

function.name: gtk_object_expression_get_object
function.description: Gets the object that the expression evaluates to.

function.name: gtk_object_expression_new
function.description:
Creates an expression evaluating to the given @object with a weak reference. Once the @object is disposed, it will fail to evaluate. This expression is meant to break reference cycles.
If you want to keep a reference to @object, use gtk_constant_expression_new().

function.name: gtk_ordering_from_cmpfunc
function.description: Converts the result of a #GCompareFunc like strcmp() to a #GtkOrdering.

function.name: gtk_orientable_get_orientation
function.description: Retrieves the orientation of the @orientable.

function.name: gtk_orientable_set_orientation
function.description: Sets the orientation of the @orientable.

function.name: gtk_overlay_add_overlay
function.description:
Adds @widget to @overlay.
The widget will be stacked on top of the main widget added with gtk_overlay_set_child().
The position at which @widget is placed is determined from its #GtkWidget:halign and #GtkWidget:valign properties.

parameter.name: widget
parameter.parameter_description: a #GtkWidget to be added to the container

function.name: gtk_overlay_get_child
function.description: Gets the child widget of @overlay.

function.name: gtk_overlay_get_clip_overlay
function.description: Gets whether @widget should be clipped within the parent.
function.return: whether the widget is clipped within the parent.

function.name: gtk_overlay_get_measure_overlay
function.description: Gets whether @widget's size is included in the measurement of @overlay.

function.name: gtk_overlay_layout_child_get_clip_overlay
function.description: Retrieves whether the child is clipped.

function.name: gtk_overlay_layout_child_get_measure
function.description: Retrieves whether the child is measured.

function.name: gtk_overlay_layout_child_set_clip_overlay
function.description: Sets whether to clip this child.

function.name: gtk_overlay_layout_child_set_measure
function.description: Sets whether to measure this child.

function.name: gtk_overlay_layout_new
function.description: Creates a new #GtkOverlayLayout instance.

function.name: gtk_overlay_new
function.description: Creates a new #GtkOverlay.

function.name: gtk_overlay_remove_overlay
function.description: Removes an overlay that was added with gtk_overlay_add_overlay().

function.name: gtk_overlay_set_child
function.description: Sets the child widget of @overlay.

function.name: gtk_overlay_set_clip_overlay
function.description: Sets whether @widget should be clipped within the parent.

parameter.name: clip_overlay
parameter.parameter_description: whether the child should be clipped

function.name: gtk_overlay_set_measure_overlay
function.description:
Sets whether @widget is included in the measured size of @overlay.
The overlay will request the size of the largest child that has this property set to %TRUE. Children who are not included may be drawn outside of @overlay's allocation if they are too large.

parameter.name: measure
parameter.parameter_description: whether the child should be measured

function.name: gtk_pad_controller_new
function.description:
Creates a new #GtkPadController that will associate events from @pad to actions. A %NULL pad may be provided so the controller manages all pad devices generically, it is discouraged to mix #GtkPadController objects with %NULL and non-%NULL @pad argument on the same toplevel window, as execution order is not guaranteed.
The #GtkPadController is created with no mapped actions. In order to map pad events to actions, use gtk_pad_controller_set_action_entries() or gtk_pad_controller_set_action().
Be aware that pad events will only be delivered to #GtkWindows, so adding a pad controller to any other type of widget will not have an effect.

parameter.name: pad
parameter.parameter_description: A %GDK_SOURCE_TABLET_PAD device, or %NULL to handle all pads

function.name: gtk_pad_controller_set_action
function.description:
Adds an individual action to @controller. This action will only be activated if the given button/ring/strip number in @index is interacted while the current mode is @mode. -1 may be used for simple cases, so the action is triggered on all modes.
The given @label should be considered user-visible, so internationalization rules apply. Some windowing systems may be able to use those for user feedback.

parameter.name: type
parameter.parameter_description: the type of pad feature that will trigger this action

parameter.name: index
parameter.parameter_description: the 0-indexed button/ring/strip number that will trigger this action

parameter.name: mode
parameter.parameter_description: the mode that will trigger this action, or -1 for all modes.

parameter.name: label
parameter.parameter_description: Human readable description of this action, this string should be deemed user-visible.

parameter.name: action_name
parameter.parameter_description: action name that will be activated in the #GActionGroup

function.name: gtk_pad_controller_set_action_entries
function.description: This is a convenience function to add a group of action entries on @controller. See #GtkPadActionEntry and gtk_pad_controller_set_action().

parameter.name: entries
parameter.parameter_description: the action entries to set on @controller

function.name: gtk_page_setup_copy
function.description: Copies a #GtkPageSetup.

function.name: gtk_page_setup_get_bottom_margin
function.description: Gets the bottom margin in units of @unit.

parameter.name: unit
parameter.parameter_description: the unit for the return value

function.name: gtk_page_setup_get_left_margin
function.description: Gets the left margin in units of @unit.

parameter.name: unit
parameter.parameter_description: the unit for the return value

function.name: gtk_page_setup_get_orientation
function.description: Gets the page orientation of the #GtkPageSetup.

function.name: gtk_page_setup_get_page_height
function.description:
Returns the page height in units of @unit.
Note that this function takes orientation and margins into consideration. See gtk_page_setup_get_paper_height().

parameter.name: unit
parameter.parameter_description: the unit for the return value

function.name: gtk_page_setup_get_page_width
function.description:
Returns the page width in units of @unit.
Note that this function takes orientation and margins into consideration. See gtk_page_setup_get_paper_width().

parameter.name: unit
parameter.parameter_description: the unit for the return value

function.name: gtk_page_setup_get_paper_height
function.description:
Returns the paper height in units of @unit.
Note that this function takes orientation, but not margins into consideration. See gtk_page_setup_get_page_height().

parameter.name: unit
parameter.parameter_description: the unit for the return value

function.name: gtk_page_setup_get_paper_size
function.description: Gets the paper size of the #GtkPageSetup.

function.name: gtk_page_setup_get_paper_width
function.description:
Returns the paper width in units of @unit.
Note that this function takes orientation, but not margins into consideration. See gtk_page_setup_get_page_width().

parameter.name: unit
parameter.parameter_description: the unit for the return value

function.name: gtk_page_setup_get_right_margin
function.description: Gets the right margin in units of @unit.

parameter.name: unit
parameter.parameter_description: the unit for the return value

function.name: gtk_page_setup_get_top_margin
function.description: Gets the top margin in units of @unit.

parameter.name: unit
parameter.parameter_description: the unit for the return value

function.name: gtk_page_setup_load_file
function.description: Reads the page setup from the file @file_name. See gtk_page_setup_to_file().

parameter.name: file_name
parameter.parameter_description: the filename to read the page setup from

parameter.name: error
parameter.parameter_description: return location for an error, or %NULL

function.name: gtk_page_setup_load_key_file
function.description: Reads the page setup from the group @group_name in the key file @key_file.

parameter.name: key_file
parameter.parameter_description: the #GKeyFile to retrieve the page_setup from

function.name: gtk_paper_size_is_custom
function.description: Returns %TRUE if @size is not a standard paper size.
function.return: whether @size is a custom paper size.

function.name: gtk_paper_size_is_equal
function.description: Compares two #GtkPaperSize objects.
function.return: %TRUE, if @size1 and @size2 represent the same paper size

function.name: gtk_paper_size_is_ipp
function.description: Returns %TRUE if @size is an IPP standard paper size.
function.return: whether @size is not an IPP custom paper size.

function.name: gtk_paper_size_new
function.description:
Creates a new #GtkPaperSize object by parsing a [PWG 5101.1-2002](ftp://ftp.pwg.org/pub/pwg/candidates/cs-pwgmsn10-20020226-5101.1.pdf) paper name.
If @name is %NULL, the default paper size is returned, see gtk_paper_size_get_default().
function.return: a new #GtkPaperSize, use gtk_paper_size_free() to free it

function.name: gtk_paper_size_new_custom
function.description: Creates a new #GtkPaperSize object with the given parameters.

parameter.name: width
parameter.parameter_description: the paper width, in units of @unit

parameter.name: height
parameter.parameter_description: the paper height, in units of @unit

function.return: a new #GtkPaperSize object, use gtk_paper_size_free() to free it

function.name: gtk_paper_size_new_from_gvariant
function.description: Deserialize a paper size from an a{sv} variant in the format produced by gtk_paper_size_to_gvariant().

function.name: gtk_paper_size_new_from_ipp
function.description:
Creates a new #GtkPaperSize object by using IPP information.
If @ipp_name is not a recognized paper name, @width and @height are used to construct a custom #GtkPaperSize object.
function.return: a new #GtkPaperSize, use gtk_paper_size_free() to free it

function.name: gtk_paper_size_new_from_key_file
function.description: Reads a paper size from the group @group_name in the key file @key_file.

parameter.name: group_name
parameter.parameter_description: the name of the group in the key file to read, or %NULL to read the first group

parameter.name: error
parameter.parameter_description: return location for an error, or %NULL

function.return: a new #GtkPaperSize object with the restored paper size, or %NULL if an error occurred

function.name: gtk_paper_size_new_from_ppd
function.description:
Creates a new #GtkPaperSize object by using PPD information.
If @ppd_name is not a recognized PPD paper name, @ppd_display_name, @width and @height are used to construct a custom #GtkPaperSize object.
function.return: a new #GtkPaperSize, use gtk_paper_size_free() to free it

function.description: Changes the dimensions of a @size to @width x @height.

parameter.name: height
parameter.parameter_description: the new height in units of @unit

function.name: gtk_picture_get_alternative_text
function.description: Gets the alternative textual description of the picture or returns %NULL if the picture cannot be described textually.

function.name: gtk_picture_get_can_shrink
function.description: Gets the value set via gtk_picture_set_can_shrink().
function.return: %TRUE if the picture can be made smaller than its contents

function.name: gtk_picture_get_file
function.description: Gets the #GFile currently displayed if @self is displaying a file. If @self is not displaying a file, for example when gtk_picture_set_paintable() was used, then %NULL is returned.

function.name: gtk_picture_get_keep_aspect_ratio
function.description: Gets the value set via gtk_picture_set_keep_aspect_ratio().
function.return: %TRUE if the self tries to keep the contents' aspect ratio

function.name: gtk_picture_get_paintable
function.description: Gets the #GdkPaintable being displayed by the #GtkPicture.
function.return: the displayed paintable, or %NULL if the picture is empty

function.name: gtk_picture_new
function.description: Creates a new empty #GtkPicture widget.

function.name: gtk_picture_new_for_file
function.description:
Creates a new #GtkPicture displaying the given @file. If the file isn’t found or can’t be loaded, the resulting #GtkPicture be empty.
If you need to detect failures to load the file, use gdk_texture_new_from_file() to load the file yourself, then create the #GtkPicture from the texture.

function.name: gtk_picture_new_for_filename
function.description:
Creates a new #GtkPicture displaying the file @filename.
This is a utility function that calls gtk_picture_new_for_file(). See that function for details.

function.name: gtk_picture_new_for_paintable
function.description:
Creates a new #GtkPicture displaying @paintable.
The #GtkPicture will track changes to the @paintable and update its size and contents in response to it.

function.name: gtk_picture_new_for_pixbuf
function.description:
Creates a new #GtkPicture displaying @pixbuf.
This is a utility function that calls gtk_picture_new_for_paintable(), See that function for details.
The pixbuf must not be modified after passing it to this function.

function.name: gtk_picture_new_for_resource
function.description:
Creates a new #GtkPicture displaying the file @filename.
This is a utility function that calls gtk_picture_new_for_file(). See that function for details.

function.name: gtk_picture_set_alternative_text
function.description:
Sets an alternative textual description for the picture contents. It is equivalent to the "alt" attribute for images on websites.
This text will be made available to accessibility tools.
If the picture cannot be described textually, set this property to %NULL.

parameter.name: alternative_text
parameter.parameter_description: a textual description of the contents

function.name: gtk_picture_set_can_shrink
function.description:
If set to %TRUE, the @self can be made smaller than its contents. The contents will then be scaled down when rendering.
If you want to still force a minimum size manually, consider using gtk_widget_set_size_request().
Also of note is that a similar function for growing does not exist because the grow behavior can be controlled via gtk_widget_set_halign() and gtk_widget_set_valign().

parameter.name: can_shrink
parameter.parameter_description: if @self can be made smaller than its contents

function.name: gtk_picture_set_file
function.description:
Makes @self load and display @file.
See gtk_picture_new_for_file() for details.

function.name: gtk_picture_set_filename
function.description:
Makes @self load and display the given @filename.
This is a utility function that calls gtk_picture_set_file().

function.name: gtk_picture_set_keep_aspect_ratio
function.description:
If set to %TRUE, the @self will render its contents according to their aspect ratio. That means that empty space may show up at the top/bottom or left/right of @self.
If set to %FALSE or if the contents provide no aspect ratio, the contents will be stretched over the picture's whole area.

function.name: gtk_picture_set_paintable
function.description:
Makes @self display the given @paintable. If @paintable is %NULL, nothing will be displayed.
See gtk_picture_new_for_paintable() for details.

function.name: gtk_picture_set_pixbuf
function.description:
See gtk_picture_new_for_pixbuf() for details.
This is a utility function that calls gtk_picture_set_paintable(),

function.name: gtk_picture_set_resource
gtk_popover_get_autohide
function.description:
Returns whether the popover is modal.
See gtk_popover_set_autohide() for the implications of this.

function.name: gtk_popover_get_cascade_popdown
function.description: Returns whether the popover will close after a modal child is closed.
function.return: #TRUE if @popover will close after a modal child.

function.name: gtk_popover_get_child
function.description: Gets the child widget of @popover.

function.name: gtk_popover_get_has_arrow
function.description: Gets whether this popover is showing an arrow pointing at the widget that it is relative to.
function.return: whether the popover has an arrow

function.name: gtk_popover_get_mnemonics_visible
function.description: Gets the value of the #GtkPopover:mnemonics-visible property.
function.return: %TRUE if mnemonics are supposed to be visible in this popover

function.name: gtk_popover_get_offset
function.description: Gets the offset previous set with gtk_popover_set_offset().

function.name: gtk_popover_get_pointing_to
function.description: If a rectangle to point to has been set, this function will return %TRUE and fill in @rect with such rectangle, otherwise it will return %FALSE and fill in @rect with the attached widget coordinates.
function.return: %TRUE if a rectangle to point to was set.

function.name: gtk_popover_get_position
function.description: Returns the preferred position of @popover.

function.name: gtk_popover_menu_add_child
function.description:
Adds a custom widget to a generated menu.
For this to work, the menu model of @popover must have an item with a `custom` attribute that matches @id.
function.return: %TRUE if @id was found and the widget added

function.name: gtk_popover_menu_bar_add_child
function.description:
Adds a custom widget to a generated menubar.
For this to work, the menu model of @bar must have an item with a `custom` attribute that matches @id.
function.return: %TRUE if @id was found and the widget added

function.name: gtk_popover_menu_bar_get_menu_model
function.description: Returns the model from which the contents of @bar are taken.

function.name: gtk_popover_menu_bar_new_from_model
function.description: Creates a #GtkPopoverMenuBar from a #GMenuModel.

function.name: gtk_popover_menu_bar_remove_child
function.description: Removes a widget that has previously been added with gtk_popover_menu_bar_add_child().

function.name: gtk_popover_menu_bar_set_menu_model
function.description: Sets a menu model from which @bar should take its contents.

function.name: gtk_popover_menu_get_menu_model
function.description: Returns the menu model used to populate the popover.

function.name: gtk_popover_menu_new
function.description: Creates a new popover menu.

function.name: gtk_popover_menu_new_from_model
function.description:
Creates a #GtkPopoverMenu and populates it according to @model.
The created buttons are connected to actions found in the #GtkApplicationWindow to which the popover belongs - typically by means of being attached to a widget that is contained within the #GtkApplicationWindows widget hierarchy.
Actions can also be added using gtk_widget_insert_action_group() on the menus attach widget or on any of its parent widgets.
This function creates menus with sliding submenus. See gtk_popover_menu_new_from_model_full() for a way to control this.

function.name: gtk_popover_menu_new_from_model_full
function.description:
Creates a #GtkPopoverMenu and populates it according to @model.
The created buttons are connected to actions found in the action groups that are accessible from the parent widget. This includes the #GtkApplicationWindow to which the popover belongs. Actions can also be added using gtk_widget_insert_action_group() on the parent widget or on any of its parent widgets.
The only flag that is supported currently is #GTK_POPOVER_MENU_NESTED, which makes GTK create traditional, nested submenus instead of the default sliding submenus.

parameter.name: flags
parameter.parameter_description: flags that affect how the menu is created

function.name: gtk_popover_menu_remove_child
function.description: Removes a widget that has previously been added with gtk_popover_menu_add_child().

function.name: gtk_popover_menu_set_menu_model
function.description:
Sets a new menu model on @popover.
The existing contents of @popover are removed, and the @popover is populated with new contents according to @model.

function.name: gtk_popover_new
function.description: Creates a new popover.

function.name: gtk_popover_popdown
function.description: Pops @popover down.This is different than a gtk_widget_hide() call in that it shows the popover with a transition. If you want to hide the popover without a transition, use gtk_widget_hide().

function.name: gtk_popover_popup
function.description: Pops @popover up. This is different than a gtk_widget_show() call in that it shows the popover with a transition. If you want to show the popover without a transition, use gtk_widget_show().

function.name: gtk_popover_present
function.description: Presents the popover to the user.

function.name: gtk_popover_set_autohide
function.description:
Sets whether @popover is modal.
A modal popover will grab the keyboard focus on it when being displayed. Clicking outside the popover area or pressing Esc will dismiss the popover.
Called this function on an already showing popup with a new autohide value different from the current one, will cause the popup to be hidden.

parameter.name: autohide
parameter.parameter_description: #TRUE to dismiss the popover on outside clicks

function.name: gtk_popover_set_cascade_popdown
function.description: If @cascade_popdown is #TRUE, the popover will be closed when a child modal popover is closed. If #FALSE, @popover will stay visible.

parameter.name: cascade_popdown
parameter.parameter_description: #TRUE if the popover should follow a child closing

function.name: gtk_popover_set_child
