function.description: Sets the child widget of @popover.

function.name: gtk_popover_set_default_widget
function.description: The default widget is the widget that’s activated when the user presses Enter in a dialog (for example). This function sets or unsets the default widget for a #GtkPopover.

parameter.name: widget
parameter.parameter_description: a child widget of @popover to set as the default, or %NULL to unset the default widget for the popover

function.name: gtk_popover_set_has_arrow
function.description: Sets whether this popover should draw an arrow pointing at the widget it is relative to.

function.name: gtk_popover_set_mnemonics_visible
function.description: Sets the #GtkPopover:mnemonics-visible property.

function.name: gtk_popover_set_offset
function.description:
Sets the offset to use when calculating the position of the popover.
These values are used when preparing the #GtkPopupLayout for positioning the popover.

parameter.name: x_offset
parameter.parameter_description: the x offset to adjust the position by

parameter.name: y_offset
parameter.parameter_description: the y offset to adjust the position by

function.name: gtk_popover_set_pointing_to
function.description: Sets the rectangle that @popover will point to, in the coordinate space of the @popover parent.

function.name: gtk_popover_set_position
function.description:
Sets the preferred position for @popover to appear. If the @popover is currently visible, it will be immediately updated.
This preference will be respected where possible, although on lack of space (eg. if close to the window edges), the #GtkPopover may choose to appear on the opposite side

function.name: gtk_print_backend_get_printer_list
function.description: Returns the current list of printers.
function.return: A list of #GtkPrinter objects. The list should be freed with g_list_free().

function.name: gtk_print_context_create_pango_context
function.description: Creates a new #PangoContext that can be used with the #GtkPrintContext.

function.name: gtk_print_context_create_pango_layout
function.description: Creates a new #PangoLayout that is suitable for use with the #GtkPrintContext.

function.name: gtk_print_context_get_cairo_context
function.description: Obtains the cairo context that is associated with the #GtkPrintContext.

function.name: gtk_print_context_get_dpi_x
function.description: Obtains the horizontal resolution of the #GtkPrintContext, in dots per inch.

function.name: gtk_print_context_get_dpi_y
function.description: Obtains the vertical resolution of the #GtkPrintContext, in dots per inch.

function.name: gtk_print_context_get_hard_margins
function.description: Obtains the hardware printer margins of the #GtkPrintContext, in units.
function.return: %TRUE if the hard margins were retrieved

function.name: gtk_print_context_get_height
function.description: Obtains the height of the #GtkPrintContext, in pixels.

function.name: gtk_print_context_get_page_setup
function.description: Obtains the #GtkPageSetup that determines the page dimensions of the #GtkPrintContext.

function.name: gtk_print_context_get_pango_fontmap
function.description: Returns a #PangoFontMap that is suitable for use with the #GtkPrintContext.

function.name: gtk_print_context_get_width
function.description: Obtains the width of the #GtkPrintContext, in pixels.

function.name: gtk_print_context_set_cairo_context
function.description:
Sets a new cairo context on a print context.
This function is intended to be used when implementing an internal print preview, it is not needed for printing, since GTK itself creates a suitable cairo context in that case.

parameter.name: dpi_x
parameter.parameter_description: the horizontal resolution to use with @cr

parameter.name: dpi_y
parameter.parameter_description: the vertical resolution to use with @cr

function.name: gtk_print_context_set_hard_margins
function.description: set the hard margins in pixel coordinates

function.name: gtk_print_error_quark
function.description: Registers an error quark for #GtkPrintOperation if necessary.
function.return: The error quark used for #GtkPrintOperation errors.

function.name: gtk_print_job_get_collate
function.description: Gets whether this job is printed collated.
function.return: whether the job is printed collated

function.name: gtk_print_job_get_n_up
function.description: Gets the n-up setting for this job.

function.name: gtk_print_job_get_n_up_layout
function.description: Gets the n-up layout setting for this job.

function.name: gtk_print_job_get_num_copies
function.description: Gets the number of copies of this job.

function.name: gtk_print_job_get_page_ranges
function.description: Gets the page ranges for this job.

parameter.name: n_ranges
parameter.parameter_description: return location for the number of ranges

function.return: a pointer to an array of #GtkPageRange structs

function.name: gtk_print_job_get_page_set
function.description: Gets the #GtkPageSet setting for this job.

function.name: gtk_print_job_get_pages
function.description: Gets the #GtkPrintPages setting for this job.

function.name: gtk_print_job_get_printer
function.description: Gets the #GtkPrinter of the print job.

function.name: gtk_print_job_get_reverse
function.description: Gets whether this job is printed reversed.
function.return: whether the job is printed reversed.

function.name: gtk_print_job_get_rotate
function.description: Gets whether the job is printed rotated.
function.return: whether the job is printed rotated

function.name: gtk_print_job_get_scale
function.description: Gets the scale for this job (where 1.0 means unscaled).

function.name: gtk_print_job_get_settings
function.description: Gets the #GtkPrintSettings of the print job.

function.name: gtk_print_job_get_status
function.description: Gets the status of the print job.

function.name: gtk_print_job_get_surface
function.description: Gets a cairo surface onto which the pages of the print job should be rendered.

function.name: gtk_print_job_get_title
function.description: Gets the job title.

function.name: gtk_print_job_get_track_print_status
function.description: Returns whether jobs will be tracked after printing. For details, see gtk_print_job_set_track_print_status().
function.return: %TRUE if print job status will be reported after printing

function.name: gtk_print_job_new
function.description: Creates a new #GtkPrintJob.

function.name: gtk_print_job_send
function.description: Sends the print job off to the printer.

parameter.name: callback
parameter.parameter_description: function to call when the job completes or an error occurs

parameter.name: user_data
parameter.parameter_description: user data that gets passed to @callback

function.name: gtk_print_job_set_collate
function.description: Sets whether this job is printed collated.

parameter.name: collate
parameter.parameter_description: whether the job is printed collated

function.name: gtk_print_job_set_n_up
function.description: Sets the n-up setting for this job.

function.name: gtk_print_job_set_n_up_layout
function.description: Sets the n-up layout setting for this job.

function.name: gtk_print_job_set_num_copies
function.description: Sets the number of copies for this job.

function.name: gtk_print_job_set_page_ranges
function.description: Sets the page ranges for this job.

parameter.name: ranges
parameter.parameter_description: pointer to an array of #GtkPageRange structs

function.name: gtk_print_job_set_page_set
function.description: Sets the #GtkPageSet setting for this job.

function.name: gtk_print_job_set_pages
function.description: Sets the #GtkPrintPages setting for this job.

function.name: gtk_print_job_set_reverse
function.description: Sets whether this job is printed reversed.

parameter.name: reverse
parameter.parameter_description: whether the job is printed reversed

function.name: gtk_print_job_set_rotate
function.description: Sets whether this job is printed rotated.

function.name: gtk_print_job_set_scale
function.description: Sets the scale for this job (where 1.0 means unscaled).

function.name: gtk_print_job_set_source_fd
function.description:
Make the #GtkPrintJob send an existing document to the printing system. The file can be in any format understood by the platforms printing system (typically PostScript, but on many platforms PDF may work too). See gtk_printer_accepts_pdf() and gtk_printer_accepts_ps().
This is similar to gtk_print_job_set_source_file(), but takes expects an open file descriptor for the file, instead of a filename.

function.name: gtk_print_job_set_source_file
function.description: Make the #GtkPrintJob send an existing document to the printing system. The file can be in any format understood by the platforms printing system (typically PostScript, but on many platforms PDF may work too). See gtk_printer_accepts_pdf() and gtk_printer_accepts_ps().

function.name: gtk_print_job_set_track_print_status
function.description:
If track_status is %TRUE, the print job will try to continue report on the status of the print job in the printer queues and printer. This can allow your application to show things like “out of paper” issues, and when the print job actually reaches the printer.
This function is often implemented using some form of polling, so it should not be enabled unless needed.

function.name: gtk_print_operation_cancel
function.description: Cancels a running print operation. This function may be called from a #GtkPrintOperation::begin-print, #GtkPrintOperation::paginate or #GtkPrintOperation::draw-page signal handler to stop the currently running print operation.

function.name: gtk_print_operation_draw_page_finish
function.description:
Signalize that drawing of particular page is complete.
It is called after completion of page drawing (e.g. drawing in another thread). If gtk_print_operation_set_defer_drawing() was called before, then this function has to be called by application. In another case it is called by the library itself.

function.name: gtk_print_operation_get_default_page_setup
function.description: Returns the default page setup, see gtk_print_operation_set_default_page_setup().

function.name: gtk_print_operation_get_embed_page_setup
function.description: Gets the value of #GtkPrintOperation:embed-page-setup property.
function.return: whether page setup selection combos are embedded

function.name: gtk_print_operation_get_error
function.description: Call this when the result of a print operation is %GTK_PRINT_OPERATION_RESULT_ERROR, either as returned by gtk_print_operation_run(), or in the #GtkPrintOperation::done signal handler. The returned #GError will contain more details on what went wrong.

function.name: gtk_print_operation_get_has_selection
function.description: Gets the value of #GtkPrintOperation:has-selection property.

function.name: gtk_print_operation_get_n_pages_to_print
function.description:
Returns the number of pages that will be printed.
Note that this value is set during print preparation phase (%GTK_PRINT_STATUS_PREPARING), so this function should never be called before the data generation phase (%GTK_PRINT_STATUS_GENERATING_DATA). You can connect to the #GtkPrintOperation::status-changed signal and call gtk_print_operation_get_n_pages_to_print() when print status is %GTK_PRINT_STATUS_GENERATING_DATA. This is typically used to track the progress of print operation.
function.return: the number of pages that will be printed

function.name: gtk_print_operation_get_print_settings
function.description:
Returns the current print settings.
Note that the return value is %NULL until either gtk_print_operation_set_print_settings() or gtk_print_operation_run() have been called.

function.name: gtk_print_operation_get_status
function.description: Returns the status of the print operation. Also see gtk_print_operation_get_status_string().
function.return: the status of the print operation

function.name: gtk_print_operation_get_status_string
function.description:
Returns a string representation of the status of the print operation. The string is translated and suitable for displaying the print status e.g. in a #GtkStatusbar.
Use gtk_print_operation_get_status() to obtain a status value that is suitable for programmatic use.
function.return: a string representation of the status of the print operation

function.name: gtk_print_operation_get_support_selection
function.description: Gets the value of #GtkPrintOperation:support-selection property.
function.return: whether the application supports print of selection

function.name: gtk_print_operation_is_finished
function.description:
A convenience function to find out if the print operation is finished, either successfully (%GTK_PRINT_STATUS_FINISHED) or unsuccessfully (%GTK_PRINT_STATUS_FINISHED_ABORTED).
Note: when you enable print status tracking the print operation can be in a non-finished state even after done has been called, as the operation status then tracks the print job status on the printer.
function.return: %TRUE, if the print operation is finished.

function.name: gtk_print_operation_new
function.description: Creates a new #GtkPrintOperation.

function.name: gtk_print_operation_preview_end_preview
function.description:
Ends a preview.
This function must be called to finish a custom print preview.

function.name: gtk_print_operation_preview_is_selected
function.description: Returns whether the given page is included in the set of pages that have been selected for printing.
function.return: %TRUE if the page has been selected for printing

function.name: gtk_print_operation_preview_render_page
function.description:
Renders a page to the preview, using the print context that was passed to the #GtkPrintOperation::preview handler together with @preview.
A custom iprint preview should use this function in its ::expose handler to render the currently selected page.
Note that this function requires a suitable cairo context to be associated with the print context.

function.name: gtk_print_operation_run
function.return: the result of the print operation. A return value of %GTK_PRINT_OPERATION_RESULT_APPLY indicates that the printing was completed successfully. In this case, it is a good idea to obtain the used print settings with gtk_print_operation_get_print_settings() and store them for reuse with the next print operation. A value of %GTK_PRINT_OPERATION_RESULT_IN_PROGRESS means the operation is running asynchronously, and will emit the #GtkPrintOperation::done signal when done.

function.name: gtk_print_operation_set_allow_async
function.description: Sets whether the gtk_print_operation_run() may return before the print operation is completed. Note that some platforms may not allow asynchronous operation.

function.name: gtk_print_operation_set_current_page
function.description:
Sets the current page.
If this is called before gtk_print_operation_run(), the user will be able to select to print only the current page.
Note that this only makes sense for pre-paginated documents.

function.name: gtk_print_operation_set_custom_tab_label
function.description: Sets the label for the tab holding custom widgets.

parameter.name: label
parameter.parameter_description: the label to use, or %NULL to use the default label

function.name: gtk_print_operation_set_default_page_setup
function.description:
Makes @default_page_setup the default page setup for @op.
This page setup will be used by gtk_print_operation_run(), but it can be overridden on a per-page basis by connecting to the #GtkPrintOperation::request-page-setup signal.

function.name: gtk_print_operation_set_defer_drawing
function.description:
Sets up the #GtkPrintOperation to wait for calling of gtk_print_operation_draw_page_finish() from application. It can be used for drawing page in another thread.
This function must be called in the callback of “draw-page” signal.

function.name: gtk_print_operation_set_embed_page_setup
function.description: Embed page size combo box and orientation combo box into page setup page. Selected page setup is stored as default page setup in #GtkPrintOperation.

parameter.name: embed
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE to embed page setup selection in the #GtkPrintUnixDialog

function.name: gtk_print_operation_set_export_filename
function.description:
Sets up the #GtkPrintOperation to generate a file instead of showing the print dialog. The intended use of this function is for implementing “Export to PDF” actions. Currently, PDF is the only supported format.
“Print to PDF” support is independent of this and is done by letting the user pick the “Print to PDF” item from the list of printers in the print dialog.

parameter.name: filename
parameter.parameter_description: the filename for the exported file

function.name: gtk_print_operation_set_has_selection
function.description:
Sets whether there is a selection to print.
Application has to set number of pages to which the selection will draw by gtk_print_operation_set_n_pages() in a callback of #GtkPrintOperation::begin-print.

function.name: gtk_print_operation_set_job_name
function.description:
Sets the name of the print job. The name is used to identify the job (e.g. in monitoring applications like eggcups).
If you don’t set a job name, GTK picks a default one by numbering successive print jobs.

parameter.name: job_name
parameter.parameter_description: a string that identifies the print job

function.name: gtk_print_operation_set_n_pages
function.description:
Sets the number of pages in the document.
This must be set to a positive number before the rendering starts. It may be set in a #GtkPrintOperation::begin-print signal handler.
Note that the page numbers passed to the #GtkPrintOperation::request-page-setup and #GtkPrintOperation::draw-page signals are 0-based, i.e. if the user chooses to print all pages, the last ::draw-page signal will be for page @n_pages - 1.

function.name: gtk_print_operation_set_print_settings
function.description: Sets the print settings for @op. This is typically used to re-establish print settings from a previous print operation, see gtk_print_operation_run().

function.name: gtk_print_operation_set_show_progress
function.description: If @show_progress is %TRUE, the print operation will show a progress dialog during the print operation.

function.name: gtk_print_operation_set_support_selection
function.description: Sets whether selection is supported by #GtkPrintOperation.

function.name: gtk_print_operation_set_track_print_status
function.description:
If track_status is %TRUE, the print operation will try to continue report on the status of the print job in the printer queues and printer. This can allow your application to show things like “out of paper” issues, and when the print job actually reaches the printer.
This function is often implemented using some form of polling, so it should not be enabled unless needed.

function.name: gtk_print_operation_set_unit
function.description: Sets up the transformation for the cairo context obtained from #GtkPrintContext in such a way that distances are measured in units of @unit.

function.name: gtk_print_operation_set_use_full_page
function.description: If @full_page is %TRUE, the transformation for the cairo context obtained from #GtkPrintContext puts the origin at the top left corner of the page (which may not be the top left corner of the sheet, depending on page orientation and the number of pages per sheet). Otherwise, the origin is at the top left corner of the imageable area (i.e. inside the margins).

parameter.name: full_page
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE to set up the #GtkPrintContext for the full page

function.name: gtk_print_run_page_setup_dialog
function.description:
Runs a page setup dialog, letting the user modify the values from @page_setup. If the user cancels the dialog, the returned #GtkPageSetup is identical to the passed in @page_setup, otherwise it contains the modifications done in the dialog.
Note that this function may use a recursive mainloop to show the page setup dialog. See gtk_print_run_page_setup_dialog_async() if this is a problem.

function.name: gtk_print_run_page_setup_dialog_async
function.description:
Runs a page setup dialog, letting the user modify the values from @page_setup.
In contrast to gtk_print_run_page_setup_dialog(), this function returns after showing the page setup dialog on platforms that support this, and calls @done_cb from a signal handler for the ::response signal of the dialog.

parameter.name: done_cb
parameter.parameter_description: a function to call when the user saves the modified page setup

function.name: gtk_print_settings_copy
function.description: Copies a #GtkPrintSettings object.

function.name: gtk_print_settings_foreach
function.description: Calls @func for each key-value pair of @settings.

function.name: gtk_print_settings_get
function.description: Looks up the string value associated with @key.

function.name: gtk_print_settings_get_bool
function.description:
Returns the boolean represented by the value that is associated with @key.
The string “true” represents %TRUE, any other string %FALSE.
function.return: %TRUE, if @key maps to a true value.

function.name: gtk_print_settings_get_bool_with_default
function.description:
Returns the boolean represented by the value that is associated with @key, or @default_val if the value does not represent a boolean.
The string “true” represents %TRUE, the string “false” represents %FALSE.

function.name: gtk_print_settings_get_collate
function.description: Gets the value of %GTK_PRINT_SETTINGS_COLLATE.
function.return: whether to collate the printed pages

function.name: gtk_print_settings_get_default_source
function.description: Gets the value of %GTK_PRINT_SETTINGS_DEFAULT_SOURCE.

function.name: gtk_print_settings_get_dither
function.description: Gets the value of %GTK_PRINT_SETTINGS_DITHER.

function.name: gtk_print_settings_get_double
function.description: Returns the double value associated with @key, or 0.

function.name: gtk_print_settings_get_double_with_default
function.description:
Returns the floating point number represented by the value that is associated with @key, or @default_val if the value does not represent a floating point number.
Floating point numbers are parsed with g_ascii_strtod().
function.return: the floating point number associated with @key

function.name: gtk_print_settings_get_duplex
function.description: Gets the value of %GTK_PRINT_SETTINGS_DUPLEX.
function.return: whether to print the output in duplex.

function.name: gtk_print_settings_get_finishings
function.description: Gets the value of %GTK_PRINT_SETTINGS_FINISHINGS.

function.name: gtk_print_settings_get_int
function.description: Returns the integer value of @key, or 0.

function.name: gtk_print_settings_get_int_with_default
function.description: Returns the value of @key, interpreted as an integer, or the default value.

function.name: gtk_print_settings_get_length
function.description: Returns the value associated with @key, interpreted as a length. The returned value is converted to @units.

parameter.name: unit
parameter.parameter_description: the unit of the return value

function.return: the length value of @key, converted to @unit

function.name: gtk_print_settings_get_media_type
function.description:
Gets the value of %GTK_PRINT_SETTINGS_MEDIA_TYPE.
The set of media types is defined in PWG 5101.1-2002 PWG.

function.name: gtk_print_settings_get_n_copies
function.description: Gets the value of %GTK_PRINT_SETTINGS_N_COPIES.
function.return: the number of copies to print

function.name: gtk_print_settings_get_number_up
function.description: Gets the value of %GTK_PRINT_SETTINGS_NUMBER_UP.
function.return: the number of pages per sheet

function.name: gtk_print_settings_get_number_up_layout
function.description: Gets the value of %GTK_PRINT_SETTINGS_NUMBER_UP_LAYOUT.
function.return: layout of page in number-up mode

function.name: gtk_print_settings_get_orientation
function.description: Get the value of %GTK_PRINT_SETTINGS_ORIENTATION, converted to a #GtkPageOrientation.

function.name: gtk_print_settings_get_output_bin
function.description: Gets the value of %GTK_PRINT_SETTINGS_OUTPUT_BIN.

function.name: gtk_print_settings_get_page_ranges
function.description: Gets the value of %GTK_PRINT_SETTINGS_PAGE_RANGES.

parameter.name: num_ranges
parameter.parameter_description: return location for the length of the returned array

function.return: an array of #GtkPageRanges. Use g_free() to free the array when it is no longer needed.

function.name: gtk_print_settings_get_page_set
function.description: Gets the value of %GTK_PRINT_SETTINGS_PAGE_SET.
function.return: the set of pages to print

function.name: gtk_print_settings_get_paper_height
function.description: Gets the value of %GTK_PRINT_SETTINGS_PAPER_HEIGHT, converted to @unit.

parameter.name: unit
parameter.parameter_description: the unit for the return value

function.return: the paper height, in units of @unit

function.name: gtk_print_settings_get_paper_size
function.description: Gets the value of %GTK_PRINT_SETTINGS_PAPER_FORMAT, converted to a #GtkPaperSize.

function.name: gtk_print_settings_get_paper_width
function.description: Gets the value of %GTK_PRINT_SETTINGS_PAPER_WIDTH, converted to @unit.

parameter.name: unit
parameter.parameter_description: the unit for the return value

function.return: the paper width, in units of @unit

function.name: gtk_print_settings_get_print_pages
function.description: Gets the value of %GTK_PRINT_SETTINGS_PRINT_PAGES.

function.name: gtk_print_settings_get_printer
function.description: Convenience function to obtain the value of %GTK_PRINT_SETTINGS_PRINTER.

function.name: gtk_print_settings_get_printer_lpi
function.description: Gets the value of %GTK_PRINT_SETTINGS_PRINTER_LPI.
function.return: the resolution in lpi (lines per inch)

function.name: gtk_print_settings_get_quality
function.description: Gets the value of %GTK_PRINT_SETTINGS_QUALITY.

function.name: gtk_print_settings_get_resolution
function.description: Gets the value of %GTK_PRINT_SETTINGS_RESOLUTION.

function.name: gtk_print_settings_get_resolution_x
function.description: Gets the value of %GTK_PRINT_SETTINGS_RESOLUTION_X.

function.name: gtk_print_settings_get_resolution_y
function.description: Gets the value of %GTK_PRINT_SETTINGS_RESOLUTION_Y.

function.name: gtk_print_settings_get_reverse
function.description: Gets the value of %GTK_PRINT_SETTINGS_REVERSE.
function.return: whether to reverse the order of the printed pages

function.name: gtk_print_settings_get_scale
function.description: Gets the value of %GTK_PRINT_SETTINGS_SCALE.

function.name: gtk_print_settings_get_use_color
function.description: Gets the value of %GTK_PRINT_SETTINGS_USE_COLOR.

function.name: gtk_print_settings_has_key
function.description: Returns %TRUE, if a value is associated with @key.

function.name: gtk_print_settings_load_file
function.description: Reads the print settings from @file_name. If the file could not be loaded then error is set to either a #GFileError or #GKeyFileError. See gtk_print_settings_to_file().

parameter.name: file_name
parameter.parameter_description: the filename to read the settings from

function.name: gtk_print_settings_load_key_file
function.description: Reads the print settings from the group @group_name in @key_file. If the file could not be loaded then error is set to either a #GFileError or #GKeyFileError.

parameter.name: key_file
parameter.parameter_description: the #GKeyFile to retrieve the settings from

parameter.name: group_name
parameter.parameter_description: the name of the group to use, or %NULL to use the default “Print Settings”

function.name: gtk_print_settings_new
function.description: Creates a new #GtkPrintSettings object.

function.name: gtk_print_settings_new_from_file
function.description: Reads the print settings from @file_name. Returns a new #GtkPrintSettings object with the restored settings, or %NULL if an error occurred. If the file could not be loaded then error is set to either a #GFileError or #GKeyFileError. See gtk_print_settings_to_file().

parameter.name: file_name
parameter.parameter_description: the filename to read the settings from

function.name: gtk_print_settings_new_from_gvariant
function.description: Deserialize print settings from an a{sv} variant in the format produced by gtk_print_settings_to_gvariant().

function.name: gtk_print_settings_new_from_key_file
function.description: Reads the print settings from the group @group_name in @key_file. Returns a new #GtkPrintSettings object with the restored settings, or %NULL if an error occurred. If the file could not be loaded then error is set to either a #GFileError or #GKeyFileError.

parameter.name: key_file
parameter.parameter_description: the #GKeyFile to retrieve the settings from

parameter.name: group_name
parameter.parameter_description: the name of the group to use, or %NULL to use the default “Print Settings”

function.name: gtk_print_settings_set
function.description: Associates @value with @key.

function.name: gtk_print_settings_set_bool
function.description: Sets @key to a boolean value.

function.name: gtk_print_settings_set_collate
function.description: Sets the value of %GTK_PRINT_SETTINGS_COLLATE.

function.name: gtk_print_settings_set_default_source
function.description: Sets the value of %GTK_PRINT_SETTINGS_DEFAULT_SOURCE.

function.name: gtk_print_settings_set_dither
function.description: Sets the value of %GTK_PRINT_SETTINGS_DITHER.

function.name: gtk_print_settings_set_double
function.description: Sets @key to a double value.

function.name: gtk_print_settings_set_duplex
function.description: Sets the value of %GTK_PRINT_SETTINGS_DUPLEX.

function.name: gtk_print_settings_set_finishings
function.description: Sets the value of %GTK_PRINT_SETTINGS_FINISHINGS.

function.name: gtk_print_settings_set_int
function.description: Sets @key to an integer value.

function.name: gtk_print_settings_set_length
function.description: Associates a length in units of @unit with @key.

function.name: gtk_print_settings_set_media_type
function.description:
Sets the value of %GTK_PRINT_SETTINGS_MEDIA_TYPE.
The set of media types is defined in PWG 5101.1-2002 PWG.

function.name: gtk_print_settings_set_n_copies
function.description: Sets the value of %GTK_PRINT_SETTINGS_N_COPIES.

function.name: gtk_print_settings_set_number_up
function.description: Sets the value of %GTK_PRINT_SETTINGS_NUMBER_UP.

parameter.name: number_up
parameter.parameter_description: the number of pages per sheet

function.name: gtk_print_settings_set_number_up_layout
function.description: Sets the value of %GTK_PRINT_SETTINGS_NUMBER_UP_LAYOUT.

function.name: gtk_print_settings_set_orientation
function.description: Sets the value of %GTK_PRINT_SETTINGS_ORIENTATION.

function.name: gtk_print_settings_set_output_bin
function.description: Sets the value of %GTK_PRINT_SETTINGS_OUTPUT_BIN.

function.name: gtk_print_settings_set_page_ranges
function.description: Sets the value of %GTK_PRINT_SETTINGS_PAGE_RANGES.

function.name: gtk_print_settings_set_page_set
function.description: Sets the value of %GTK_PRINT_SETTINGS_PAGE_SET.

function.name: gtk_print_settings_set_paper_height
function.description: Sets the value of %GTK_PRINT_SETTINGS_PAPER_HEIGHT.

function.name: gtk_print_settings_set_paper_size
function.description: Sets the value of %GTK_PRINT_SETTINGS_PAPER_FORMAT, %GTK_PRINT_SETTINGS_PAPER_WIDTH and %GTK_PRINT_SETTINGS_PAPER_HEIGHT.

function.name: gtk_print_settings_set_paper_width
function.description: Sets the value of %GTK_PRINT_SETTINGS_PAPER_WIDTH.

function.name: gtk_print_settings_set_print_pages
function.description: Sets the value of %GTK_PRINT_SETTINGS_PRINT_PAGES.

function.name: gtk_print_settings_set_printer
function.description: Convenience function to set %GTK_PRINT_SETTINGS_PRINTER to @printer.

function.name: gtk_print_settings_set_printer_lpi
function.description: Sets the value of %GTK_PRINT_SETTINGS_PRINTER_LPI.

parameter.name: lpi
parameter.parameter_description: the resolution in lpi (lines per inch)

function.name: gtk_print_settings_set_quality
function.description: Sets the value of %GTK_PRINT_SETTINGS_QUALITY.

function.name: gtk_print_settings_set_resolution
function.description: Sets the values of %GTK_PRINT_SETTINGS_RESOLUTION, %GTK_PRINT_SETTINGS_RESOLUTION_X and %GTK_PRINT_SETTINGS_RESOLUTION_Y.

function.name: gtk_print_settings_set_resolution_xy
function.description: Sets the values of %GTK_PRINT_SETTINGS_RESOLUTION, %GTK_PRINT_SETTINGS_RESOLUTION_X and %GTK_PRINT_SETTINGS_RESOLUTION_Y.

function.name: gtk_print_settings_set_reverse
function.description: Sets the value of %GTK_PRINT_SETTINGS_REVERSE.

function.name: gtk_print_settings_set_scale
function.description: Sets the value of %GTK_PRINT_SETTINGS_SCALE.

function.name: gtk_print_settings_set_use_color
function.description: Sets the value of %GTK_PRINT_SETTINGS_USE_COLOR.

function.name: gtk_print_settings_to_file
function.description: This function saves the print settings from @settings to @file_name. If the file could not be loaded then error is set to either a #GFileError or #GKeyFileError.

function.name: gtk_print_settings_to_gvariant
function.description: Serialize print settings to an a{sv} variant.

function.name: gtk_print_settings_to_key_file
function.description: This function adds the print settings from @settings to @key_file.

parameter.name: key_file
parameter.parameter_description: the #GKeyFile to save the print settings to

parameter.name: group_name
parameter.parameter_description: the group to add the settings to in @key_file, or %NULL to use the default “Print Settings”

function.name: gtk_print_settings_unset
function.description: Removes any value associated with @key. This has the same effect as setting the value to %NULL.

function.name: gtk_print_unix_dialog_add_custom_tab
function.description: Adds a custom tab to the print dialog.

parameter.name: child
parameter.parameter_description: the widget to put in the custom tab

parameter.name: tab_label
parameter.parameter_description: the widget to use as tab label

function.name: gtk_print_unix_dialog_get_current_page
function.description: Gets the current page of the #GtkPrintUnixDialog.

function.name: gtk_print_unix_dialog_get_embed_page_setup
function.description: Gets the value of #GtkPrintUnixDialog:embed-page-setup property.

function.name: gtk_print_unix_dialog_get_has_selection
function.description: Gets the value of #GtkPrintUnixDialog:has-selection property.

function.name: gtk_print_unix_dialog_get_manual_capabilities
function.description: Gets the value of #GtkPrintUnixDialog:manual-capabilities property.

function.name: gtk_print_unix_dialog_get_page_setup
function.description: Gets the page setup that is used by the #GtkPrintUnixDialog.

function.name: gtk_print_unix_dialog_get_page_setup_set
function.description: Gets the page setup that is used by the #GtkPrintUnixDialog.
function.return: whether a page setup was set by user.

function.name: gtk_print_unix_dialog_get_selected_printer
function.description: Gets the currently selected printer.

function.name: gtk_print_unix_dialog_get_settings
function.description: Gets a new #GtkPrintSettings object that represents the current values in the print dialog. Note that this creates a new object, and you need to unref it if don’t want to keep it.
function.return: a new #GtkPrintSettings object with the values from @dialog

function.name: gtk_print_unix_dialog_get_support_selection
function.description: Gets the value of #GtkPrintUnixDialog:support-selection property.
function.return: whether the application supports print of selection

function.name: gtk_print_unix_dialog_new
function.description: Creates a new #GtkPrintUnixDialog.

parameter.name: parent
parameter.parameter_description: Transient parent of the dialog, or %NULL

function.name: gtk_print_unix_dialog_set_current_page
function.description: Sets the current page number. If @current_page is not -1, this enables the current page choice for the range of pages to print.

function.name: gtk_print_unix_dialog_set_embed_page_setup
function.description: Embed page size combo box and orientation combo box into page setup page.

function.name: gtk_print_unix_dialog_set_has_selection
function.description: Sets whether a selection exists.

function.name: gtk_print_unix_dialog_set_manual_capabilities
function.description: This lets you specify the printing capabilities your application supports. For instance, if you can handle scaling the output then you pass #GTK_PRINT_CAPABILITY_SCALE. If you don’t pass that, then the dialog will only let you select the scale if the printing system automatically handles scaling.

parameter.name: capabilities
parameter.parameter_description: the printing capabilities of your application

function.name: gtk_print_unix_dialog_set_page_setup
function.description: Sets the page setup of the #GtkPrintUnixDialog.

function.name: gtk_print_unix_dialog_set_settings
function.description: Sets the #GtkPrintSettings for the #GtkPrintUnixDialog. Typically, this is used to restore saved print settings from a previous print operation before the print dialog is shown.

function.name: gtk_print_unix_dialog_set_support_selection
function.description: Sets whether the print dialog allows user to print a selection.

function.name: gtk_printer_accepts_pdf
function.description: Returns whether the printer accepts input in PDF format.

function.name: gtk_printer_accepts_ps
function.description: Returns whether the printer accepts input in PostScript format.

function.name: gtk_printer_compare
function.description: Compares two printers.
function.return: 0 if the printer match, a negative value if @a < @b, or a positive value if @a > @b

function.name: gtk_printer_get_backend
function.description: Returns the backend of the printer.

function.name: gtk_printer_get_capabilities
function.description:
Returns the printer’s capabilities.
This is useful when you’re using #GtkPrintUnixDialog’s manual-capabilities setting and need to know which settings the printer can handle and which you must handle yourself.
This will return 0 unless the printer’s details are available, see gtk_printer_has_details() and gtk_printer_request_details().

function.name: gtk_printer_get_default_page_size
function.description: Returns default page size of @printer.
function.return: a newly allocated #GtkPageSetup with default page size of the printer.

function.name: gtk_printer_get_description
function.description: Gets the description of the printer.

function.name: gtk_printer_get_hard_margins
function.description:
Retrieve the hard margins of @printer, i.e. the margins that define the area at the borders of the paper that the printer cannot print to.
Note: This will not succeed unless the printer’s details are available, see gtk_printer_has_details() and gtk_printer_request_details().

parameter.name: top
parameter.parameter_description: a location to store the top margin in

parameter.name: bottom
parameter.parameter_description: a location to store the bottom margin in

parameter.name: left
parameter.parameter_description: a location to store the left margin in

parameter.name: right
parameter.parameter_description: a location to store the right margin in

function.return: %TRUE iff the hard margins were retrieved

function.name: gtk_printer_get_hard_margins_for_paper_size
function.description:
Retrieve the hard margins of @printer for @paper_size, i.e. the margins that define the area at the borders of the paper that the printer cannot print to.
Note: This will not succeed unless the printer's details are available, see gtk_printer_has_details() and gtk_printer_request_details().

parameter.name: top
parameter.parameter_description: a location to store the top margin in

parameter.name: bottom
parameter.parameter_description: a location to store the bottom margin in

parameter.name: left
parameter.parameter_description: a location to store the left margin in

parameter.name: right
parameter.parameter_description: a location to store the right margin in

function.return: %TRUE iff the hard margins were retrieved

function.name: gtk_printer_get_icon_name
function.description: Gets the name of the icon to use for the printer.

function.name: gtk_printer_get_job_count
function.description: Gets the number of jobs currently queued on the printer.

function.name: gtk_printer_get_location
function.description: Returns a description of the location of the printer.

function.name: gtk_printer_get_name
function.description: Returns the name of the printer.

function.name: gtk_printer_get_state_message
function.description: Returns the state message describing the current state of the printer.

function.name: gtk_printer_has_details
function.description: Returns whether the printer details are available.

function.name: gtk_printer_is_accepting_jobs
function.description: Returns whether the printer is accepting jobs

function.name: gtk_printer_is_active
function.description: Returns whether the printer is currently active (i.e. accepts new jobs).

function.name: gtk_printer_is_default
function.description: Returns whether the printer is the default printer.

function.name: gtk_printer_is_paused
function.description: Returns whether the printer is currently paused. A paused printer still accepts jobs, but it is not printing them.

function.name: gtk_printer_is_virtual
function.description: Returns whether the printer is virtual (i.e. does not represent actual printer hardware, but something like a CUPS class).

function.name: gtk_printer_list_papers
function.description: Lists all the paper sizes @printer supports. This will return and empty list unless the printer’s details are available, see gtk_printer_has_details() and gtk_printer_request_details().
function.return: a newly allocated list of newly allocated #GtkPageSetup s.

function.name: gtk_printer_new
function.description: Creates a new #GtkPrinter.

function.name: gtk_printer_option_set_get_groups
function.description: Gets the groups in this set.

function.name: gtk_printer_request_details
function.description: Requests the printer details. When the details are available, the #GtkPrinter::details-acquired signal will be emitted on @printer.

function.name: gtk_progress_bar_get_ellipsize
function.description: Returns the ellipsizing position of the progress bar. See gtk_progress_bar_set_ellipsize().

function.name: gtk_progress_bar_get_fraction
function.description: Returns the current fraction of the task that’s been completed.

function.name: gtk_progress_bar_get_inverted
function.description: Gets the value set by gtk_progress_bar_set_inverted().
function.return: %TRUE if the progress bar is inverted

function.name: gtk_progress_bar_get_pulse_step
function.description: Retrieves the pulse step set with gtk_progress_bar_set_pulse_step().

function.name: gtk_progress_bar_get_show_text
function.description: Gets the value of the #GtkProgressBar:show-text property. See gtk_progress_bar_set_show_text().
function.return: %TRUE if text is shown in the progress bar

function.name: gtk_progress_bar_get_text
function.description: Retrieves the text that is displayed with the progress bar, if any, otherwise %NULL. The return value is a reference to the text, not a copy of it, so will become invalid if you change the text in the progress bar.
function.return: text, or %NULL; this string is owned by the widget and should not be modified or freed.

function.name: gtk_progress_bar_new
function.description: Creates a new #GtkProgressBar.

function.name: gtk_progress_bar_pulse
function.description: Indicates that some progress has been made, but you don’t know how much. Causes the progress bar to enter “activity mode,” where a block bounces back and forth. Each call to gtk_progress_bar_pulse() causes the block to move by a little bit (the amount of movement per pulse is determined by gtk_progress_bar_set_pulse_step()).

function.name: gtk_progress_bar_set_ellipsize
function.description: Sets the mode used to ellipsize (add an ellipsis: "...") the text if there is not enough space to render the entire string.

function.name: gtk_progress_bar_set_fraction
function.description: Causes the progress bar to “fill in” the given fraction of the bar. The fraction should be between 0.0 and 1.0, inclusive.

parameter.name: fraction
parameter.parameter_description: fraction of the task that’s been completed

function.name: gtk_progress_bar_set_inverted
function.description: Progress bars normally grow from top to bottom or left to right. Inverted progress bars grow in the opposite direction.

function.name: gtk_progress_bar_set_pulse_step
function.description: Sets the fraction of total progress bar length to move the bouncing block for each call to gtk_progress_bar_pulse().

function.name: gtk_progress_bar_set_show_text
function.description:
Sets whether the progress bar will show text next to the bar. The shown text is either the value of the #GtkProgressBar:text property or, if that is %NULL, the #GtkProgressBar:fraction value, as a percentage.
To make a progress bar that is styled and sized suitably for containing text (even if the actual text is blank), set #GtkProgressBar:show-text to %TRUE and #GtkProgressBar:text to the empty string (not %NULL).

function.name: gtk_progress_bar_set_text
function.description:
Causes the given @text to appear next to the progress bar.
If @text is %NULL and #GtkProgressBar:show-text is %TRUE, the current value of #GtkProgressBar:fraction will be displayed as a percentage.
If @text is non-%NULL and #GtkProgressBar:show-text is %TRUE, the text will be displayed. In this case, it will not display the progress percentage. If @text is the empty string, the progress bar will still be styled and sized suitably for containing text, as long as #GtkProgressBar:show-text is %TRUE.

function.name: gtk_progress_tracker_advance_frame
function.description: Increments the progress of the animation forward a frame. If no animation has been started, does nothing.

parameter.name: frame_time
parameter.parameter_description: The current frame time, usually from the frame clock.

function.name: gtk_progress_tracker_finish
function.description: Stops running the current animation.

function.name: gtk_progress_tracker_get_ease_out_cubic
function.description: Applies a simple ease out cubic function to the result of gtk_progress_tracker_get_progress().

parameter.name: reversed
parameter.parameter_description: If progress should be reversed before applying the ease function.

function.name: gtk_progress_tracker_get_iteration
function.description: Returns the fractional number of cycles the animation has completed. For example, it you started an animation with iteration-count of 2 and are half way through the second animation, this returns 1.5.

function.name: gtk_progress_tracker_get_iteration_cycle
function.description: Returns an integer index of the current iteration cycle tracker is progressing through. Handles edge cases, such as an iteration value of 2.0 which could be considered the end of the second iteration of the beginning of the third, in the same way as gtk_progress_tracker_get_progress().
function.return: The integer count of the current animation cycle.

function.name: gtk_progress_tracker_get_progress
function.description: Gets the progress through the current animation iteration, from [0, 1]. Use to interpolate between animation targets. If reverse is true each iteration will begin at 1 and end at 0.

function.name: gtk_progress_tracker_get_state
function.description: Returns whether the tracker is before, during or after the currently started animation. The tracker will only ever be in the before state if the animation was started with a delay. If no animation has been started, returns %GTK_PROGRESS_STATE_AFTER.

function.name: gtk_progress_tracker_init_copy
function.description: Copy all progress tracker state from the source tracker to dest tracker.

function.name: gtk_progress_tracker_skip_frame
function.description: Does not update the progress of the animation forward, but records the frame to calculate future deltas. Calling this each frame will effectively pause the animation.

parameter.name: frame_time
parameter.parameter_description: The current frame time, usually from the frame clock.

function.name: gtk_progress_tracker_start
function.description: Begins tracking progress for a new animation. Clears all previous state.

parameter.name: iteration_count
parameter.parameter_description: Number of iterations to run the animation, must be >= 0

function.name: gtk_propagate_event
function.description:
Sends an event to a widget, propagating the event to parent widgets if the event remains unhandled. This function will emit the event through all the hierarchy of @widget through all propagation phases.
Events received by GTK from GDK normally begin at a #GtkRoot widget. Depending on the type of event, existence of modal dialogs, grabs, etc., the event may be propagated; if so, this function is used.
All that said, you most likely don’t want to use any of these functions; synthesizing events is rarely needed. There are almost certainly better ways to achieve your goals. For example, use gtk_widget_queue_draw() instead of making up expose events.

function.name: gtk_property_expression_get_expression
function.description: Gets the expression specifying the object of a property expression.

function.name: gtk_property_expression_get_pspec
function.description: Gets the #GParamSpec specifying the property of a property expression.

function.name: gtk_property_expression_new
function.description:
Creates an expression that looks up a property via the given @expression or the `this` argument when @expression is %NULL.
If the resulting object conforms to @this_type, its property named @property_name will be queried. Otherwise, this expression's evaluation will fail.
The given @this_type must have a property with @property_name.

parameter.name: this_type
parameter.parameter_description: The type to expect for the this type

parameter.name: expression
parameter.parameter_description: Expression to evaluate to get the object to query or %NULL to query the `this` object

function.name: gtk_property_expression_new_for_pspec
function.description:
Creates an expression that looks up a property via the given @expression or the `this` argument when @expression is %NULL.
If the resulting object conforms to @this_type, its property specified by @pspec will be queried. Otherwise, this expression's evaluation will fail.

parameter.name: expression
parameter.parameter_description: Expression to evaluate to get the object to query or %NULL to query the `this` object

parameter.name: pspec
parameter.parameter_description: the #GParamSpec for the property to query

function.name: gtk_range_get_adjustment
function.description: Get the #GtkAdjustment which is the “model” object for #GtkRange. See gtk_range_set_adjustment() for details. The return value does not have a reference added, so should not be unreferenced.

function.name: gtk_range_get_fill_level
function.description: Gets the current position of the fill level indicator.

function.name: gtk_range_get_flippable
function.description: Gets the value set by gtk_range_set_flippable().

function.name: gtk_range_get_inverted
function.description: Gets the value set by gtk_range_set_inverted().

function.name: gtk_range_get_range_rect
function.description:
This function returns the area that contains the range’s trough, in coordinates relative to @range's origin.
This function is useful mainly for #GtkRange subclasses.

parameter.name: range_rect
parameter.parameter_description: return location for the range rectangle

function.name: gtk_range_get_restrict_to_fill_level
function.description: Gets whether the range is restricted to the fill level.
function.return: %TRUE if @range is restricted to the fill level.

function.name: gtk_range_get_round_digits
function.description: Gets the number of digits to round the value to when it changes. See #GtkRange::change-value.
function.return: the number of digits to round to

function.name: gtk_range_get_show_fill_level
function.description: Gets whether the range displays the fill level graphically.

function.name: gtk_range_get_slider_range
function.description:
This function returns sliders range along the long dimension, in widget->window coordinates.
This function is useful mainly for #GtkRange subclasses.

parameter.name: slider_start
parameter.parameter_description: return location for the slider's start, or %NULL

parameter.name: slider_end
parameter.parameter_description: return location for the slider's end, or %NULL

function.name: gtk_range_get_slider_size_fixed
function.description:
This function is useful mainly for #GtkRange subclasses.
See gtk_range_set_slider_size_fixed().
function.return: whether the range’s slider has a fixed size.

function.name: gtk_range_get_value
function.description: Gets the current value of the range.

function.name: gtk_range_set_adjustment
function.description: Sets the adjustment to be used as the “model” object for this range widget. The adjustment indicates the current range value, the minimum and maximum range values, the step/page increments used for keybindings and scrolling, and the page size. The page size is normally 0 for #GtkScale and nonzero for #GtkScrollbar, and indicates the size of the visible area of the widget being scrolled. The page size affects the size of the scrollbar slider.

function.name: gtk_range_set_fill_level
function.description:
Set the new position of the fill level indicator.
The “fill level” is probably best described by its most prominent use case, which is an indicator for the amount of pre-buffering in a streaming media player. In that use case, the value of the range would indicate the current play position, and the fill level would be the position up to which the file/stream has been downloaded.
This amount of prebuffering can be displayed on the range’s trough and is themeable separately from the trough. To enable fill level display, use gtk_range_set_show_fill_level(). The range defaults to not showing the fill level.
Additionally, it’s possible to restrict the range’s slider position to values which are smaller than the fill level. This is controller by gtk_range_set_restrict_to_fill_level() and is by default enabled.

parameter.name: fill_level
parameter.parameter_description: the new position of the fill level indicator

function.name: gtk_range_set_flippable
function.description:
If a range is flippable, it will switch its direction if it is horizontal and its direction is %GTK_TEXT_DIR_RTL.
See gtk_widget_get_direction().

function.name: gtk_range_set_increments
function.description: Sets the step and page sizes for the range. The step size is used when the user clicks the #GtkScrollbar arrows or moves #GtkScale via arrow keys. The page size is used for example when moving via Page Up or Page Down keys.

function.name: gtk_range_set_inverted
function.description: Ranges normally move from lower to higher values as the slider moves from top to bottom or left to right. Inverted ranges have higher values at the top or on the right rather than on the bottom or left.

function.name: gtk_range_set_range
function.description: Sets the allowable values in the #GtkRange, and clamps the range value to be between @min and @max. (If the range has a non-zero page size, it is clamped between @min and @max - page-size.)

function.name: gtk_range_set_restrict_to_fill_level
function.description: Sets whether the slider is restricted to the fill level. See gtk_range_set_fill_level() for a general description of the fill level concept.

parameter.name: restrict_to_fill_level
parameter.parameter_description: Whether the fill level restricts slider movement.

function.name: gtk_range_set_round_digits
function.description: Sets the number of digits to round the value to when it changes. See #GtkRange::change-value.

function.name: gtk_range_set_show_fill_level
function.description: Sets whether a graphical fill level is show on the trough. See gtk_range_set_fill_level() for a general description of the fill level concept.

parameter.name: show_fill_level
parameter.parameter_description: Whether a fill level indicator graphics is shown.

function.name: gtk_range_set_slider_size_fixed
function.description:
Sets whether the range’s slider has a fixed size, or a size that depends on its adjustment’s page size.
This function is useful mainly for #GtkRange subclasses.

parameter.name: size_fixed
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE to make the slider size constant

function.name: gtk_range_set_value
function.description: Sets the current value of the range; if the value is outside the minimum or maximum range values, it will be clamped to fit inside them. The range emits the #GtkRange::value-changed signal if the value changes.

function.name: gtk_recent_info_create_app_info
function.description: Creates a #GAppInfo for the specified #GtkRecentInfo

parameter.name: app_name
parameter.parameter_description: the name of the application that should be mapped to a #GAppInfo; if %NULL is used then the default application for the MIME type is used

function.return: the newly created #GAppInfo, or %NULL. In case of error, @error will be set either with a %GTK_RECENT_MANAGER_ERROR or a %G_IO_ERROR

function.name: gtk_recent_info_exists
function.description: Checks whether the resource pointed by @info still exists. At the moment this check is done only on resources pointing to local files.

function.name: gtk_recent_info_get_added
function.description: Gets the the time when the resource was added to the recently used resources list.
function.return: a #GDateTime for the time when the resource was added

function.name: gtk_recent_info_get_age
function.description: Gets the number of days elapsed since the last update of the resource pointed by @info.
function.return: a positive integer containing the number of days elapsed since the time this resource was last modified

function.name: gtk_recent_info_get_application_info
function.description:
Gets the data regarding the application that has registered the resource pointed by @info.
If the command line contains any escape characters defined inside the storage specification, they will be expanded.

parameter.name: app_name
parameter.parameter_description: the name of the application that has registered this item

parameter.name: app_exec
parameter.parameter_description: return location for the string containing the command line

parameter.name: count
parameter.parameter_description: return location for the number of times this item was registered

parameter.name: stamp
parameter.parameter_description: return location for the time this item was last registered for this application

function.return: %TRUE if an application with @app_name has registered this resource inside the recently used list, or %FALSE otherwise. The @app_exec string is owned by the #GtkRecentInfo and should not be modified or freed

function.name: gtk_recent_info_get_applications
function.description: Retrieves the list of applications that have registered this resource.

parameter.name: length
parameter.parameter_description: return location for the length of the returned list

function.return: a newly allocated %NULL-terminated array of strings. Use g_strfreev() to free it.

function.name: gtk_recent_info_get_description
function.description: Gets the (short) description of the resource.
function.return: the description of the resource. The returned string is owned by the recent manager, and should not be freed.

function.name: gtk_recent_info_get_display_name
function.description: Gets the name of the resource. If none has been defined, the basename of the resource is obtained.
function.return: the display name of the resource. The returned string is owned by the recent manager, and should not be freed.

function.name: gtk_recent_info_get_gicon
function.description: Retrieves the icon associated to the resource MIME type.
function.return: a #GIcon containing the icon, or %NULL. Use g_object_unref() when finished using the icon

function.name: gtk_recent_info_get_groups
function.description: Returns all groups registered for the recently used item @info. The array of returned group names will be %NULL terminated, so length might optionally be %NULL.

parameter.name: length
parameter.parameter_description: return location for the number of groups returned

function.return: a newly allocated %NULL terminated array of strings. Use g_strfreev() to free it.

function.name: gtk_recent_info_get_mime_type
function.description: Gets the MIME type of the resource.
function.return: the MIME type of the resource. The returned string is owned by the recent manager, and should not be freed.

function.name: gtk_recent_info_get_modified
function.description: Gets the time when the meta-data for the resource was last modified.
function.return: a #GDateTime for the time when the resource was last modified

function.name: gtk_recent_info_get_private_hint
function.description: Gets the value of the “private” flag. Resources in the recently used list that have this flag set to %TRUE should only be displayed by the applications that have registered them.
function.return: %TRUE if the private flag was found, %FALSE otherwise

function.name: gtk_recent_info_get_short_name
function.description: Computes a valid UTF-8 string that can be used as the name of the item in a menu or list. For example, calling this function on an item that refers to “file:///foo/bar.txt” will yield “bar.txt”.
function.return: A newly-allocated string in UTF-8 encoding free it with g_free()

function.name: gtk_recent_info_get_uri
function.description: Gets the URI of the resource.
function.return: the URI of the resource. The returned string is owned by the recent manager, and should not be freed.

function.name: gtk_recent_info_get_uri_display
function.description: Gets a displayable version of the resource’s URI. If the resource is local, it returns a local path; if the resource is not local, it returns the UTF-8 encoded content of gtk_recent_info_get_uri().
function.return: a newly allocated UTF-8 string containing the resource’s URI or %NULL. Use g_free() when done using it.

function.name: gtk_recent_info_get_visited
function.description: Gets the time when the meta-data for the resource was last visited.
function.return: a #GDateTime for the time when the resource was last visited

function.name: gtk_recent_info_has_application
function.description: Checks whether an application registered this resource using @app_name.

parameter.name: app_name
parameter.parameter_description: a string containing an application name

function.return: %TRUE if an application with name @app_name was found, %FALSE otherwise

function.name: gtk_recent_info_has_group
function.description: Checks whether @group_name appears inside the groups registered for the recently used item @info.

function.name: gtk_recent_info_is_local
function.description: Checks whether the resource is local or not by looking at the scheme of its URI.

function.name: gtk_recent_info_last_application
function.description: Gets the name of the last application that have registered the recently used resource represented by @info.
function.return: an application name. Use g_free() to free it.

function.name: gtk_recent_info_match
function.description: Checks whether two #GtkRecentInfo point to the same resource.
function.return: %TRUE if both #GtkRecentInfo point to the same resource, %FALSE otherwise

function.name: gtk_recent_info_ref
function.description: Increases the reference count of @recent_info by one.
function.return: the recent info object with its reference count increased by one

function.name: gtk_recent_info_unref
function.description: Decreases the reference count of @info by one. If the reference count reaches zero, @info is deallocated, and the memory freed.

function.name: gtk_recent_manager_add_full
function.description:
Adds a new resource, pointed by @uri, into the recently used resources list, using the metadata specified inside the #GtkRecentData passed in @recent_data.
The passed URI will be used to identify this resource inside the list.
In order to register the new recently used resource, metadata about the resource must be passed as well as the URI; the metadata is stored in a #GtkRecentData, which must contain the MIME type of the resource pointed by the URI; the name of the application that is registering the item, and a command line to be used when launching the item.
Optionally, a #GtkRecentData might contain a UTF-8 string to be used when viewing the item instead of the last component of the URI; a short description of the item; whether the item should be considered private - that is, should be displayed only by the applications that have registered it.
function.return: %TRUE if the new item was successfully added to the recently used resources list, %FALSE otherwise

function.name: gtk_recent_manager_add_item
function.description:
Adds a new resource, pointed by @uri, into the recently used resources list.
This function automatically retrieves some of the needed metadata and setting other metadata to common default values; it then feeds the data to gtk_recent_manager_add_full().
See gtk_recent_manager_add_full() if you want to explicitly define the metadata for the resource pointed by @uri.
function.return: %TRUE if the new item was successfully added to the recently used resources list

function.name: gtk_recent_manager_get_default
function.description: Gets a unique instance of #GtkRecentManager, that you can share in your application without caring about memory management.
function.return: A unique #GtkRecentManager. Do not ref or unref it.

function.name: gtk_recent_manager_get_items
function.description: Gets the list of recently used resources.
function.return: a list of newly allocated #GtkRecentInfo objects. Use gtk_recent_info_unref() on each item inside the list, and then free the list itself using g_list_free().

function.name: gtk_recent_manager_has_item
function.description: Checks whether there is a recently used resource registered with @uri inside the recent manager.
function.return: %TRUE if the resource was found, %FALSE otherwise

function.name: gtk_recent_manager_lookup_item
function.description: Searches for a URI inside the recently used resources list, and returns a #GtkRecentInfo containing information about the resource like its MIME type, or its display name.

parameter.name: error
parameter.parameter_description: a return location for a #GError, or %NULL

function.return: a #GtkRecentInfo containing information about the resource pointed by @uri, or %NULL if the URI was not registered in the recently used resources list. Free with gtk_recent_info_unref().

function.name: gtk_recent_manager_move_item
function.description:
Changes the location of a recently used resource from @uri to @new_uri.
Please note that this function will not affect the resource pointed by the URIs, but only the URI used in the recently used resources list.

parameter.name: uri
parameter.parameter_description: the URI of a recently used resource

parameter.name: new_uri
parameter.parameter_description: the new URI of the recently used resource, or %NULL to remove the item pointed by @uri in the list

parameter.name: error
parameter.parameter_description: a return location for a #GError, or %NULL

function.name: gtk_recent_manager_new
function.description:
Creates a new recent manager object. Recent manager objects are used to handle the list of recently used resources. A #GtkRecentManager object monitors the recently used resources list, and emits the “changed” signal each time something inside the list changes.
#GtkRecentManager objects are expensive: be sure to create them only when needed. You should use gtk_recent_manager_get_default() instead.

function.name: gtk_recent_manager_purge_items
function.description: Purges every item from the recently used resources list.

parameter.name: error
parameter.parameter_description: a return location for a #GError, or %NULL

function.return: the number of items that have been removed from the recently used resources list

function.name: gtk_recent_manager_remove_item
function.description: Removes a resource pointed by @uri from the recently used resources list handled by a recent manager.

parameter.name: uri
parameter.parameter_description: the URI of the item you wish to remove

function.return: %TRUE if the item pointed by @uri has been successfully removed by the recently used resources list, and %FALSE otherwise

function.name: gtk_render_activity
function.description: Renders an activity indicator (such as in #GtkSpinner). The state %GTK_STATE_FLAG_CHECKED determines whether there is activity going on.

function.name: gtk_render_arrow
function.description:
Renders an arrow pointing to @angle.
Typical arrow rendering at 0, 1⁄2 π;, π; and 3⁄2 π:
![](arrows.png)

parameter.name: angle
parameter.parameter_description: arrow angle from 0 to 2 * %G_PI, being 0 the arrow pointing to the north

parameter.name: x
parameter.parameter_description: X origin of the render area

parameter.name: y
parameter.parameter_description: Y origin of the render area

function.name: gtk_render_background
function.description:
Renders the background of an element.
Typical background rendering, showing the effect of `background-image`, `border-width` and `border-radius`:
![](background.png)

function.name: gtk_render_check
function.description:
Renders a checkmark (as in a #GtkCheckButton).
The %GTK_STATE_FLAG_CHECKED state determines whether the check is on or off, and %GTK_STATE_FLAG_INCONSISTENT determines whether it should be marked as undefined.
Typical checkmark rendering:
![](checks.png)

function.name: gtk_render_expander
function.description:
Renders an expander (as used in #GtkTreeView and #GtkExpander) in the area defined by @x, @y, @width, @height. The state %GTK_STATE_FLAG_CHECKED determines whether the expander is collapsed or expanded.
Typical expander rendering:
![](expanders.png)

function.name: gtk_render_focus
function.description:
Renders a focus indicator on the rectangle determined by @x, @y, @width, @height.
Typical focus rendering:
![](focus.png)

function.name: gtk_render_frame
function.description:
Renders a frame around the rectangle defined by @x, @y, @width, @height.
Examples of frame rendering, showing the effect of `border-image`, `border-color`, `border-width`, `border-radius` and junctions:
![](frames.png)

function.name: gtk_render_handle
function.description:
Renders a handle (as in #GtkPaned and #GtkWindow’s resize grip), in the rectangle determined by @x, @y, @width, @height.
Handles rendered for the paned and grip classes:
![](handles.png)

function.name: gtk_render_icon
function.description:
Renders the icon in @texture at the specified @x and @y coordinates.
This function will render the icon in @texture at exactly its size, regardless of scaling factors, which may not be appropriate when drawing on displays with high pixel densities.

parameter.name: texture
parameter.parameter_description: a #GdkTexture containing the icon to draw

function.name: gtk_render_layout
function.description: Renders @layout on the coordinates @x, @y

function.name: gtk_render_line
function.description: Renders a line from (x0, y0) to (x1, y1).

parameter.name: x0
parameter.parameter_description: X coordinate for the origin of the line

parameter.name: y0
parameter.parameter_description: Y coordinate for the origin of the line

parameter.name: x1
parameter.parameter_description: X coordinate for the end of the line

parameter.name: y1
parameter.parameter_description: Y coordinate for the end of the line

function.name: gtk_render_option
function.description:
Renders an option mark (as in a radio button), the %GTK_STATE_FLAG_CHECKED state will determine whether the option is on or off, and %GTK_STATE_FLAG_INCONSISTENT whether it should be marked as undefined.
Typical option mark rendering:
![](options.png)

function.name: gtk_requisition_copy
function.description: Copies a #GtkRequisition.

function.name: gtk_requisition_free
function.description: Frees a #GtkRequisition.

function.name: gtk_requisition_new
function.description: Allocates a new #GtkRequisition-struct and initializes its elements to zero.
function.return: a new empty #GtkRequisition. The newly allocated #GtkRequisition should be freed with gtk_requisition_free().

function.name: gtk_revealer_get_child
function.description: Gets the child widget of @revealer.

function.name: gtk_revealer_get_child_revealed
function.description: Returns whether the child is fully revealed, in other words whether the transition to the revealed state is completed.
function.return: %TRUE if the child is fully revealed

function.name: gtk_revealer_get_reveal_child
function.description:
Returns whether the child is currently revealed. See gtk_revealer_set_reveal_child().
This function returns %TRUE as soon as the transition is to the revealed state is started. To learn whether the child is fully revealed (ie the transition is completed), use gtk_revealer_get_child_revealed().

function.name: gtk_revealer_get_transition_duration
function.description: Returns the amount of time (in milliseconds) that transitions will take.

function.name: gtk_revealer_get_transition_type
function.description: Gets the type of animation that will be used for transitions in @revealer.

function.name: gtk_revealer_new
function.description: Creates a new #GtkRevealer.

function.name: gtk_revealer_set_child
function.description: Sets the child widget of @revealer.

function.name: gtk_revealer_set_reveal_child
function.description:
Tells the #GtkRevealer to reveal or conceal its child.
The transition will be animated with the current transition type of @revealer.

function.name: gtk_revealer_set_transition_duration
function.description: Sets the duration that transitions will take.

function.name: gtk_revealer_set_transition_type
function.description: Sets the type of animation that will be used for transitions in @revealer. Available types include various kinds of fades and slides.

function.name: gtk_rgb_to_hsv

parameter.name: h
parameter.parameter_description: Return value for the hue component

parameter.name: s
parameter.parameter_description: Return value for the saturation component

parameter.name: v
parameter.parameter_description: Return value for the value component

function.name: gtk_root_get_display
function.description: Returns the display that this GtkRoot is on.

function.name: gtk_root_get_focus
function.description:
Retrieves the current focused widget within the root.
Note that this is the widget that would have the focus if the root is active; if the root is not focused then `gtk_widget_has_focus (widget)` will be %FALSE for the widget.
function.return: the currently focused widget, or %NULL if there is none.

function.name: gtk_root_set_focus
function.description:
If @focus is not the current focus widget, and is focusable, sets it as the focus widget for the root. If @focus is %NULL, unsets the focus widget for the root.
To set the focus to a particular widget in the root, it is usually more convenient to use gtk_widget_grab_focus() instead of this function.

parameter.name: focus
parameter.parameter_description: widget to be the new focus widget, or %NULL to unset the focus widget

function.name: gtk_scale_add_mark
function.description:
Adds a mark at @value.
A mark is indicated visually by drawing a tick mark next to the scale, and GTK makes it easy for the user to position the scale exactly at the marks value.
If @markup is not %NULL, text is shown next to the tick mark.
To remove marks from a scale, use gtk_scale_clear_marks().

parameter.name: value
parameter.parameter_description: the value at which the mark is placed, must be between the lower and upper limits of the scales’ adjustment

parameter.name: position
parameter.parameter_description: where to draw the mark. For a horizontal scale, #GTK_POS_TOP and %GTK_POS_LEFT are drawn above the scale, anything else below. For a vertical scale, #GTK_POS_LEFT and %GTK_POS_TOP are drawn to the left of the scale, anything else to the right.

parameter.name: markup
parameter.parameter_description: Text to be shown at the mark, using [Pango markup][PangoMarkupFormat], or %NULL

function.name: gtk_scale_button_get_adjustment
function.description: Gets the #GtkAdjustment associated with the #GtkScaleButton’s scale. See gtk_range_get_adjustment() for details.
function.return: the adjustment associated with the scale

function.name: gtk_scale_button_get_minus_button
function.description: Retrieves the minus button of the #GtkScaleButton.
function.return: the minus button of the #GtkScaleButton as a #GtkButton

function.name: gtk_scale_button_get_plus_button
function.description: Retrieves the plus button of the #GtkScaleButton.
function.return: the plus button of the #GtkScaleButton as a #GtkButton

function.name: gtk_scale_button_get_popup
function.description: Retrieves the popup of the #GtkScaleButton.

function.name: gtk_scale_button_get_value
function.description: Gets the current value of the scale button.
function.return: current value of the scale button

function.name: gtk_scale_button_new
function.description: Creates a #GtkScaleButton, with a range between @min and @max, with a stepping of @step.

parameter.name: min
parameter.parameter_description: the minimum value of the scale (usually 0)

parameter.name: max
parameter.parameter_description: the maximum value of the scale (usually 100)

parameter.name: step
parameter.parameter_description: the stepping of value when a scroll-wheel event, or up/down arrow event occurs (usually 2)

parameter.name: icons
parameter.parameter_description: a %NULL-terminated array of icon names, or %NULL if you want to set the list later with gtk_scale_button_set_icons()

function.name: gtk_scale_button_set_adjustment
function.description: Sets the #GtkAdjustment to be used as a model for the #GtkScaleButton’s scale. See gtk_range_set_adjustment() for details.

function.name: gtk_scale_button_set_icons
function.description: Sets the icons to be used by the scale button. For details, see the #GtkScaleButton:icons property.

function.name: gtk_scale_button_set_value
function.description: Sets the current value of the scale; if the value is outside the minimum or maximum range values, it will be clamped to fit inside them. The scale button emits the #GtkScaleButton::value-changed signal if the value changes.

parameter.name: value
parameter.parameter_description: new value of the scale button

function.name: gtk_scale_clear_marks
function.description: Removes any marks that have been added with gtk_scale_add_mark().

function.name: gtk_scale_get_digits
function.description: Gets the number of decimal places that are displayed in the value.
function.return: the number of decimal places that are displayed

function.name: gtk_scale_get_draw_value
function.description: Returns whether the current value is displayed as a string next to the slider.
function.return: whether the current value is displayed as a string

function.name: gtk_scale_get_has_origin
function.description: Returns whether the scale has an origin.
function.return: %TRUE if the scale has an origin.

function.name: gtk_scale_get_layout
function.description: Gets the #PangoLayout used to display the scale. The returned object is owned by the scale so does not need to be freed by the caller.
