function.return: if %FALSE, the insertion cursor will not be shown, even if the text is editable.

function.name: gtk_text_layout_get_line_at_y
function.description: Get the iter at the beginning of the line which is displayed at the given y.

parameter.name: target_iter
parameter.parameter_description: the iterator in which the result is stored

parameter.name: line_top
parameter.parameter_description: location to store the y coordinate of the top of the line. (Can by %NULL)

function.name: gtk_text_layout_get_line_yrange
function.description: Find the range of y coordinates for the paragraph containing the given iter.

parameter.name: y
parameter.parameter_description: location to store the top of the paragraph in pixels, or %NULL. @height location to store the height of the paragraph in pixels, or %NULL.

function.name: gtk_text_layout_is_valid
function.description: Check if there are any invalid regions in a #GtkTextLayout’s buffer
function.return: %TRUE if any invalid regions were found

function.name: gtk_text_layout_iter_starts_line
function.description: Tests whether an iterator is at the start of a display line.

function.name: gtk_text_layout_move_iter_to_line_end
function.description: Move to the beginning or end of a display line.

parameter.name: direction
parameter.parameter_description: if negative, move to beginning of line, otherwise move to end of line.

function.name: gtk_text_layout_move_iter_to_next_line
function.description: Move the iterator to the beginning of the next line. The lines of a wrapped paragraph are treated as distinct for this operation.

function.name: gtk_text_layout_move_iter_to_previous_line
function.description: Move the iterator to the beginning of the previous line. The lines of a wrapped paragraph are treated as distinct for this operation.

function.name: gtk_text_layout_move_iter_to_x
function.description: Keeping the iterator on the same line of the layout, move it to the specified X coordinate. The lines of a wrapped paragraph are treated as distinct for this operation.

function.name: gtk_text_layout_move_iter_visually
function.description:
Move the iterator a given number of characters visually, treating it as the strong cursor position. If @count is positive, then the new strong cursor position will be @count positions to the right of the old cursor position. If @count is negative then the new strong cursor position will be @count positions to the left of the old cursor position.
In the presence of bidirection text, the correspondence between logical and visual order will depend on the direction of the current run, and there may be jumps when the cursor is moved off of the end of a run.

parameter.name: count
parameter.parameter_description: number of characters to move (negative moves left, positive moves right)

function.name: gtk_text_layout_set_cursor_direction
function.description: Sets which text directions (left-to-right and/or right-to-left) for which cursors will be drawn for the insertion point. The visual point at which new text is inserted depends on whether the new text is right-to-left or left-to-right, so it may be desired to make the drawn position of the cursor depend on the keyboard state.

parameter.name: direction
parameter.parameter_description: the new direction(s) for which to draw cursors. %GTK_TEXT_DIR_NONE means draw cursors for both left-to-right insertion and right-to-left insertion. (The two cursors will be visually distinguished.)

function.name: gtk_text_layout_set_cursor_visible
function.description: Sets whether the insertion cursor should be shown. Generally, widgets using #GtkTextLayout will hide the cursor when the widget does not have the input focus.

parameter.name: cursor_visible
parameter.parameter_description: If %FALSE, then the insertion cursor will not be shown, even if the text is editable.

function.name: gtk_text_layout_set_keyboard_direction
function.description: Sets the keyboard direction; this is used as for the bidirectional base direction for the line with the cursor if the line contains only neutral characters.

parameter.name: keyboard_dir
parameter.parameter_description: the current direction of the keyboard.

function.name: gtk_text_layout_set_overwrite_mode
function.description: Sets overwrite mode

function.name: gtk_text_layout_set_preedit_string
function.description: Set the preedit string and attributes. The preedit string is a string showing text that is currently being edited and not yet committed into the buffer.

parameter.name: preedit_string
parameter.parameter_description: a string to display at the insertion point

parameter.name: preedit_attrs
parameter.parameter_description: a #PangoAttrList of attributes that apply to @preedit_string

parameter.name: cursor_pos
parameter.parameter_description: position of cursor within preedit string in chars

function.name: gtk_text_layout_validate
function.description: Validate regions of a #GtkTextLayout. The ::changed signal will be emitted for each region validated.

parameter.name: max_pixels
parameter.parameter_description: the maximum number of pixels to validate. (No more than one paragraph beyond this limit will be validated)

function.name: gtk_text_layout_validate_yrange
function.description: Ensure that a region of a #GtkTextLayout is valid. The ::changed signal will be emitted if any lines are validated.

parameter.name: anchor
parameter.parameter_description: iter pointing into a line that will be used as the coordinate origin

parameter.name: y0_
parameter.parameter_description: offset from the top of the line pointed to by @anchor at which to begin validation. (The offset here is in pixels after validation.)

parameter.name: y1_
parameter.parameter_description: offset from the top of the line pointed to by @anchor at which to end validation. (The offset here is in pixels after validation.)

function.name: gtk_text_mark_get_buffer
function.description: Gets the buffer this mark is located inside, or %NULL if the mark is deleted.

function.name: gtk_text_mark_get_deleted
function.description: Returns %TRUE if the mark has been removed from its buffer with gtk_text_buffer_delete_mark(). See gtk_text_buffer_add_mark() for a way to add it to a buffer again.

function.name: gtk_text_mark_get_left_gravity
function.description: Determines whether the mark has left gravity.
function.return: %TRUE if the mark has left gravity, %FALSE otherwise

function.name: gtk_text_mark_get_name
function.description: Returns the mark name; returns NULL for anonymous marks.

function.name: gtk_text_mark_get_visible
function.description: Returns %TRUE if the mark is visible (i.e. a cursor is displayed for it).

function.name: gtk_text_mark_new
function.description: Creates a text mark. Add it to a buffer using gtk_text_buffer_add_mark(). If @name is %NULL, the mark is anonymous; otherwise, the mark can be retrieved by name using gtk_text_buffer_get_mark(). If a mark has left gravity, and text is inserted at the mark’s current location, the mark will be moved to the left of the newly-inserted text. If the mark has right gravity (@left_gravity = %FALSE), the mark will end up on the right of newly-inserted text. The standard left-to-right cursor is a mark with right gravity (when you type, the cursor stays on the right side of the text you’re typing).

parameter.name: left_gravity
parameter.parameter_description: whether the mark should have left gravity

function.name: gtk_text_mark_set_visible
function.description: Sets the visibility of @mark; the insertion point is normally visible, i.e. you can see it as a vertical bar. Also, the text widget uses a visible mark to indicate where a drop will occur when dragging-and-dropping text. Most other marks are not visible. Marks are not visible by default.

function.name: gtk_text_new
function.description: Creates a new self.

function.name: gtk_text_new_with_buffer
function.description: Creates a new self with the specified text buffer.

parameter.name: buffer
parameter.parameter_description: The buffer to use for the new #GtkText.

function.name: gtk_text_set_activates_default
function.description: If @activates is %TRUE, pressing Enter in the @self will activate the default widget for the window containing the self. This usually means that the dialog box containing the self will be closed, since the default widget is usually one of the dialog buttons.

parameter.name: activates
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE to activate window’s default widget on Enter keypress

function.name: gtk_text_set_attributes
function.description: Sets a #PangoAttrList; the attributes in the list are applied to the text.

function.name: gtk_text_set_buffer
function.description: Set the #GtkEntryBuffer object which holds the text for this widget.

function.name: gtk_text_set_enable_emoji_completion
function.description: Sets whether Emoji completion is enabled. If it is, typing ':', followed by a recognized keyword, will pop up a window with suggested Emojis matching the keyword.

function.name: gtk_text_set_extra_menu
function.description: Sets a menu model to add when constructing the context menu for @self.

function.name: gtk_text_set_input_hints
function.description: Sets the #GtkText:input-hints property, which allows input methods to fine-tune their behaviour.

function.name: gtk_text_set_input_purpose
function.description: Sets the #GtkText:input-purpose property which can be used by on-screen keyboards and other input methods to adjust their behaviour.

function.name: gtk_text_set_invisible_char
function.description:
Sets the character to use in place of the actual text when gtk_text_set_visibility() has been called to set text visibility to %FALSE. i.e. this is the character used in “password mode” to show the user how many characters have been typed.
By default, GTK picks the best invisible char available in the current font. If you set the invisible char to 0, then the user will get no feedback at all; there will be no text on the screen as they type.

function.name: gtk_text_set_max_length
function.description:
Sets the maximum allowed length of the contents of the widget.
If the current contents are longer than the given length, then they will be truncated to fit.
This is equivalent to getting @self's #GtkEntryBuffer and calling gtk_entry_buffer_set_max_length() on it. ]|

parameter.name: length
parameter.parameter_description: the maximum length of the self, or 0 for no maximum. (other than the maximum length of entries.) The value passed in will be clamped to the range 0-65536.

function.name: gtk_text_set_overwrite_mode
function.description: Sets whether the text is overwritten when typing in the #GtkText.

function.name: gtk_text_set_placeholder_text
function.description:
Sets text to be displayed in @self when it is empty.
This can be used to give a visual hint of the expected contents of the self.

parameter.name: text
parameter.parameter_description: a string to be displayed when @self is empty and unfocused, or %NULL

function.name: gtk_text_set_propagate_text_width
function.description: Sets whether the GtkText should grow and shrink with the content.

function.name: gtk_text_set_tabs
function.description: Sets a #PangoTabArray; the tabstops in the array are applied to the self text.

function.name: gtk_text_set_truncate_multiline
function.description: Sets whether the GtkText should truncate multi-line text that is pasted into the widget.

function.name: gtk_text_set_visibility
function.description:
Sets whether the contents of the self are visible or not. When visibility is set to %FALSE, characters are displayed as the invisible char, and will also appear that way when the text in the self widget is copied to the clipboard.
By default, GTK picks the best invisible character available in the current font, but it can be changed with gtk_text_set_invisible_char().
Note that you probably want to set #GtkText:input-purpose to %GTK_INPUT_PURPOSE_PASSWORD or %GTK_INPUT_PURPOSE_PIN to inform input methods about the purpose of this self, in addition to setting visibility to %FALSE.

parameter.name: visible
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE if the contents of the self are displayed as plaintext

function.name: gtk_text_tag_changed
function.description:
Emits the #GtkTextTagTable::tag-changed signal on the #GtkTextTagTable where the tag is included.
The signal is already emitted when setting a #GtkTextTag property. This function is useful for a #GtkTextTag subclass.

parameter.name: size_changed
parameter.parameter_description: whether the change affects the #GtkTextView layout.

function.name: gtk_text_tag_get_priority
function.description: Get the tag priority.

function.name: gtk_text_tag_new
function.description: Creates a #GtkTextTag. Configure the tag using object arguments, i.e. using g_object_set().

function.name: gtk_text_tag_set_priority
function.description: Sets the priority of a #GtkTextTag. Valid priorities start at 0 and go to one less than gtk_text_tag_table_get_size(). Each tag in a table has a unique priority; setting the priority of one tag shifts the priorities of all the other tags in the table to maintain a unique priority for each tag. Higher priority tags “win” if two tags both set the same text attribute. When adding a tag to a tag table, it will be assigned the highest priority in the table by default; so normally the precedence of a set of tags is the order in which they were added to the table, or created with gtk_text_buffer_create_tag(), which adds the tag to the buffer’s table automatically.

function.name: gtk_text_tag_table_add
function.description:
Add a tag to the table. The tag is assigned the highest priority in the table.
@tag must not be in a tag table already, and may not have the same name as an already-added tag.

function.name: gtk_text_tag_table_foreach
function.description: Calls @func on each tag in @table, with user data @data. Note that the table may not be modified while iterating over it (you can’t add/remove tags).

parameter.name: func
parameter.parameter_description: a function to call on each tag

function.name: gtk_text_tag_table_get_size
function.description: Returns the size of the table (number of tags)

function.name: gtk_text_tag_table_lookup
function.description: Look up a named tag.
function.return: The tag, or %NULL if none by that name is in the table.

function.name: gtk_text_tag_table_new
function.description: Creates a new #GtkTextTagTable. The table contains no tags by default.

function.name: gtk_text_tag_table_remove
function.description: Remove a tag from the table. If a #GtkTextBuffer has @table as its tag table, the tag is removed from the buffer. The table’s reference to the tag is removed, so the tag will end up destroyed if you don’t have a reference to it.

function.name: gtk_text_unset_invisible_char
function.description: Unsets the invisible char previously set with gtk_text_set_invisible_char(). So that the default invisible char is used again.

function.name: gtk_text_util_create_drag_icon
function.description: Creates a drag and drop icon from @text.

parameter.name: len
parameter.parameter_description: length of @text, or -1 for NUL-terminated text

function.return: a #GdkPaintable to use as DND icon

function.name: gtk_text_view_add_child_at_anchor
function.description: Adds a child widget in the text buffer, at the given @anchor.

function.name: gtk_text_view_add_overlay

parameter.name: xpos
parameter.parameter_description: X position of child in window coordinates

parameter.name: ypos
parameter.parameter_description: Y position of child in window coordinates

function.name: gtk_text_view_backward_display_line
function.description: Moves the given @iter backward by one display (wrapped) line. A display line is different from a paragraph. Paragraphs are separated by newlines or other paragraph separator characters. Display lines are created by line-wrapping a paragraph. If wrapping is turned off, display lines and paragraphs will be the same. Display lines are divided differently for each view, since they depend on the view’s width; paragraphs are the same in all views, since they depend on the contents of the #GtkTextBuffer.
function.return: %TRUE if @iter was moved and is not on the end iterator

function.name: gtk_text_view_backward_display_line_start
function.description: Moves the given @iter backward to the next display line start. A display line is different from a paragraph. Paragraphs are separated by newlines or other paragraph separator characters. Display lines are created by line-wrapping a paragraph. If wrapping is turned off, display lines and paragraphs will be the same. Display lines are divided differently for each view, since they depend on the view’s width; paragraphs are the same in all views, since they depend on the contents of the #GtkTextBuffer.
function.return: %TRUE if @iter was moved and is not on the end iterator

function.name: gtk_text_view_buffer_to_window_coords
function.description: Converts coordinate (@buffer_x, @buffer_y) to coordinates for the window @win, and stores the result in (@window_x, @window_y).

parameter.name: window_x
parameter.parameter_description: window x coordinate return location or %NULL

parameter.name: window_y
parameter.parameter_description: window y coordinate return location or %NULL

function.name: gtk_text_view_forward_display_line
function.description: Moves the given @iter forward by one display (wrapped) line. A display line is different from a paragraph. Paragraphs are separated by newlines or other paragraph separator characters. Display lines are created by line-wrapping a paragraph. If wrapping is turned off, display lines and paragraphs will be the same. Display lines are divided differently for each view, since they depend on the view’s width; paragraphs are the same in all views, since they depend on the contents of the #GtkTextBuffer.
function.return: %TRUE if @iter was moved and is not on the end iterator

function.name: gtk_text_view_forward_display_line_end
function.description: Moves the given @iter forward to the next display line end. A display line is different from a paragraph. Paragraphs are separated by newlines or other paragraph separator characters. Display lines are created by line-wrapping a paragraph. If wrapping is turned off, display lines and paragraphs will be the same. Display lines are divided differently for each view, since they depend on the view’s width; paragraphs are the same in all views, since they depend on the contents of the #GtkTextBuffer.
function.return: %TRUE if @iter was moved and is not on the end iterator

function.name: gtk_text_view_get_accepts_tab
function.description: Returns whether pressing the Tab key inserts a tab characters. gtk_text_view_set_accepts_tab().
function.return: %TRUE if pressing the Tab key inserts a tab character, %FALSE if pressing the Tab key moves the keyboard focus.

function.name: gtk_text_view_get_bottom_margin
function.description: Gets the bottom margin for text in the @text_view.

function.name: gtk_text_view_get_buffer
function.description: Returns the #GtkTextBuffer being displayed by this text view. The reference count on the buffer is not incremented; the caller of this function won’t own a new reference.

function.name: gtk_text_view_get_cursor_locations
function.description:
Given an @iter within a text layout, determine the positions of the strong and weak cursors if the insertion point is at that iterator. The position of each cursor is stored as a zero-width rectangle. The strong cursor location is the location where characters of the directionality equal to the base direction of the paragraph are inserted. The weak cursor location is the location where characters of the directionality opposite to the base direction of the paragraph are inserted.
If @iter is %NULL, the actual cursor position is used.
Note that if @iter happens to be the actual cursor position, and there is currently an IM preedit sequence being entered, the returned locations will be adjusted to account for the preedit cursor’s offset within the preedit sequence.
The rectangle position is in buffer coordinates; use gtk_text_view_buffer_to_window_coords() to convert these coordinates to coordinates for one of the windows in the text view.

parameter.name: strong
parameter.parameter_description: location to store the strong cursor position (may be %NULL)

parameter.name: weak
parameter.parameter_description: location to store the weak cursor position (may be %NULL)

function.name: gtk_text_view_get_cursor_visible
function.description: Find out whether the cursor should be displayed.
function.return: whether the insertion mark is visible

function.name: gtk_text_view_get_editable
function.description: Returns the default editability of the #GtkTextView. Tags in the buffer may override this setting for some ranges of text.
function.return: whether text is editable by default

function.name: gtk_text_view_get_extra_menu
function.description: Gets the menu model set with gtk_text_view_set_extra_menu() or %NULL if none has been set.

function.name: gtk_text_view_get_gutter
function.description:
Gets a #GtkWidget that has previously been set with gtk_text_view_set_gutter().
@win must be one of %GTK_TEXT_WINDOW_LEFT, %GTK_TEXT_WINDOW_RIGHT, %GTK_TEXT_WINDOW_TOP, or %GTK_TEXT_WINDOW_BOTTOM.

function.name: gtk_text_view_get_indent
function.description: Gets the default indentation of paragraphs in @text_view. Tags in the view’s buffer may override the default. The indentation may be negative.

function.name: gtk_text_view_get_input_hints
function.description: Gets the value of the #GtkTextView:input-hints property.

function.name: gtk_text_view_get_input_purpose
function.description: Gets the value of the #GtkTextView:input-purpose property.

function.name: gtk_text_view_get_iter_at_location
function.description: Retrieves the iterator at buffer coordinates @x and @y. Buffer coordinates are coordinates for the entire buffer, not just the currently-displayed portion. If you have coordinates from an event, you have to convert those to buffer coordinates with gtk_text_view_window_to_buffer_coords().
function.return: %TRUE if the position is over text

function.name: gtk_text_view_get_iter_at_position
function.description:
Retrieves the iterator pointing to the character at buffer coordinates @x and @y. Buffer coordinates are coordinates for the entire buffer, not just the currently-displayed portion. If you have coordinates from an event, you have to convert those to buffer coordinates with gtk_text_view_window_to_buffer_coords().
Note that this is different from gtk_text_view_get_iter_at_location(), which returns cursor locations, i.e. positions between characters.

parameter.name: trailing
parameter.parameter_description: if non-%NULL, location to store an integer indicating where in the grapheme the user clicked. It will either be zero, or the number of characters in the grapheme. 0 represents the trailing edge of the grapheme.

function.return: %TRUE if the position is over text

function.name: gtk_text_view_get_iter_location
function.description: Gets a rectangle which roughly contains the character at @iter. The rectangle position is in buffer coordinates; use gtk_text_view_buffer_to_window_coords() to convert these coordinates to coordinates for one of the windows in the text view.

function.name: gtk_text_view_get_justification
function.description: Gets the default justification of paragraphs in @text_view. Tags in the buffer may override the default.

function.name: gtk_text_view_get_left_margin
function.description: Gets the default left margin size of paragraphs in the @text_view. Tags in the buffer may override the default.

function.name: gtk_text_view_get_line_at_y
function.description: Gets the #GtkTextIter at the start of the line containing the coordinate @y. @y is in buffer coordinates, convert from window coordinates with gtk_text_view_window_to_buffer_coords(). If non-%NULL, @line_top will be filled with the coordinate of the top edge of the line.

parameter.name: line_top
parameter.parameter_description: return location for top coordinate of the line

function.name: gtk_text_view_get_line_yrange

parameter.name: y
parameter.parameter_description: return location for a y coordinate

function.name: gtk_text_view_get_monospace
function.description:
Gets the value of the #GtkTextView:monospace property.
Return: %TRUE if monospace fonts are desired

function.name: gtk_text_view_get_overwrite
function.description: Returns whether the #GtkTextView is in overwrite mode or not.
function.return: whether @text_view is in overwrite mode or not.

function.name: gtk_text_view_get_pixels_above_lines
function.description: Gets the default number of pixels to put above paragraphs. Adding this function with gtk_text_view_get_pixels_below_lines() is equal to the line space between each paragraph.
function.return: default number of pixels above paragraphs

function.name: gtk_text_view_get_pixels_below_lines
function.description:
Gets the value set by gtk_text_view_set_pixels_below_lines().
The line space is the sum of the value returned by this function and the value returned by gtk_text_view_get_pixels_above_lines().
function.return: default number of blank pixels below paragraphs

function.name: gtk_text_view_get_pixels_inside_wrap
function.description: Gets the value set by gtk_text_view_set_pixels_inside_wrap().
function.return: default number of pixels of blank space between wrapped lines

function.name: gtk_text_view_get_right_margin
function.description: Gets the default right margin for text in @text_view. Tags in the buffer may override the default.

function.name: gtk_text_view_get_tabs
function.description: Gets the default tabs for @text_view. Tags in the buffer may override the defaults. The returned array will be %NULL if “standard” (8-space) tabs are used. Free the return value with pango_tab_array_free().
function.return: copy of default tab array, or %NULL if “standard" tabs are used; must be freed with pango_tab_array_free().

function.name: gtk_text_view_get_top_margin
function.description: Gets the top margin for text in the @text_view.

function.name: gtk_text_view_get_visible_rect
function.description: Fills @visible_rect with the currently-visible region of the buffer, in buffer coordinates. Convert to window coordinates with gtk_text_view_buffer_to_window_coords().

function.name: gtk_text_view_get_wrap_mode
function.description: Gets the line wrapping for the view.

function.name: gtk_text_view_im_context_filter_keypress
function.return: %TRUE if the input method handled the key event.

function.name: gtk_text_view_move_mark_onscreen
function.description: Moves a mark within the buffer so that it's located within the currently-visible text area.
function.return: %TRUE if the mark moved (wasn’t already onscreen)

function.name: gtk_text_view_move_overlay
function.description: Updates the position of a child, as for gtk_text_view_add_overlay().

parameter.name: child
parameter.parameter_description: a widget already added with gtk_text_view_add_overlay()

parameter.name: xpos
parameter.parameter_description: new X position in buffer coordinates

parameter.name: ypos
parameter.parameter_description: new Y position in buffer coordinates

function.name: gtk_text_view_move_visually
function.description:
Move the iterator a given number of characters visually, treating it as the strong cursor position. If @count is positive, then the new strong cursor position will be @count positions to the right of the old cursor position. If @count is negative then the new strong cursor position will be @count positions to the left of the old cursor position.
In the presence of bi-directional text, the correspondence between logical and visual order will depend on the direction of the current run, and there may be jumps when the cursor is moved off of the end of a run.

parameter.name: count
parameter.parameter_description: number of characters to move (negative moves left, positive moves right)

function.return: %TRUE if @iter moved and is not on the end iterator

function.name: gtk_text_view_new
function.description: Creates a new #GtkTextView. If you don’t call gtk_text_view_set_buffer() before using the text view, an empty default buffer will be created for you. Get the buffer with gtk_text_view_get_buffer(). If you want to specify your own buffer, consider gtk_text_view_new_with_buffer().

function.name: gtk_text_view_new_with_buffer
gtk_text_view_place_cursor_onscreen
function.description: Moves the cursor to the currently visible region of the buffer, if it isn’t there already.
function.return: %TRUE if the cursor had to be moved.

function.name: gtk_text_view_remove
function.description: Removes a child widget from @text_view.

function.name: gtk_text_view_reset_cursor_blink
function.description:
Ensures that the cursor is shown (i.e. not in an 'off' blink interval) and resets the time that it will stay blinking (or visible, in case blinking is disabled).
This function should be called in response to user input (e.g. from derived classes that override the textview's event handlers).

function.name: gtk_text_view_reset_im_context
function.description:
Reset the input method context of the text view if needed.
This can be necessary in the case where modifying the buffer would confuse on-going input method behavior.

function.name: gtk_text_view_scroll_mark_onscreen
function.description: Scrolls @text_view the minimum distance such that @mark is contained within the visible area of the widget.

parameter.name: mark
parameter.parameter_description: a mark in the buffer for @text_view

function.name: gtk_text_view_scroll_to_iter
function.description:
Scrolls @text_view so that @iter is on the screen in the position indicated by @xalign and @yalign. An alignment of 0.0 indicates left or top, 1.0 indicates right or bottom, 0.5 means center. If @use_align is %FALSE, the text scrolls the minimal distance to get the mark onscreen, possibly not scrolling at all. The effective screen for purposes of this function is reduced by a margin of size @within_margin.
Note that this function uses the currently-computed height of the lines in the text buffer. Line heights are computed in an idle handler; so this function may not have the desired effect if it’s called before the height computations. To avoid oddness, consider using gtk_text_view_scroll_to_mark() which saves a point to be scrolled to after line validation.

parameter.name: within_margin
parameter.parameter_description: margin as a [0.0,0.5) fraction of screen size

parameter.name: use_align
parameter.parameter_description: whether to use alignment arguments (if %FALSE, just get the mark onscreen)

parameter.name: xalign
parameter.parameter_description: horizontal alignment of mark within visible area

parameter.name: yalign
parameter.parameter_description: vertical alignment of mark within visible area

function.name: gtk_text_view_scroll_to_mark
function.description: Scrolls @text_view so that @mark is on the screen in the position indicated by @xalign and @yalign. An alignment of 0.0 indicates left or top, 1.0 indicates right or bottom, 0.5 means center. If @use_align is %FALSE, the text scrolls the minimal distance to get the mark onscreen, possibly not scrolling at all. The effective screen for purposes of this function is reduced by a margin of size @within_margin.

parameter.name: within_margin
parameter.parameter_description: margin as a [0.0,0.5) fraction of screen size

parameter.name: use_align
parameter.parameter_description: whether to use alignment arguments (if %FALSE, just get the mark onscreen)

parameter.name: xalign
parameter.parameter_description: horizontal alignment of mark within visible area

parameter.name: yalign
parameter.parameter_description: vertical alignment of mark within visible area

function.name: gtk_text_view_set_accepts_tab
function.description: Sets the behavior of the text widget when the Tab key is pressed. If @accepts_tab is %TRUE, a tab character is inserted. If @accepts_tab is %FALSE the keyboard focus is moved to the next widget in the focus chain.

parameter.name: accepts_tab
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE if pressing the Tab key should insert a tab character, %FALSE, if pressing the Tab key should move the keyboard focus.

function.name: gtk_text_view_set_bottom_margin
function.description:
Sets the bottom margin for text in @text_view.
Note that this function is confusingly named. In CSS terms, the value set here is padding.

function.name: gtk_text_view_set_buffer
function.description: Sets @buffer as the buffer being displayed by @text_view. The previous buffer displayed by the text view is unreferenced, and a reference is added to @buffer. If you owned a reference to @buffer before passing it to this function, you must remove that reference yourself; #GtkTextView will not “adopt” it.

function.name: gtk_text_view_set_cursor_visible
function.description:
Toggles whether the insertion point should be displayed. A buffer with no editable text probably shouldn’t have a visible cursor, so you may want to turn the cursor off.
Note that this property may be overridden by the #GtkSettings:gtk-keynav-use-caret settings.

parameter.name: setting
parameter.parameter_description: whether to show the insertion cursor

function.name: gtk_text_view_set_editable
function.description: Sets the default editability of the #GtkTextView. You can override this default setting with tags in the buffer, using the “editable” attribute of tags.

function.name: gtk_text_view_set_extra_menu
function.description: Sets a menu model to add when constructing the context menu for @text_view. You can pass %NULL to remove a previously set extra menu.

function.name: gtk_text_view_set_gutter
gtk_text_view_set_indent
function.description: Sets the default indentation for paragraphs in @text_view. Tags in the buffer may override the default.

function.name: gtk_text_view_set_input_hints
function.description: Sets the #GtkTextView:input-hints property, which allows input methods to fine-tune their behaviour.

function.name: gtk_text_view_set_input_purpose
function.description: Sets the #GtkTextView:input-purpose property which can be used by on-screen keyboards and other input methods to adjust their behaviour.

function.name: gtk_text_view_set_justification
function.description: Sets the default justification of text in @text_view. Tags in the view’s buffer may override the default.

function.name: gtk_text_view_set_left_margin
function.description:
Sets the default left margin for text in @text_view. Tags in the buffer may override the default.
Note that this function is confusingly named. In CSS terms, the value set here is padding.

function.name: gtk_text_view_set_monospace
function.description: Sets the #GtkTextView:monospace property, which indicates that the text view should use monospace fonts.

function.name: gtk_text_view_set_overwrite
function.description: Changes the #GtkTextView overwrite mode.

parameter.name: overwrite
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE to turn on overwrite mode, %FALSE to turn it off

function.name: gtk_text_view_set_pixels_above_lines
function.description: Sets the default number of blank pixels above paragraphs in @text_view. Tags in the buffer for @text_view may override the defaults.

function.name: gtk_text_view_set_pixels_below_lines
function.description: Sets the default number of pixels of blank space to put below paragraphs in @text_view. May be overridden by tags applied to @text_view’s buffer.

function.name: gtk_text_view_set_pixels_inside_wrap
function.description: Sets the default number of pixels of blank space to leave between display/wrapped lines within a paragraph. May be overridden by tags in @text_view’s buffer.

parameter.name: pixels_inside_wrap
parameter.parameter_description: default number of pixels between wrapped lines

function.name: gtk_text_view_set_right_margin
function.description:
Sets the default right margin for text in the text view. Tags in the buffer may override the default.
Note that this function is confusingly named. In CSS terms, the value set here is padding.

function.name: gtk_text_view_set_tabs
function.description: Sets the default tab stops for paragraphs in @text_view. Tags in the buffer may override the default.

function.name: gtk_text_view_set_top_margin
function.description:
Sets the top margin for text in @text_view.
Note that this function is confusingly named. In CSS terms, the value set here is padding.

function.name: gtk_text_view_set_wrap_mode
function.description: Sets the line wrapping for the view.

function.name: gtk_text_view_starts_display_line
function.description: Determines whether @iter is at the start of a display line. See gtk_text_view_forward_display_line() for an explanation of display lines vs. paragraphs.

function.name: gtk_text_view_window_to_buffer_coords
function.description: Converts coordinates on the window identified by @win to buffer coordinates, storing the result in (@buffer_x,@buffer_y).

parameter.name: buffer_x
parameter.parameter_description: buffer x coordinate return location or %NULL

parameter.name: buffer_y
parameter.parameter_description: buffer y coordinate return location or %NULL

function.name: gtk_toggle_button_get_active
function.description: Queries a #GtkToggleButton and returns its current state. Returns %TRUE if the toggle button is pressed in and %FALSE if it is raised.

function.name: gtk_toggle_button_new
function.description: Creates a new toggle button. A widget should be packed into the button, as in gtk_button_new().

function.name: gtk_toggle_button_new_with_label
function.description: Creates a new toggle button with a text label.

parameter.name: label
parameter.parameter_description: a string containing the message to be placed in the toggle button.

function.name: gtk_toggle_button_new_with_mnemonic
function.description: Creates a new #GtkToggleButton containing a label. The label will be created using gtk_label_new_with_mnemonic(), so underscores in @label indicate the mnemonic for the button.

parameter.name: label
parameter.parameter_description: the text of the button, with an underscore in front of the mnemonic character

function.name: gtk_toggle_button_set_active
function.description:
Sets the status of the toggle button. Set to %TRUE if you want the GtkToggleButton to be “pressed in”, and %FALSE to raise it.
If the status of the button changes, this action causes the #GtkToggleButton::toggled signal to be emitted.

function.name: gtk_toggle_button_set_group
function.description:
Adds @self to the group of @group. In a group of multiple toggle buttons, only one button can be active at a time.
Note that the same effect can be achieved via the #GtkActionable api, by using the same action with parameter type and state type 's' for all buttons in the group, and giving each button its own target value.

parameter.name: group
parameter.parameter_description: another #GtkToggleButton to form a group with

function.name: gtk_toggle_button_toggled
function.description: Emits the #GtkToggleButton::toggled signal on the #GtkToggleButton. There is no good reason for an application ever to call this function.

function.name: gtk_tooltip_set_custom
function.description: Replaces the widget packed into the tooltip with @custom_widget. @custom_widget does not get destroyed when the tooltip goes away. By default a box with a #GtkImage and #GtkLabel is embedded in the tooltip, which can be configured using gtk_tooltip_set_markup() and gtk_tooltip_set_icon().

parameter.name: custom_widget
parameter.parameter_description: a #GtkWidget, or %NULL to unset the old custom widget.

function.name: gtk_tooltip_set_icon
function.description: Sets the icon of the tooltip (which is in front of the text) to be @paintable. If @paintable is %NULL, the image will be hidden.

function.name: gtk_tooltip_set_icon_from_gicon
function.description: Sets the icon of the tooltip (which is in front of the text) to be the icon indicated by @gicon with the size indicated by @size. If @gicon is %NULL, the image will be hidden.

function.name: gtk_tooltip_set_icon_from_icon_name
function.description: Sets the icon of the tooltip (which is in front of the text) to be the icon indicated by @icon_name with the size indicated by @size. If @icon_name is %NULL, the image will be hidden.

function.name: gtk_tooltip_set_markup
function.description: Sets the text of the tooltip to be @markup, which is marked up with the [Pango text markup language][PangoMarkupFormat]. If @markup is %NULL, the label will be hidden.

parameter.name: markup
parameter.parameter_description: a markup string (see [Pango markup format][PangoMarkupFormat]) or %NULL

function.name: gtk_tooltip_set_text
function.description: Sets the text of the tooltip to be @text. If @text is %NULL, the label will be hidden. See also gtk_tooltip_set_markup().

function.name: gtk_tooltip_set_tip_area
function.description:
Sets the area of the widget, where the contents of this tooltip apply, to be @rect (in widget coordinates). This is especially useful for properly setting tooltips on #GtkTreeView rows and cells, #GtkIconViews, etc.
For setting tooltips on #GtkTreeView, please refer to the convenience functions for this: gtk_tree_view_set_tooltip_row() and gtk_tree_view_set_tooltip_cell().

function.name: gtk_tree_create_row_drag_content
function.description: Creates a content provider for dragging @path from @tree_model.

function.name: gtk_tree_drag_dest_drag_data_received
function.description: Asks the #GtkTreeDragDest to insert a row before the path @dest, deriving the contents of the row from @value. If @dest is outside the tree so that inserting before it is impossible, %FALSE will be returned. Also, %FALSE may be returned if the new row is not created for some model-specific reason. Should robustly handle a @dest no longer found in the model!

parameter.name: dest
parameter.parameter_description: row to drop in front of

function.return: whether a new row was created before position @dest

function.name: gtk_tree_drag_dest_row_drop_possible
function.description: Determines whether a drop is possible before the given @dest_path, at the same depth as @dest_path. i.e., can we drop the data in @value at that location. @dest_path does not have to exist; the return value will almost certainly be %FALSE if the parent of @dest_path doesn’t exist, though.
function.return: %TRUE if a drop is possible before @dest_path

function.name: gtk_tree_drag_source_drag_data_delete
function.description: Asks the #GtkTreeDragSource to delete the row at @path, because it was moved somewhere else via drag-and-drop. Returns %FALSE if the deletion fails because @path no longer exists, or for some model-specific reason. Should robustly handle a @path no longer found in the model!
function.return: %TRUE if the row was successfully deleted

function.name: gtk_tree_drag_source_drag_data_get
function.description: Asks the #GtkTreeDragSource to return a #GdkContentProvider representing the row at @path. Should robustly handle a @path no longer found in the model!
function.return: a #GdkContentProvider for the given @path or %NULL if none exists

function.name: gtk_tree_drag_source_row_draggable
function.description: Asks the #GtkTreeDragSource whether a particular row can be used as the source of a DND operation. If the source doesn’t implement this interface, the row is assumed draggable.

parameter.name: path
parameter.parameter_description: row on which user is initiating a drag

function.return: %TRUE if the row can be dragged

function.name: gtk_tree_expander_get_child
function.description: Gets the child widget displayed by @self.

function.name: gtk_tree_expander_get_item
gtk_tree_expander_get_list_row
function.description: Gets the list row managed by @self.

function.name: gtk_tree_expander_new
function.description: Creates a new #GtkTreeExpander

function.name: gtk_tree_expander_set_child
function.description: Sets the content widget to display.

function.name: gtk_tree_expander_set_list_row
function.description: Sets the tree list row that this expander should manage.

function.name: gtk_tree_get_row_drag_data
function.description:
Obtains a @tree_model and @path from value of target type %GTK_TYPE_TREE_ROW_DATA.
The returned path must be freed with gtk_tree_path_free().
function.return: %TRUE if @selection_data had target type %GTK_TYPE_TREE_ROW_DATA is otherwise valid

function.name: gtk_tree_iter_copy
function.description:
Creates a dynamically allocated tree iterator as a copy of @iter.
This function is not intended for use in applications, because you can just copy the structs by value (`GtkTreeIter new_iter = iter;`). You must free this iter with gtk_tree_iter_free().

function.name: gtk_tree_iter_free
function.description:
Frees an iterator that has been allocated by gtk_tree_iter_copy().
This function is mainly used for language bindings.

function.name: gtk_tree_list_model_get_autoexpand
function.description: Gets whether the model is set to automatically expand new rows that get added. This can be either rows added by changes to the underlying models or via gtk_tree_list_row_set_expanded().
function.return: %TRUE if the model is set to autoexpand

function.name: gtk_tree_list_model_get_child_row
function.description:
Gets the row item corresponding to the child at index @position for @self's root model.
If @position is greater than the number of children in the root model, %NULL is returned.
Do not confuse this function with gtk_tree_list_model_get_row().

parameter.name: position
parameter.parameter_description: position of the child to get

function.name: gtk_tree_list_model_get_model
function.description: Gets the root model that @self was created with.

function.name: gtk_tree_list_model_get_passthrough
function.description:
If this function returns %FALSE, the #GListModel functions for @self return custom #GtkTreeListRow objects. You need to call gtk_tree_list_row_get_item() on these objects to get the original item.
If %TRUE, the values of the child models are passed through in their original state. You then need to call gtk_tree_list_model_get_row() to get the custom #GtkTreeListRows.
function.return: %TRUE if the model is passing through original row items

function.name: gtk_tree_list_model_get_row
function.description:
Gets the row object for the given row. If @position is greater than the number of items in @self, %NULL is returned.
The row object can be used to expand and collapse rows as well as to inspect its position in the tree. See its documentation for details.
This row object is persistent and will refer to the current item as long as the row is present in @self, independent of other rows being added or removed.
If @self is set to not be passthrough, this function is equivalent to calling g_list_model_get_item().
Do not confuse this function with gtk_tree_list_model_get_child_row().

parameter.name: position
parameter.parameter_description: the position of the row to fetch

function.name: gtk_tree_list_model_new
function.description: Creates a new empty #GtkTreeListModel displaying @root with all rows collapsed.

parameter.name: passthrough
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE to pass through items from the models

parameter.name: autoexpand
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE to set the autoexpand property and expand the @root model

parameter.name: create_func
parameter.parameter_description: Function to call to create the #GListModel for the children of an item

function.name: gtk_tree_list_model_set_autoexpand
function.description: If set to %TRUE, the model will recursively expand all rows that get added to the model. This can be either rows added by changes to the underlying models or via gtk_tree_list_row_set_expanded().

parameter.name: autoexpand
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE to make the model autoexpand its rows

function.name: gtk_tree_list_row_get_child_row
function.description: If @self is not expanded or @position is greater than the number of children, %NULL is returned.

parameter.name: position
parameter.parameter_description: position of the child to get

function.name: gtk_tree_list_row_get_children
function.description:
If the row is expanded, gets the model holding the children of @self.
This model is the model created by the #GtkTreeListModelCreateModelFunc and contains the original items, no matter what value #GtkTreeListModel:passthrough is set to.

function.name: gtk_tree_list_row_get_depth
function.description:
Gets the depth of this row. Rows that correspond to items in the root model have a depth of zero, rows corresponding to items of models of direct children of the root model have a depth of 1 and so on.
The depth of a row never changes until the row is destroyed.

function.name: gtk_tree_list_row_get_expanded
function.description: Gets if a row is currently expanded.

function.name: gtk_tree_list_row_get_item
function.description:
Gets the item corresponding to this row,
The value returned by this function never changes until the row is destroyed.
function.return: The item of this row or %NULL when the row was destroyed

function.name: gtk_tree_list_row_get_parent
function.description:
Gets the row representing the parent for @self. That is the row that would need to be collapsed to make this row disappear.
If @self is a row corresponding to the root model, %NULL is returned.
The value returned by this function never changes until the row is destroyed.

function.name: gtk_tree_list_row_get_position
function.description: Returns the position in the #GtkTreeListModel that @self occupies at the moment.

function.name: gtk_tree_list_row_is_expandable
function.description:
Checks if a row can be expanded. This does not mean that the row is actually expanded, this can be checked with gtk_tree_list_row_get_expanded()
If a row is expandable never changes until the row is destroyed.

function.name: gtk_tree_list_row_set_expanded
function.description:
Expands or collapses a row.
If a row is expanded, the model of calling the #GtkTreeListModelCreateModelFunc for the row's item will be inserted after this row. If a row is collapsed, those items will be removed from the model.
If the row is not expandable, this function does nothing.

parameter.name: expanded
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE if the row should be expanded

function.name: gtk_tree_list_row_sorter_get_sorter
function.description: Returns the sorter used by @self.

function.name: gtk_tree_list_row_sorter_new
function.description:
Create a special-purpose sorter that applies the sorting of @sorter to the levels of a #GtkTreeListModel.
Note that this sorter relies on #GtkTreeListModel:passthrough being %FALSE as it can only sort #GtkTreeListRows.

function.name: gtk_tree_list_row_sorter_set_sorter
function.description:
Sets the sorter to use for items with the same parent.
This sorter will be passed the #GtkTreeListRow:item of the tree list rows passed to @self.

function.name: gtk_tree_model_filter_clear_cache
function.description: This function should almost never be called. It clears the @filter of any cached iterators that haven’t been reffed with gtk_tree_model_ref_node(). This might be useful if the child model being filtered is static (and doesn’t change often) and there has been a lot of unreffed access to nodes. As a side effect of this function, all unreffed iters will be invalid.

function.name: gtk_tree_model_filter_convert_child_iter_to_iter
function.description: Sets @filter_iter to point to the row in @filter that corresponds to the row pointed at by @child_iter. If @filter_iter was not set, %FALSE is returned.

parameter.name: child_iter
parameter.parameter_description: A valid #GtkTreeIter pointing to a row on the child model.

function.return: %TRUE, if @filter_iter was set, i.e. if @child_iter is a valid iterator pointing to a visible row in child model.

function.name: gtk_tree_model_filter_convert_child_path_to_path
function.description: Converts @child_path to a path relative to @filter. That is, @child_path points to a path in the child model. The rerturned path will point to the same row in the filtered model. If @child_path isn’t a valid path on the child model or points to a row which is not visible in @filter, then %NULL is returned.

function.name: gtk_tree_model_filter_convert_iter_to_child_iter
function.description: Sets @child_iter to point to the row pointed to by @filter_iter.

parameter.name: filter_iter
parameter.parameter_description: A valid #GtkTreeIter pointing to a row on @filter.

function.name: gtk_tree_model_filter_convert_path_to_child_path
function.description: Converts @filter_path to a path on the child model of @filter. That is, @filter_path points to a location in @filter. The returned path will point to the same location in the model not being filtered. If @filter_path does not point to a location in the child model, %NULL is returned.

function.name: gtk_tree_model_filter_get_model
function.description: Returns a pointer to the child model of @filter.

function.name: gtk_tree_model_filter_new
function.description: Creates a new #GtkTreeModel, with @child_model as the child_model and @root as the virtual root.

function.name: gtk_tree_model_filter_refilter
function.description: Emits ::row_changed for each row in the child model, which causes the filter to re-evaluate whether a row is visible or not.

function.name: gtk_tree_model_filter_set_modify_func
function.description:
With the @n_columns and @types parameters, you give an array of column types for this model (which will be exposed to the parent model/view). The @func, @data and @destroy parameters are for specifying the modify function. The modify function will get called for each data access, the goal of the modify function is to return the data which should be displayed at the location specified using the parameters of the modify function.
Note that gtk_tree_model_filter_set_modify_func() can only be called once for a given filter model.

parameter.name: n_columns
parameter.parameter_description: The number of columns in the filter model.

parameter.name: data
parameter.parameter_description: User data to pass to the modify function, or %NULL.

function.name: gtk_tree_model_filter_set_visible_column
function.description:
Sets @column of the child_model to be the column where @filter should look for visibility information. @columns should be a column of type %G_TYPE_BOOLEAN, where %TRUE means that a row is visible, and %FALSE if not.
Note that gtk_tree_model_filter_set_visible_func() or gtk_tree_model_filter_set_visible_column() can only be called once for a given filter model.

parameter.name: column
parameter.parameter_description: A #int which is the column containing the visible information

function.name: gtk_tree_model_filter_set_visible_func

parameter.name: data
parameter.parameter_description: User data to pass to the visible function, or %NULL

function.name: gtk_tree_model_foreach
function.description:
Calls func on each node in model in a depth-first fashion.
If @func returns %TRUE, then the tree ceases to be walked, and gtk_tree_model_foreach() returns.

parameter.name: func
parameter.parameter_description: a function to be called on each row

function.name: gtk_tree_model_get
function.description:
Gets the value of one or more cells in the row referenced by @iter. The variable argument list should contain integer column numbers, each column number followed by a place to store the value being retrieved. The list is terminated by a -1. For example, to get a value from column 0 with type %G_TYPE_STRING, you would write: `gtk_tree_model_get (model, iter, 0, &place_string_here, -1)`, where `place_string_here` is a #gchararray to be filled with the string.
Returned values with type %G_TYPE_OBJECT have to be unreferenced, values with type %G_TYPE_STRING or %G_TYPE_BOXED have to be freed. Other values are passed by value.

parameter.name: Varargs
parameter.parameter_description: pairs of column number and value return locations, terminated by -1

function.name: gtk_tree_model_get_column_type
function.description: Returns the type of the column.

function.name: gtk_tree_model_get_flags
function.description:
Returns a set of flags supported by this interface.
The flags are a bitwise combination of #GtkTreeModelFlags. The flags supported should not change during the lifetime of the @tree_model.
function.return: the flags supported by this interface

function.name: gtk_tree_model_get_iter
function.description: Sets @iter to a valid iterator pointing to @path. If @path does not exist, @iter is set to an invalid iterator and %FALSE is returned.

function.name: gtk_tree_model_get_iter_first
function.description: Initializes @iter with the first iterator in the tree (the one at the path "0") and returns %TRUE. Returns %FALSE if the tree is empty.

function.name: gtk_tree_model_get_iter_from_string
function.description: Sets @iter to a valid iterator pointing to @path_string, if it exists. Otherwise, @iter is left invalid and %FALSE is returned.

function.name: gtk_tree_model_get_n_columns
function.description: Returns the number of columns supported by @tree_model.

function.name: gtk_tree_model_get_path
function.description:
Returns a newly-created #GtkTreePath-struct referenced by @iter.
This path should be freed with gtk_tree_path_free().

function.name: gtk_tree_model_get_string_from_iter
function.description:
Generates a string representation of the iter.
This string is a “:” separated list of numbers. For example, “4:10:0:3” would be an acceptable return value for this string.
function.return: a newly-allocated string. Must be freed with g_free().

function.name: gtk_tree_model_get_valist
function.description: See gtk_tree_model_get(), this version takes a va_list for language bindings to use.

function.name: gtk_tree_model_get_value
function.description:
Initializes and sets @value to that at @column.
When done with @value, g_value_unset() needs to be called to free any allocated memory.

parameter.name: column
parameter.parameter_description: the column to lookup the value at

function.name: gtk_tree_model_iter_children
function.description:
Sets @iter to point to the first child of @parent.
If @parent has no children, %FALSE is returned and @iter is set to be invalid. @parent will remain a valid node after this function has been called.
If @parent is %NULL returns the first node, equivalent to `gtk_tree_model_get_iter_first (tree_model, iter);`

parameter.name: iter
parameter.parameter_description: the new #GtkTreeIter-struct to be set to the child

function.return: %TRUE, if @iter has been set to the first child

function.name: gtk_tree_model_iter_has_child
function.description: Returns %TRUE if @iter has children, %FALSE otherwise.

function.name: gtk_tree_model_iter_n_children
function.description:
Returns the number of children that @iter has.
As a special case, if @iter is %NULL, then the number of toplevel nodes is returned.

function.name: gtk_tree_model_iter_next
function.description:
Sets @iter to point to the node following it at the current level.
If there is no next @iter, %FALSE is returned and @iter is set to be invalid.
function.return: %TRUE if @iter has been changed to the next node

function.name: gtk_tree_model_iter_nth_child
function.description:
Sets @iter to be the child of @parent, using the given index.
The first index is 0. If @n is too big, or @parent has no children, @iter is set to an invalid iterator and %FALSE is returned. @parent will remain a valid node after this function has been called. As a special case, if @parent is %NULL, then the @n-th root node is set.

parameter.name: iter
parameter.parameter_description: the #GtkTreeIter-struct to set to the nth child

parameter.name: parent
parameter.parameter_description: the #GtkTreeIter-struct to get the child from, or %NULL.

parameter.name: n
parameter.parameter_description: the index of the desired child

function.name: gtk_tree_model_iter_parent

parameter.name: iter
parameter.parameter_description: the new #GtkTreeIter-struct to set to the parent

function.return: %TRUE, if @iter is set to the parent of @child

function.name: gtk_tree_model_iter_previous
function.description:
Sets @iter to point to the previous node at the current level.
If there is no previous @iter, %FALSE is returned and @iter is set to be invalid.
function.return: %TRUE if @iter has been changed to the previous node

function.name: gtk_tree_model_ref_node
function.description:
Lets the tree ref the node.
This is an optional method for models to implement. To be more specific, models may ignore this call as it exists primarily for performance reasons.
This function is primarily meant as a way for views to let caching models know when nodes are being displayed (and hence, whether or not to cache that node). Being displayed means a node is in an expanded branch, regardless of whether the node is currently visible in the viewport. For example, a file-system based model would not want to keep the entire file-hierarchy in memory, just the sections that are currently being displayed by every current view.
A model should be expected to be able to get an iter independent of its reffed state.

function.name: gtk_tree_model_row_changed
function.description: Emits the #GtkTreeModel::row-changed signal on @tree_model.

parameter.name: path
parameter.parameter_description: a #GtkTreePath-struct pointing to the changed row

parameter.name: iter
parameter.parameter_description: a valid #GtkTreeIter-struct pointing to the changed row

function.name: gtk_tree_model_row_deleted
function.description:
Emits the #GtkTreeModel::row-deleted signal on @tree_model.
This should be called by models after a row has been removed. The location pointed to by @path should be the location that the row previously was at. It may not be a valid location anymore.
Nodes that are deleted are not unreffed, this means that any outstanding references on the deleted node should not be released.

parameter.name: path
parameter.parameter_description: a #GtkTreePath-struct pointing to the previous location of the deleted row

function.name: gtk_tree_model_row_has_child_toggled

parameter.name: path
parameter.parameter_description: a #GtkTreePath-struct pointing to the changed row

parameter.name: iter
parameter.parameter_description: a valid #GtkTreeIter-struct pointing to the changed row

function.name: gtk_tree_model_row_inserted
function.description: Emits the #GtkTreeModel::row-inserted signal on @tree_model.

parameter.name: path
parameter.parameter_description: a #GtkTreePath-struct pointing to the inserted row

parameter.name: iter
parameter.parameter_description: a valid #GtkTreeIter-struct pointing to the inserted row

function.name: gtk_tree_model_rows_reordered
function.description:
Emits the #GtkTreeModel::rows-reordered signal on @tree_model.
This should be called by models when their rows have been reordered.

parameter.name: path
parameter.parameter_description: a #GtkTreePath-struct pointing to the tree node whose children have been reordered

parameter.name: iter
parameter.parameter_description: a valid #GtkTreeIter-struct pointing to the node whose children have been reordered, or %NULL if the depth of @path is 0

parameter.name: new_order
parameter.parameter_description: an array of integers mapping the current position of each child to its old position before the re-ordering, i.e. @new_order`[newpos] = oldpos`

function.name: gtk_tree_model_rows_reordered_with_length
function.description:
Emits the #GtkTreeModel::rows-reordered signal on @tree_model.
This should be called by models when their rows have been reordered.

parameter.name: path
parameter.parameter_description: a #GtkTreePath-struct pointing to the tree node whose children have been reordered

parameter.name: iter
parameter.parameter_description: a valid #GtkTreeIter-struct pointing to the node whose children have been reordered, or %NULL if the depth of @path is 0

parameter.name: new_order
parameter.parameter_description: an array of integers mapping the current position of each child to its old position before the re-ordering, i.e. @new_order`[newpos] = oldpos`

function.name: gtk_tree_model_sort_clear_cache
function.description: This function should almost never be called. It clears the @tree_model_sort of any cached iterators that haven’t been reffed with gtk_tree_model_ref_node(). This might be useful if the child model being sorted is static (and doesn’t change often) and there has been a lot of unreffed access to nodes. As a side effect of this function, all unreffed iters will be invalid.

function.name: gtk_tree_model_sort_convert_child_iter_to_iter
function.description: Sets @sort_iter to point to the row in @tree_model_sort that corresponds to the row pointed at by @child_iter. If @sort_iter was not set, %FALSE is returned. Note: a boolean is only returned since 2.14.

parameter.name: child_iter
parameter.parameter_description: A valid #GtkTreeIter pointing to a row on the child model

function.return: %TRUE, if @sort_iter was set, i.e. if @sort_iter is a valid iterator pointer to a visible row in the child model.

function.name: gtk_tree_model_sort_convert_child_path_to_path
function.description: Converts @child_path to a path relative to @tree_model_sort. That is, @child_path points to a path in the child model. The returned path will point to the same row in the sorted model. If @child_path isn’t a valid path on the child model, then %NULL is returned.

function.name: gtk_tree_model_sort_convert_iter_to_child_iter
function.description: Sets @child_iter to point to the row pointed to by @sorted_iter.

parameter.name: sorted_iter
parameter.parameter_description: A valid #GtkTreeIter pointing to a row on @tree_model_sort.

function.name: gtk_tree_model_sort_convert_path_to_child_path
function.description: Converts @sorted_path to a path on the child model of @tree_model_sort. That is, @sorted_path points to a location in @tree_model_sort. The returned path will point to the same location in the model not being sorted. If @sorted_path does not point to a location in the child model, %NULL is returned.

function.name: gtk_tree_model_sort_get_model
function.description: Returns the model the #GtkTreeModelSort is sorting.

function.name: gtk_tree_model_sort_iter_is_valid
function.description:
> This function is slow. Only use it for debugging and/or testing > purposes.
Checks if the given iter is a valid iter for this #GtkTreeModelSort.
function.return: %TRUE if the iter is valid, %FALSE if the iter is invalid.

function.name: gtk_tree_model_sort_new_with_model
function.description: Creates a new #GtkTreeModelSort, with @child_model as the child model.

function.name: gtk_tree_model_sort_reset_default_sort_func
function.description: This resets the default sort function to be in the “unsorted” state. That is, it is in the same order as the child model. It will re-sort the model to be in the same order as the child model only if the #GtkTreeModelSort is in “unsorted” state.

function.name: gtk_tree_model_sort_set_model
function.description: Sets the model of @tree_model_sort to be @model. If @model is %NULL, then the old model is unset. The sort function is unset as a result of this call. The model will be in an unsorted state until a sort function is set.

function.name: gtk_tree_model_unref_node
function.description:
Lets the tree unref the node.
This is an optional method for models to implement. To be more specific, models may ignore this call as it exists primarily for performance reasons. For more information on what this means, see gtk_tree_model_ref_node().
Please note that nodes that are deleted are not unreffed.

function.name: gtk_tree_path_append_index
function.description:
Appends a new index to a path.
As a result, the depth of the path is increased.

function.name: gtk_tree_path_compare
function.description:
Compares two paths.
If @a appears before @b in a tree, then -1 is returned. If @b appears before @a, then 1 is returned. If the two nodes are equal, then 0 is returned.

function.name: gtk_tree_path_copy
function.description: Creates a new #GtkTreePath-struct as a copy of @path.

function.name: gtk_tree_path_down
function.description: Moves @path to point to the first child of the current path.

function.name: gtk_tree_path_free
function.description: Frees @path. If @path is %NULL, it simply returns.

function.name: gtk_tree_path_get_depth
function.description: Returns the current depth of @path.

function.name: gtk_tree_path_get_indices
function.description:
Returns the current indices of @path.
This is an array of integers, each representing a node in a tree. This value should not be freed.
The length of the array can be obtained with gtk_tree_path_get_depth().

function.name: gtk_tree_path_get_indices_with_depth
function.description:
Returns the current indices of @path.
This is an array of integers, each representing a node in a tree. It also returns the number of elements in the array. The array should not be freed.

parameter.name: depth
parameter.parameter_description: return location for number of elements returned in the integer array, or %NULL

function.name: gtk_tree_path_is_ancestor
function.description: Returns %TRUE if @descendant is a descendant of @path.

function.name: gtk_tree_path_is_descendant
function.description: Returns %TRUE if @path is a descendant of @ancestor.

function.name: gtk_tree_path_new
function.description: Creates a new #GtkTreePath-struct. This refers to a row.

function.name: gtk_tree_path_new_first
function.description:
Creates a new #GtkTreePath-struct.
The string representation of this path is “0”.

function.name: gtk_tree_path_new_from_indices
function.description: Creates a new path with @first_index and @varargs as indices.

function.name: gtk_tree_path_new_from_indicesv
function.description: Creates a new path with the given @indices array of @length.

function.name: gtk_tree_path_new_from_string
function.description:
Creates a new #GtkTreePath-struct initialized to @path.
@path is expected to be a colon separated list of numbers. For example, the string “10:4:0” would create a path of depth 3 pointing to the 11th child of the root node, the 5th child of that 11th child, and the 1st child of that 5th child. If an invalid path string is passed in, %NULL is returned.

parameter.name: path
parameter.parameter_description: The string representation of a path

function.name: gtk_tree_path_next
function.description: Moves the @path to point to the next node at the current depth.

function.name: gtk_tree_path_prepend_index
function.description:
Prepends a new index to a path.
As a result, the depth of the path is increased.

function.name: gtk_tree_path_prev
function.description: Moves the @path to point to the previous node at the current depth, if it exists.
function.return: %TRUE if @path has a previous node, and the move was made

function.name: gtk_tree_path_to_string
function.description:
Generates a string representation of the path.
This string is a “:” separated list of numbers. For example, “4:10:0:3” would be an acceptable return value for this string. If the path has depth 0, %NULL is returned.
function.return: A newly-allocated string. Must be freed with g_free().

function.name: gtk_tree_path_up
function.description: Moves the @path to point to its parent node, if it has a parent.
function.return: %TRUE if @path has a parent, and the move was made

function.name: gtk_tree_rbtree_contains
function.description: Checks if @potential_child is a child (direct or via intermediate trees) of @tree.

function.name: gtk_tree_row_reference_copy
function.description: Copies a #GtkTreeRowReference.

function.name: gtk_tree_row_reference_deleted
function.description: Lets a set of row reference created by gtk_tree_row_reference_new_proxy() know that the model emitted the #GtkTreeModel::row-deleted signal.

parameter.name: path
parameter.parameter_description: the path position that was deleted

function.name: gtk_tree_row_reference_free
function.description: Free’s @reference. @reference may be %NULL

function.name: gtk_tree_row_reference_get_model
function.description: Returns the model that the row reference is monitoring.

function.name: gtk_tree_row_reference_get_path
function.description: Returns a path that the row reference currently points to, or %NULL if the path pointed to is no longer valid.

function.name: gtk_tree_row_reference_inserted
function.description: Lets a set of row reference created by gtk_tree_row_reference_new_proxy() know that the model emitted the #GtkTreeModel::row-inserted signal.

parameter.name: path
parameter.parameter_description: the row position that was inserted

function.name: gtk_tree_row_reference_new
function.description:
Creates a row reference based on @path.
This reference will keep pointing to the node pointed to by @path, so long as it exists. Any changes that occur on @model are propagated, and the path is updated appropriately. If @path isn’t a valid path in @model, then %NULL is returned.

function.name: gtk_tree_row_reference_new_proxy
function.description:
You do not need to use this function.
Creates a row reference based on @path.
This reference will keep pointing to the node pointed to by @path, so long as it exists. If @path isn’t a valid path in @model, then %NULL is returned. However, unlike references created with gtk_tree_row_reference_new(), it does not listen to the model for changes. The creator of the row reference must do this explicitly using gtk_tree_row_reference_inserted(), gtk_tree_row_reference_deleted(), gtk_tree_row_reference_reordered().
These functions must be called exactly once per proxy when the corresponding signal on the model is emitted. This single call updates all row references for that proxy. Since built-in GTK objects like #GtkTreeView already use this mechanism internally, using them as the proxy object will produce unpredictable results. Further more, passing the same object as @model and @proxy doesn’t work for reasons of internal implementation.
This type of row reference is primarily meant by structures that need to carefully monitor exactly when a row reference updates itself, and is not generally needed by most applications.

function.name: gtk_tree_row_reference_reordered
function.description: Lets a set of row reference created by gtk_tree_row_reference_new_proxy() know that the model emitted the #GtkTreeModel::rows-reordered signal.

parameter.name: path
parameter.parameter_description: the parent path of the reordered signal

parameter.name: iter
parameter.parameter_description: the iter pointing to the parent of the reordered

function.name: gtk_tree_row_reference_valid
function.description: Returns %TRUE if the @reference is non-%NULL and refers to a current valid path.
function.return: %TRUE if @reference points to a valid path

function.name: gtk_tree_selection_count_selected_rows
function.description: Returns the number of rows that have been selected in @tree.

function.name: gtk_tree_selection_get_mode
function.description: Gets the selection mode for @selection. See gtk_tree_selection_set_mode().

function.name: gtk_tree_selection_get_select_function
function.description: Returns the current selection function.

function.name: gtk_tree_selection_get_selected
function.description: Sets @iter to the currently selected node if @selection is set to #GTK_SELECTION_SINGLE or #GTK_SELECTION_BROWSE. @iter may be NULL if you just want to test if @selection has any selected nodes. @model is filled with the current model as a convenience. This function will not work if you use @selection is #GTK_SELECTION_MULTIPLE.

parameter.name: model
parameter.parameter_description: A pointer to set to the #GtkTreeModel, or NULL.

function.return: TRUE, if there is a selected node.

function.name: gtk_tree_selection_get_selected_rows
function.description:
Creates a list of path of all selected rows. Additionally, if you are planning on modifying the model after calling this function, you may want to convert the returned list into a list of #GtkTreeRowReferences. To do this, you can use gtk_tree_row_reference_new().
To free the return value, use: |[<!-- language="C" --> g_list_free_full (list, (GDestroyNotify) gtk_tree_path_free); ]|

parameter.name: model
parameter.parameter_description: A pointer to set to the #GtkTreeModel, or %NULL.

function.return: A #GList containing a #GtkTreePath for each selected row.

function.name: gtk_tree_selection_get_tree_view
function.description: Returns the tree view associated with @selection.

function.name: gtk_tree_selection_get_user_data
function.description: Returns the user data for the selection function.

function.name: gtk_tree_selection_iter_is_selected
function.description: Returns %TRUE if the row at @iter is currently selected.

function.name: gtk_tree_selection_path_is_selected
function.description: Returns %TRUE if the row pointed to by @path is currently selected. If @path does not point to a valid location, %FALSE is returned

function.name: gtk_tree_selection_select_all
function.description: Selects all the nodes. @selection must be set to #GTK_SELECTION_MULTIPLE mode.

function.name: gtk_tree_selection_select_iter
function.description: Selects the specified iterator.

function.name: gtk_tree_selection_select_path
function.description: Select the row at @path.

function.name: gtk_tree_selection_select_range
function.description: Selects a range of nodes, determined by @start_path and @end_path inclusive. @selection must be set to #GTK_SELECTION_MULTIPLE mode.

parameter.name: start_path
parameter.parameter_description: The initial node of the range.

parameter.name: end_path
parameter.parameter_description: The final node of the range.

function.name: gtk_tree_selection_selected_foreach
function.description: Calls a function for each selected node. Note that you cannot modify the tree or selection from within this function. As a result, gtk_tree_selection_get_selected_rows() might be more useful.

parameter.name: func
parameter.parameter_description: The function to call for each selected node.

parameter.name: data
parameter.parameter_description: user data to pass to the function.

function.name: gtk_tree_selection_set_mode
function.description: Sets the selection mode of the @selection. If the previous type was #GTK_SELECTION_MULTIPLE, then the anchor is kept selected, if it was previously selected.

function.name: gtk_tree_selection_set_select_function
function.description:
Sets the selection function.
If set, this function is called before any node is selected or unselected, giving some control over which nodes are selected. The select function should return %TRUE if the state of the node may be toggled, and %FALSE if the state of the node should be left unchanged.

parameter.name: data
parameter.parameter_description: The selection function’s data. May be %NULL

parameter.name: destroy
parameter.parameter_description: The destroy function for user data. May be %NULL

function.name: gtk_tree_selection_unselect_all
function.description: Unselects all the nodes.

function.name: gtk_tree_selection_unselect_iter
function.description: Unselects the specified iterator.

function.name: gtk_tree_selection_unselect_path
function.description: Unselects the row at @path.

function.name: gtk_tree_selection_unselect_range
function.description: Unselects a range of nodes, determined by @start_path and @end_path inclusive.

parameter.name: start_path
parameter.parameter_description: The initial node of the range.

parameter.name: end_path
parameter.parameter_description: The initial node of the range.
